reviewText: ...but I'm gratified to find that all the hours and hours of reading I did of other customers' reviews of miscellaneous strollers paid off. My two 16-pound 4-year-old cats will fit quite comfortably in this one. it's attractive and gives them lots of views of where we're going--when we go there. it's easy to push and needn't even be folded up to be tucked out of the way in a corner of the apartment. the interior comes supplied with a soft-enough cushion that I supplemented with a little blanket I know they'll feel comfortable with. If I remember to, i'll add to the review when we've actually taken a trip somewhere, if even only down the long corridors of my apartment building.
summary: don't yet know how the cats will take to it...

reviewText: My dog can be very picky about dog treats so I didn't know if he would like Beggin treats but....he does love to catch things so I knew he would like that part.This is a simple device that is attached to the jar of treats. Fairly easy to open the jar and there is a generous amount of treats. I have to say that I had a hard time understanding how it works.  There are instructions that are very brief and confusing.  After a little bit of hit or miss I figured out how it should work.  It is simple to use ( once you figure it out) and my dog is in love.  I have to hide it because otherwise he will sit next to it waiting for me to pick it up.I would recommend this as a good way to interact with your dog...very pleased with the product and would have given it 5 stars if the instruction had been more clear.

I put this liner on top of the thin one that came with our pet carrier.  It is thicker and more substantial than the original, so it adds comfortable padding for my little dog.  It doesn't slip around, but it's easy to remove and launder.
I PERFERE TIDDY CAT IN A 40 LB POUND BOX, BUT AMAZON DOES NOT CARRY THE  PRODUCT, SURE WISH THEY DID.  MY CATS LIKE THIS, BUT LIKE TIDDY CAT BETTER

reviewText: We bought this for our Cocker Spaniel when she was six weeks pregnant.  It helped her be able to climb instead of jumping to and off of the bed.  She still uses it some even though the puppies are weaned now.  The cat even uses it on occasion!The steps are slanted toward the ground.  I think that helps them to climb the stairs.  The carpet pieces are thin and come off if you need to wash them.  It's a really nice product overall.
My girls just love these sweet potato fries.  They come running when they see the bag and I tell them here's your goodies.

I have a minature dashund who cant get into our platform bed on his own. We've always used stairs for him. When i took the reusable cover off the last set the cardboard inside fell apart and we descided it was time to upgrade. I should have measured my bed and got a 3 step verison because these arent as tall as I'd prefer; but thats my own fault so i won't hold it again the company.ProThey are really sturdy stairsEasy to assemblethe carpet on the stairs stays cleancheaper than most comperable stairsI've had these about 6 months and they dont appear to show any signs of wear, so thats a good thing.I knocked a star off because these stairs are oddly pitched forward. Took my dog some convincing to use them, he always does but it seems to be with some hesistation that he's gonna mistep and end up face first in my dresser. Where it not for that they owuld be perfect.

I admit it stops my cats from going where I place the can. It only has 120 sprays and since it is motion sensored it goes off when people go there to.120 sprays seems enough for the cat to figure out what it will do. It takes a few second for the motion sensor to go off. Once it does go off the next spray will happen right away. Overall I like it enough that I am going to splurge on another one The biggest downfall is that my cat just finds another spot to use. I wish I had not stopped her from the first spot because it was preferable to the newest place she picked. And once I get her to stop going there I will need to figure out where she chose for her next place. I wish it would be the litter box.
summary: It will deter the cat from that spot - but be prepared for your cat to pick another spot.

reviewText: My dogs love these as a treat.  Nice large bag that is long-lasting.  It needs to be kept sealed though for freshness.  Great buy for the cost.

I ordered this along with a couple of other toys that dispense food, but I don't like this one.  It's hard for my dog to get the food out of this one so she just gives up.  I threw it away.  I don't recommend this one at all.  Instead I would recommend the  "Premier Busy Buddy Bristle Bone Dog Toy" and the "StarMark Bob-A-Lot Interactive Dog Toy".  She loves both of them and are easier for her to get the food out of.  The Bristle Bone requires refills and I get the  Premier Busy Buddy Refill Ring in Cornstarch rather than the rawhide....I think it's healthier for my dog. reviewText: my chinchillas would make a mess with their hay and this is purfect it has the bars to hold the hay and the pellets in same dish
My dog loves these treats, we give him one a day and his breath is fresher and his teeth are very clean.

I am a 42 year old female who has 3 older cats ranging from ages 10 - 16.  About 5 years ago, when I adopted my dog, my cats were not happy, to say the least.  One of them started to urinate every night on the window curtain, coffee table or other flat surfaces to express her anger at me for allowing the dog into the house.  I purchased the Feliway product and put one of these in every room, hoping that it would calm her down.It didn't help with her urination, or her anxiety at all.  But, it definitely made my other cats calmer overall - less frustration in the house, in general.  I have given this to my neighbor, who adopted a new stray cat.  He seemed to be very upset being indoors permanently, and was spraying around the house.  After plugging in this product, in only two rooms (the two rooms that he was spraying in), he stopped spraying and generally became more content.This product is the refill for the unit that you plug into any electrical outlet.  It contains 6 refills - they are small plastic bottles which insert into the plastic plug in device.  It works just like any of the liquid air diffusers - you plug it in and the liquid is heated and becomes vapor which moves through the air.  After about a month, the liquid has been used up and you simply replace it.In summary, if you have a distressed cat for whatever reason, I suggest that you try this.  It is pretty expensive if you buy this in a store (for example, I purchased the device originally from Petsmart) but it's a great price if you buy it here.  I haven't use this in a while (as my cat has since passed away due to health issues, which were probably the cause of her discomfort which explains why this didn't work for her...).  But, I think that I will plug these in again and see if they can make my kitty household a bit happier.

This vacuum is advertised as a Pet hair cleaner with an attachment that is supposed to be able to grab lots of hair.  Let me give you my experiences with it.First of all, it's a really big vacuum and I think it's heavy.  (someone else reviewed it and said it was light but I don't think so)  Putting it together wasn't hard, but I still have problems with the piece on the back top that you are supposed to loop over the tubing on and hold the cord.  It has no screws to keep it in, it just "pops" in.  The problem is that it also just kind of "pops" out all the time.  It's so annoying.The vacuum does have strong suction and really does pick up a lot of dog hair - except when you use it as an attachment to sweep couches and furniture.  Then I think it really does fail.  The pet hair just doesn't come up completely and I feel like it's a waste of time.Cleaning out the unit is easy for the bottom part of the bowl - it comes right out and can be emptied into the trash.  The upper part isn't very handy to clean - I've taken to using a curtain rod piece to dig up there to get stuff out, but it all falls onto the open area and makes a huge mess.  I've yet to figure out how to sweep up the stuff that falls out onto the exposed cleaner.It does the job but it's not as good as it could be.
summary: Does the job but has some issues

reviewText: Wonderful product!!!!! This is sold by my vet at a much HIGHER price. This stuff is great! I use it once a week on my dog's ears using a cotton ball (or 2!) soaked in the solution. A gentle wipe inside the ear, followed by a little squirt, then holding the ear close to the head and massaged for 10 seconds. The dog shakes his head afterwards and voila! You're done and his ears are clean!
This spray is not as strong as other brands I have had but the price is right.  I find myself having to spray it more than some other brands I have bought but my cats still like it.
I love this cage. You can change it around to suit your needs and I added another one to it for an even bigger cage. It is easy to clean and my piggies are very happy.

My model 900 was great until last night. This was my 3rd littermaid. The last two didn't last too long. This one was less than 2 years old. Stops for unknown reason.  But, with a multiple cat household, it is so much more convenient that scooping all day long, and it is definitely much better on odor. However, for the price, it should not die so young. I did go out in a panic and bought no. 4,  cheaper version (though still expensive) the elite 5000 because it was the only one I could find, but I think I am going to regret it.  I'll see how it does, but  I hate to have to keep spending money like this, and I predict it won't last that long anyway.  Most of these machines can probably be fixed, a ex- littermaid repair person told me, but unless I can do it myself (he sent me a manual but I can't find it now,) it just doesn't pay to keep sending them back, and of course they didn't break until after the warranty ended.
summary: Can't live with it, can't live without it

I did the math on the cost of using this food to feed my 100-lb lab, and according to the feeding guide listed on the bag, I would use up the entire 3.5 lb bag in a mere 3 days.  At the current price on Amazon of $34.58, that works out to about $11.50 per day, or over $4000 per year.  The 21-lb bag would work out to $3.27 per day, or $1,193 per year.  So the larger bag is an absurdly better deal, although it might still be out of most people's budgets for dog food.  Even if you have a tiny dog, it's probably a good idea to spring for the larger bag and just store it.But how about the food itself?  I am largely impressed with the ingredients list.  Salmon really is the first ingredient, and then it's followed by many whole foods.  There is no indication on the package about whether or not the salmon is sustainably caught, or where it was harvested.  If you care about the source of your salmon, I'd assume the worst, since they are not advertising wild-caught, Alaskan, or anything like that.  From  the Salmon buying guide at Summer Tomato, “Farmed salmon are raised in large, densely packed pens that pollute surrounding waters with waste and chemicals. In addition, farmed salmon are more prone to illness in crowded net-pens, and antibiotics are often used to treat disease.”  So that's probably a concern with this food.Another issue with this food is the presence of “Chicken Liver Flavor,” which, make no mistake, is NOT actually chicken liver, as well as “Natural Flavors.”  If “Chicken Liver Flavor” were actually chicken liver, it would just say so, instead of adding the “flavor” after it.  There are whole companies that market flavorings (often loaded with MSG) to food companies.  And, of course, “Natural Flavors” is a well-known pseudonym for MSG.  MSG is an ingredient that many people have a problem with (if you don't know why, do a quick web search for MSG truth), and among other problems it is known to be linked with obesity. If you're struggling to keep your pet's weight in check, having this ingredient in the food is problematic.The upshot is that this is not the Holy Grail of dog foods, but it is MUCH better than grain-based foods.  The first ingredient of any good dog food should be an animal protein, and the presence of wheat or grains should be avoided as much as possible.For what it's worth, my dog loved this food and tolerated it just fine.  It's a definite step up from less expensive foods, and, as long as you buy the large bags, the cost can be within reason.
summary: Good--but not the Holy Grail of dog foods

reviewText: We bought two of these.  One for food and one for water.  The sides on the bowl are high enough that the water does not splash out while driving.  The seams are done very well and do not leak at all.  We had water in the bowl for over a week while out of town for the holidays.  I would surely recommend this to other people.

My dog is a 65lb English Bulldog/German Shepherd mix that repeatedly suffers from allergies, especially from food. He can also be a bit of a picky eater so finding the right mix can often be difficult. While he loves just about any treat, I always have reservations about trying new food. Unfortunately, a large majority of popular dog foods today are filled with terrible weight gaining ingredients not to mention carrying a high price tag. I'm always willing to try a new food so here are my thoughts on Hill's Science Diet Perfect Weight Dry Dog Food;Pros+ A nice healthy variety of chicken, fruits, vegetables and supplements.+ Dog loved it and gobbled it up quickly with no fuss.+ No soy, artificial colors, flavors or preservatives.+ Lean ingredients designed to help your dog lose and maintain a healthy weight.+ My dog had no digestive issues after eating this.Cons- Contained a few questionable ingredients for your dog such as corn gluten meal, dried beet pulp and tomato pomace.- A bit expensive for an 30-pound bag.  If you have multiple dogs the price will get a bit hefty.- No glucosamine and chondroitin.  These are crucial joint supplements for overweight dogs and I'm surprised to not see them included.- Kibble may be too large for smaller or older dogs.- No way to reseal the bag after opening.- Not Grain Free.My dog really enjoyed Hill's Science Diet Perfect Weight Dry Dog Food.  He was of course extremely excited when I approached with the bag (as he is with every new food) and quickly ate the half cup I mixed into his bowl.  His current food isNutrience Grain Free Dog Food, 18-Pound, Ocean Fishwhich he really enjoys.  After introducing him to Hill's Science Diet he still seems to prefer the Nutrience brand.  Currently I'm still mixing the two foods until both are gone at which point I'll completely return to this Grain Free Ocean Nutrience.  Although the price may be a bit more to purchase on a regular basis, I feel the savings will outweigh the cost of unnecessary veterinary visits due to weight gain caused by questionable ingredients in other foods.  If you're willing to pay a little extra for your dog's food in hopes of keeping them happy and healthy, then you may want to give Hill's Science Diet Perfect Weight Dry Dog Food a try.
summary: A well balanced weight maintenance dry food from Hills Science Diet

reviewText: solid rubber construction that you'd expect from kong.my only complaint with this product is the size and design of the treat holes. there is a wide hole at the top, and a narrower slit at the bottom of the ball. none of the ribs on the side open up. the top hole is big enough that average puppy sized kibble just falls right out. not really much for the dog to figure out than to roll the ball. we used it for a while to stop the puppy from eating his breakfast too fast, but unless you buy a specific size treat that won't fall through the hole there's no challenge to this one.

I LOVE the Sense-ation No-Pull Harness! I am a professional dog trainer. I have been purchasing this harness for several years and it is by far my favorite. reviewText: i love these dog toys, have had many of them since i got my 5 year old dog Zack.  He loves them, i have one that barks Jingle Bells and one that barks We Wish You a Merry Christmas.  I don't know if he loves them as much as I do, they are FUNNY.  He seems to have a humorous look on his face when he plays with them, and if i start arf-ing the tune to either of those songs, he will go look for the toy.  The first one i ever saw was at a pet store in my neighborhood. I was buying Christmas gifts for a friend and her dog in Canada. I got the toy and shipped it to them and she sent me a video of her dog playing with it,  he was barking at it and running in a circle around it wagging his tail.  It was the last one in the store. I didn't get one for my dog until a year later and he has played with them so much, he wears them out and i get more.  I couldn't find any several months ago after he destroyed his last one, so i found it on Amazon and ordered it there.  It's the best of all the toys.

reviewerName: Leah Chang "writing at desert spirit's fire!"
reviewText: With all the advances and variations in cat littler over the past decade, it's tough to decide if a formulation rates 4 stars or 5; I like this litter a lot, but have given it 4, knowing better will soon be on the way. For my two cats who currently have their litter box in close quarters, I like: the easily liftable, lightweight plastic jug; the very mild scent; the way it covers odors; esp how the clumps are solid but not at all like concrete, so they're easy to scoop and the box is easy to clean. Anything to dislike? Other than the high price, not really--it's just as I've already said, improvements will be here soon.

I went to another cheaper brand only to read the label, which clearly stated : "NOT TO BE USED ON CATS". The ad said 'for dogs AND cats' so I believed it...what a jerk!At least this has some enzymes and chlorhexidine gluconate, a dental rinse used even for us humans (in a stronger form for us). I might get my dentist to write a script and dilute. But, as a person trained in science, I know how to do that correctly. I wouldn't advise it unless your math and science are current. I suppose you could ask your dentist how much sterile water and CET to mix for the right strength.As for the xylitol, YES it is a toxin for cats, but the percentage is vey, very low and is alright in these quantities. Hell, a potato would NOT pass the FDA's requirement (in human foods) for arsenic content either.

Cat toys are by their nature a hit and miss proposition.  Who can really guess what our feline friends will prefer?  My two cats go ape wild over a tiny flashlight that projects a small red dot on the ground while ignoring far more expensive and elaborate playthings.  Similarly, the boxes, bows, and wrapping paper that are part and parcel of this time of year are far preferable in their eyes to anything I might bother to purchase for their enjoyment.  This particular item, while it gained their curiosity at first (they were probably humoring me), has barely been touched since.  I think its rather jerky motion does not meet their standards for a top flight plaything.  Save your money and give your feline companions an empty box or some other harmless everyday item as a toy.  Just as we tend to buy toys with bright colors (for us) without regard for what would be most colorful to our pets (they see colors differently than us), so we also tend to buy toys we think they should be interested it but rarely are.
summary: Barely Made it Through the Finicky Test

reviewText: Kitty loved it colors are spectacular she was drawn to it.I would recommend this cat toy and seller Debnroo.Her reaction to this was priceless we both had fun!
It seems like I go through a lot of blades.  I ordered this one because they say that it lasts longer than the regular ones do.  I hope they are right.  Time will tell!!!!!

Tippy the pampered poodle gives her seal of approval.These "Dual Action Dental Support" sticks are dark green and crunchy with chewy stuff in the center, sort of like a round, stuffed tube, about 3/4 inch in diameter and about 3 inches long -- 30 sticks to a package.The package recommends 1 stick daily or 2 for dogs over 50 lbs, giving daily and between meals. The sticks are said to be designed to freshen and shine, penetrate plaque, and support healthy gums.I was surprised at the active ingredients listed:spirulina, natural zeolites, parsley leaf powder, cinnamon powder, champignon mushroom extract, coenzyme Q10, yucca schidigera extract, cranberry extract, taurine, zinc, lactobacillus acidophilus, enterococcus faecium.  For those of you that are into vitamins and minerals, you will recognize many that we take!
summary: Put a smile on your doggie's face

reviewText: It's hard to find good toys for my cat, but she really seemed to like this tea bag! The cat nip inside must've really done the trick!

my 12 pound chihuahua just ignored this dental stix at first. but after a few days she started playing with it. and then she started chewing on it. it took her about 3 days to chew up one dental stix. she really enjoys playing with them now and chewing on them regularly. i keep checking her teeth and mouth. the teeth in the front half of her mouth are cleaner. i have to keep an eye on the back section of teeth as they have more buildup on them. i will update as time goes on. i am going to continue giving her the dental stix and checking her mouth daily for more improvement.

I was disappointed in the size and simplicity of the attachment, and the attaching loop is so tiny that it's a little hard to attach, but then again it's not my opinion that counts in this home.  The cats are mesmerized by this toy and I'm glad I bought 2 at the same time, so I don't risk being without.  I don't know what it is about this toy, but all 3 cats concur: they can't get enough of it!One advantage compared to the same attachment that comes with a wand is that this one's tail hasn't been chewed off yet, in spite of all the hours of play.  A common disadvantage: the fur on both wears very quickly, making the mice look much smaller.  But my cats don't seem to mind - they love small bugs to chase, and their excitement doesn't diminish even when the mice are the size and shape of the kernel of an olive.I will definitely continue buying this toy.

I purchased the medium ones for my 13 year male Samoyed who is 24" at the waist and has incontinence. They barely fit with lots of stretching. So now I am using them as liners with the simple solution male wrap until I get something better.

We have been purchasing these treats for our Goldendoodle for the past year. Our puppy loves these treats and we have found them very useful in training or for rewards. The pieces range from the size of your hand to smaller strips. Due to their pungent scent (not a bad smell necessarily but noticeable) our dog seems to pay more attention when using the Texas Hold Em's compared to other treats.Combined, we have purchased at least 20 varieties of dog treats / training treats and found these to be the best.
Tough enough for two vizslas to chew on every day.. it takes them a couple of weeks to start destroying this (which is saying a lot).. you can stuff treats in each end as well.

I have been researching and studying canine nutrition since about 1988. Ironically, my interest sprang from a program that Hill's (makers of Science Diet) used to offer called the Small Animal Dietician program. I completed all levels that they offered and learned quite a bit about food, most especially, NOT to feed Science Diet, lol.That being said, I have been showing and breeding dogs for over 20 years. I have tried virtually every high end food on the market: Core, EVO, The Honest Kitchen, Before Grain, Prairie, Orijen, Blue Buffalo, Canidae, California Natural....I could go on. The *extremely* high protein content in some of those foods can be quite dangerous, especially for puppies. I just had to euthanize my 3 year old Staffordshire Bull Terrier in December due to kidney failure, and I am certain it was brought on by being on Before Grain, Orijen & EVO as a puppy.Chicken Soup is a fantastic food and a great value. I am currently feeding it to my Bullmastiff and 2 Chihuahuas, one of whom is almost 16 years old. It is my exclusive food now and as long as they don't change the formula, I see no reason to switch to another food again. The price for the quality of food in unbeatable. I'm very happy to see it offered on Amazon now with free shipping! Makes things even better!

It solve my problem with the roomba kicking the water bowls of my dogs. This avoid the problem reducing the impact and leaving them at higher level. Only think I would replace, is those four blocks of plywood in the side... They are needed for strength but can get wet and we know what happen with plywood and water. I will remade those with Starwood when they get bad. Other than that, good product.

When he was a puppy I bought this and he did well.. as he got older would jump up the side of it ad catch his little duclaw in it and ut would bleed.. I have donated since purchasing. GREAT for pups.. I use the iris play pen now!

I received the "Cat Dancer" today and my three fairly rambunctious cats are loving it already. It's interactive so you actually have to make the effort to PLAY with them! If it tuckers them out so they don't wake me at 4am -- all the better.They'll probably wind up eating it sooner or later but, until then, this is a great toy. And you can use it to qualify for the next summer Olympics too.

My item arrived with the UV bulb's collar cracked where the o-ring seal is located near the electrical socket. In my opinion, the bulb should not be shipped already installed. Glass is fragile and there's a pressure point where the o-ring seal and socket are located. During shipping, it was damaged. Otherwise, it appears to be a well constructed unit and looking forward to using it once the replacement arrived. I will add to the review once I get my replacement and have a chance to use it. Otherwise, Amazon's return process was very easy and they have already scheduled a shipment for a replacement!Sept 5, 2012: I've been using the UV filter now for about 2 months. I have it on a timer where it cycles on for about 1 hour, every 8 hours. The idea to save on power and extend the life of the unit. So far, it seems to be working really well. My fresh water was already clear. However, after installation and running it for just a few hours, the clarity of the water was noticeable different. Some will argue this will kill your bacteria in your tank. It does kill both good and bad. However, it will only kill the bacteria that is suspended in the water that passes over it. Overall, I think it does more good than any harm with killing potential diseases, bacteria, etc.

I ONLY use Epi Soothe products on my Westie. I mostly use the Shampoo, conditioner, and ResiCORT leave in conditioner and sometimes the Humilac spray. Westies are HIGH maintenance dogs and I recommend Virbac products highly. I bathe her with Epi Soothe shampoo once or twice a week. I put on the Epi Soothe cream rinse too (you can leave this in if you like but I rinse it off her). I towel dry her and then put on pretty thick layer of Resicort especially around her feet and her vulva (her feet and vulva are discolored from her licking). Putting Resicort on these areas has reduced chewing by at least 50% - 70% and her feet are almost completely white like they should be.
summary: I ONLY use Virbac products on my Westie

reviewText: Bought this for the three dogs to play in this winter indoors. They love it, I love that I can just fold it up and put it away since it is large. I can also use it outside in the winter or in the summer. Even my large Kuvasz dog fits in it.

I love this product I would give it 10 stars I love the fact the panels can change to different colors so if you wanted to match the kitchen, less mess love the fact the bowl is raised and that both plates can be removed to clean and they feel really sturdy
summary: a must have for  cat/dog owner!!!

reviewText: He's a mouse. She's a cat. Could it get any better?My cat Meeko loves mice. Stuffed mice, jingle mice, squeek mice, probably live mice if given the chance but this one drives her WILD.We use it on the end of her Da Bird pole (Da Bird Cat Catcher Cat Toy by Go Cat Feather Toys) and she will chase it anywhere. She drags it around the house to try to get someone to play with her and more than once I've walked in on her tangled up in the string batting the mouse up in the air by herself (she always tries to pretend she wasn't, but I know what's going on).This mouse is really well built. I'm not sure if the leather tale is directly connected to the nose loop or if its just very well secured, but it has not shown ANY sign that its going to come off despite Meeko's nearly ritualistic gnawing and pulling on it. The nose loop is very secure as well and has not come off of the fishing lure connector that comes on the Da Bird pole once and shows no signs of getting ready to detach from the body (which is more than I can say for most of the name brand Da Bird refills we've tried).The only little bit of mess you get from this one is the bristles that make up the body. They certainly don't litter the floor like an over-loved catnip mouse, but they do pull off at a pretty constant rate (pretty much from the first catch you'll see a few on your cat's face). They aren't bad and in a few weeks haven't made the toy any less mouse like (although the body is getting a little more sparse), but if you're a neat freak you might need to stick to your laser pointer or a jingle ball (but where's the fun in that).For my money I'll certainly be back. This is the best refill I've come across for Da Bird and an excellent buy.*****Five Well Earned Stars
summary: "Just a game of cat and mouse" DOES NOT GIVE THIS THING NEAR ENOUGH CREDIT

reviewText: i like oxbow products so i am sure this is good quality and nutritious.  my piggy did not care for it so i switcher her back to the regular one but i would still recommend this as is a good option

The understanding with a five-star rating is that "I love it"  In light of full disclosure and total transparency I have to say that I have not put any BellyRubs fish oil on my food or in my juice, coffee or other refreshments.  For the purpose of this review I must speak for my Golden Retriever.  I switched from a much higher priced fish oil product and have not seen any change in how Gemma consumes her daily rations.  In fact, several friends have commented on the beautiful texture of her coat.  When she is in the right position and the sun engulfs her it is possible to see a glow or a sheen reflecting from her red fur.  I attribute part of that to the fish oil.  So if she is happy and continues to chow down her food like there's no tomorrow - then I will continue to use the product and share with my friends and colleagues the wonders of adding BellyRubs to their pet's diet.

These check valves weren't the internal design that I thought they were (it's hard to take a photo of the internals of a tiny, semi-transparent item,) but when push came to shove, it worked perfectly.  When my air pump that's placed on the floor beneath my aquarium was accidentally turned off, the water started to siphon down the tube and would have drained my entire 55 gallon tank onto my floor and into the apartment below me.  But it stopped dead when the water hit the check valve.  I've had check valves that have failed to work before (different design,) and I can definitely say these were a lifesaver!  Don't operate any air pump that's at or below your tank's water level without a check valve!
summary: Worked perfectly to prevent a flood

reviewText: I want to give my four-paw friend great food; yet seem to forget to shop at the local pawfect dog food store. Amazon's delivery system has this solved. I was buying this before as it is grain-free and contains lamb.My dog, Jacky Rylee, approves of this food as his bowl is empty and he seems to want more.

My cats like to play with this toy and will jump all over to try to catch it. It's more durable than the previous toy I had that was similar to this, but had a feather. My cats were shredded the feather, but the fleece ribbon on this has held up nicely.
Two rounds with this stuff on the carpet (AFTER removing the padding) and the you-know-what is still there. I have had better luck with URINE GONE and NATURE's MIRACLE.
Got these because they biodegrade in under 2 years, I like the clip on it except that it does not fit on the handle of my retractable leash. Works great on a regular leash though

This is a great collar...  with a fluffy cover that isn't even shown in the picture.The problem is that the collar was too narrow to keep my dog from licking her incisionfollowing her spaying surgery.It's too bad too because it really looks and feel very comfortable.  I ordered a mediumand my dog is a 30 lb vizsla, so she's a small dog.  It fit her neck perfectly, it justwasn't a deterant to her licking the wound.  I found another product on Amazon that wasmore effective:  Lick Guard.  It smells bad...it must taste horrible!  But it works -you have to reapply every few hours as it gets worn off.

reviewText: For a moderately priced line of crates and accessories, Midwest is great.  I've never had a problem with a pan cracking as long as you don't expose them to winter temperatures.  The lip catches water that my pets spill, too.  I use this pan under an X-Pen as it's lightweight and easy to move to whereever I want to place the pen.

I have purchased so many of the deshedding tools and none of them did a good job.  I figured I would give it one last shot and purchase this one considering the great reviews.  OMG I didn't think that my dog has so much hair.  Wait until you try this.  I sat there for over half and hour brush and brushing and so much came off of him I thought he was going to be bald by the time I got through.  Great product.  My dog is a Jack Russell with a thicker coat and about 16 pounds. Not sure how it would work on a bigger dog but works well for the little guys.  Best investment I have made.
summary: Fur-So-Fresh Groominator Dog and Cat 2in1 Deshedding Tool by Sergeant's Pet

reviewText: I bought two of these since I have 2 babies aboard and prayed they would actually sit in them. They resisted at first but after a couple of times, they sit back and started to relax and enjoy all the compliments on how cute they looked in them. (They are so spoiled!). I now feel like they are as safe as we can make them when they travel with us. The seats are easy to put together and are soft and comfortable. I wish they had put the tether strap a little higher in back but they may not have for safety's sake because if you don't get them latched in correctly they can jump out of there. Also, never attach them to just a collar but use a harness on them, just in case they do jump out and choke themselves to death.
Our rabbit loves this. It is gone within a month. I have found that my rabbit also likes the "snak shak treat stuffer".  That was gone faster than this snak shak (with no treats within).
My small dog did not like this brush.  It was too big for their little mouth.

My 3 dogs loved these. I have two labs and a medium sized mixed breed. All of them like these and eat them entirely when I give them one. One of my dogs likes them so much I have to give her the smallest pieces, because she tries to eat them so fast she almost chokes on them! The treats are a nice big size, which works well for my larger dogs.
summary: Went over well with my 3 dogs

reviewText: I tried this on several of my cats and could not tell any difference in their demeanor.  Also this collar is not breakaway and I had an issue with one of the cats getting it stuck.
We have a dog that likes to be a bit uncooperative sometimes and ignore a call. These treats help lure him to the back door when when the trash is making its way to the road. He loves them.

Our vicious hound (a Westie) tore through this thing in about 1 hour which is amazing, since every other toy lasts somewhere between 10 seconds to 15 minutes.  Once he kills the squeaker, he gnaws on the toy but doesn't continue to tear the sucker up.  Even in its state, the toy still flies, which our visiting chocolate lab loves.  Even though our dog can get through any of Tuffy's level 9 toys in about an hour, they are still the most durable toy out there and would still recommend.  4 out of 5 because my little dog wreaks havoc on these things.
summary: Tuffy's are the only toys we continue to buy

reviewText: I couldn't believe it but these REALLY WORK! I was definitely skeptical but since my poor cat got teary eyes & acted lethargic a few times a month from his virus, I decided these couldn't hurt to try. I tried him out on 1 a day and within a week, his eyes cleared up and he was perky again! After a couple of weeks I upped him to 2 a day but he started catching the virus again, so backed him down to 1 a day and for the past 3 months now, no symptoms of the virus at all! I'm so excited to have found these, and luckily for me, my cat LOVES them! He waits in his what I call "treat spot" for them and pretty much inhales them as soon as they're in front of him. Some people on here have said their cats wouldn't touch them so I tried a small piece on another one of my cats and they ate it, but weren't as excited about it as my other one was but didn't avoid it either so guess it depends on the cat's taste preference. Reviewers also said theirs were a very hard texture, the ones I've received have always been very soft, I easily peel them into pieces so my cat thinks he's getting more, and because they're pretty big to eat whole. So those that receive hard ones might want to return them, might be a bad batch. My cat's vet gave us a little bottle of Lysine chewables to try a while back when he was diagnosed with the virus, and it held about 20 chewables in it and cost me over $16! I saw these on Amazon and wondered if they were the same ones. They were identical and for a FRACTION of the price for 120 pieces (so giving him 1 a day, they last about 4 months)! I was so excited to find these on here, the price, quality and the fact that these work will bring me back here again & again for my kitty!
summary: My kitty's eyes don't tear up anymore!!!

reviewText: This item helps with cat odors and fits the "Scoop Free" brand of automatic cat boxes.  I love this system...

My Yorkie took immediately to this little guy.  The heart is a little bit to loud though and sort of freaked him out.  May take some time for him to get used to.  The heat pack is great and going to order more as my little guy loves to snuggle close to us for warmth.

this was a replacement for an older tetra filter that lasted for over 7 years...Every month or 2 i would replace the filter and clean out the filter tube and it made the water super clear ..so i decided to get another Tetra filter system. this one uses 2 filters and my old on used just 1.5/5 definately will buy again

Our Jack Russell Terriers love to play ball. They also love to chew. They retrieve, but do not give.These Chuckit! Balls stand up to their abusive chewing without so much as a dent in them, and are soft enough the dogs like them. We buy the small size for these Terriers in any variety that is all rubber. Though we tend to use 4-6 balls at a time for a fun run and trade type game they are all still in great shape.So many other brands have been destroyed, or worse if too stiff not accepted by our dogs as fun toys.These are favorites with them and with us, right along with different varieties of Nylabones ( non edible kinds)Chuckit! Your balls are great

this harness is great its nice and sturdy and well made yet nice and light and airy great for walking or jogging with your dog. which is what we were looking for because my 90 pound American pit bull seemed to get more tired with his heavy leather harness when we would go on long walks so I was looking for something more light weight and this did the trick. but we still use his leather harness for trips to the vet or for casual outings. but for working out this is perfect for him, his neck is at 21 inches and this fits ok I just wish the neck opening was about 1/2 an inch to 1 inch wider to make it a little more comfortable for my baby ( pitbull ). but he does just fine in the size that it is now and it is starting to get stretched around the neck area from the walks we have been going on. so it is starting to get more comfortable for him but if the would have made it in a 22 or 22.25 inch opening around the neck it would have gotten 5 stars instead of just 4 stars but that's ok its working out just fine we joke around and always call it his girdle........hahahaha ....lol but yes I would recommend this..
summary: great for walking my 90lbs pit bull light weight airy but yet sturdy.

reviewText: This product may be worth a try and we thought it was, but after 3 months, it did not change our dogs anxiety level at all.  We never did find anything that did work, but her anxiety stopped when she got very sick with an auto-immune disease (vasculitis) instead.  I only recommend it for a one-month try.  You should notice a difference by then, but if not, do not reorder.

reviewText: FINALLY I don't have to continually refill the fountain. We have two cats and a medium sized dog, so I was having to refill our previous regular sized fountain like 3 times a day! This looks great, stays clean and I only put new water in about once a day--and when I forget, it doesn't run dry!We have purchased fountains from Pioneer before, and I will continue. The pumps are good quality, the filters are (relatively) cheap and all of it is easy to clean when necessary. Great products.
Very nice dark chocolate color.  Excellent manufactured.  Keeps my dog warm, but not too hot, it seems to be very comfortable because my dog loves it.
I use this with my toy poodle to get rid of/prevent mattes.  It was recommended by my groomer and I am very happy.

reviewText: Great for big dogs that like to chew.  Little dogs have fun with it too.  My 2 little dogs love to play tug of war with the Rotties with it.

Any treat that getting eaten, which has some nutritional benefit, is a winner. I tried a different brand of lysine treat and it was too hard for my cat to eat. However, this is relatively softish, so he was able to chew it. My cat is healthy, I just want him to get some lysine for overall health.

reviewText: Dog destroyed this in seconds... I think I will stick to the Extreme Kongs! Too bad they don't make an extreme version for this toy, I would have liked to try it!! It was lame of me to try it, I should have expected this, tbh.

reviewText: I've purchased this litter twice now and will be trying it a few more times just because it is so cheap. Both bags that I have received have been extremely dusty and cat urine tends to stick to the bottom of the litter box. On the second bag, we mixed this with some of our regular litter and it seemed to work better because the cat urine did not stick to the litter box. This litter also tracks more than any other litter we have used. I'm not sure if we just need to try different litter mats or if this is just the nature of the litter. With all of the great reviews on this litter I was hoping for an amazing product. The only reason why I give this litter 3 stars is because of the price.

My husband and I have had 3 cats for almost 20 years now.  We've learned that in addition to a good steam cleaning machine you have to have a good enzyme cleaner for pet accidents.  We have tried every product out there and this one is far and above the best.Our cat had an accident on the way back from the vet and urine soaked the car seat.  We thought nothing could get that out.  We squirted on a whole bottle of Kids n Pets and let it sit overnight with the windows cracked to vent.  Could not believe how in 24 hours it completely eliminated any trace of an odor.  We use it all the time on our carpets, cloth furniture, wool rugs, etc.  This stuff blows away Nature's Miracle.  We're so glad we found this product.
summary: Best Enzyme Cleaner on the Market

reviewText: I bought this for my 2.5 gal tank with cherry shrimp in it. I didn't want a strong current filter and risk them getting caught in it. However, the trade off is that it doesn't do a very good job of keeping the ammonia levels down. I'm doing a pwc about every other day just to get them under control. Unlike my bigger tank with the bigger filter I can't custom make the tiny and inadequate cartridges, namely to put ammonia crystals in it.2 stars because it does function but it just can't handle my tank.I'll be looking for a different filter.

Was looking for an additional PetSafe heated bed and found out that some of them are being recalled, I called the 800 number and PetSafe is sending a new adaptor. The bed has functioned perfectly for over five years and is much loved by our cats and dog. The company and the product get 5-stars in my book.
summary: Bed has functioned perfectly for over five years

reviewText: My dog loved these! He seemed to like these more than the other treats I usually buy so I will definitely be ordering these in the future. His tail would wag as soon as I reached for the bag. Highly recommended!
My doggy loves these treats we have been road tripping a bit and they are a fine nutritional snacks on long car rides.
It is not the best solution but definitely not the worst. white paper and some other things also glow so you have to go down and check if there's actually pee in that sector and not a false possitive
summary: good guide but not fool proof

reviewText: You name it, I've tried it.... clay, corn, wheat, silica, pine, newspaper, cedar, various combinations of the above, and multiple brands of several varieties ... none of them worked as well as the green tea litter.  It's the best odor control I've found.  It doesn't stick to my long-haired cats butts and create a clumpy mess that has to be clipped out of their pantalones (a major issue with long-haired cats and clumping litter).  It eradicates the litter box smell better than anything else I've found.  It doesn't have a strong or chemical smell.  To top it off, the cats prefer it to anything else I've tried and all adapted to it immediately.  It also tracks less than the other options.The only issues I've had are:  1. It's a pain in the neck to order it and then wait for a week for it to show up; 2. Because of the larger chunk size I had to find a scoop with larger holes than average and that was a bit of a pain; and 3. The chunk size is too big to work with the littermaid I own.... the thick plastic tines just acted like a shovel, instead of a scoop -- and it's just too expensive to be throwing clean litter out when it's still good like that.Green tea litter vs. keep using the LitterMaid?....  the green tea litter won and the LitterMaid has been retired.... yeah, the green tea litter is better at lowering litterbox hassle than the self-scooper.If the chunk size was small enough to work well with the littermaid, this would be 5 stars.I did just order an OmegaPaw rolling litterbox to try with it -- hopefully that will work out and make cleaning the box easier -- with 8 cats I need all the help I can get.Update......It's too chunky for the "roll n clean" grid.... it WILL go through, but instead of slowly roll it one way, then roll it back, pull out the tray and dump it, then roll back further to put the clean litter back.... it's slowly roll it forward to tilting toward the end..... spend a couple of minutes shaking the heck out of it to get the non-clumped litter through the grid, finish rolling it and then roll it back, dump the drawer and then roll it back the other way and shake the heck out of it again to get the clean litter back in the other direction.....  a workout which pretty much takes the ease of use of the "roll n clean" away.  I'm contemplating modifying the roll n clean and then retrying with larger slots to see if that works.  Decided to try a LitterMaid Ultra Mega because of the wire tines in the rake and the larger gaps between and it still raked way too much clean litter -- acting more like a shovel than a rake.  At this point I'm back to testing litter/box combos looking for a solution.... with 8 cats and a bad back, the notion of scooping by hand several times a day is not a good one.
summary: I've tried everything, and this is the best

reviewText: This kennel (we have been using a few weeks) arrived in 3 pieces and was simple to install.  Attach the door in the cut out holes, place the top on the bottom of the kennel floor and put in the screws and nuts (by hand).  No tools required!  The only complaint (if you'd call it that) is a few places where you would insert the screws threw the plastic, were not all the way "punched" out of the plastic.  The holes were there but the circular hole was not all the way punched.  All it took was a little muscle to push the screws through.  Overall, an easy 10 to 15 minute task for the entire job!  We do not move this particular kennel from place to place, so I am not sure how well it would do in shipping or for flying, but it does the job as a stationary kennel!
Soft, sturdy, easy to put on, comfortable, nice fabric, pup loves it, I love it, arrived on time.  I highly recommend this product.  Medium fits a 15 pound pup.

I have a 20/21 year old cat.  He has been fed a very good diet of grain free canned food, nothing dry, and the best commercial raw food, but for a few years he had been throwing up a great deal and it got so that he was throwing up every day for continuous weeks or months.  He was so frail, wasting away.  Then I got these probiotics and started adding it to his meals, spreading the suggested dosage out throughout the day.I swear this is true!  From the very first dose he stopped throwing up!  I've been using this product for about ten months.  I think that he's only thown up twice in all that time.  He can digest his food just fine now. He is regaining weight.I also give this to my perfectly healthy 12 year old cat, by sprinkling it on his canned food.There are no bad additives to these probiotics like I've come across in other popular probiotics, and this stuff really works.The pets do not mind it at all on their food.  It's like they don't even notice it.It lasts a long time with cats, too.  I am very very happy with this product. (And there is nothing at all wrong with the container, like one reviewer said.  That makes no sense at all to me.)
summary: Great product.  Might have saved my cat's life.

reviewText: This product really works when removing pet odor from your carpets.  6 months ago a cat who adopted me gave birth to four kittens.  I photographed their birth and the days of growing into cathood.  Along the way they had a few accidents on the capret when being sand boxed trained.  This product I had used before became my best friend in the battle of strong cat odors.  Now there is peace in the family as the cats are approaching 6 months old and will be "fixed" in November as their mother was 4 months ago. Ahhh peace in the family is a wonderful thing especillay when the air smells sweet due to Kids and Pets.

We have a stressed and not very confident cat that typically hides under things and gets quickly bored with most toys.  She got interested in the Da Bird feather pole.  So, we tacked one of these refills (without the pole) to the medium high step on a cat condo and encouraged her to climb up.Now this cat obsessively climbs up and down the condo to capture DA bird.  Sometimes she climbs practically upside down to bat this thing around.  We swear her self confidence is better and she now OWNS that step and the one above it!  She actually lost weight she is getting so much exercise.Thanks Da Bird!  Over a few weeks the quality of life for this cat changed right before our eyes.  Check out her photo in the product photo gallery.

I kept buying this cat litter. This is the best I can find in the market.The thing I like most is that it's not dusty like other cat litters. So my cat will always come out clean.I believe you need to add in other products if you want to reduce the odor, this one doesn't work well on keeping the odor away itself.

This is a must have cat toy.It is far superior to similar "fishing pole" type cat toys. The feathered tip is specifically made and mounted to spin, thus mimicking the motions of a bird. Even old, lazy cats will perk up and respond to this toy. Young cats will leap and jump to grab it.You will have to store it away from your cat so she does not destroy the feathers.

Go to a crafts store and get a giant mat of cotton and cut it yourself. use it in your fish tank and the cotton you cut yourself will remove more material. and make your water much clearer. not to mention one bag of cotton from the crafts store will last about 10Xs as long as these crappy bio bags.  The carbon that comes with these bags are completely useless unlesss your using it in a canister filer.DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY. BUY COTTON FROM A CRAFTS STORE AND CUT YOUR OWN.
summary: I'm convinced these are the biggest scam going. Go to a crafts store and get a thin cotton mat for $10

reviewText: Uncomplicated to assemble and worth the price difference it is to purchase pre assembled filters. Also, it's very convenient to have close to a years supply for next to nothing financially. A great buy!

I've ordered Da Bird Refills on Amazon 3x now -- the first time the refills were just as great as my original Da Bird which I bought in a local pet store. The 2nd and 3rd time I I ordered the refills they came with black rubber ends instead of the red rubber ends show in the picture -- these refill pack toys did not make the "bird flutter" sound that makes my cats go wild. 2 or 3 or the refills also fell apart after just seconds of play. My cats love this toy so much I was desperate so I ordered some refills directly from Da Bird and they came today -- they are perfect and my cats are chasing them just like the very first time.... The lady at Go Cat told me that Amazon is selling some knock-ff refills of Da Bird and that it is very hard to tell the difference so be CAREFUL - or order directly from Go Cat!!!!
summary: Buyer Beware of Quality Control - Amazon selling knock-offs

reviewText: works great

One of our cats did something really bad: he peed on top of the washer, drenching newly washed clothes with cat pee. Unfortunately, we didn't catch it until after the clothes had been dried. If you have cats, you know that fresh cat pee odor/stains are hard enough to manage. Odor and stains that have been set with heat? Nearly impossible.We tried everything we could think of, to no avail. What finally seemed to work was soaking the clothes in a mixture of Nature's Secret Weapon Pet Urine Odor Remover and some water overnight. We then washed the clothes with fresh water, more Secret Weapon, laundry detergent, a cup of baking soda, and Wisk Deep Clean. Yep, the shotgun approach: try everything and see if something works.Happily, that seems to have done the trick. I won't say those black jeans are completely odor free, but they're fresh enough to wear around the house. I think another soaking just might restore them for good. If you have a stubborn situation, I think this product is definitely worth a try.
summary: Why is it always the new expensive jeans that fit perfectly that the cats seem to ruin?

reviewText: I haven't met a cat yet, who didn't love Da Bird cat toy.  These refills are great, because you don't have to buy the whole wand every time.  You just buy the refills.  I've bought Da Bird cat toy for many of my friends who have cats.  I buy these refills and share them with my friends.  If you have a cat, I guarantee they will love Da Bird, and the Guinea Feather refills!

Our cat is a tough case to entertain. He doesn't play much and loses interest quickly. Then I found out about "Da Bird" and thought it would worth the shot. Our cat loves it! It's fun to see him getting all excited, and not just watch but actually chase his "prey" again.Great entertainment for bored indoor-cats!

These treats are pretty thick and pretty tough. If your dog is like mine then they chew twice and swallow. They could probably choke on these if they have any pre existing throat or swallowing issues.I gave one to my dog she is medium sized and made sure she had tons of water available.  She ate it and had no issues of any kind.  I only feed her about 1 per week and she loves them.They seem like a good treat overall,  and I would for sure recommend them to others.

This cat litter is reasonably priced, and it works great. We have two very large tabby cats and have an extra-large sized cat pan.  This litter perfoms wonderfully, it clumps nice and hard & doesn't fall apart when you scoop the clumps. The litter we used to use, the clumps would crumble apart when we tried to scoop them, causing a big stinky mess in the pan. Now the litter stays fresher longer because the clumps stay hard as rocks and thus....less mess, less stink, less dumping old litter and adding fresh.  PLUS (a big plus), if you are an Amazon Prime member you get FREE shipping (it's a 40 lb. bag!!) and it's delivered right to your door in 2 days, no hauling it from pet store to the car, then from the car into the house. How great is that!  I love the litter and I love the convenience of ordering online with free shipping. Can't beat it the product or the service!  Cats love it too!
summary: Best Cat Litter For the Money

reviewText: they recommend this for a 10-20 gallon tank but it's way too long for the 10 gallon. it's harder too maneuver and it sticks out the top of the water after a minute of siphoning. i felt like it wasn't able to get everything because it had such a long way to go up the tube that when the gravel was falling out, it pulled a lot of the poop back out with it.  so if you have a 10 gallon tank, go with the mini, not the small.otherwise, i think it works well for what it is and the price.
summary: too big for a 10 gallon tank

reviewText: When I adopted my two kittens, I wanted to feed them wet food at least once a day as it is better for them and has higher moisture content. The shelter was feeding them Friskies Chicken once a day, but I bought a few cans ofWellness Canned Cat Food, Kitten Recipeto see if they liked it. Between the two kittens, they finished a 3 oz can per day. When it came time to order more, I found out that this CORE product was more economically priced by weight than their regular kitten recipe!I immediately switched over to CORE and my kittens LOVED it. They now finish a 5.5 oz can between the two of them per day, which is more what they finished with the regular Wellness kitten recipe. This is more in line with the Wellness feeding recommendations (1/2 cup dry + 3 oz wet per kitten per day). CORE has also has slightly higher protein content. I've noticed that my kittens eat less dry food as well. When it's around wet food feeding time (they have open feed on dry food), my kittens rush to crowd around me and mew when I'm in the kitchen.Clearly they prefer CORE. I'm alright with that. Recommend.

These are tough and chewy, so my large-dog grand-puppy loves them as is; for my two little yappers, I use kitchen shears and snip bits off.  every one of them just love these, and they seem to agree with everyone's tummies.

My German Sheperd LOVES this!!He is crazy about playing ball and the Chuck it! makes me happy to play. No more slobbery balls to throw.Your dog drops the ball at your feet (hopefully) and all you need to do is slap the Chuck It on the ball and toss again!Care must be taken if using in a fenced enclosure--the ball can travel quite a distance when "chucked". I have gone into neighbors yards several times to retrieve an overthrown ball.This is a great toy for man and beast!!The rubber balls that are used with the Chuck It are sturdy and have stood up to the chomping of my dog's jaws--which have reduced other balls to rubble.The white ball actually does glow in the dark if you have a dog who is in to night time play.

reviewerName: Retired Navy Guy "Chief Cook & Bottle Washer,...
reviewText: This is a well made, sturdy dog collar, adjusts easily, closure is positive and secure to about 40-50 lb pull for NON-Aggressive or overly strong dogs. The reflective strip is a bit narrow, but still shows up well.Definitely Recommend IF NOT for an aggressive dog where a more secure closure would be needed.  Would not put one of the "dangerous" breeds on one.

My cats can't get enough of Da Bird. They're addicts! Every day they sit under the shelf where Da Bird lives and try their hardest to call our attention to it, as if we've forgotten about it. They love this toy. We love it too because it gets them to run and play when they wouldn't otherwise. We do it before bed and have cats that sleep through the night. Love it!

After reading a lot of reviews on similar products, we chose this one.  Our dog is only about 40 pounds, but I wanted something sturdy because she is fast and will pull quickly without much notice (especially if there is a squirrl involved somewhere...).  The leash part is sturdy and rewinds perfectly with no hanging up.  The case is a little heavy, but it speaks to the sturdyness of the product.  The handle is plenty large enough to put 4 fingers in to hold it.  Over all a well made product and I forsee using this for a very long time.
Dogs love them and we still use plastic canister to store treats we buy. It has become the most sacred object in our house according to our dogs:)

I am unaware if it fits the door space of the smaller cages, but the nest box isn't large enough to attach to theVision Bird Cage Model L02 - Largewithout leaving a significant gap over the top. Even if it does fit the door space on your particular model, it's a horrible constriction of cage use because you will have to remove it every time you need to gain access to the inside of the cage to handle the animals or change food and water, which will disturb the birds and anything inside the nest box. The Vision cage, unlike almost every bird cage, comes with no breeding doors to allow placement of a nest box on the exterior of the cage, which is essentially an industry standard even in cages designed for companion birds.This is too large to fit inside a cage as it needs to be placed in a top corner for most species (excluding budgerigars), which uses valuable real estate, and makes access to the nest box difficult. I had to cut several bars on the left side of the cage in order to give access to the entrance hole of the nest box which I placed on the outside. This is something no consumer should have to do and it is a grievance because it causes permanent damage.For the nest box itself, I find the plastic material to be preferable to wood because it discourages chewing and it is much more sanitary in addition to being easier to clean than traditional wooden nest boxes. It's relatively easy to get together the first time. I don't like that it isn't completely "airtight" except for the entrance hole because it allows light to intrude and could be a risk for even the slightest drafts to chicks (which are dangerous in a bird room anyway). Regarding the green door that slides up for observation, the lip around the bottom connecting part is not high enough to contain a good amount of nesting material inside, which is yet another design flaw considering how close the round nest bowl is placed to this observation door. The box is apparently designed with the slick plastic trays so nesting material doesn't need to be used, but if something like shavings is not used a breeder risks producing chicks with splayed legs.In short, the use of plastic in this is a very good thing, but the way it comes together in the end with both nest box concept flaws and a complete miss as for use with the Vsion cage, it is not a good investment and I will not recommend the product or purchase another. It may perhaps be good with cages that are quite large or even in an aviary, but for use with a Vision cage it is a failure.
summary: This certainly doesn't seem to have been designed with the Vision cage in mind!

reviewText: Even though I have a small (15 lb) dog, I bought the large version of this leash.  I figured, the sturdier the better, so if the leash is spec'd to handle 110 lb dogs, it'll be indestructible vis-a-vis my dog.And it is very heavy and sturdy.  I used to have a cord leash which felt flimsy compared to this.  The tape style leash feels strong and is very reassuring.I've had it for a week, so I can't speak to its long-term durability, but the retracting action felt very smooth and controlled.  Haven't had any issues with tangling or the tape getting "stuck" at all.Highly recommended.

They are like pacifiers for her! If she's been running around like a nut and we need her to calm down, we give her one of these and she chews it for a while and calms down. This size seems good for my puppy, who has been chewing them from when we got her at 11 pounds and is now 15 pounds. they take her more than 2-5 sittings to finish.
Both the red and the black versions have survived the predations of our 11 month old German shepherd.See my review for the Kong Dog Toy XX-Large, Black.

reviewText: This replacement pump died almost 2 months to the day that I bought it (yesterday was 2 months). What a piece of crap. I'm debating whether to buy yet ANOTHER and hope for the best or do as another reviewer did and just use it as a regular bowl. reviewText: I bought our first spray collar from PetSmart (won't do that again, they charge $90!) and we love it. It's not as sensitive as the first spray collar we bought for our small terrier mix -that one seemed to go off at random and even at the mere shake of his head- this one actually seems to only pick up barking which is great. It enables him to play as normal and even make sounds so long as he doesn't full-on BARK. We will definitely be purchasing another one (from Amazon!) for our other little terrier. Totally recommend this collar!

I have ordered this product for the sake of it being 2 in 1 a shampoo and a conditioner however I received a different white bottle which does not say conditioner on it so now apparently I shall have to order a conditioner separately.As for the shampoo I am very content, I have a 3 months old Maltese and it was his first bath in my family, the shampoo has a great smell, washes of fast, worked on small amount of tear stains (I used a soft toothbrush on stained areas very delicately) and my little one had an ear infection before and we used a special ear product which was orange and made his ears yellow and for the first try the shampoo handled it perfectly. I am hoping that in a bath or two the color will be totally white again.But very disappointing regarding the product as I thought I bought shampoo and conditioner together 2 in 1 and eventually I shall have to pay twice.

My dogs absolutely love this stuff.  The ingredients are simply chicken breast and vegetable glycerin.  Purina is a trusted US company.  The only down side is that it's made in China.  A while back, a similar product, also from China, was pulled from the shelves at the local club store due to a contamination issue.  Since then I've been reluctant to purchase similar products.  The Purina name has prompted me to give it a try.  I'm counting on Purina to monitor the quality better than the other company.  I still rather severely limit the amount that I give them and keep my fingers crossed that we don't have any issues.
summary: My Dogs LOVE This but It's from China

reviewText: My dogs love these and I have been buying them for years with absolutely no problems. I did stop getting them until I read that Purina does its own safety test on each batch, with Purina inspectors onsite in China.Here's what they've changed -"CHICKEN SOURCED EXCLUSIVELY FROM ONE SINGLE, TRUSTED SUPPLIER:  We now source all of our chicken from just one trusted supplier in China. This is important, because sourcing exclusively from a single chicken supplier means greater control over all aspects of the chicken supply, including how the chickens are fed, raised and processed.STRICT QUALITY CONTROLS SUPERVISED BY OUR OWN QUALITY INSPECTORS:  We've also strengthened our already strict quality controls throughout the production process.  For example, we now exclusively partner with one trusted manufacturer to make these treats, in facilities where we have our own quality inspectors on the premises throughout the entire production process.  Our treats are quality-checked at each step and quality-monitored under a comprehensive food safety program designed to prevent potential quality issues before they can occur. We're confident we have the best quality program in the industry, and we know of no other chicken jerky manufacturer in China that has the controls we have.ENHANCED PRODUCT TESTING:  Purina has further enhanced our product testing. We test each batch of our Waggin' Train Chicken Jerky Tenders for Salmonella, melamine, di-ethylene glycol and antibiotics. Additional routine testing includes assessing for heavy metals, pesticides and mycotoxins."My guess is that these are probably safer than many chicken products made in the US for human consumption. Here, only a small percentage is tested.Each dog owner will have to make up their own mind.
summary: Dogs love these, but some owners may have safety concerns

reviewText: I have been using the Cat Tent for years to cover my Littermaid Mega.Pros:  provides coverage, privacy to the animals and offers some degree of odor control.  Does not retain odor.Cons: Fits too tight, which causes the zipper to break and fail.  Vinyl also discolors after 6 months or so and it can pick up stains fairly easily.  COst is also a con - this thing along with all LitterMaid products is too expensive.Overall, I have owned several of these.  Eventually, they start to look bad on the exterior and the zipper will fail.  That's really all I can say about it.
Left my dog alone for a few minutes and came back to find a million pieces of string everywhere. He pulled it apart from the rope ends and called it a day.

I have been buying the large CET chews for years - I've probably bought 50+ bags of them. Last week I ordered two bags: one was normal (various sizes, some thick, others thin.) but the second bag was strange. Every chew was identical, very thin and brittle. My dog could snap off a chuck with one bite and I was afraid he was going to choke. I submitted a request for return to amazon and was pleased with their response: they will refund my money and I don't have to return the chews. I threw the whole bag in the trash. I might give CET one more chance but if I receive another bad batch, I'm looking for a new chew.
summary: Very thin chews are not safe.

reviewText: It didn't take more than a minute to remove it from the packaging and stick it on my Fluval Spec III.Readings have been accurate and easy to read.

My Shiba Inu loves these treats -- however, I've noticed these vary from batch to batch -- sometimes the sweet potato and chicken seem fresher while with other orders, that hasn't been the case although the treats are still safe to eat -- e.g., the natural sugars from the sweet potatoes has crystallized, resulting in a white coating -- my dog doesn't seem to care and he looks forward every morning to his treat -- it seems that the lower the price, the product might be a little older but each container is emptied way before its' expiration date!

My 45 lb. border collie hurt her back, she's almost 14 years old.  I was told by the Vet that she could not do steps for about a week.  My sister had purchased 2 of these same harness for her dogs about 5 years ago and she always spoke highly of it.  I placed an order after measuring her and got it shipped overnight.  I got this within 24 hours, that was great as I live on the 2nd floor with 18 steps each way.  I was having difficulty picking her up and carrying her up and down the steps.  Once I received this harness I adjusted it to fit her perfectly and started using it.  By the end of the week I could carry her down the steps while holding a cup of coffee in my other hand.  This is amazing, I feel like I just put handles on my dog LOL  I highly recommend this harness.
summary: This is an incredibly well made, very useful product

reviewText: I have a 20 year old Japanese redbellied newt (no kidding, she's 20 years old) who loves this stuff.  I hand feed her crickets and wax worms, but she takes a few seconds to decide if she wants each one.  When I reach in with a tube of these bloodworms, she swims over immediately and attacks the gooey deliciousness as it comes out of the tube.  I give her a big mouthful and then squeeze the rest into her underwater food bowl.  She crams her head in the bowl & doesn't come out for the rest of the night.  She's only about the size of your pinky finger, but she can eat a whole tube of this in one day.  She's persistent.  I've been feeding this product to her on and off as treats and sometimes as a staple food for about four years now.

I don't like using the standard metal choke collars on my dog.  The metal discolors her neck.  This is supposed to provide a similar effect without metal, i.e. collar tightens if the dog pulls.  I hope the material means it is a more comfortable collar for her.  Unfortunately, it is not as effective but my dog has improved with training with a regular choke collar enough so that I use this one now.  You feel the pull but it's a more humane compromise.  My sister recommended it because her dog is an escape artist.  Apparently it is works for that problem:  dogs who can escape from their collar on a walk.  It is reflective and that's a nice touch.  Normally, my 45 pound border collie wears a medium size collar, but for this collar, I needed a large.  If you have a larger dog, try putting a string tied into a circle to see how much room you need to fit it over your dog's head.  That will give you the number of minimum inches of how large of a collar you need.  I don't recommend using the collar as the 24/7 collar, but just use on walks.  I would worry about choking if worn overnight and it gets caught and there is metal that touches the neck and that might cause discoloration or discomfort from metal on skin/fur.
summary: Fits small.  Not ideal for initial training to avoid pulling, but maybe a longer term substitute.

reviewText: My dog is super smart, but never gets bored with this ball. Easy to use. Well made. Great options for different sizes of kibble/treats. I use it often to feed my pup because she eats SUPER fast. Great way to slow down fast eaters. Your dog will love you!

This is great for my small (13-14lb) Havanese; Large size fits right. These vests are made only for small breeds so check the size carefully and do not buy for large breeds; large and extra large are for small dogs only. Extra-large is probably for a big chested Pug or small bulldog. This has a great breathable material, is light-weight, has good build quality, is attractive and comfortable, and is very easy to put on as it does not squeeze over the head but clips and velcro's easily behind the neck and shoulders; easily adjustable. It can be used safely and conveniently as a travel harness. No trauma putting it on or taking it off.  I highly recommend this Puppia vest-harness; 5 stars for me, my spouse, and my dog. I also highly recommend The Dogger from Canada. Check it out. I would buy this again, and I hope this helps someone.

This works great! The clip it comes with doesn't work as well with the expendable leashes if you've got one of the bigger ones so you might want to keep that in mind.  We have one that's good for dogs<40lbs and it just fits on the handle awkwardly.  It would work fine with any normal rope/nylon leash.  Easy to install bags and it has a cute bone shape!Update:  Since the entire casing is made of hard plastic is does not withstand any drops of the leash.  Our puppy likes to dart off sometimes and the leash will slip out of our hands if we're not ready for it.  This happened twice on the sidewalk before the entire clip broke off.  Just a warning.  The replacement one I bought was a canzas housing so we won't have that problem again.

It's supposed to be very nutritious and also good for their teeth. My 4 month old kitten seems to like it, and I'm glad she does because I can leave it out for her all day and it doesn't go bad or get crusty like canned food.
These rolls are awesome to cut up and use as training treats, but my pooches recently had a diet switch due to allergies. The only grain free option is duck and potato - wish there were more!

When we rescued our little dog, the vet said to give her glucosamine because based on her exam, the dog would have joint problems one day. We give her one every other day with breakfast and she acts like its a treat.

We needed a poop bag dispenser for walks and little trips, so we purchased this particular brand.It's easy to pop open to put in another roll of bags. The hole is big enough, so that it's easy to take pull out and rip a bag.The clip that comes with the dispenser is very useful.
