reviewText: I know nobody wants to read a wall of text on how good or bad this dog food is, so here is a very brief summary:This review is specifically for the High Prairie formula only.Pros:1. Bison and Venison as the main 2 ingredients in the dog food! Not that Bison and Venison meat is any better, but it might help out dogs that has allergies to common meats such as Chicken, Beef and/or fish. Best part of it is that the price of the dog food costs the same as other flavors! A lot of dog foods meant for dogs with allergies usually tend to cost a lot more.2. Price per pound is very economical. Price is actually much cheaper than lower quality foods such as Eukanuba, Purina, etc. It isn't cheaper than Pedigree, but at the same time it isn't filled with garbage like Pedigree is.3. Dog likes the taste. A lot of my friends feed this to their dogs. I fed it to one of my dogs before. He likes it as much as he does for the fish flavor. My other dog doesn't but he doesn't like any kibble anyways, so it isn't this food's fault.4. Food quality is good. No by-products or corn or any other garbage (like unknown sources of bone and meat meals, etc).5. No more ethoxyquin in any taste of the wild products!6. Solid poop with no disgusting smells!Cons:1. Dogs seem to poop more on this food than other brands such as Orijen or Wellness. Not a lot more though so this isn't really a biggie.2. Made by diamond Pet foods. Not really a biggie either, but diamond pet foods had been plagued with pet recalls problems in the past. Taste of the Wild hasn't had any recalls that I know of, but you're still running a risk, just a really small one.Compared to other brands, this is probably 4 out of 5, but it would be unfair because this brand is much cheaper. Orijen costs almost 2x of what taste of the wild cost.
summary: Good for allergic dogs! And good dog food for the price!

reviewText: My German Shepherd ruined this hammock the 3rd time she got in my car. She ripped the hammock in half, wouldn't recommend for large active dogs.

I did not hold out much hope for this product. We have two pedigree Persian cats, and they are as finicky eaters as any cats alive. My wife and I have tried all kinds of different wet and dry foods, but our cats usually just turn up their noses and look at us like we're stupid, until we give them something we know they like. So, when this arrived and I opened the chicken pot pie to see it was full of chunks of chicken and carrot (and something else, potato maybe) in what looked like chicken soup, I braced myself for packing up the remainder and donating it to the local animal shelter...but, NO! Both of our cats dug right in. Both ate up all the soup, and one cleared his bowl. The other left the larger chunks of chicken and all the veggies (he never eats veggies). For our cats, that's a rave review. The second kind, shredded chicken in sesame sauce, they didn't like as much, but they still cleared out all the liquid and a good portion of the chicken. Honestly, I was very pleasantly surprised they ate as much of the new stuff as they did. It must be good. For us, these single serving size cans are perfect, because we can split one between the two cats (they don't eat much), or give half in the morning and half in the evening, so it comes in quantities our pets are comfortable with. Also, packaging two kinds in one box is helpful, as our cats also thrive on variety. Because our cats did not eat it down to the bowl like they would their current favorites, I can't give the product five stars, but I do give this product a hearty four and half stars, and I think we are likely to buy this brand in the future if its price is competitive with our cats' current favorites.

My two dogs loved these, but my concern was how chewy they were... every time I gave one to my little dogs they would gag while trying to chew them up.  I ended up breaking them into tiny pieces every time I fed them to my dogs for fear of them getting choked on them.

Way back in 1997, my vet recommended I buy this fountain for my male cat who was suffering from crystals in his urine, in part from not drinking enough water. He was a finicky drinker, and if the water was more than 12 hours old, he wouldn't drink it. Back then, there were very few places that sold this fountain and it was expensive. I ordered it from a Drs. Foster and Smith catalog, and I seem to remember it cost more than $70 after shipping, which was a lot to a poor college student. But I thought it would be cheaper than vet bills and if anything would stop Dragon's painful urinary problems, I would try it (I also changed his to a non-seafood based food, which helped). Long story short, he and his brother both loved it, he never had another kidney related vet appointment again, and he died at the ripe old age of 14 from natural causes. This same fountain is now living on through another generation of cats who also love it, and it just keeps on pumping. I admit I am not the most diligent about cleaning it. It gets a rinse once a month and a full breakdown cleaning in the dishwasher (with the pump removed and the clear pastic reservior handwashed) every two months or so. I change the filter once per month. I've never had to replace a single part, even the pump. It's all original 1997 vintage parts, doesn't even look like the new version anymore, no logo or anything. :) My DH says it looks ugly from the limescale build-up around the bowl that will NOT come off (we have hard water) and he suggested we buy one of those fancy-schmancy bubbly dome ones for our ridiculously pampered kitties. It's not gonna happen. If this fountain EVER ACTUALLY DIES, I will be loyal to both the manufacturer and the vendor I bought it from and buy another one just like it from the same place. If you have any doubts about buying this, don't worry, just press "Add To Cart."

My dog is a VERY dedicated chewer. I can not give him anything but hard bones to play with unfortunately because he tears everything apart, and accidentally swallows pieces in the process. This ball gives him the ability to play with a BALL instead of a bone, and because of its shape he can not tear little chunks off. It is quite heavy though, I tossed it and it dented the wall. That is the only downside to it. I am very happy because he has a ball to play with that is not dangerous for him to chew on.

This has no smell, no dust, clumps very well, and comes in a 40 lb bag delivered at my door in 2-3 days after ordering.  What could possibly be easier other than Momma Kitty pouring it in her box..."not going to happen".  I really don't use as much litter because I clean her box on a daily basis.

We have three GSD.  One has a sensitive stomach, one has food allergies and one has had multiple surgeries followed by extensive antibiotic use leaving all pooches with food issues.  I found this food at the local Petco (well it's an hour's drive away).  Then I found the same product on Amazon fifteen dollars cheaper with free shipping.  It was a no-brainer to purchase from Amazon and set up the subscription with monthly delivery.The product arrives at our front door, gets emptied into the dog food coolers and the dogs think the chow is wonderful.  The dogs have had no problems with this dog food.  There are no corn fillers, no wheat, no gluten.  There are no by-products.  Unless I'm mistaken or have a faulty memory, I don't remember this product line being involved in voluntary recalls.One of the dogs (food allergy sufferer) now has a silky full coat where patches of lost fur were.  And the best part of it all:  their poop is small, compact and virtually odourless.  What dog owner doesn't love that?!
summary: Best Holistic dog food for dogs with sensitivities

reviewText: I have the shorter version too. This length of handle and M size is perfect for tossing and picking up Chuckit balls AS WELL AS regular ole tennis balls. We use this one just about every day.

I've been feeding my 2 maltese this food and this brand for over 5 years now.They love it and so do I because its completely & nutritionally balanced with the vitamins and minerals dogs need. There's no fillers or garbage in it.AND the best part is I get it cheaper thru Amazon. All I do is click order it and it comes to me 2 days later. I live in a part of South Dakota where nothing is close to me and Amazon makes it easy. Without Amazon, I'd have to drive over 200 miles round trip to get it or order it online somewhere else and pay more.Lets not forget the high cost of gas too. It's an excellent product bought thru an excellent merchant. It keeps me and the boys happy. You just won't go wrong buying thru Amazon. When you do it, your wallet stays fatter longer...and I like that part.
summary: My dog's rate this 2 paws up...lol

reviewText: I like these bowls for the same reasons other have stated: sturdy, difficult for my pup to spill, easy to clean. I ordered two medium-sized bowls for water and food, and I would recommend this size for most dogs (she is a puppy, about 5 lbs. now, and they work fine for her). While the bowls are well-made and very useful, I think they are a bit overpriced. I decided to view it as an investment for my pup, but others might prefer something less expensive, especially while training a young dog who likes chewing.

Out of 4 cats, one simply wouldn't go near it, one liked the broth and played with the food and the remaining 2  liked it immensely (nom nom nom). The cans are a good single serving size and it really smells like human food. Literally, they smell like cold leftovers. The food is in a broth and very wet, which your cat may or may not like. They only similarity in cats is that they are all different.To be fair, the one that didn't like it is insanely picky.  The food is not overly processed and I am happy to feed this to my cats. When I saw that it was made in Thailand, I was a bit wary as we all have heard about the melamine in, well, everything, in China. Then reading further, I saw the company addresses this and says that the food doesn't use Chinese products.  They seem a thoughtful company at the least, which when it comes to pets, goes a long way with me.As good as the food may seem to me, they are the ones that have to eat it.  It's a little more expensive, but not prohibitively so, especially if your cat likes it.
I just started giving this to my cat, it is an expensive product, I have high hopes and I'll pray that it will work because of the positive comments that i have read about this product

I have used other Wellness food products in the past and have had good results.  For some reason, this particular fish flavor seemed to bring out itching in one of my dogs and she started to have dry flaky skin.  I won't be using flavor again.

I just got the large size for my dog to use in his crate at trials.  It cools instantly to the touch and I am excited to try freezing it for an even great effect.  It folds up nicely for easy storage although the large size is quite heavy.

This is a really useful tool that all dog owners who regularly walk their dog should have.  Responsible dog owners know the importance of cleaning up after their pooch and this product makes it easy - no forgetting to grab bags before you go out because they are already on the leash.
summary: Any responsible dog owner should have one

reviewText: This was never a thought in my mind until a freak fire broke out at my apartment complex. (A lightning strike hit a neighboring building in my apartment complex and set it on fire), Everyone was okay (pets included) but it really scared me! It made me think - "what if it was me?", happy with these stickers!
summary: If you have a cat, get this sticker!

reviewText: My dog LOVES being under covers (he is a 12 pound miniature pinscher). Whether it is sitting around on the couch at night or sleeping under his own covers on top of my bed, he loves being covered up.  Most of the time I have to get up and fix his blankets to make sure hes covered up good, which is why I thought this cozy cave bed would be a good idea for him.  I actually purchased the small bed first but he would have been squashed fairly tightly into it, and also, it was so fluffy which gave it height, but the circumference was small, which made it easy to tip one way or another when he tried to crawl into it.  I couldn't find a medium sized bed anywhere so I purchased the large instead and returned the small bed, and it is much better.  Yes, I could probably fit a couple of dogs his size in it, but that's fine because he can stretch out in it comfortably if he wants to and it doesn't take up much more space than the other beds I have gotten him. The bed is high quality and has retained it's fluff and shape after 5 months. This is a great option for anyone who has a dog that likes to burrow and cover up.
summary: Great quality bed for dogs who like to be covered up...

reviewText: The second our rabbit tries to pull the hay out of it the ball falls of the wire so then it's still in the bedding.  I was so looking forward to keeping it up & off too.  Very disappointing.

My cats always rub against the corner in my kitchen so I bought this and put it on their favorite corner. They really love it and rub up against it just like the cat in the photo. It didn't stick to my walls too good because I have high gloss paint but I added some sticky mounting strips to it and it sticks fine now. I'm sure it would stick to other surfaces without adding your own adhesive strips. I comes with a little bag of catnip for the catnip pouches too.
I was sure this was a toy my dog would have good interest in.  Sadly, maybe 15 mins.  It is nice and heavy but my chewer found a weak spot and exploited it.

There's not even the tiniest bit of competition, this is THE BEST clumping, clay cat litter available. If you have a preference for clay and clumping litters, you can't do better than this. If you use an automated litter box, like the litter maid brands, you should really consider switching over because this litter is going to hold up so much better to that mechanical arm than other brands. Even if you don't have one of those, and you use clay based litters, you should still switch over right away!Cleaning out litter, which is always the least pleasant part of owning an indoor cat, was made so much easier when we made the switch to Dr. Elsey's. Now, there's no need to worry about clumps breaking as you're scooping or inhaling litter dust as you clean out the kitty's box. The low dust baseline is also excellent for your cat, and a must if you have a kitty with respiratory problems. This is an unscented, clay litter which is great, as it wont turn off cats from using it (due to their much more highly developed sense of smell, cats are often offended by scented litters). If you did want something to absorb the odors a bit better, you could always sprinkle a little bit of baking soda on the litter after you clean it out and add more.So now, what used to take so much time because you had to be so incredibly careful in scooping, lest you break up clumps, cleans up in just a minute or two. This litter's also cut back drastically on how often I need to toss out the entire box of litter, saving on money. Because the clumps don't break up, there's no real residue or broken, stray pieces dirtying up the remaining litter. As a result, the litter really doesn't need to be changed all the frequently. From what used to be a weekly thing, now it's a once a month chore. And if you're really diligent about regular, daily box cleanup, and maintain a sufficient height of litter (~3.5-4 inches) you could probably even get away with not tossing it ever (see amazing online articles on litter and litter boxes by Vet, Lisa A. Pierson on catinfo.org).I've also noticed less tracking, I think because it's such a dense litter, though some still occurs. I think that's just the nature of clumping litter though and easily addressed with a good mat or tray in front of the litter box entrance.Honestly, there's not enough good things to say about this litter. I've found it to be great for my cats and the foster home my last kitty came from also used this brand and they had some 10 cats living there. They swore by this litter and couldn't rave enough about it. I strongly recommend switching, if you're even slightly considering it! You wont regret it.
summary: Hands down best clumping litter EVER!

reviewText: I use this litter box with PINE PELLETS (you can go to a local feed store and ask for pelleted pine bedding for horses). The pine pellets turn to dust when it hits liquid and falls through the slots. The dust catches at the bottom (tray) and you just dump that out. You can rinse it if you want but it doesn't really matter. And if you shake the box (side to side) the poop floats up. Anyways it's held up pretty well (it's been a few months) and I got three of these. I highly recommend!

Our vet recommended a drinking water additive to help with our cat's gingivitis.  His red gums cleared up nicely after a course of antibiotics and now we are using this product.  I only gave it 4 stars because I haven't been using it long enough to know if it works but the best news is that the cats actually don't even hesitate to drink their water with this additive in it.  I was afraid that they would taste or smell something different and refuse to drink, but that's not the case.  Hopefully using this and the Hill's Prescription t/d kibble made for dental health, I will be able to avoid expensive and risky dental cleanings.  Even though only one cat has the dental problem, this is supposed to work to prevent problems too so both cats get it.  And of course how can you keep cats from sharing bowls????
Love the tidy cat system! Have multiple cats and no more litter all over floor. Has some dust but nothing compared to clay!

We just received this item only an hour or so ago.  The negatives:  Made in China, all TEXT DIRECTION is in Chinese BUT, THE DIAGRAM on the same side as the text is simple and anyone should be able to decipher it if they understand the plus and minus of a battery.  If your eyesight is poor, you may need magnification.  QUICK DIRECTIONS:  Remove the attached key chain, and remove the slide off door from the bottom of the mouse.  Insert all three batteries, the flat side of the button batteries are the plus side and it goes toward the SPRING or tail end of the mouse.  I put in two then pushed the two back with my fingernail toward the spring so I could slide the third one into the front.  I think using a knife or anything metal may short out the batteries but am not sure.  The door goes back on and I put the key chain back to insure the door would not slide open.  The small centered button on top of the mouse is the connection and the second we hit the button the mouse came alive with its beam.  On the floor, the cat went straight for it and we played for 10 or 15 minutes before he gave up to go about other things.  I am sure we can entertain him well, off and on, with this inexpensive little toy.  It did not come in the color shown which I would have preferred over "plastic yellow" but after all it's an inexpensive toy for cat play, not purchased for its color.  I think it is a fair amount of fun to expect for the small price.  No complaints except for the color and that is not enough of an upset to downgrade the 5 points it gets for immediate attention getter for the cat.  Cat rates it a 5 star item.  ONE MORE THING, this is a laser beam and it is noted on the package it is NOT TO BE DIRECTED AT EYES.
Yes as with others on here it is hard and cannot be grabbed thus my dogs have a hard time pushing it around, It is not a bouncy ball at all but than the product does not state that either,
Best toy....my cats love chasing the light!! Hours and hours of enjoyment. Even my older cat wanted in on the play!!

This is a great cat "fishing toy" made of sturdy velour on a wooden wand.  In fact, one really nice thing is that the wand is also covered, which makes it easier to hang onto with a big cat tugging on the other end.  The only thing I would note (and I did not lessen the review on account of it) is that my cat promptly pulled out all the feathers on the end.  Just captured the snake head and one-by-one extracted the feathers like a dentist pulling teeth!  Well, he's a young manx with a bit of a vicious killing mode, so I don't fault the toy.  I would, however, suggest that this toy might be better with a simple velour or fake fur "tongue" instead of the feathers.  In fact, I'm going to add one. :)

I gave my 20 lb dog a piece of a Waggin' Train Chicken Jerky tender. He loved it. He gnawed it enthusiastically.  Roughly 30 minutes later, he started throwing up.There is every chance that this was unrelated. My dog doesn't throw up often but I know correlation does not imply causation. It could well have been something else.But I love my tubby not smart little buddies. I just couldn't bring myself to try to feed these again. Given all the concern about jerky products, I will have to er on the side of caution.Given that experience, I am not going to feed the Waggin Train Jerky Duos dog treats.

Purina has been under investigation from 2007 from the FDA for the death and sicknesses of thousands of pets from their Jerky treats. their Beneful product is also been associated with sickness and ACUTE KIDNEY FAILURE. Please research before feeding your beloved family members anything from this corrupt company. I almost lost my dog from their products I have no agenda or gain but to save those who have no voice!
This toy is one of my ferrets favorites. My ferrets do not really care for toys but they like to hide in this one :)

For the first 14 years of my cat's life, I used a hooded box, lined with plastic, and filled with fine, clumping litter.  My cat had no problem with this set-up.  I, however, could not stand the constant sweeping of litter that would be tracked all over my hardwoods, even with the various mats I placed outside the box.  Two years ago, I decided to look at other boxes on Amazon, and the good reviews drew me to the Breeze.  For a month, I attempted to allow my cat to transition on her own by placing the Breeze box beside her regular box.  She refused to use the Breeze, until I finally decided to take my chances, and I took her old box away.  Success!**Breeze vs. Old box/clumping litter**Pros:* Very little tracking of litter!  A few stray pellets may escape, but nothing compared to the old clumping litter.* Seems more environmentally friendly, especially for the cat, as these pellets create very little dust.Cons:* More expensive.  I keep the cost down by mixing Breeze pellets with Fresh Pine pellets.* Can be messy if you don't use it properly.  For me, the biggest thing was to ensure I laid the pad in the tray "just so."  She liked to pee towards the front of the box, so if there was even a slight shift of the pad, it would not absorb, and the tray would be filled with urine.  If you remove the tray for any reason, aside from changing the pad, make certain the pad is still placed correctly before you slide the tray back, as it may have shifted.  It's recommended you change the pad once a week for a one cat home, and this worked for me.Final note - I do have concerns about how sanitary Breeze is, if I was to follow Breeze's recommendations.  One month seems a long time to go without changing the pellets.  I know the pee is absorbed underneath on the pad, but some must be absorbed by the pellets, and I don't like the idea of my cats having to stand in that for a month.  With the recent passing of my 16 year old cat, I've adopted two kittens, and I've got them using Breeze.  I'm planning to do some research for tips on how to keep the box really clean, as well as practical expected usage for the pellets.
summary: Solved issues with tracking of litter.  But expensive and has potential to be messy.

reviewText: I've only had the collar for a week and only now had the chance to use it in the field ... all I can say is WHAT A DIFFERENCE! I should say that my dog already knew basic commands like "Come", "Sit", "Stay", "Heel", and "Down" but getting him to do those things off-lease was a real challenge. With the radio collar, things are a snap. Games of fetch are now actually fun for both of us. He used to run after the ball, catch it, but then proceed to not come back with it. Prompts of treats didn't help past the first one or two throws. After only two "tickles" on the lowest setting (and we really are talking a "tickle" here ... I tested it on myself and the lowest setting is far less than you might get from a shock from walking on synthetic or wook carpeting), he now makes a bee line back to me after only getting the tone prompt. With only one tickle at the lowest setting, he's even heeling off lease as we walk home from throwing the ball. Truly ... if you have a dog who already knows basic commands and you'd like to be able to take him off-lease for games (or hunting as the product description states) this is a wonderful product. This is not a substitute for training but is a very effective supplement to it. All my dog needed was the reinforcement that I meant the commands I was giving him even off-lease.An additional kudos to the Petsafe company ... the originally shipped transmitter (the part that looks like a little FRS radio) was defective making the set essentially useless. One call to Petsafe and they replaced the transmitter with a new one with no problelm.
summary: Extremely pleased with this product -- works like a charm!

reviewerName: K. Gardner "Think occasionally of the sufferi...
reviewText: My two outdoor cats refuse to come in the house. They've been outside and happy for years, but it just drove me crazy, so I'd always construct some type of makeshift shelter on the carport or back porch for them.  They never used them that I know of. Bought this thing on a whim, put a couple of old flannel pillowcases inside and lo and behold they LOVE it.  It's large enough for a small dog or two, so I ordered one for my daughter's two little Jack Russells. Now, if they're outside and it starts raining, they quickly take shelter until they can be brought inside. Excellent value, I think.  It is bigger than it looks in the picture.  Also, the opening is quite large, so a makeshift flap can be placed over it or - I just positioned the opening towards the wall and away from the wind. This will be the Igloo's second Winter and it's still standing without any defects or design flaws that we've noticed.

When we got a second cat and had to have a second litter box, I was looking for a way to make the process of maintaining them easier.  After reading the review here I bought two, and I'm very happy with the purchase.  I used to hate litter box duty and because of that did it less frequently than I should.  This makes it so easy that the litter box is always clean.  I wish I'd had this years ago.
bought as shelter for outdoor cat....it is huge....for a cat....but does the trick....well constructed...nice,,,,,,excellent outdoor shelter for cat or dog

My dogs love these, but i save them for a special treat, because they are expensive.  But for me they are a good choice, since i don't give my dogs rawhide.  My chokie can make his stick last quite awhile, but my beagle-maltese can chew these up very quickly, hence I save them for a special treat.

The description claims that some companies sell bowls that are smaller than advertised, but that "all Bergan bowls reflect true capacity." False. These 2-cup bowls seemed a bit small, so I got out a measuring cup and decided to see how much water the bowl holds. Definitely less than 2 cups! It was around a cup and a half. If you feed one cat twice a day this bowl is probably large enough, but it is not the size advertised. Also, the label does not come off cleanly, leaving a sticky residue that's quite hard to get off. It would be nice if the label was at least on the outside of the bowl, but now the bottom of my bowl is all sticky. Giving it a generous 2 stars because it's cheap and it is indeed a stainless steel bowl, no rough edges or anything like that.
Excellent product. Helps a lot with chronic URI. I'll be purchasing this for as long as I need to. Good Job PetAlive.

This is our favorite brand of pet stain cleaner. It's affordable, and if you're working with fresh "messes," it works just as effectively as other stain removers without having to sit and soak on fabrics. Love it.
summary: Our favorite brand of pet stain cleaner!

reviewText: Fits in mouth like real bone; sturdy and durable.  If your dog is a chewer, these are great toys.  Also floats.

We switched to this for our self-cleaning litterboxes. The difference is night and day. It absorbs the odor quickly and our cats don't track nearly as much litter through the house as they used to. Highly recommend.

My kitty has issues with enclosed spaces, so this pan is great!  The top is open and the sides are clear, giving her that "open" feel, but still keeping the litter in the pan if she gets a little "energetic" while scratching around in it.  I'm using Precious Cat Litter (laugh at the name if you must, but so far this is some GREAT litter) and a Litter Genie.  Using the scoop included with the Litter Genie, but the one included with pan seems good and will hook onto the box (although if it fell, it might startle kitty, so I haven't stored it there).  Definitely would recommend this box to friends and family.

I have 4 cats, 2 that just turned a year old, and 2 that are almost 10.  Hathor and Nephrys, my elder kitties, were having bad urinary tract infections, we we had to buy them Pruina Vetrinary UR, which was $50 for an 18 pound bag and only available from the vet.  And they did not like it.  But after trying that and buying them a Drinkwell pet fountain, no more infections.  Great!Then a few years ago I heard about wellness and decided to give it a shot.  We upgraded to a Drinkwell Platinum Pet Fountain (becuase the resivour is awesome) and started them on Wellness.  Now, no more UTIs, much fewer hairballs, soft sleek kitties, and I much happier owner.The 2 new kitties came to us at 4 weeks old and they both had eye infections and upper respritory infections.  They were on wellness kitten for about 6 months, but then they refused to leave alone the indoor formula, so they are all on the same stuff.  They are both in much better shape, and although Odin has never fully recovered (he is blind and has seizures) Hel is a tiny terror with more energy than I have ever seen on any cat.  I think a big part of that is the wellness.  She is also soft and silky and will attack anyone who walks by her while she is on the cat tree.I would recoment this to anyone to at least try.

Ok, first the item was described as a pack of 2 mice when I only received one.  This definitely needs to be fixed as I now see I'm not the only one that thought this.  Second, this is my kittens favorite type of toy.  We have about every type Skineeez makes and they are by far his favorite.  He keeps them hoarded until we get home from work then brings each one out seperately to each of us then goes crazy tossing them around.  SUPER CUTE! :3

I'm glad to read so many success stories with this product.  Unfortunately, I can't say the same.  We have 3 cats and decided to rescue a 4th.  Our only female cat has never liked the "newbie" so I thought this might help.  I haven't noticed a difference, as of yet.  I guess they'll continue to agree to disagree!
summary: Nature's Miracle Just for Cats No Stress Calming Spray, 8-Ounce

reviewText: I have 6 cats and 3 litter boxes, all kept in the garage with easy access through a kitty door.  There was always a mess of litter kicked out around the boxes.  While these may not be the toughest plastic boxes I have found, they definitely serve their purpose.  I usually do not keep littler boxes for more than 6 months anyway, and replace them often because of difficulty keeping the urine odor at bay.  The high sides keep some of my over-zealous cats from kicking litter all over the place while burying their duties.  The boxes seem plenty sturdy to me as long as they are not moved around too much, in which case the plastic top barrier might come loose.  Three boxes and 3 scoopers for less than $30.00 is the best deal around, especially with the barrier.  I would recommend these to anyone who is tired of walking around with kitty litter/gravel/whatever stuck between their toes after cleaning the boxes :)
I don't quite understand this toy and neither do my cats.  The cats aren't interested in playing with it.  Save your money.

My 1y/o chocolate lab power chewer loves the Hurley.  We had previously bought the hulk and he loves that too. The hulk has lasted several months and is still going strong which is quite the accomplishment in our home.  I'm hoping this one hold up as well as the hulk.  So far, so good.  We've had this about a week and he loves it and it shows no signs of damage despite his affections.
summary: Holding up very well and he loves it

reviewText: My dogs are 2 and 8 years old.  They had no interest in these bones.  Perhaps a puppy who has a strong urge to chew would like these.  They have no smell and are a slick plastic texture.
summary: My two dogs would not chew these.

reviewText: Have two cats & have used the breeze system since introduced on the market/a breeze to use! Cost is minimal/no faucet hook-ups/no messy litter to step on/clean up easy!

I have these bones all over my house.  There are probably 2 in each room just so the dogs will always have something to chew on.  They are durable and will last for MANY hours of chewing pleasure for your pooches.  HOWEVER, you do need to periodically check the bones to make sure that there aren't any sharp points.  These are made out of a durable plastic, so small chunks can splinter off and make them sharp.  Two of my dogs don't seem to have a problem with this, but one of them does.  After a bone has had some chew time, it will get sharp and cause her gums or lips to bleed.  I just simply take it and sand it down a little bit with some sandpaper and give it back to her.P.S. - They also hurt like the dickens when you step on them after they've been chewed.  Be cautious with these around the house.  =P

Over the past 17 years I have always used the large litter box with the attached top.  When I saw this type of open top litter box I decided to give it a try. We have three cats and the transition was so easy I bought two more. The length of the box is a little short than what I had before but I love not having to deal with the lid any longer when I clean the boxes out. One of our cats is fairly large at 18 pounds but there is still enough room for her to move around. I would recommend this to friends and family.

I try to buy dog mats for my Pug because he will EAT the stuffing out of regular beds.I saw this and I was happy to see it looked comfty and with very little stuffing.I thought the 18" x 13" was going to fit my puppy but rather looks like it is for teacup dogs, toy breeds or Chihuahuas.I put it outside in the terrace and eventually my dog went to investigate the strange object.He liked it and doesn't chew on it but eventually you need to remember you are not purchasing something fancy or stylish.But for the purpose I bought it ... I'M DEFINITELLY HAPPY :)

reviewText: This is the second one i have bought, keeps my German Shorthair busy when Mom is at work. Buy it for your dog, it will make him happy.
My dog likes this but will not chew it much because it is very hard. He is an older dog so maybe a pup would enjoy it more.
My animals have been recently diagnosed with being dehydrated. This watering hole is perfect to grab their attention and makes them want to drink more water.

Although I was promised (like others in the Vine Program) 24 cans vs. the 1 can I received, I was able to give this a trial with ONE of my seven Norwegian Forest cats we show. All of my cats love the pate version of canned food so I fed this to my Queen and she ate the entire can in 5 minutes. It seemed to be well-received by her and didn't upset her delicate system.Speaking as a human, I appreciated the scent of this food, which was more akin to what we'd enjoy then the stuff I scoop out of a can and need to hold my breath when serving. This appears to be a very high quality food based on appearance and aroma.

This is my dog's favorite nylabone, and I have purchased several of these (and many other nylabone products). She is a husky and a very strong chewer, and nylabone is the only thing that she can't chew up in 5 minutes! These are great for heavy chewers! (The material might be too hard for dogs that don't chew heavily- try the puppy ones or the edible nylabones instead)

My corgi's are food obsessed and love their Kongs.  I was hoping that this toy would keep them occupied.  But, even though I put some high value treats in it, my dogs had no interest.  From my corgis' POV, this is a * item, but I gave it *** because it seems well made.
summary: Well Made - But My Dogs Had Zero Interest

reviewText: They liked it tell they could not get to the peanut butter which was only 5 min after giving it to them. I expected it to be more of a treat and that it would last longer. Further more one cracked when my dog dropped it a foot to the ground first thing.
My heeler loves this over the regular large bone shape nylabone. This is a very hard toy, so maybe she feels more destructive. Think it gives her more area to chew on at one time.

I always have a problem reviving my pond after the winter.  The water will start to get cloudy and dark as the water warms up.  I can't even see my fish when spring begins.  All of my good bacteria dies off during the winter.  So, I use this stuff for a few weeks and my water always turns crystal clear again and I can see to the bottom of my pond again.  Please note that there are limits to what this product can do, if you have too many nutrients in your water it won't be able to remove algae and it definitely doesn't help with string algae.  It is just good bacteria that works as a water clarifier.  But, it can't work miracles if you aren't testing your water and keeping your water under control.  I have under stocked my pond, and use lots of live plants so I don't have a problem with anything except string algae, but my water remains crystal clear with this stuff.This stuff stinks like raw sewage, but works great.  Be careful where you store it, I had stored mine in the garage and my wife was concerned we had burst a sewage pipe until I explained to her what it was.

I've been an Amazon customer for YEARS and have bought everything from toothpaste to computers on Amazon.  Lately, though, everything over $30 or so is obviously used, arrives greasy and dirty, and is obviously someone else's return.  In this instance, the Andis Clipper was open, greasy and the instructional CD referred to ao completely different make and model.  It never used to be like this but I'm going to start purchasing from ebay instead.
My cats won't TOUCH these. One of them tried and chewed and chewed. She finally spit it out. Oh, well...

I have a 4 month old kitten and I wanted to train him to walk on a harness early. I bought the xs but it doesn't really fit him. It's too small around the top and too big around his belly. The top part is also very stiff. I can fit it around his neck fine but it looked like the stiff collar was pressing up against his wind pipe and choking him. So I ended up pulling the holster back and put the top opening around his chest except then the velcro part became too small. The bottom velcro part was way too big no matter where I put it around his stomach. If the harness slid up, the opening for the "arm" rubbed against my kitten's "armpits" and it made him walk around slowly and clumsily like a cat with brain damage. He eventually gave up and flopped over and just went to sleep. Maybe he has to grow into this harness but so far, not a good buy! Do no recommend for kittens.I bought mine from Litterboy Products's ebay account because I had an ebay bucks coupon. They also have an account on Amazon. They ship fast so I recommend.
summary: Makes my kitten walk funny because it doesn't fit right

reviewText: I had a cat who used to attack some of my other cats.  I would put her in this thing and walk her around to get used to the cats, but be able to pull her back if she decided to attack.  This harness really holds the cat well.  It is much better than other harnesses that I've used that the cats were able to twist around and get out of.

My dog, Chester, dove right into this flavor, which is not his regular food. He is 12 years old and he had no problems chewing the food or digesting it. The food arrived in a bag within a box with no damage to either. The order arrived promptly after ordering. The food is fresh and Chester, who weighs in at 140 pounds, cleans the bowl and isn't hungry until his next feeding. I've never given him Nutrience brand food before, but if the dog's happy, I'm happy and it is quality food. Only reason for the 4 out of five is that I don't eat it, so I really can't say "I love it". Chester gives it a four-paws up.

I like this bowl because it is wide and has a nice wide profile.  I have two Cairn terrier mixes and feed them together - plenty of room for both to get their heads in the bowl at the same time.  Non-skid and easy cleanup.

It's a pretty big litter box, and the cover is high enough to prevent litter from going everywhere when the cats kick it to cover their evidence. The opening is big enough for most cats (unless you have a puma or something). It's very light yet sturdy, and the scoop is a big convenience.

I previously owned the plastic Petmate fountain and this fountain is so much better. This fountain only has 3 pieces and was fairly simple to assemble. It is very heavy duty, which is great because my cat likes to drag his water bowl all over the kitchen. This one hasn't moved. The trickling water sound is pretty noisy, and the pump is hard to fit correctly in it's housing. For these 2 reasons I only rate it at 4 stars. Other than that, I love it and so do the cats.

While the concept is great - my dog LOVES empty pop bottles - he doesn't have any interest in this particular toy. I think it is pretty sturdy, though I may not be the best judge as he hasn't really played hard with it. He has a ton of toys and this is his least favorite. It really is a good idea though and I do like how well it was made.
After she's through eating for the day I give her one kinda like a treat.  She looks forward to it.The vet was quite surprised how clean my cat's teeth are and we both attritube it to the chews.

I recently became concerned that I wasn't doing enough for my cat's oral health. Nobody wants her cat's teeth to theoretically fall out due to inadequate attention from the caregiver. So I started looking for solutions. I bought some fishy toothpaste that comes with a tiny brush, thinking I could somehow make it work. As a backup I bought these chews, not having much hope for them as they are quite large, larger than I thought would even fit in my cat's mouth. Well, lo and behold, even tho a very picky eater, she quite likes them and will munch one up quietly overnight. However, lately she has figured out how to eat the insides out of the little tube without crunching through the skin, which I think is what is supposed to clean her teeth. So the tiny toothbrush may have to come into play eventually.

My fish said they really like these shrimp pellets, but they wanted to know why it makes a mess on the bottom of their home when they don't eat all of it though.  I told them, it's probably because I feed them too much!

Great for their teeth-a little expensive, but not when compared to the vet bills!  Took a little bit of time to get them used to this, as it is not a normal snack.  Paper covered and they have to eat thru this to get to the treat, but now they beg for them.

We purchased this product hoping to ease the transition for our recently adopted shelter cat, as he seemed somewhat stressed and high-strung, and I was hoping Comfort Zone would help kitty "recognize" that this was his home. I will admit we didn't have litter box or scratching problems, which seems to be the selling point of this product. This product lasts about four weeks, and ultimately, it took kitty about 2 months to adapt to his new living arrangements. The product had absolutely no noticeable effect on kitty's stress levels, and in the end, we had to rely on good old time. It would be nice if this product could have helped kitty adjust so we could have minimized stress for him, but it just didn't seem to help. So if you're planning to use this product with a similar intention, just be aware of this.
summary: Not good as a general relaxant; maybe it would help for litter box or scratching issues

reviewText: If you are reading this, chances are you've got a dog, so going in we all have to keep in mind, each dog with their own personality and preferences may love FunBites, be indifferent, or walk away.OK, nutritionally these are mediocre, at very best.  They contain calcium but beyond that there's not much there.  The calcium is way down on the ingredient list, preceded by beef hide, starches and a sugar, so the calcium may be trace amounts.  The package analysis lists it at 1.38% minimum.  So essentially, the product is mostly filler.Before anyone says "But FunBites is loaded with protein"....The package lists crude protein as 53%.  Keep in mind manufacturers know what our eyes see on a label, which is PROTEIN.  Yes, but crude protein is simply the amount of protein found in the foods, and doesn't' signify that it is quality protein that is of any value to your dog.  So unless you see ingredients which list "meat" or "meal" after their name (example "chicken meal"), the crude protein is simply a number.These are made in Mexico, if you are concerned about buying food/products from outside the U.S. or specific countries.I think the one benefit to FunBites is their shape, being flat.  We have a 5 month old Golden Retriever puppy.  Like most puppies, he's going through his teething stage.  He is chewing on most everything and his new teeth are coming in.  He has a good assortment of chew toys, including some soft, some hard, cold ones, etc.  One thing he has shied away from is rawhide products.  Even if we get something filled, or fillable with his favorite snacks like peanut butter, he pays them little mind.  We figured he just didn't like them, or perhaps it was his teeth making it painful to gnaw on the rawhide.So we tried FunBites Calcibone.  He really likes them.  He will chew on them for a bit, eat them right up and wag his tail for more.So for us, they fit the bill as an occasional treat.  They are hard enough to hopefully give him a little cleaning benefit (but always brush their teeth!) yet small enough for him to manage, unlike larger or rounder rawhide products. These are not our main treat, as we prefer other products that are more beneficial nutritionally.  So we just use them on occasion as small rewards,  They can also be broken in half or smaller, so you can stretch these a long way.Price-wise they are not bad at all, then again there is little to them in the way of ingredients, so the value is in the volume of treats not in the overall quality.  Overall, these are just OK and I probably wouldn't use them again.
summary: OK, but nothing to bark home about.

reviewText: I have 3 cats.  The 2 males love crunching on these.  The female had trouble at first getting her mouth open big enough to grab a hold of these plugs.  She would kind of lick at it and it would roll across the floor with her going after it.  After a month now she enthusiastically crunches on these as well as the boys do.  These plugs serve a useful purpose in scraping plaque off your cats teeth.  What I do and highly recommend is using this with PlaqueOff.  They are an awesome complementary combination together and the sum of the parts is better than either alone.

My cat Olley loves this thing. I got him the Jungle-stripe lounge. Although he is blind (from birth) he uses it several times a day. He is also no longer 'marking' the front door or tearing up the couch. It was just what he needed. He is a happy cat again. I would say the only minor draw-back to this thing is the mess of cardboard scraps that surround it on the carpet when he is through with it (easy to vacuum up). It has taken my kitty about 2 & 1/2 months destroy this thing. It was smaller than I expected for the price (9x20 inches) but again makes up for that in use. I would much rather spend 12 bucks every 3 months for a new one of these than clean up urine marks and try to repair my couch.

The double end tooth scaler is exactly as described. I have 2 dogs (both rescued) and one has pretty bad breath and "brown" teeth so I have been trying water additives, sprays, dental chews/treats, and figured I would try this too. At their age I do not want to risk taking them for a professional cleaning (not to mention the cost estimates of $400-1,500+). I just started using the water additive, teeth spray, and this scaler so I'm not sure which is helping most but their teeth and breath are improving.As others have mentioned in the reviews, the scaler itself is good quality and the edges are sharp so be careful and do a little at a time. The storage sleeve mentioned is a joke. When I picked up the sleeve the scaler fell right out of the bottom. I'm guessing the sharp edge of the scaler punctured right thru the sleeve.If your pets are relatively calm and submissive to let you mess with their teeth, I would recommend you give this a try. Just be patient, persistent, and careful!
summary: Good scaler but sleeve is a joke

reviewText: My friend recommended this Kong Bounzer.  Our yellow Lab loved it.  Just don't leave unattended if you have a powerful chewer like I have.  The toy will just last longer.

I add water and hamburger and my dogs love it.  Dogs are 14 and 10 and no problems.  Recommended to my by a dog trainer.  I don't try anything else.  If you change to this product, I would recommend 1/2 this and 1/2 of the kind you currently use for a week or so before going to 100% this product.

We bought this and a 22 x 13 pink pet bed and they both fit our 7lb Maltese perfectly. We use it to make sure that our puppy does not get into trouble while we're at work. I give her some chew toys and Busy Buddy Twist kibble feeder when I leave. She's usually sleeping when I come back. I can't recommend crate training enough and this crate is well constructed. She likes this much better than a plastic crate. I'm guessing because it allows her more visibility.

My dog loves these. I bought them based on the other reviews. Most other rawhide products she doesn't show much interest in. I just have to watch her to make sure she doesn't eat it too fast and choke. It is always good with something like this to give them one when you have time to supervise them especially since they are small. Our dog is 28 lbs. so these might be a bit small for her. I might get her the next size up next time.

High quality. Great grip. Easy to use. Watch a how to video before using. If gums bleed when you use this, you need to brush their teeth a LOT more. Brush teeth at least 5-6x a week. Only takes 5 minutes and will keep your dog healthy. 99% of infections or diseases originate in the gums so if you love your dog BRUSH their teeth with Virbac Dog Toothpaste 5-6x a week. Virbac is THE best toothpaste on the market so look it up. If any bleeding occurs when you use this product, just dab a napkin or tissue with a tiny amount of plain Listerine for bleeding and gently dab area. A very small amount will do the trick. Bleeding gums can get infected so Listerine is a MUST. Although I'm sure there are other options to the Listerine, but if you use a tiny amount you'll be fine. Allows you to maintain tarter in between professional cleaning. Our vet teases me all the time because my dog's teeth are whiter than most people. Secret? Brushing her teeth every day, and using this dental scraper every month or so.

Absolutely love these.  Got two before moving (flying) across country with our cats from Seattle to NYC.  They fit perfectly under the airline seats so that we were able to keep our babies near us (which was especially important to us since one of our cats was 16 years old at the time).  Very soft and cozy insert which is also washable.  Love the privacy flaps with plenty of easy air circulation for them.  Our fattest cat fit in easily with space to move around.  Shoulder straps make them easy to carry.  What I especially love about the design of this bag is that it is unassuming, so that no one really knows you have your pet inside (unless they cry, meow, bark, etc). Great product!

I have two of these fountains for my cats.  They really enjoy drinking from them.  And I think that they encourage my cats to drink more water than the otherwise would.  These filters are easy to use and seem very adequate in filtering the water.  I have used them for some time and will continue to use them.  I would highly recommend them for others to use.

I must admit, listening to the sad little dog voiced over by David Duchovny is very touching, but just because a company supports shelters, doesn't mean the food is any good.I bought one bag few years ago when I got my first dog and when I opened it, it smelled like rotten garbage. Even at the time, when I didnt know anything about nutrition, I threw it out.Ingredients: Ground whole corn, chicken by-product meal (natural source of glucosamine) corn gluten meal, animal fat (preserved with BHA and citric acid), meat and bone meal (natural source of calcium), brewers rice, ground whole wheat, dried plain beet pulp, natural flavor, salt, potassium chloride, vegetable oil (source of linoleic acid), vitamins (dl-alpha tocopherol acetate [source of vitamin E], l-ascorbyl-2-polyphosphate [source of vitamin C, vitamin A supplement, thiamine mononitrate [vitamin B1], biotin, d-calcium pantothenate, riboflavin supplement [vitamin B2], vitamin D3 supplement, vitamin B12 supplement), choline chloride, minerals (zinc sulfate, zinc proteinate, copper sulfate, copper proteinate, manganese proteinate, potassium iodide), added FD&C; colors (red 40, yellow 5, blue 2)corn- first ingredient is hard to digest allergenic, gmo grain, where the meat?byproducts- whatevers left over after good bits are used up for human consumptions, heads, feet, intestines, tumors, etc.animal fat- unidentified animal, could be anything including roadkillBHA- carcinogenic preservativemeat and bone meal- unidentified animal, could be roadkill, most likely denatured (doused with chemicals like crude oil and citronella)natural flavor- msgFD&C-; dyes, linked to allergies and seizures

tried another healthy choice brand before this brand & all 5 cats hated it but then was weaning them off the fast food friskies & cat chow anyway, but this bag they've all taken to eating at once. Little round pellets are easy for them to eat, especially the eldest which is 11 now & she was vomitting twice a day every day before I decided they had to have a healthier diet & this cat food fits the bill perfectly. I'm so glad I found this!!! I love my babies & they'll prob outlive me lol. Haven't noticed any improvement in their coats etc but it's just now into Fall & growing thicker. Did notice one of my males had really dry skin when I'd scratch his back & now that's mostly gone so if it's changing weather or healthier diet, who knows. Just know he's better so that's all that matters.
summary: 5 cats like it, so do I

reviewText: I've been feeding my kitten Purina Kitten Chow for months, and just decide to give Iams a try. He seems to like Iams but his stool is softer after eating it, maybe it contains more fat. So now I only feed a tiny batch of Iams to him every other day or so, and still stick to Purina mostly.
summary: May not be suitable for your kitten

reviewText: My dogs prefer these bones over all others. The bacon smell is strong but that's why they like them and it doesn't over power the room or anything. These are big hit.
I purchase these very often for my two large dogs.  They are a great treat as well as being good for their teeth.  Highly recommend.
Not much a human can say about a dog treat.  We have a yellow lab who really enjoys her FunBites FlatSticks.  They do clean her teeth and do NOT give her bad breath.  Good choice for a dog treat.

My girls LOVE these things.  You should see how they dance when they know I'm getting them out!!  They don't even know I'm buying them to help keep their teeth clean.  :)Thanks for keeping the cost down so we can afford to give them a little "happy" each day!
Every time I use it in pack n bag it tears the bag open! {t says fits all but is not for all.

This is a neat little tool. It picks up the dirt and poo pretty good. It takes a few seconds for the siphoning cycle to start but once it does it picks up well. The only thing I don't like is that the water runs through the bag that the poo is in so if you run it too long it mushes the poo into liquid and it goes right through the bag. The only way I could see to make it better would be to devise a separate catch bin that the poo falls into. Any way it is way better than having to change water out. Just pick up a little poo, clean the bag, and pick up some more.

If you don't have a mama this is a must.  If you do have a mama it's a nice supplement to help babies gain weight and get a healthy start.  You can mix it with kitten food too once they start eating too.

This may work for a barely-stocked 10 gallon aquarium, but my 5 gallon is apparently too short, and it isn't strong enough for my 29 gallon. It just sort of stirred up everything it was meant to vacuum, leaving my 29 gallon looking worse than it did when I started. I'm not the type to write a negative review, but nothing I've purchased from the Tom line has worked correctly.
summary: Spend a little more and get something worthy.

reviewText: I seen this in a store for allot more money than on amazon so I had to order one.  The suction power isn't good at all and the thing only works when the water level is exactly right. The cheap version without a motor or need for batteries works so much better at removing things from the tank.  And when you clean the tank you should change the water anyway.  The only plus to this is you don't lose the water when you are cleaning the gravel.  The minus is you have to have the water at just the right depth to get the thing to work at all, and then the suction isn't strong enough to move much.  This thing just managed to stir things up in the tank and make it look terrible.In my little tanks 5gal, 6gal, this is almost a worthless item, in the new 29gal tank it works wonders.  with more water its easy to get the water flowing, and keep it flowing, and with a larger tank the gravel cleaning attachment works allot like a comb as you move it around your tank because the large grooves in the side of the head don't allow real suction to get going.  If you take the head off this thing is full of suctions power and you have to be careful not to allow gravel to get into the impeller.In a larger tank it does what its supposed to do, and when I emptied my smaller tanks it worked pretty well and filtering the debris out of the water and moving it into a bucket for reuse in the bigger tank.  There is a strange little stream of water that shoots out of it below the filter sock though. It doesn't make much sense to me to leave a way for stuff to just flow right back into the tank without running through the filter.It also does quit well at when you attach a hose to it, at removing water from  a tank. the water comes out quite quickly, for this use I was impressed, I just wish they hadn't cut the huge groves in the gravel head so I could do what it was make for, maybe they have two and half inches of gravel in their tanks, but I don't have enough gravel to make the grooves sense.

This is the first scratching post I got for our new kitty (first one I've had in more than 15 years) and I didn't realize it is just corrugated (sp?) carboard.  It comes with catnip that you are supposed to sprinkle on the top, but it just falls right through and onto our carpet.  The kitty seemed to like it right away and would enjoy laying on it, but has since ignored it and hasn't gotten attention from him since right after we got it.  I think I will try something else next time I purchase a scratching pad.

I bought the Drinkwell Platinum Pet Fountain because my cat was driving me nuts meowning for me to turn thetap on in the bathroom so much.  A week or so ago she stopped drinking from her water bowl (I tried many others),but, no... she only wanted RUNNING water.So, I went to Amazon (one of my fav places in the world) and found the 'Drinkwell'.It arrived yesterday.It mentioned, in the instruction booklet, that 'my cat might take a day or two to get used to it' (there's a slight hum).They were joking, right! :D :D  She was in there like a bat (cat) our of hell! :D:DAs I mentioned, she would INSIST that I turn the bathroom tap on for her.NOT ANY MORE!!!She now sits for hours watching the water flow...Can you see me smiling! :D

My cat did NOT like this fountain. I think the sound of running water actually frightened her. My suggestion, if your cat is okay with drinking from a dish, don't spend the extra money on one of these fountains. Not worth it.

This is really just a pricey cat treat. They're a bit greasy, so they gave our cats tummy aches. Perhaps they're in pain so then they're not insane? No matter, it didn't really calm my cat's nature to stop ripping his fur out.

Both of my dogs are medium-sized and not fussy eaters.  They just gobble this up!  They enjoy the small bites and seem to love the flavor.  My vet recommends this and sells it in their office.  Amazon is a little cheaper.  I will definitely buy this again.
LOVED them!  They do have a bit of a smell as most bully sticks have, but these really were great!  They lasted quite awhile, and you really cant find a better deal on the price!
My dog loves these.  They are by far her favorite chew toys and among her cheapest.  Go figure.
summary: They are by far her favorite chew toys and among her cheapest

reviewText: We just changed to this product from another Wellness Brand name. The well know store I went to to purchase our regular foodhad all expired stock this was all they had that was expectable as a filler to make due until our pet food order arrived from Amazon.While it was a per chance purchase we noticed all the dogs LOVED it after reading the ingredients from then on it has beenour food of choice for all our dogs above a year in age.
These calming chews are a decent size and perfect for a night-night treat.  The bag contains a large portion as well... good value!
This Nylabone is durable and keeps our pup busy. She is teething and seems to really enjoy it. It is not large, but well sized for a medium puppy.

My vizsla puppy loved this toy and started to chew it right away. In 5 minutes there were a lot of small and very sharp pieces everywhere. I had to throw the toy out. My puppy destroys everything and chews on toys really hard so this chew toy wasn't the right choice for him. But it would probably work with dogs who are easy chewers.

Despite years of daily walks, there always seemed to be at least one day a month when I would leave the house without enough dog poop bags. And, of course, those are the days my pooches have an audience. Considering the grief I've given others for not picking up their dogs' poop over the years, I have had no choice but to find something, anything to clean up the mess.Even when all goes as planned and I do remember to pack bags, there have been occasional times that I realized too late that the plastic grocery bag I'm using is split or has a hole. Skin contact! Ewwwww!These bags fit thisBags on Board Bone Dispenser, 30 Bagswhich eliminates (no pun intended) both problems. First, these are strong bags. Thicker gauge plastic than grocery bags means no (ewwwww!)surprises caused by split seams or holes. For my periodic memory issue, I bought two dispensers to hang from two of my dogs' leashes, so I never run out as long as I remember to refill whichever dispenser goes empty first (so far so good).Save money and get the Bags on Board Regular Bag Refill Pack, 120 Bags at a discount with Amazon's Subscribe and Save program.If you're the responsible type and pick up after your dog(s), you'll love these bags and the simple dispenser.*** The bags I received are the same blue ones pictured here and are the same size as the ones I received when I purchased the dispensers. I see that there are multiple sellers. Perhaps it was choosing the Subscribe and Save option that brought me the same 5 Star bags as before. If my next S&S; delivery brings the smaller, thinner bags others have described here, I will update my review and reduce the rating (and cancel my delivery subscription).
summary: Makes It Easy To Doo Doo The Right Thing!

reviewText: Tally Ho, is high strung and she shakes like a leaf when she goes to the vet or groomers. These really help her relax. Take the edge off.
Be careful.  The hard plastic is strong but may cause your dog's gums to bleed all over the place.  Not good for white carpet.
This is my second bag....the first one lasted for 13 years! I bought this bag for a new puppy that I am transporting home on a plane.  It is durable and perfect for a puppy.

reviewerName: I HATE GRAHAM MCINTYRE AND NADER AIINEHSAZIAN
reviewText: I bought this for my great dane. she doesnt pull but I bought one for my other dog so figured why not. unfortunately I lost this one so have no idea how it fits or works on my dane sorry
summary: I lost this one but the M one I ordered for my heeler works great

reviewText: absolutely the best dental snack!  my dog took time to like the product but once he is hooked, this becomes one of his favorite treat.  it is pricy, so i give him every other day.  it is a great feeling to know while he is chewing on it, he is also getting his dental care.  became a repeat buyer once my dog decides this should be one of his regular treats!
The Spirit Essences have worked very well on my temperamental, neurotic male cat.  They calm him and soothe him so I will continue to use them.

Anxious cat was constantly crying in the night...this did an amazing job at calming her.  She did the freeze-and-flop for a while, but soon figured out she could move around in it.  Unfortunately once she started moving around she figured out how to undo the velcro with her paws and wriggle out (she's a little Houdini, she can even wriggle out of snug harnesses).  So I fear its effectiveness is only really limited to actually being ON the cat ;)  (But if your cat isn't as skilled as mine is...)
summary: it actually does work, if you can keep it on.

reviewText: My puppy was recovering from a hip surgery and was restricted for his daily activity. I was very happy reading all the good reviews about the bull sticks. For the last couple months, we went through 4 bags of this 1 lb large bull sticks. Though my puppy is always in heaven when he has one to chew on. The quality of the sticks is, sadly as other reviewers mentioned, going down hill.  I just received the latest bag from UPS today, and the majority of the sticks are like pencil size. No kidding, PENCIL SIZE!I'm glad that I always add items to the cart first. This way, you'll be reminded any price change. Though I'm not happy about the size of the sticks, my puppy does love them. So I'll keep my eyes open for better options. At the mean time, guess he'll just do with pencil thin bull sticks!
My three dogs found nothing interesting with this toy.  I don't even they smelled eat.  It is worthless.  Do not buy

I rated it 5 stars because I read the reviews of others and new what to expect. Yes the bags are a little shorter than the ones you get at the pet store but then the price is half that. My dog weighs 65lbs and the bags are fine for my dog. If your dog is 75lbs or more you obviously need the longer bags.
My Conure likes this toy a lot so I will be buying this again for him when it wears out.
I use these and dentastix after my dogs eat. Think it helps to keep teeth clean. My dogs seen to really enjoy chewing them.

I found this on amazon while searching for a similar product that was 3x more expensive. This had great reviews and was affordable. My dogs seem to love it and eat it readily.  I usually just put it in their food.It seems to work especially well on my 9 year old black lab. She loves to chase the ball and overdoes it. This seems to help her stiff joints a lot.
This is a must have if you plan to cut your own dog's toenails. Works very well.Purchase in combination with Miller's Forge toenail clippers and youll be all set!
Even though this toy was a little smaller than I thought it would be, it has become one of my dog's favorite toys.

My dog enjoyed eating these treats immensely (although the list of things she will eat is long and frightening!).  My complaint is that they are so thin that they are gone to fast.  I have a 75-pound lab/retriever mix, and she gobbled the treat up practically before it hit the floor.  on one hand, that means she really enjoyed it, but on the other hand I'd rather give her something she's going to chew on for a little bit longer instead of something so puny.

reviewText: Love the carbon in bags - don't get rid of this product, as I use them to drop in a wet-dry filter I currently have.  Will continue to buy...thanks.

Previous sticks had a very mild odor which would become a little stronger when my dogs started chewing on them.  These smell very strong.

reviewText: Wonderful products with high quality ingredients that don't include corn, grain, meat-by-products, and other fillers. Cat approves. Highly recommended for cat owners.

Likes:- Nutrition and ingredients.  Pretty fancy stuff.- Grain free.  Another option to try for your pet.  Sometimes switching their diet helps.  Try it for a couple of months.- Our cats love it.  They are very enthusiastic about this stuff.- No extra barfing.  Some types of food seem to cause our cats to throw up more.  Not the case with this one.  Seems easy to digest for them (a mid-age and a senior cat)Dislikes:- Price.  You get what you pay for.  This is grain free, with premo ingredients.- Aroma.  This stuff really smells fishy when you first open the bag.  Cats love it.  We keep it in a plastic bin that seals.  Not really a problem, but you will be surprised the first time you open it.  It really is made with a bunch of fish.Two paws up.

reviewText: My cats are diggers and they often end up breaking up their clumps into small bits that most other litter scoops cannot pick up.  This lifter is much better at getting almost all of these little bits.  It is also nice because the clean litter quickly falls through the scoop rather than sit in it like other scoops I've used.  It is a large scoop and doesn't hang from the hook inside my Hidy Tidy litter box, but that is a minor inconvenience.  I read from other reviewers that being plastic, the scoop will eventually break.  I can see that that would happen, so I am making sure I support the scoop where it joins the handle as I lift.  It is too large to maneuver in a small litter box that I use for my foster kittens.  It'd be the perfect scoop if it would come in different sizes and in metal.

summary: VIDEO of ONE OF MY FOUR CATS LOVING THIS FOUNTAIN

reviewText: These are great for potty training a hard to train dog that you really want to let inside.  If they happen to sneak around trying to eliminate, the wrap catches it so you don't have a mess in your house.

So far my cat who has to be on grain free and has been for the last 3 years is eating this but barely compared to his normal brand. It's a lot drier hence harder cat food and I'm not fond of the quality. My cat is a lot, I mean a LOT more talkative lately and I can't help but think he's trying to tell me something since his bowl still isn't empty, lol. My dog's couldn't handle this brand and had to be immediately taken off it so I'm not going to continue giving it to my cat. I did love the velcro closure though. But I'm sticking to hill's ideal balance.

reviewText: I got the hot pink scoop and love it. It quickly combs through litter and picks up even small clumps. The ridges are smoother too so less litter sticks to it!

WHERE ARE THE INSTRUCTIONS TO PUT THIS TOGETHER?  I'VE LOOKED AT SEVERAL SITES....NONE TO BE FOUND. WOULD YOU HURRY TOO WITH AN ANSWER. I'VE BEEN WAITING A MONTH TO GET THIS AND PUT IT TOGETHER.SINCERELY, MARSHA SCHEFCICK

Well I didn't try these first hand so I can't speak to taste. My black lab Buddy seemed to really love them though. I hadn't purchased the harder treats for quite a while and I think he enjoyed that aspect - although he would still finish off one of these sticks on about 20 seconds.Dogs need some tough stuff to chew on occasionally and these are a safe way for your dog to use his teeth the way nature intended and really dig into something. I wouldn't hesitate to get more of these.

Fun Bites are small sticks made up of little pieces of beefhide compressed into a flat strip and fortified with calcium carbonate. The strips are 5" long and 3/4" wide. The package touts that they help clean your dogs teeth while he/she chews. They don't seem to have any smell to me nor are they artificially colored. Since my dogs adore rawhide bones, I thought they would enjoy these, too. Unfortunately, they aren't excited about Fun Bites.My 80 lb. lab/mix will take one, although without enthusiasm, but she seems to crunch it up and swallow it in less than a minute. She definitely does not chew it so it never has a chance to do any dental cleaning. My 17 lb. dachshund/mix took it, after first checking to see if I was offering anything better, and ran off to the other room with it. I thought that indicated he kinda liked them, so I gave him a few more over the next couple of days. Sadly, I discovered he was simply burying them in between the cushions of the couch.I'm not sure why my dogs don't care for Fun Bites, but there you have it. Maybe your dog will like them better. Even though there is a yellow lab pictured on the front of the package, I think because of their size, these would be better for smaller breed dogs. They don't present much of a chewing challenge for a large dog.For those who read labels before buying, the ingredients listed are: beefhide, rice, flour, maltodextrins, dicalcium phosphate, dextrose, and calcium carbonate
summary: My dogs aren't excited about Fun Bites

reviewText: Very good quality. Super easy to hang. My little cat loves to cuddle down inside. Great product overall. I think it would be too small for a large cat but this is designed for ferrets and such. I just wanted something for my kitten to feel warm and safe. Suits that purpose just fine.

The improvement in breath in pretty clear and they are low in fat/high in protein.  The 60 count pack is also more than what you would get from similar products of similar cost. reviewText: Wandrcat finds this mix of turkey, chicken, and herring extremely delicious. He usually favors fish flavors over poultry so I was relieved that he didn't balk when I first served him this kibble. Wandrcat is missing some teeth yet he has no trouble chewing this food....the kibble size is small and easily broken up. He also seems to regurgitate less frequently which is greatly appreciated by both feline and human. There is nothing fancy about the look of this food....no special "raw" bits or fancy shapes. It is just good nutrition that tastes good…..at least to this particular cat.

***I've posted a picture of my cage. CHECK IT OUT!I bought this cage through Amazon because it's like 50% off and I got free shipping with my Prime. It is extremely spacious and the multiple levels really make it a "home" instead of just a cage. This cage is meant for FERRETS. So everyone who is giving it negative reviews because it wasn't good for say guinea pigs, rabbits, or other small animals...THAT'S BECAUSE IT"S NOT MEANT TO BE GOOD FOR THEM. There are two shelves that allow for built-in food-bowls. This is really convenient to prevent spillage. I was able to fit all the shelves in AND have three hammocks up top. I was also able to fit toys/tunnels on the floor and the shelves. It fits nicely a top my dresser and is super easy to clean. Also, a large square-backed litter pan will fit on the floor; even under the shelves. The wiring has withstood my ferret's persistent chewing and the multiple cage openings/"doors" make getting your ferret out super easy. It is definitely better-made than some of Super Pet's more recent "My First Homes." It's really too bad that they aren't selling it in stores anymore. If you want your ferret to have plenty of room to play/explore and not be stuck in a two or three level cage than THIS IS THE CAGE FOR YOU!

The one time I did see him in it, he was on the edge like he knew there was something in the middle. I tried not plugging it in and just let him get used to the pad being there. Nope, he's on to me and he's not into it. In theory it seems great, especially if your dog had arthritis or something. But my 1 year old border collie mix is just too smart for my tricks I guess.
