There's such a range with dog treats - you can find those fake bacon treats that are filled with chemicals and then you can find these treats that contain only organic ingredients - no strange chemicals that you can't pronounce. If you want to give your dog healthy organic treats that they'll like, these treats are it.These treats are about 2 inches by 1 inch, scored in the middle so that you can break them in half (even scored, it can be difficult to break them in half). These treats are very hard - so if you have a dog with dental problems (like a senior dog), they will have problems eating these treats. If you have a dog that leaves crumbs and doesn't vacuum the floor for every morsel, you'll find plenty of crumbs after your dog eats these treats.Taste-wise, my dogs loved these treats. I have 2 large dogs (Labs) who, granted, love all treats. I decided to try a taste test - since my dogs will eat their favorite treat first, I was curious to see how these treats fared with some of their other treats. I gave my dogs these treats, a lite doggie treat, and a bacon/cheddar treat (both of these treats are made by Old Mother Hubbard). Of the three times I tried this test, one Lab consistently preferred the Old Mother Hubbard (OMH) bacon/cheddar treat (and would eat this treat a quick second), the other Lab preferred the Newman's Own treats. Considering that the Lab who ate the OMH treats first, tried to eat these at almost the same time, I'll say he liked these treats a lot too.For the amount of treats and with Amazon's current price, I think this is great deal for a healthy doggie treat.

price point is great, super comfy, survived plenty of washes. the ONLY thing that i would want to change is the way it's cut. if it was a bit higher cut on the belly area my male dog would be able to pee in it, but at the price point, great hoodie to keep him warm.sizing - miniature schnauzer, about 14 lbs, 12 inches, fits a size small perfectly

reviewText: My pets, cat & dog, enjoy their new fountain. The doxie drinks from the bowl and Miss Kitty goes wild over the running stream of water. I hoped my dogs would like these.  They eat most chews, but I thought these might last longer, and be gentle on their stomachs, based on the description.  One of my dogs is fussy, the other will eat almost anything, and they both turned up their noses at these, and I tried on a few different occasions.  Therefore, I cannot recommend them or comment on their digestibility.

Update: I no longer use this. Sludge, slim and dirt collects and forms too fast making it not worth the cleaning effort compared to just using a stainless steel bowl. I may try a Ceramic Pet Fountain, I know they have stainless steel fountains as well.The positive points: Cats seem to enjoy it. You don't have to change out the water in the bowl as frequently as a still standing bowl. It has a filter to filter out the crud that collects in the bowl. It fits together nicely and doesn't use too much space. It does make a bit of a splashing noise when the cats drink and / or if you have the pump set to a certain flow. It isn't bad IMO, its actually relaxing to me.The negative points: You'll have to clean it once every 1-2 weeks, and it can be a bit of a pain. (There are a lot of parts to clean.) You have to set aside 10-15 minutes to clean it. If you use filtered water, the water tends to stay clean longer. Sludge will eventually form regardless. The pump causes vibrations and some of the plastic parts rattle. I usually just hit the top of it and it stops when it does that. When the pump is on high, water runs over the top of the internal filter. (Defeating its purpose.) So you cant really have it on high unless the filter is brand new. I think the internal filter design sucks but it works. Kinda.Overall, im pleased with it and recommend it. I think there could be some improvements but it is defiantly better then having a regular still standing plastic water bowl. If you pass on getting one of these water fountains, I would use a stainless steel bowl.  It doesn't generate sludge like the plastic.

reviewText: Hi,I volunteer for a poodle rescue group and rehabilitate a lot of neglected animals. Neglected poodles suffer badly since their breed needs washing and grooming or their hair mats, can stay damp, and becomes filthy. This leads to all kinds of bacterial and yeast infections of the skin, eyes, and ears. My current foster dog has a severe case of Malassezia yeast and Pseudomonas in both ears and a generalized yeast skin infection. The smell is horrendous so I can appreciate the odor control ingredients in this product. The ingredients help break up the bio-film that Pseudomonas forms in the ear and this is absolutely necessary for any medication to work. Obviously, the dog I am fostering needs and is receiving veterinary care and Rx medications to get her condition under control. I use the Epi Otic Advanced in conjunction with these meds and will recommend that her new owners use Epi Otic Advanced once or twice a week to hopefully prevent future ear infections. Dogs with allergies and other underlying conditions which compromise the skin, make a dog prone to ear infections and regular hygiene with Epi Otic Advanced is a must.Before using any ear washes or medications, please have a veterinarian check the ear first to make sure the ear drum is intact. Any chemical put in the ear when the ear drum is ruptured can lead to deafness.My favorite ear products are Epi-Otic original for normal hygiene, Epi-Otic Advanced for shelter dogs, ear infections, and maintenance for dogs prone to ear infections and zymox ear medications. Use all medications liberally and for an extended period of time to make sure you wipe out the entire infection. If your dog currently has an infection or is prone to ear infections, please skip the home-made vinegar, alcohol type treatments and use the scientifically formulated stuff. Your dog deserves to live without ear pain.
Use this on my dogs problem ears and would not ever use anything else!!!!! clears up in a matter of days! not weeks! better than anything the vet ever had!!! vet did not work anyway, this does!!!!

1-29-2014:I'm modifying this review and changing the stars from 4 to 5. I DID get my senior kitty to use it. It took a little more prompting. I had to both have her get used to a ramp from the couch to the floor (she gained confidence using that one, and eventually realized that there was a pretty similar ramp up to the Litter Robot), as well as change her alternate litter box to a cheap covered one - cost me $9.99 and is here on Amazon: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0002ASCGC/ref=oh_details_o01_s00_i01?ie=UTF8&psc;=1. I kept it uncovered at first, then a few days later, covered it. I kept taping the lid of the covered one up (although it kept falling down). I think eventually the litter in there got dirty enough and the cover trapped in the smell enough that she saw the Litter Robot as a cleaner, better option. She and the younger cat have been fighting over the Litter Robot - the younger one got used to it being part of "his" turf. I did add more catnip to the litter (inside) as well as spray catnip spray around the 'bot, and used only Cat Attract litter for the 'bot (I used World's Best for the cheap covered box - which the Litter Robot people don't recommend using, btw.) For several days, I also put the globe on the floor. I stabilized it (somewhat) with the cardboard packaging material it came with (a few pieces had circles cut out which fit the globe). My senior kitty got used to using it while it was on the floor, and then I put it up on the base again, with the ramp, after she was already used to a similar ramp doing something she was motivated to do (getting on and off the couch). It's a bit of effort and can be a pain while transitioning, but it's very much worth the effort!!!I also called the people at Litter Robot and they gave me great advice. I thought my circuit board in the front wasn't working and they shipped another out right away (Murphy's law, it seemed to work again the day after I called them.) It really is an incredible piece of machinery and if you can't get your cat to use it, I'd try calling Litter Robot for a few other ideas...their ideas helped get me to get my senior kitty using it, and I am THRILLED.12-29-2014:The Litter Robot is the best kitty litter solution available, IF your cat will use it. We have two cats - one is a senior, arthritic with previous injuries, the other young and agile. The young one became curious enough and I let the other cat litter in the regular litter boxes "go" long enough for him to realize this was a good place to do his business. He doesn't, however, like it. It still intimidates him (after all, it does look like the Death Star - it's even intimidating looking for us). I added a makeshift ramp to it (a ramp catscratcher and put catnip on the catscratcher), to help entice him. It worked. I would recommend that the makers offer some kind of ramp like solution.My senior kitty would not use it. Even though she was embarrassed and ashamed, she preferred to go outside the traditional litter boxes (once they were dirty enough) than to use the Litter Robot. I thought the ramp would help entice her, but since it is lightweight and not attached, I think she felt too insecure using it. The shelf offered on this machine is not enough for the older, senior, arthritic cat. She is not very agile and, while not intimidated by the machine itself, she is intimidated by her ability to actually use it (get in, turn around, do her business, get out without falling, etc.). I really wanted her to use this since she has to go through radioactive iodine treatment soon, for her hyperthyroidism, and I wanted to limit my exposure to handling her radioactive waste, after the treatment. Since I've had it out for a month and she has never touched it, I gave up and bought the LitterMaid as an additional backup litter solution. The LitterMaid is pretty terrible. We've had it all of a night and already the litter is stuck on the rake and the rake is putting more clean litter than dirty into the waste receptacle.The two modifications I would make to the Litter Robot, if I were at all mechanically inclined would be:1. A ramp offering for cats who aren't agile (there's tons and the company would be wise to think of the owners of those animals - usually the seniors are using the litter box a lot more frequently, so owners have a greater need for some litter box help).2. A way to disengage the top. While my senior likes her privacy, and normally wouldn't have an issue with the top, she has been "caught" in a few places in the past, by the younger cat, and now doesn't like a spot that doesn't have an escape route. It's well known that cats are more comfortable with litter boxes with no covers. I know that if I had a ramp that was sturdy and didn't move, as well as a temporary period where I could take the top off, my senior cat would be using this as well.I'm keeping this as my younger cat *sometimes* uses it (he doesn't often - he'll use the alternatives if clean enough - he's still scared of the thing), so that helps. But it is a lot of money to shell out for a "sometimes". I'm hoping that he gets more in the habit.If you have perfectly "normal" cats (I don't, both were rescues), then you'll probably have better luck than I've had. There is literally NO smell after the Robot has done its dirty work. You barely have to touch it (I only touch mine to turn the power on and off - so as to lessen the chances of freaking my cats out). And it doesn't spew litter everywhere, as one reviewer described. I do recommend spraying catnip spray on the outside, as well as adding some Cat Attract litter and catnip on the inside as well as on the lip and shelf. I also recommend purchasing a $16 incline cat scratcher ramp and sprinkling catnip all over that as well. It goes a little higher than the shelf, a little lower than the lip, but my younger cat has been using that.I also don't know what reviewers are complaining about as far as the noise goes. I live in a 750 sq foot house, with pergo floors, so ALL sounds travel, and I have sensitive hearing. I barely hear the litter robot from any other room. I guess any noise is too much for some people? It's not unbearable at all. Again, if this machine were modified, somewhat, for the older kitty or kitty with some body issues, it would be a home run. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is for that issue, otherwise it would be 10 stars.

I love this product so much that I have TWO! (After three years, mine needed to go into the shop, and I could not live without it for the two weeks for shipping and repairs. Plus, I had three cats and was considering purchasing a 2nd one.) This is an awesome product! Very reliable. Super customer support. I have both bone and black. Would suggest bone as the litter rubs onto globe. Less noticable on bone/beige. I cannot tell you how much I love this product. Without it, I would not have my cats! Just note that it is rather large. Mine "stick out" in my townhouse. However, when I move into my single-family home, I am looking for a laudry or utility room to house my robots. Cannot recommend enough!

We purchased this unit as an alternative to the old fashioned laser pointer. The cats were curious about it and now are CRAZY for it. They rub against it and whine until we turn it on. I like the variety of speeds and the timer option. It is starting to seem a little sluggish and I am hoping that it is just the batteries needing a change. If not, I will still be okay with the purchase as it has been the most enjoyed toy my cats have ever received.

My dog LOVES this ball.  In fact, it is one of her favorite toys.  She pushes it around the house for hours per day, picks it up and carries it to her bed, and even likes to sleep next to it.  It is definitely a favorite.Because it is made of a soft rubber/plastic, this toy doesn't damage furniture or walls when my dog slams it around, and it is also easy for her to pick up and move around.  Again, it is a favorite.But...The two identical X-shaped holes for filling have little "nubs" in them to help keep treats/kibble from falling out too quickly.  That's great in theory, but not in practice.  The holes are so "well-designed" that they don't allow most treats/kibble to come out AT ALL.  This is frustrating to my dog, as I am sure it will be to most dogs.  Therefore, I made a modification to the ball... I clipped two of the "nubs" out of one side of the ball, so the kibble/treats come out much more easily on one side.  I didn't want to do this to both sides because I didn't want the toy to dump things TOO easily.  One side was enough!The ball is a little larger than a softball, which means it is a great size for big dogs.  I'm sure small dogs can enjoy this, as well, but they might not be able to carry the ball.
summary: Great ball that my dog loves, but needs one small modification

reviewText: My mastiff-x loves to pick this thing up and bounce it around outside (she'd WRECK the house if we gave it to her indoors!).  The treat dispensing part is a little iffy - small treats sort of dump out, and larger ones get stuck, which frustrates her.  I hesitate to cut the holes larger because most of the treats I have are pretty small.  My dog isn't the brightest bulb in the pack, so it may be that she just hasn't figured out how to bite down on it so that it changes the dimensions of the holes and allows the larger treats to fall out, but at least she's entertained for a while!  The look on her face while she's playing with it is the reason for the 5 stars!
summary: Fun bouncy ball that is persnickety about treat size.

reviewText: They can get particular at times, but they always love this flavor.  Friskies can be found for fairly good prices, too.
Not bad but the FroliCat Bolt keeps them more entertained for sure!  However, it's a great change-up every once in awhile.

I have had one of theses brooms for 10-12 years and it is only now begining to "get tired"  I have alot of kitties and it cleans up litter and cat hair like nothing else..............So today I am getting a second one......I am very happy with it..............

Bought this in the spring and the finches are in heaven.  Other sock feeders I've used in the past didn't attract nearly as many finches as this does.  Others have mentioned the nyger seed falling through the sock - I have not had this problem.  Today as I refilled the feeder, I did notice the socks are becomming worn, but they've been out there for 8 months or so and one would expect a little wear and tear with all those beaks and claws.  It comes with 2 extra socks.  Once those are used up I'll probably just buy another feeder and get the 2 extra socks - seems cheaper than buying 4 socks.  Great item - the birds highly recommend it!!

on the type of cat you have and the time of the day.  Some of my five kitties are interested and some won't even look at it.  It is very noisy and that could be the reason all of them won't play.  Easy to setup, turn on and walk away.  It turns itself off.

This "Extreme" Kong Goodie Bone Dog Toy is the only "extreme" product that our dog was able to chew through.  He's got pretty strong teeth and is a strong chewer.  It was a great idea with the indentations in which to put dog treats -- until our dog chewed right through the middle.  The middle softer and pretty flexible. This Bone Toy should probably not be included in the "Extreme" series.  The regular Extreme Kong Dog Toys which are round are far thicker and stand up to a dog's strong teeth.  I would recommend this toy for a dog that likes to chew but isn't a strong chewer.
My dog likes to lick the frozen toy filled with oatmeal/peanut butter/yogurt mix, but he has no interest in playing with it.
Both of my dogs love these and they seem to be much cheaper here online than in the store. great christmas gift too

It gave the cats a different flavor to choose from.  I try to alternate the flavors so they aren't stuck w/the same one every day.  The price was reasonable so we were able to add a couple of cases to the cases of variety pack we purchase giving them another option.

My cat took to this puzzle box right away!  Once he got the hang of it, he graduated to the difficult level easily.  It's really fun to watch him trying to get the treats out, too!  The instructions for putting the cardboard box together were easy.  I would give it five stars if the box had a larger "difficult" area.  But all-in-all the Cat Amazing is a lot of fun for cats.
This is a classic, basic dog bowl. If that's what you are looking for then look no further because the price is the best you are going to find!

If you were feeding your cat poor quality food before and have switched to this you've probably seen some improvement, hence the positive reviews.  HOWEVER, please be aware that this food really isn't all that great.  Corn is the second AND sixth ingredient listed which means there is a lot of it!  It is used partially as a cheap protein source and a cheap filler.  Cats have no use for corn and cannot effectively digest it which can result in very stinky, large stools and some medical problems.  Corn is also a common allergen among cats.  Corn is not good for cats!  Brewer's rice is a by-product of beer production.  Basically it is nutritionally worthless.On the positive side there are no animal by-products in this food.  For those of you who don't know what animal by-products are I'll fill you in.  Animal by-products are the beaks, feathers, hooves, intestines, bones, etc. (basically the inedible parts of an animal) all ground up and served up for your cat to eat.I don't believe this food to be terrible but at the same time it isn't great either.  Remember that just because it's "natural" doesn't mean it's good!!  After having several of my cats (I have 16) develop hairloss and other related allergy and medical issues I have made it a point to thoroughly research any cat food I serve up.  Because I have so many, I need to be frugal but at the same time I also need to be responsible by choosing quality food products.  The information to make good food choices for your pet is out there, easy to find, and readily available.
summary: Some good but still some bad ingredients

reviewText: Very nice and plush bed!  I use it in my dog's crate so he has lots of comfort.  I purchased the Midwest 42" Crate from Amazon and this pet bed.  They work very well together.  I have purchased the smaller size of this same bed in the past and I have had no problems with this brand.  I wash it in cold water.  I shake it out to re-distribute the stuffing and air dry it.  I never put it in the dryer.  Contrary to what other people said, it is very thick and soft.  My dog loves it!
summary: My dog loves this thick and plush pet bed!

reviewText: KONG toys are always a hit at my house, so naturally when this bone arrived my dogs went crazy. KONG makes quality dog toys and this bone is something that will last.

We have a medium size rabbit and he likes the cage. We even have the litter box in one corner that he goes in all of the time. I took a bunch of carpet squares from work and cover about 3/4 of the bottom so it's soft on his feet. It also stops his hay from falling through

My dog loves this toy!  It must be the material or something but she is bonkers for it.  Sadly, that means she's going to chew it.  Within 5 minutes I was picking up bits of rubber.  After 20 minutes I took it away because the bits of rubber coming off were quite large and I didn't want her ingesting them.  We'll use this as a fetch toy, but keep it up/away and stick to nylabones for chewing.

The FunBites treats are obviously high quality, though expensive. It definitely helps with fresher breath for the dogs, and they all seem to genuinely enjoy them (be aware, though, my dogs eat anything.)Assuming the price isn't out of the range (which it may well be) these treats are definitely recommended. The only caveat is you shouldn't order them for small dogs, unless you want to spend lots of time breaking and cutting the treats into smaller pieces. These are big, definitely too large for a chihuahua or miniature pinscher (you probably knew that, but just in case, I thought I'd throw that out there.) They're chewy in the middle, with a harder rawhide shell, and defintely nutritious.Overall, they're recommended.
summary: Good Treats, Definitely Don't Use For Small Dogs

reviewText: Our old cat was barfing several times a day on science diet until we went to a local pet store that offered grain free foods.  With the symptoms are cat was having they recommending Instict.  We switched to the raw boost shortly after due to she has bad teeth but still needs the crunchy for tarter build up.  Adding the Instinct raw frozen chicken has eliminating the constant barfing.  Her coat is shiny again and she is more energized.

I threw away so many bowls of partially eaten product because my cat licks up the gravy and leaves the rest.  For some reason, he did not even eat the beef gravy, so we're back to buying poultry types only.
summary: Gravy Loving Cat Enjoys all but the Beef

reviewText: My cat id getting to be older and is getting picky.  He is refusing to eat anything that does not have enough gravy.  But lately he has been begging for extra tubs of this.  Thank you fancy feast I was starting to worry he wasnt eating.
my vet recommended this product and i didn't see it in the pet store so i ordered it online. Good product cats like it.

Ok so the first two things I think people want to know are this...My dog loves these treats and they don't cause any digestive issues for her.I mean those are really the two biggest things when it comes to dog treats.  But also, they are good sized.  My dog is a little smaller (50lbs), so I usually break it up and use them for rewards while walking.  Like, good job hazel for not jumping all over those kids or good job pup for not asserting your dominance on those dogs.  But my daily routine is to grab one in the morning, break it into four littler pieces and walk.  Then repeat at night.  My dog absolutely loves them and they don't smell as, well, pungent as some other treats I've used in the past.  They are nice and soft and easy to break up, but don't crumble to pieces.Overall, no buyers remorse here.  My dog likes them as do I, for different reasons obviously :)

It' the same as we said in our review of "da bird".  We really don't understand why our human room mate/servant can't bring home live mice for us to play with and eat.  One time, we saw a live mouse being fed to a snake on our favorite TV show, "Fatal Attraction".  Don't we deserve as much as a disgusting snake?Anyway, about the toy: the mouse is weighted so that is skitters along the floor very much like a real mouse.  It is colored very much like a delectable baby mouse, and has a long tail, too.  When we "catch" it, we enjoy carrying it around by the tail, just like a real mouse.  It is our second favorite toy, after "da bird".We have to give it four stars because the fiberglass handle isn't long enough for a tall person.  The string that the mouse is attached to is also too short.  Our servant has to bend over slightly to drag the mouse along the floor.  A longer handle and attachment string would make it easier for a tall person to use.  We believe that humans should enjoying playing with our toys, too.Finally, we have to give it four stars because the tail came off of the mouse pretty quickly.  While we still enjoy our toy, it now looks more like a cockroach or large insect than a mouse.  That's fine, we enjoy chasing them too, but the mouse should have been more durable.

Brush would work well for toy breeds over 8 - 10 pounds but it's too large for 4 - 6 pound toy  poodles in full coats.Quality is there in the brush, for the money, just too large to handle around the small heads and bodies easily.
summary: Well made, too large for toy breeds

reviewText: 3.5 stars. Design is great, construction is strong and durable, but the dog doesn't seem to enjoy this nearly as much as his other toys, like the PetProjekt Dogbon (http://www.amazon.com/dp/B008ESAISY/)
summary: Good design and construction, but dog isn't in love with it

reviewText: I LOVEEEE these clippers. They have a quick guard that you can use or push off to the side if you need to clip deeper if you've let your dog's nails grow WAY too long, which was exactly what happened to my dog. However, I used the quick guard and clipped several times because it was my first time clipping and I was scared to accidentally clip the quick. This product works REALLY well and I am happy to say my first dog nail clipping experience was a very pleasant one for both of us. I'd definitely recommend this product.
summary: pleased with my first dog clipper

reviewText: This bottle drips / leaks. It is poorly made. It is low quality. I don't like the attachment design. Don't waste your money. There are many better options on Amazon.

Easy to put on and the litter box it goes with is absolutely perfect for my older cats as it it low to the floor.  they do not kick the litter out and my girl cat kisses me everytime she uses it, saying "thanks mom." Actuallly I keep the top up but it is plenty big enough entrance with it covering the litter box.  I am glad I bought it.

This is a great dog snack.  I only scored down on the stars because the 'small' size is pretty big, and if you have a dog under 40 pounds I don't know that I would recommend.  These go over well with the bigger dogs in the house and they are a great price.
It's very cheaply made, so far kitty has ignored it.  If he gives it much attention it  won't hold up.

I got this for my puppy labrador, he sleeps on it while in his kennel at night.  It's very soft and looks great.  He chewed it a little at first but it stood the chew test and he left it alone after the first night.  He also ate something on a walk a few weeks ago and had an accident in his kennel.  After rinsing the bed off, placing it in the washer/dryer it came out clean like new.  I also used bleach on it and it didn't alter any of the original colors which was great.
summary: Dog loves it, cleans easily in the washer

reviewText: I have tried a bunch of these balls and they always break, this one has been standing up to the punishment of two dogs.

I buy this for our 2 indoor pet quail and also our parakeet. They all love it. Full of nutrients they need. A brand I know and love. I have bought this bag numerous times and on here the price is cheaper!

reviewerName: Bartok Kinski "A casual stroll through the lu...
reviewText: As a rabid, frothing cat lover, I picked up the CatGenie Self-Flushing Cat Box for a feral cat I found on the street. He never did use the cat Flushing Cat Box for reasons I suspect have to do with a fear of metal parts. I did everything I could for him to use the Flushing Cat Box but he refused. It was later that I found out that he was blind in both eyes.The box itself is a superb, fake ceramic bowl type Self-Flushing Cat Box. It seems to have a little camera which detects Cat movements and has soothing sounds of ocean breezes or other music you choose. A little robot hand comes out to scoop the Cat waste and then shoves it towards the back where it accumulates for months in a smelly decomposition chamber that will make you vomit when you change it.I really liked the manual Flushing handle for a cat's paw, not too big, not too small.In all, you're still going to be doing tons of labor in regards to the Cat waste so you might want to consider the advantage of spending tobacco money on a small toilet that you stuff in the corner of your home that smells like a Formaldehyde fish bowl.Eventually I gave it to a midget friend because I had sold all my cats to the lab.

My collie does not like to be brushed because it involves pulling out that undercoat. This de-matting rake cuts through the tangles and pulls them out in a way the dog doesn't mind as much as the brush. I've used other brands but they weren't as good. This is my second time purchasing this brand, the old one lasted 5 years and stayed sharp but then I forgot and left it outside for a few weeks and it rusted.  Now I have a pyrenees/collie mix and it works great on him too.
summary: Great for Dogs Who Hate Brushes

reviewText: I put this at the window (runs to floor) in our main room next to the kitty grass. This has now become the spot where everyone (four cats) comes and flops over and holds on to be brushed. The catnip that was included with lounger was just the ticket to get the party going. This is not a functional scratcher/lounger, it is a work of art and looks beautiful in our main room.
summary: This is now the offical grooming station for all the cats

reviewText: San Fancisco brand is one of several brands of brine shrimp eggs I've tried and this brand by far has the best hatch rate.  Highly recommended.

This was the second time i ordered these.  The first time no issues.  This time some of the cans had dents.  I'm not sure if that messed with the taste, but the cats didn't seem to like it as much this time around.  Last time this was their favorite.  Next time if it arrives with dents I will return.I recently switched over to the wet food diet because research indicates its better for them.  This is a good alternative to purchasing in the store, you get it for the same price (on sale) at your door step.  I will update if the next shipment arrives with dents, which.would indicate a pattern;

We were using Diamond Lamb and Rice for Puppies, but all of a sudden our dog had diarrhea that just wasn't clearing up. The vet did every test in the book, and they were all fine. So we changed his food, thinking maybe the lamb just wasn't doing it for him, and chose this Beef Meal and Rice Formula. His stomach issues cleared right up, but now he only eats his food once a day, when he used to inhale it twice. I think he doesn't like the new flavor. He'll inhaled it when his Natural Balance wet food is mixed in, though!
summary: Cleared up poor pup's diarrhea, but he doesn't like it much

reviewText: I have an ornery 16 year old poodle, and I'm not sure if it's accidental or senility.. that sometimes she can go for a week without an accident, and then have three in one morning.  I bought these, and was shocked at how easily she "took" to wearing them.  She never once has tried to bite them off, and even waits once she comes in to get them put on.  I bought WM brand sanitary pads, and cut them into half... no problems.  This was a poodle that doesn't like to "wear coats" or bows, yet this has worked great.

This really terrific interactive exercise toy was an instant hit with my two feline babies. I no sooner unpacked it from its shipping package before they pounced on it with their wild, unbridled kitten enthusiasm. I played with them for almost an hour yesterday until I was completely worn out. I know my kitties could have kept going because they were genuinely disappointed when I put DaBird away for another day. They even gave a good stare-down to the closed closet where I stored their new favorite toy.This fishing-pole type cat toy is designed for air-hunting. A strong string is attached to a pull apart fishing pole with which your sweeping movement makes the feathers attached at the end of the string move freely through ther air, twirling around to move and sound like actual bird wings. The movement is absolutely irresitible to my kitties and stimulates their natural prey-hunting instinct. It is very rewarding play for them and I definitely need to order another one so each kitty has their own toy to chase simultaneously.The DaBird is exceptionally well made with top quality materials. And best of all - it's handcrafted in the USA! They are inexpensive and available everywhere but I found a great price and free shipping right here at Amazon.
summary: Terrific interactive exercise toy made in the USA

reviewText: It looks (to me) disturbingly like a real mouse and my cats love it and are willing to suspend their disbelief to chase and catch this mouse.
What can I say ..this stuff is great. I have 2 young labs and live in the North East. I have never found a flea or tick on either of themso I will be a loyal customer for this brand
summary: It works especially in high tick season

reviewText: This senior pate helps keep the weight down and is easily digestable.  They like it but prefer chunky or chewy wet cat food.

I gave these Milk-Bone Brushing Chews to my smaller dog.  He is missing the teeth on the right side of his mouth, so these were just the size for him to chew on.  The bones have nubs on them to help clean his teeth and gums.  I think cleaner teeth and gums also equals fresher breath.  I like the resealable inner bag as it keeps the bones fresh like the first time I opened it.  I have never been able to brush my dog's teeth, so if these do the same thing as brushing I am all for them.

reviewText: All 4 Cats LOVED it but the cost is prohibitive for me to purchase again unfortunately since I have 4. If I had one, I would get it all the time probably. it has quality ingredients and they really do seem to love it, they hated the salmon though?

reviewText: Our pets have fewer issues with the limited ingredient foods.  Chessie loves the potato duck and the venison sweet potato foods.  Worth the extra cost.

My wife is a veterinarian. We have 5 rescue dogs here right now. We have 5 large beds that we have been using for about a year. We decided to change one out that is looking old and worn. The puppies will chew on the beds, more of a teething motion than attempting to destroy them.This bed lasted 3 minutes, I am NOT joking.It arrived and was left at our ranch gate. I picked it up along with some other boxes. I brought it in to the house and unpacked it and put it on the floor for the dogs. I walked back out to the pickup to get the next box. By the time I walked back in the stuffing was torn out and the fabric torn up. I kid you not.It went from packaging to trash can in less than 5 minutes. Remember all our other 5 beds lasted a year.WORST purchase ever.This is very weak material.Only buy this for older dogs. Also, the flimsy material means this is likely to wear easily on tiled or hardwood surfaces.
summary: VERY flimsy, not suitable for young dogs

reviewText: One of the longest lasting bed..They get flat after a couple of years but we still have 2 that are 3 years old..We love em.

ThePetmate Deluxe Fresh Flow Medium Pet Fountainis so quiet and works great.  I have a 3 pound Chihuahua and a 14 pound Chinese Crested Hairless and the size is perfect for the two of them.  I highly recommend this to any petite to small animal owner.  It only needs to be refilled once a day and it is very easy to clean.

reviewText: The Da Bird toy is the only cat toy my cat will play with and she goes crazy over it.

My dogs enjoyed these chews and the plus is, they are supposed to help keep their teeth healthy.  I experienced no problems with my dogs after they ate these.  Next time I'll get a larger size, though.  My two dogs didn't have to really do much chewing to get them down.

It does work ok but I was expecting more air to be pumped and having to use a valve control to lower the amount of air (not the case).I am happy wth this pump and how quiet it is. I have two parakeets and a canary in an aviary, and all three enjoy this hideaway, although none have gone inside yet.  One parakeet worked two solid weeks on shredding the rope, and she finally sawed through it yesterday.  I'll replace the rope, and if she shreds that one, too, that's just fine, because she was so entertained all the while she worked on it.  The canary uses the bridge now, and he will be the one to go inside, I'm sure.  I'm going to put spray millet in it when I put it back up.  The canary will go anywhere and do anything to get at the millet!  So far, this is the best toy I have bought, considering its modest price.
My little mix breed loves these treats and would keep its adopted sister away from them at any cost. Be prepared for a happy dog.

Multiple air stones don't seem to get enough air with this guy, but, as it's for a small aquarium, that's to be expected. Works really great now that I'm using just one air stone strip under the gravel.

reviewText: This stuff allowed for puddles of urine underneath which stunk terribly.  The cats did not like it and tried to get it all out of the box.  It seemed like a good idea but unless you can keep your cat box in some far far far far far away place it will stink up the whole house.

New kitten now 5 pounds using an igloo type litter box and fed only dry food. I changed from the scoop type litter. Odd looking stuff, looks like three inch long green worms but compact. Doesn't crumble or track or stick to the litter box when wet. Cat at first tried to eat it. No more tracking, scooping or smells. Love it. Wish it was on subscribe and save.

Please let me say my dog never had fleas prior to using this product and still has not had fleas (which is amazing in South Texas). I have a flea collar on my dog and we use internal flea protection. I could not give this product a five because I cannot honestly say this product is why my dog is free of fleas. I cannot give less than four stars for that same reason. Why did I choose four stars? Simply because I can. I can honestly say the smell of the product is neutral and the product does not seem harsh on my pet or myself. I have not experienced any outbreaks or irritability after contact with the product and neither has my dog.
...that won't fall apart.  Quickly became a favorite.  It's nice and long and you can wiggle it like a snake or make it go way up...both cats love it!

I use this spray on my dog after his shower and between showers. First of all he hates it, the it makes him sneeze and makes me cough, furthermore, I saw a flee on his forhead. To prove that it wasn't working, there were a couple of bites on his tummy where I can see them.
When they arrived they were basically in a pile of seeds in the bottom of the bag.  I just dumped into food dishes and fed it to my keets that way.

My little guy absolutely adores this little tunnel and spends the better part of his day sleeping in it. In fact, this is my 3rd order for the same product as it tends to get worn out with constant use. Has just enough "spring" that it retains the shape over time and gives pets a secure feeling.
summary: 3rd Time ordering! My pet LOVES IT!

reviewText: i love this ear wash . It has a nice smell and it does a good job cleaning my dogs ears.

I loved this product (which I bought through Groupon), as did my three cats.  One tended to sleep on it more than the other two, but all three used it.  Also, the cardboard didn't disintegrate quickly as some of the cheaper scratchers do.  But, when one of them threw up his breakfast on it, and the liquid absorbed into the holes, I knew it was time to pitch it, even though there was a lot of life left in the product.  I wish I could have saved it, but I knew that Dave's barf had just found the perfect growing medium for germs and mold.
summary: Great (until the cat barfs on it)

reviewText: Prodyuct is working exactyl how i wanted it to. I have a 40 Gallon Breeder tank with turtles fish and plants.

My 12 year old dog takes two pills twice a day for seizures and low thyroid.  Been using beef flavor Pill Pockets and he has grown tired of that flavor.  I ordered the duck and pea flavor and he readily takes his pills.  Very pleased!!

reviewerName: Amy Sumida, author of The Godhunter Series
reviewText: Not much to say besides they are exactly what they say they are, filters for my cat's water fountain and they fit perfect and filter the water. It's a good price and I'm very happy with them. Thank you.

The lightweight property of this litter is wonderful...so easy to carry, and to pour into the litter box.  Also, the clumping ability is quite good. However, as far as odor control and dust, it gets a low grade.  The odor of the clean litter is nice and not overpowering, but once waste gets deposited in it from the cat, you can start to smell the "cat odor" pretty quickly.  When cleaning the waste out, dust gets kicked up and fills the box....not good for me or for my cat. I don't think I'll get this litter again...my favorite so far is Precious Cat.

WhenKeep Off! Repellentwasn't doing the job for me, I tried to find something better. Boundary makes strong claims, but ultimately it's the same product as Keep Off. From the label, it's clear that at least 2% of the ingredients are the same, but the undisclosed "other ingredients" might not be different either. Both products smell the same. The active ingredients are the same. A close look at the labels shows that out of the many paragraphs of text, most are the same word for word.I had higher expectations from Lambert Kay. TheirFresh 'n Clean Oxy-Strength Cat Odor & Stain Eliminatoris the best odor eliminator I have found. But with Boundary, they are selling a product that may repel cats for a while, but might not keep them away for an entire day. I expect that this will work for some people. Some cats are likely to dislike it, but not necessarily enough to stay away.I would not go so far as to say it doesn't work. If you buy this, you will be taking a chance. For some percentage of customers it will be an ideal solution. But don't expect a guarantee.

Our pig, Stella, has been eating this since she reached adulthood and she's done very well on it. She's about 4.5 now and very healthy. I don't know that it can be solely attributed to the food, but she certainly hasn't been hurt by it!

I have three cats who range in age from 10 to 16.  Needless to say, they don't run around and play as much as they used to due to their age.  I saw this toy on the TV show "My Cat from Hell", so I decided to give it a try.The toy is very light weight - it consists of a short plastic handle which has a thin wire attached to it, and at the end of the wire is a small mouse made of sisal.  You (the person) are supposed to use the wand to wave the mouse around on the floor to simulate an actual mouse moving and the cat is supposed to chase and catch it.All three of my cats loved this toy!  My boy cat is a great mouser - he caught it very quickly and actually put it into his mouth and tried to walk away with the entire toy, so proud of his "catch".  Too funny.A few important notes...this is an INTERACTIVE toy, meaning, it is intended to be used during a play session with you and your cat.  Do NOT leave this laying around as a small child could choke on the mouse (it is very hard and small - only about 1 1/2 inches long).  Also, I have a dog and I do not leave it laying around as the dog would definitely choke on this, as well.  I keep it in a drawer and pull it out when it's time to play, always careful to put it away afterwards.Since my guys liked it so much, I just ordered some more of it for my aunt, mother, sister and uncle to give to their cats for Christmas.  As long as you use it with care, it's a great toy that even older cats will enjoy.
summary: Great interactive toy, but need to be careful with dogs/kids

reviewText: Our veterinarian recommended this to us, it is that good.  I use it on all our pets and even on ourselves.  Wounds heal and infections clear up quickly.  Even in the winter time mud Vetericyn will heal our horses cuts and scrapes.

I purchased this for my six month old german shepherd puppy who pulled something fierce.  This was really great as it helps redirect the dog with the part of the leash that attaches to the front.  I was not being dragged in the same way.  This doesn't cure that.  After much time and failures with softer, more humane products and methods, I found that the Sprenger training collar worked miraculously.  I bought this harness because I was thrilled to see that they had a free replacement up to two harnesses/leashes regardless of how and why it was destroyed.  About two weeks into having the harness, my pup that normally does not chew on anything but her toys, positioned herself just right and managed to chew through one of the straps.  When I called the manufacturing company for replacement, I found out that they only replace the damaged/cut strap, and send it back.  I could live with that, but I found that I would have to enclose $6 for return shipping, and pay to ship it there.  While this is not a horrible deal, one is still paying approximately 50% of the purchase price in shipping to have only the severed strap replaced while the company claims that it is a free replacement program.  I didn't care for the misrepresentation.  Thus, I didn't have it replaced with the same.  It is a very nice collar otherwise.  My pup liked wearing it so much that she got ancy when I took it off of her for baths.
summary: Good, but not perfect, deterrent for pulling in pups

reviewText: We tried other brands of training systems for our Frenchie, some cut under her arms and caused problems.  This works great for her and us.  Allows lots of control for training.
summary: Great system for short nosed dogs!

reviewText: Coiled very tight, make sure it isn't pulling too hard on your dog's neck, it may wear out in time, but out of the package is very stiff

I love these containers, I have three, sm, med and large. They do keep bugs out, keeps items fresh and water tight. I use for dog foods, rice, and dog treats. Its not just for pets and animals, I use it to store food b/c its cheaper then buying "people" designated storage items. These are safe for human and animals.

So I have had this bown for a few months now.  The construction of the bowl an metal piece are top notch.  No visible signs of rust or scratchs.  It will last a long time.However,  the rubber ring around the base is cracking and about to come apart.  I contact the company and told them about this.  Heck I even attached a copy of my purchase.  They told me that the rubber ring will crack under extreme temperature changes.  They said this and nothing else.The diner has always been indoors and away from direct sunlight.  It has never been exposed to extreme temperature changes.  I replied telling this, but the did not reply back.  Heck I even asked if they sold the ring seperately.No reply again.  Come on!  At least tell me you will not replace it.  Don't just ignore me!Poor Customer Service on their part.In summary,  good dishes, good base, bad ring, bad customer service.

Our cats absolutely love this tunnel.  We leave it set up in the house most of the time for them.  They walk through it, sit in it for long periods of time, and nap in it.  One our cats repeatedly walks back and forth through it; we're guessing she likes the feel of the mesh against her feet???The tunnel is light-weight and very easy to set up - just release the tabs and it springs open.We previously had another tunnel that was opaque and smaller in diameter.  Our cats seem to prefer this one.  We're presuming that's because they can see through it and can more easily play in it because of its larger size.Price:  We found a lower price at a national discount store that also offered free shipping to their local store.We also purchased twoABO Gear Happy Habitat for Indoor Catsto go with the tunnel.  We join the tents with the tunnel for an even larger outdoor play enclosure.  Our cats love it!The reason we're giving the tunnel 4 stars instead of 5 is because we feel it is way overpriced.Update:  My cats got VERY frisky playing in the tunnel the other day in the house (both ends were open) and succeeded in tearing off one of the end flaps.  We were able to zip the flap back on, so the tunnel is fine.  We did not see it happen, but we're guessing the two of them worked together on it as they often do with things.  So just be aware that this can happen.  They have NOT damaged the actual mesh on the tunnel at all.
Holds my 50lb dog food great with some room to spare, love it. Keeps the bugs out and food fresh!
summary: Holds my 50lb dog food great with some room to spare

reviewText: Consider this : just the fact that I own more than ten of these beds is a review in and of itself.

great product as it is big enough and absorbant enough you dont have to change pads every day.  When working it is easy to forget to change so this fits the bill. Good price also, particularly if you get auto sent.  Its great!!!

Our little Chihuahua's are always bringing sticks in from the outside to chew on, which makes a mess in the house and I am always worried about sharp pieces or splinters in the dogs mouth or throat. Although one of our three Chihuahua can chew through these sticks fairly fast, they still last for a decent amount of time and they do not splinter into sharp, messy pieces. Already ordered more.
Works good so far. It hasn't been noisy for us. Sometimes it depends whats on the shelf next to it. It will make that item vibrate causing a loud vibration.  Fish like it.

Slowed my 14 week old GSD Loki down considerably. Heavy duty stainless will last for years. I would have given this 5 stars had it not been for the ridiculous sticker super glued on the dish that took 45 mins of scrubbing with rubbing alcohol to remove. Seriously Indipets, heavy duty glue too?

My border collie looooooves to chew on sticks, but they're a mess when she tries to bring them inside. I think she loves this toy just as much as a real stick. Yes, she does slowly eat it (took her about 4 months to reduce it to a nub I had to take away) but tiny shavings of plastic are not going to kill your dog.I'm a vet tech and have no problems with letting my dogs eat itty bitty pieces of plastic. They aren't sharp enough to cause a perforation and aren't big enough to cause an obstruction. I think people can be a little over-protective of their dogs. If corn kernels can come out safely in human and dog poo, so can little bits of plastic. (And from this toy they are way smaller than corn...more like sawdust.)

Unfortunately this size is too small for my two dogs.  Other reviewers have trouble with the splash ring, so I was expecting it to be hard to remove for cleaning.  Well, it is easy enough to remove, but, once the bowl is full of water, it is hard to fasten it back down so it doesn't just slip off.  My dogs don't knock it off but I bet there are other dogs that do knock it off. It slips off quite easily if you don't click it down.

I can't stand the smell of nasty litter, and was looking for an effective solution so that cleaning the litter box wouldn't be such a chore, and the Omega Paw Self-Cleaning Litter Box is the answer! It's much less pricey than the auto-clean litter boxes, and very easy to use. This along with theLitter Locker II Hygenic Soiled Litter Disposal Systemhave really improved my apartment's odor!I find that since my boys pee on the side, I need to knock the clumps loose with a litter scoop before I roll. Some reviewers mentioned that they get "clean" litter in the scoop drawer. To remedy this, when the box is on it's side (when litter is over the screen), I rock the box gently from side to side until I only see clumps over the screen. I then roll it onto the top of the box and roll it back to the original position.I've had this box for a little over a month. My boys previously had an open litter box, but it only took them about a day or so to start using this one. I put the Omega in the normal litter box position, and then left their regular box a few feet away.
summary: Makes it EASY to keep a clean box!

reviewText: It took them a couple of days to decide whether they like it or not. I think they are still deciding. My son told me one of the balls came off the track, it was ingnored. So we don't know for sure if they like it or not. Sorry I cannot be more positive.

We ended up getting this for just the water bowl because of the no tip and anti skid. We have to large dogs that paw and tipped over their last bowl and sloshed the water while drinking. I'm actually purchasing the smaller size for cat food and water bowls I love this so much. The handle cutout is especially nice for the 64 ounce as it's sometimes a little heavy and difficult to get a steady hold of on a hardwood or kitchen floor. The only thing I'd complain about is the lip that covers the inside of the bowl makes it a tiny bit difficult to dump out and clean the bowl-it just takes slightly longer and really isn't a big deal, just something I noticed. You get used to it quickly. The features on this bowl make me think this was a product they took thoughtful time designing and is really well made. It looks nice too! Absolutely worth the price.
summary: Worth it. Just an awesome bowl.

reviewText: We had one of these before, a smaller one, and really liked it. It is very convienant and actually fun to use for my son. You just float one side in tank, put the outside one near and they magnetically go together. Occasionally you just "scrub" the outer one, moving it back and forth, up and down.  Easy! It really cleans the algae and keeps it clean after that. We keep ours there all of the time and use when needed.If I had to get one over again, I would order the small one and not the medium size. It's a little big for our 10 gallon tank but that was my fault as it did list it was for larger tanks.As far as the seller, they were very quick and had no problems at all with anything. I would use them again.

I so wanted to post a video of our dog eating Chef Michael's Grilled Sirloin Dry Dog Food, but my camera software would not cooperate.  I will therefore provide you a written testimony.  Shep, our rescued English Setter, has always been very finicky about his food.  Many times he walks away rather than eat something he does not care for.  Upon seeing Chef Michael's Grilled Sirloin Dry Dog Food in his bowl he took the time to fully investigate by sniffing and lightly tasting with his tongue and then drooling (Shep has a tendency to do that when he really likes something).  Then, he started eating and he ate and he ate, until it was all gone.  Then, like one of the three bears he examed his empty bowl numerous times in the hopes that more would appear.  He repeated this ritual with every meal until the bag was gone.  We're on our way to the store now to refill his pleasure palate.  I can highly recommend this dog food.
summary: This is a dog food that evidently tastes as good as it looks.

reviewText: This spray really works exceptionally well.It works by "encapsulating odor molecules".I have six cats and in this hot and humid weather, and clean my litter boxes at least three times daily. Now that I've found this spray, my place really smells fresh and clean.No, nothing replaces frequent litter box cleanings.Using this product in addition to proper litter cleaning will really let your house smell as though you have no cats.
Fast Delivery.  Product arrived exactly as described.  Would purchase again from this company.

Third life vest we've purchased and finally the one we are not returning! Getting one for the second dog after we return the other brand. Dog is a 55lb catahoula mix and we purchased a Medium in Dandelion Yellow. She looks adorable and is swimming much easier now.We kayak and boat frequently and want our dogs to be safe and not tire too quickly. With this jacket she doesn't have to work as hard, and she is much easier to pull back into the boat when she jumps out to go swimming. It seems to be built well and i don't hesitate to pull her up by the handle. Because it is situated towards the front of the vest it is easier to pull up and get her back in the boat. The other vests had handles in the middle and it would pull them to the side when we tried to get them back in the boat.One thing important to note is the length of the vest. It is not on this site but on the Ruffwear site. Our other dog fits the chest and weight requirement but when we put this size on her she was not long enough. The edge of the vest hit her in the hip when she tried to sit or lie down and would not have been comfortable. She is getting a small even though she is 45 lbs and a chest depth of 27"Overall excellent product. Most expensive but best quality.
summary: Love it so much we're getting two!

reviewText: It doesn't hurt to have a good quality cat food that also helps with preventing hairballs. The cats love it.

Cat condo showed up in new condition and was easy for my brother to install.  Buddy, the young cat, likes the cat condo.  Budster, the old fat cat, doesn't like to get on it but sniffs at it instead.  Mainly bought it for Buddy to have something to play on and scratch at.  Working out so far! :)

This is a legendary filter and one of the best around. The water flow is a bit weak but the filter is highly effective. Dont forget to rinse the media before you start it or else you will get some dust int to the tank.The instructions sucks but there are some you tube videos that should help with the install.

Wow, this is great ... have found it to be perfect for  the harness I made for my daughter Earline ( she has eating disorder and I found no product directly on point, so I had to devise my own).  Thank you Amazon!

I bought the Eheim classic 250 (2113) to replace a HOB filter on my 55 south american cichlid tank.  Eheim makes wonderful filters, simple but effective.  This filter even comes with the optional shut off valves so you will only have to prime it once, wich was very easy.  As every other reviewer noted the directions are pretty bad, just do yourself a favor and look up a video on installation on youtube.  Once you get it running, it is silent and does a great job.
summary: Can't go wrong with an Eheim

reviewText: My local PetSmart only had dewormer for small dogs, so (of course) my next step was to search Amazon.This stuff got rid of my puppy's worms in no time! He had no adverse effects, which was something I was concerned about. I highly recommend this brand!
Happy puppy is a good puppy, color does not bleach in sun and does not rip apart like most dog toys
My dogs loved this. In fact...they loved it to death...in about 5 minutes! It's a shame it didn't last longer. It wasn't very durable for a Kong toy.

I bought this to groom two long haired cats.  When my cats got matted up, I'd take them to a professional groomer and pay the exorbitant prices to have them professionally groomed.  It seemed crazy to pay so much when I just wanted their fur trimmed for their own comfort. I didn't need for them to be shampooed, blow dried and groomed up like they're entering a cat show.I had never used a clippers before.  I had no idea how to groom an animal.  The "instructional" DVD that comes with the kit shows you how to do different styles of dog cuts for certain dog breeds, which would be good if you're buying this to groom a dog and you already know how to use clippers.  It doesn't show you the very basics of how to use a clippers and how to put on the attachments.  Thankfully, the written instructions that come with it are pretty thorough and you can figure it out.  If like me your main concern is not knicking your pet's skin while you're learning, do what I did and start with the #4 attachment (1/2").  This way you can get the hang of it and build your (and your pet's!)confidence without coming anywhere close to cutting the skin.

This looks very nice and is good for the price. A couple of the tubes did break because they are cardboard. I took the caps and glued them onto PVC tubing and worked great to fix it.It's a bit hard to clean and I've had it a couple years but some of the plush fur has shed from the steps and the ladder steps can come loose easily.Still the price was great compared to others though I'm guessing a real carpet one would have held up better to the abuse from pets.
summary: Very nice but a little weak

reviewText: We buy 30-pound bags of dog food, and the large container just barely can hold it all.  It is sturdy, and we love the wheels; I highly recommend this for any dog owner.

I've tried many different brands lot of canister filters of all sizes.None of them match up to the performance of the Classice Eheim filters.They are quite, simple and they last a very long time.Don't try to save a couple of bucks and buy the other brands, this filter will save you the headaches and noises in the long run.
summary: Best canister filter you can buy.

reviewText: *Note to Amazon.com,Pretty please put this Liver on Subscribe and Save! You have the beef & liver and the beef available for S&S; but not the Liver yet. THANK YOU SO MUCH!Now on to my review...My cat has been slowly switching to Newman's own beef products over from Wellness brand cat food (which is a great brand and will still be reserved for treats occasionally). I was ecstatic that there was a totally NO grain-and-NO fillers ORGANIC cat food I could feed my 9 year old cat who is prone to crystal formation in his bladder and also plaque build up on his teeth (even though I brush his outer teeth every evening).So far I've tried the beef & Liver and the Liver and he LOVES it. I just ordered the beef today for him which I'm sure he'll love too.This product *IS* very thick and concentrated (the beef liver alone has the consistency of a concentrated pate' and the beef & liver has the consistency of a gelatinous, thick beefy oatmeal), so I scoop it into his bowl and blend a bit of hot water to the product to warm the fats and make more of a 'gravy' for him (he also prefers to eat his food a bit warm anyhow). He barely wants to nibble at his Wellness brand cat food now (which I've had him on for over four years, so I guess that means he's one 'sold' cat. It might be unusual for a cat to love beef so much but my cat goes crazy for beef (especially if I make him steak when I can afford to). So, for me to find him a organic, no grain, beef based line of cat food made his day (and one of his nine lives no doubt)!Anyway, if you know your cat already loves beef and beef liver then he/she reviewText: I give this to my 9 year old Rottie and it sure has helped.  She likes the flavor, much better than the wafers.

The first pack of these I purchased from my vet.  $65!  When I noticed that my Saint Bernard (who has really bad hips due to poor breeding and lack of nutrition as a puppy) was rolling over more and more for tummy rubs I knew I had to continue using these.  But, I had to find a better price than what they wanted at the vet.  And I found it on Amazon!

this  toy is suitable for non mastiff, non pitbull dogs, they are in a class alone due to their jaws. I rate chewing dogs 1 -10, my boarding dogs u p to 7s get this toy. actually only a few like it. my current golden project loves it, had a corgi  that adored it, I keep huge bin of toys for them to check out and choose. all toys are supervised.  I have had mine for 5 years.
I ordered based on the size chart online and the thundershirt did not fit my 9 pound dachshund.  So, I didn't even get to try it and he ran from it when I tried it on him

Honestly, if I offer him two or more different treats at once;he chooses this one FIRST EVERY TIME !!  And NO stomach or bowel problems.I'll be buying these again & AGAIN !!

My dog has always played with a heavier rubber frisbee which takes quite a bit of effort to throw and has to be replaced every couple of months. This frisbee, however, is really light, flies great, it is easy for her to catch because of its weight and material and it's hopefully not so hard on her teeth. I was worried because the disc seemed to be thin nylon that it wouldn't fly very well, but it's got a heavier outline which provides good ballast. I think this was a great purchase and hopefully it will last for a while!The 10-inch size was a good choice for my 75-lb dog. As other reviewers have mentioned, I would definitely take it away after your done playing. So far all of my pups have taken a turn trying to chew/destroy it, luckily to no avail.

I have bought 3 different slicker brushes, everyone of them have painful sharp points on each bristle, my toy poodle jumps every time I would use each one on him and I would inevitably stick myself (ouch!!!) and bleed on him while brushing him. This ones bristles are blunt on each bristle end and does not stick him or me! (yeaaaaa!). It gets out knots (with gentle help on my part), loose hairs, mats, its Great! Wish I had found this one first before all the others I wasted money on. I am going to get another one for my outdoor dog, he has such sensitive skin he needs this one.(I bought the Furminator for comparison and this slicker brush won hands down, that Furminator is a gimmick product in my opinion, I sent the Furminator right back)
summary: GREAT SLICKER BRUSH, BLUNT END BRISTLES, PAINLESS FOR DOG AND OWNER!!

reviewText: Durable and fun toy. It no longer "giggles" but my 3 dogs still enjoy it. JW Pet makes durable toys.

I really like the way these collars look and feel.  My poor dog's neck was getting rubbed and irritated with his old collar, so I hope the new one is comfy for him.  It's not easy to find a collar in a thin width, so I was very pleased to find one that fit everything I was looking for: leather, padded, slim width.  The buckle adds a bit of class to it, too.
This mat leaks. I bought them to go with 3 neater feeders, waste of money. Won't buy again. Plus, if you wash them, the ends curl and don't want to go back down.

We have two Schnauzer's and my husband does the grooming at home; it saves us tons of money since they get clipped every 6-8 weeks.  This blade works well for their hair type, cuts smooth leaving clean lines. We use a different blade for the face as this one is too large to get into small places.  That said, we love this one for the overall job!

It is a great treat toy, or even a regular food dispenser.  It takes a while to get the food out, but my pups love it and knock it all over the place to get the treats.  the only thing I do not like is the inability to open it up to clean it out.Just make sure the treats/food is dry and small bits though.

I have two small dogs (8 pounds and 18 pounds) - this is a great coat because it is super easy to put on and take off, there is nothing constricting that could hurt them and the side that touches them is soft, but the outer coat is more like a jacket and repels rain/snow as opposed to allowing it to soak in.  It's been the best coat that we found for their comfort and our ease of use.
My dog loves these small dingos.  She chews them fast so I buy the bigger bag.  Would recommend for pets.

This food makes a good compromise for me and my dogs. They're big fans of duck anything, and don't inhale it as immediately as they do other flavors, but they're still content to eat it without protest. I'm very pleased with the ingredient list. Real meat is the first ingredient, and there are no scary, nasty or allergenic items lurking anywhere. It's safe to serve, and safe to share with friends' dogs when they're over without worry. The kibble is small, so any size dog can safely eat it. Definitely pleased and will most likely buy again... now if only the stores around here would carry it!
Glad I bought to try for them!  And cheaper here (if it's on sale) than at my local stores!

My 10 lb. shih tzu is a work in progress, so the low calorie count in this product is important to me as several are used in our multiple training sessions every day and I don't want her to get overweight.  However, she is not crazy about this flavor, so after just a few I have to switch to a different flavor or different product altogether.This is a great product, she responds to other flavors of this product with enthusiasm during training.  The chicken flavor problem is a personal preference for my dog.
summary: Low calorie, but not my dog's favorite flavor

reviewText: I've been purchasing this grass/hay for about a year and a half now and never disappoints! Its always soft, always fresh and my bunnies love it.

This product is fairly expensive compared to other cat litters.  However, I want to just break it down into what I liked and didn't like about this product.What I Liked:The smell is nice and cleanIt's environmentally friendlyIt sucks up the cat pee wellAbsorbs odors fairly well but not completelyIts very lightweightWhat I didn't like:It doesn't adhere to poop so the smell is exposedIt does a good job with odors but not completelyIt's expensive compared to most litterIt doesn't pee-clump, so scooping is more troubleNote that I do use an OMEGA KITTY LITTER box that you roll over on its top.  The lateral slots let the clean litter fall in while the wet litter does as well.OMEGA KITTY LITTER BOX - my video reviewhttp://www.amazon.com/Omega-Paw-Self-Cleaning-Litter-Large/dp/B000LVGL1A/ref=cm_cr_pr_pb_t
summary: Smells Okay - Not Meant To Clump, Unfortunately

reviewText: Fit nicely in pet kennel!  Soft and cuddley. Kitty loved it!  Stays in place compared to the blankets or towels I usually use.

Product locks well . Plastic tough & durable unlike other company products . Most components for your money in comparison with others with wheel features . In fact cheaper then other competitors which made me choose them. Others that had wheels or more than 1 component priced outrageous . The lock on container airtight which is so relieving . Other brands have a flimsy lock that breaks easily or just not airtight .

This is a very nice indoor toy. It sails nicely through the living room onto the sofa so my 5 month old Maltese can leap on it and sometimes bring it back. It's not too big for him to handle, but is sized for a slightly larger dog than he is. I'd recommend for anything from toy through beagle sized.
I gave it a good try. Thought it was working after a week, but I have continued to give it to my dog...4 a day, and she is still eating her poo...So I cannot recommend this.

My husband and I have 16 finches. This is a great food to have.  Last year two of our Zebra Finches bred 5 finches.  This food is great for nutrition and for birds when they are in the process of breeding.  It's also great to keep on hand.

I love the regular Zero Odor product, but this one doesn't seem to help out my litter odor situation like I anticipated. Not sure why or what improvements could be made.  It might work for others, but it wasn't for me.
summary: Just ok.  Prefer the regular Zero Odor products

reviewText: Seems no better or no worse than other products.  Funny thing though, I actually think bulk MSG worked the best.

My "senior" cats (9 and 13) absolutely LOVE this scratcher.  The minute it arrived they were all over it (even before I sprinkled catnip on it--after that you couldn't get them away from it).  The younger one is a major scratcher and digger, so it didn't take long for him to completely tear up the cardboard (so be prepared with replacement disks for heavy duty scratchers).  The older one loves playing with the ball and if you rub it with the tiniest pinch of catnip he will play for hours.  Even when they aren't using it they like to sit on it or next to it.This is the best toy I ever bought my cats. I wish I had found this years ago, before they tore up my sofa!  Now they don't touch the furniture at all (unless they are playing and sorta scratch at the carpet).  They are noticeably more active and happier.  I can't recommend this enough!

reviewerName: Marj Baker "Marj Baker, Basenji and Manx cats"
reviewText: Came quickly and I like the velcro fasteners.  However it is too small around and to short in length.  Sizing information might help ordering this E-Collar.  Basenijis usually take medium size.
summary: Too small but probably my error in ordering

reviewText: My year and a half old Zelda is a tough chewer and will generally rip through any toy with a squeaker in less than 5 minutes. Snake however, is on of her favorites. She takes her time with the squeakers, takes him to the backyard, and carries him around the house too. We are now on snake number two since the first one was pretty dirty and worn out. I do wish he was a bit more invincible as far as the fabric and stitching are concerned.

I debated about purchase but after a week of using this scoop, I wish I could rate it more than 5 stars. I use clumping litter in boxes for two feline friends and clean litter twice a day. As anyone who does the same, you know there are variable "consistencies" of the soiled particles, depending on individual cat,food,water intake..etc, I usually had to use 2 different plastic scoops to really assure the litter was cleaned,for the kitties and for any residual tracked through house from fuzzy feet. This scoop does it all..from the "sticky-in-the corner-still-wet clumps" to the dryer clumps,large or small. The spacing of the openings in the scoop picks up even the smallest clumps. The shorter and padded handle is an extra stress saver for wrist. The soiled litter does not stick to the scoop as it does to plastic ones.I store it in a small waste basket with a plastic bag inside and so far have not had to wash it as I did the old plastic scoops,nearly daily. Wish I would have found this years ago..highly recommend.Thanks Amazon!
summary: Obviously designed by Someone Who Cleans Litter Boxes

reviewText: My dogs love these bogs. They are a good product and I will purchase them again for my dogs because they enjoy them.
When my puppy chews it, it makes a cracking noise and he loves it. It can be washed in the washing machine.
There's really not much to say in a review about a brush made for cleaning a fountain other than it works.
summary: It is exactly what it's supposed to be

reviewText: Dog really likes these, but they aren't a great value - doesn't take her long to woof them down, and the bits of the red chicken portion do flake off.  Of course the dog does a good job of clean-up. The mini bones last longer and don't have the flaking issue.
summary: Dog likes em, but they don't last long

reviewText: We have wanted an automatic litter box for a long time now. Last time I searched all of the options that were less than $300 had bad reviews (for the record this particular litter box was not on the market then). $300 for a cat litter box is way more than what we are willing to spend. The current price of this box at $106 is much more reasonable.When the box arrived we did the small amount of assembly required and read the directions. We decided not to leave our cats a second option and not to put any of the old used litter into this new box (as recommended). Our two cats have had several different litter boxes over the years (one is 8 and the other is about 11 years old). They are pretty good about going wherever we pour the litter. Within minutes of us replacing their old box with this new one our older cat was in there using it and checking it out. Several minutes later we heard it scooping. We were thrilled.We have now been using this litter box for about two weeks. With two cats it has to be emptied out daily, but now that is super easy to do. We have been reusing one of the bags that come with the box for the entire time. We just dump the mess out into the trash every morning. It literally takes seconds now and is so easy. It is much less strain on our back and knees than it used to be trying to scoop everything out ourselves. The cats seem to love it too. Before they would always be in the litter box moving the litter around trying to get around any clumps that were already in there. Now that is not an issue.The rake does not always get everything on the first pass, but it normally picks up the rest on the second time. I also want to address the noise. It claims to be "Over 4 Times Quieter Operation than Another Leading Brand". I am not sure who the leading brand is and I have nothing to compare it to. It is not super loud, however it is noticeable. In our house the litter box is in the laundry room which is off of the living room. When the television is off, you definitely hear it. It isn't distracting or super loud though. For us it blends in with the noise of our refrigerator making ice in the kitchen and the air-conditioner running. If it was in a bathroom off of our bedroom it may disturb my sleep. This is something to keep in mind depending on where your litter box is located.The box is also a little on the larger size. It works out fine for us since we have a large area with carpet that we place it on, but it is something to consider.This Pet Zone Smart Scoop Automatic litter box does use regular cat litter (which I love!). It has two lines - a minimum and maximum fill line to use as guides for the cat litter. I love this because it shows how much we overfilled our litter box before. We will definitely be saving on litter now.This litter box has definitely made our lives easier and made our house smell better. If this one breaks, we will probably buy another one. I definitely recommend this litter box.
summary: Our cats love it and we love it even more!

reviewText: The cats just pull it out of the fountain several times a day, and once the seeds sprout, the mess goes everywhere.  It needs to be attached more securely.  The grass is very spindly.  Pooh!

My dog loves the taste of the liquid health formula, which is the most important thing right up front.  I've gotten supplements for her before which she refused to eat.  Not only that, but after being on this product for a couple of weeks, my dog has better mobility in her hind legs.
