My only complaint is that you can't see through the automatic portion filling side.  You have to put it under a light and look down into it.  That's why I only gave it four stars.  Once opened it has to be refrigerated, but my dog doesn't mind that it is cold on her food.

I have used frontline plus for over 10 years. It has always been great for fleas and ticks. Over the last 6 months I have found it only works for 2-3 weeks after application. By about 2 1/2 weeks I am starting to see fleas, by 3 weeks they are biting the dogs, making them itchy and it is not killing them. I plan to call the manufacturer as I have 4 dogs and buy this in bulk for the year.

I am giving this product four stars because my dog absolutely loves it.  In fact, I'm wondering if I made a mistake ever letting her try it and if she'll turn up her nose at our usual (cheaper!) dog food now.  This is different from the usual kibble she is used to because it has both hard pieces and soft chickeny pieces all mixed together.  I didn't realize from looking at the bag what a big difference in look and texture this dog food would be compared to what I'm used to.  It looks like pieces of chicken, green vegetables, assorted bits in different colors and shapes instead of the more uniform ones.I do think that the look (both bag and the food itself) is a little misleading with the product.  Just because it looks like all that's in there is chicken and vegetables doesn't mean that's the case.  The ingredients include  animal digest and poultry by-product meat, and food coloring which I guess is for my benefit because I guarantee my pup is unconcerned.  These not great additives are certainly not limited to this brand of dog food, but if I am going to be paying more for dog food (this brand is more expensive than what I'm used to paying), I'd rather have one without them.
summary: Dog loves it, but I wouldn't buy again

reviewText: I use this on my small dog who is quite old.  Works fine.  I have to use Heartguard too in order to get the heart worms.  I use Trifexis for my bigger younger dog and that is one pill and done... BUT that does not get ticks.

Our rescue dog, Smokey, a 20lb schnauzer mix was pretty much perfect in every way: obedient, loving, sociable (and I may be biased :), extremely cute. The only thing we weren't expecting: a serious case of separation anxiety. After digging a hole to China in our apartment, howling for hours on end & later having to fork over a few hundred dollars for a trainer, I was feeling really demoralized because we weren't making much progress. Several people had asked if I had tried a stuffed Kong. I had always wondered what the draw was with them (our family dogs never gave them a 2nd glance) so I hadn't even thought about it for Smokey. After reading a few reviews online & checking out blogs on separation anxiety, I purchased the large Kong & figured I'd give it a shot.A few of the blogs I had read recommended stuffing it with delicious treats like steak or cheese on the bottom, then kibbles & sealing it up with cream cheese or Kong spray & freezing it. I tried this & settled Smokey in his kennel with the door open, gave him the Kong which he went BANANAS for & then made a big production of leaving -- jiggled keys, got my purse, opened the door: nothing. He didn't even look up at me. Mind you, this is the same dog who would cry when I would close the door to go to the bathroom.After practicing in different rooms, for different lengths of time, I FINALLY felt like there was a light at the end of tunnel. We actually bought extra Kongs so we could always have one ready to go in the freezer. Smokey is so excited for his Kong that when I get it from the freezer, he'll go racing to his kennel & hop right inside waiting for it. We've also made it a fast rule that he only gets the Kong when we leave & can only eat it in his kennel. The one time we forgot to get the Kong from the kennel upon returning home, I found him later that day in his kennel working on the rest of it.The separation anxiety is still a work in progress, but without the Kong, we couldn't even leave the house without him starting to howl. Now we can leave for up to 3-4 hours (and making progress week by week!) I'd definitely encourage freezing it & as your dog gets more familiar with it, add water or chicken broth to the kibbles to make it even harder to get out. Smokey can now clear a frozen Kong in an hour or less so we're working on perfecting more tricky methods!
It was very easy to put the treats in this ball and they come out fairly easily too. Not too fast, but quick enough to keep the cats interested. I would recommend it for any cat owner.

These mice are good value as there are plenty to replace as they got lost. I took one star off because the felt ears come off instantly the cat has the mouse and the eyes and nose generally follow later. The kitten doesn't seem to bother. She likes the black ones in particular. I bought some similar mice that rattled and I hoped these would as they are preferred. They don't.

These absorb alot better than the four paws brand. The four paws brand tends to leak and these have never leaked once.  Worth the extra $1 and change for a higher quality puppy pads.  My puppy only took a few minutes to recogize this is where he pees/poops. My puppy now prefers to do his business outside(and me, too) but because I am gone all day, i leave one out in case he can't hold it till I get home so there is no accidents on my wood floors.

My puppy loves playing with the tags that hang off of towels, blankets, other stuffed toys, etc. I got this toy when my aussie was about 10 weeks old. He is now 4 months old (40+lbs!) and he still enjoys this toy every time I bring it out. He simply loves pulling and nibbling on the little tags. He also loves how these tags make a light crinkly noise. But not all of them do, which makes it more entertaining for him, since he needs to figure out which ones are the special noise making tags. I would say that if you find your dog generally more interested in the tags hanging off of toys than the toys themselves, you should try this one out! It's the ultimate "tag" for them to play with!
summary: A favorite for a puppy that loves chewing on tags!

reviewText: I bought 4.  My pups love them!  I give them one when I go to work in the morning and one when I come home for lunch.  There are some good recipes on the Kong website or you can create your own.  Fill the Kong, put it in the freezer, and serve when frozen.  The dogs get a little mental challenge and entertainment.  Excellent, excellent product!

We have used this product for years, and the cat version also for fleas and ticks, and it works very well in our area of The Woodlands, Texas, although I've heard that in certain parts of Texas, the fleas are becoming resistant to it, but I've not experienced that in my area, but we do use it year round here in the south.

I love Kongs, they're practically indestructible, and when filled with enough treats, you can keep a dog occupied for hours with one.  My concern here, is that this is listed as an x-large Kong.  I don't doubt that I was sent the correct Kong, but it is about 1/3 the size of the largest traditional Kong.  It is not really big enough for a large dog, and I think the label x-large is a tad misleading.  If you have a large dog, it may be better to go to a pet supply store and look at the Kong sizes in person to make sure of the correct size.
summary: Love Kongs but the x-large is tiny

reviewText: This was purchased for a 20- pound Tennessee Mountain Feist named Bandit.  Bandit does not seem to mind his collar, it stays in place and I like the color. I have two issues with the collar--it is hard to adjust and only the threads on the collar are reflective--not the whole collar.  The collar seems durable.

We got this for a bulldog puppy and it is a heavy chain.  The weight of the chain pulled on him when he was smaller.  It's fine now because he's already over 40 pounds, but I wouldn't recommend this for a smallish dog.  The clip at the end is not high quality but it hasn't given us any trouble in 4 months of almost daily use.
summary: Great price but not really good for smaller dogs, the wieght of the chain is heavy

reviewText: This lead is made of great materials. We use it multiple times a day, and it is used for a very active puppy.
summary: Durable materials and easy to use.

reviewText: All of my cats use this box the most. If you have a large kitty, he or she would most likely appreciate the roominess as well.The "sun roof" on top is very handy at scooping time. I don't have to unsnap the lid and remove it in order to get the job done.It has a sort of lip at the bottom of the entrance. I place a bag over that and get the waste from the pan directly into the bag.I liked this box well enough to purchase a second one.So why 4 stars and not 5 ?As with all hooded litter boxes, sometimes you'll need to remove the hood so that you can do a thorough washing of the box.In order to lock / unlock the hood, you have to slide the 4 locks in one direction or the other. (There are little icons of a lock right there on the sides that will show you which position is which.) The locks that hold the hood onto the pan are rather flimsy and fiddly. Sometimes it takes me a few attempts to get them in place. If one isn't careful, they could break.I think that the flip locks on my old, smaller boxes are better than this slide type.I'd also like to see the bottom of the entrance way a little higher because sometimes my cats will scratch piles of litter over it and outside of the box.As I stated above, all of my cats prefer to use this box and when paired with the Duranimals DuraScoop Cat Litter ScoopB001DCAAP4I have a winner for all concerned in my household. :)
summary: Love the size, neutral color and "sunroof"

reviewText: need to return; dogs irritate eyes and cant be used on them.. sad it seems good

That yum was from my dog, not me. :) My dog loves this food. The texture feels meaty and you can see all sorts of different ingredients in each piece.  My dog gets excited just by seeing the bag and always finishes every last bit in his bowl.  I like that this food contains real and healthy ingredients and really takes the time to care about proper nutrition for dogs. This is definitely a product I will continue using.

Wouldn't say its 100% good but it has a really great waterfall feature which I think is very beautiful and admiring. The bowl stopped working after a few months and the glass broke after picking it up and cutting my hand in the process. Luckily i moved my betta fish from it after it broke and moved it into a 10 gallon tank where its more happy and greets me.
Thought it would be bigger, my smallest cat hardly fits in it, not worth the money but will say it's nice and thick.
These are great. They don't smell. Our 3 month old puppy probably can get about 6-10 hours of chewing time per stick, which equates to about 2 weeks.

We have 3 dogs ranging from 50-85 pounds. It can be a trick to find food they will all eat. We have to keep them on limited ingredient foods due to one of our dogs having some skin issues. That said we use this food as a treat for them on top of their regular food and not as their regular meal. They love it! It's like candy to them. When they see the bag they get excited because they know what it is. The pieces aren't real big so the food would probably be appropriate for all size dogs.After seeing our three dogs reactions I can recommend this but also recommend reading the ingredients to make sure it is appropriate for your dogs needs. It could also be easy to overfeed if they like it as much as ours do but that can be easily remedied.I say give it a try!

HUGE litterbox!!  I have 2 cats and this box could accommodate another 2.... I need to clean it less often, and the cats used it right away, no problems.  It is well made and sturdy.  I took the door off, like most people suggested....

We were really getting a lot of ticks crawling on us.  I put this on the boys and the ticks just disappeared.  We don't usually have a flea problem, so this wasn't an issue.  They are happy and so are we.
summary: Merial Frontline Plus Flea and Tick Control for 45 to 88-Pound Dogs, 6...

reviewText: Our dog Shultz loves the food, in fact he loves it so much he has given up on his self structured eating and now is continually heading back to the bowl for more food.Unfortunately the large amount of Soy does a number on our dog's intestinal emanations as well as his eating habits so we are going to give away the rest of the bag, after he gets through the mixture in our table top canister.  The other issues we have are the artificial ingredients, which may also lend themselves to the gas issues as well.I believe we will be heading back to the regular dog food we previously purchased.  We need a leaner, healthy dog, and a dog food with more natural ingredients will do a much better job.Dog rating 5 starsHuman Rating 2 starsCombined 3 stars

I haven't finished putting everything together, placed it on the back of the sofa, and Charlie already found it! It goes into another window, but he doesn't care. Already asleep and loving it!  This is the first perch I've bought. Very easy installation directions with pictures on the box. Has an extra cover included.

My  two 9 pound chihuahuas love this food. One of them is highly sensitive to other brands I have tried, but she is fine with this food.  i enjoy knowing its all organic, USA made and supports Ellen as well.ive been ordering from Amazon for over a year, and its finally on subscribe and save! hoorah!!
summary: excellent and finally on subscribe and save

reviewText: the product was a small package but it was packed in a huge box. i only realised i can only use it next year because my dog has just been de-wormed. well, i can always keep it til next year.
It's really cheap and with free shipping, what else could you ask for? The material of the leash is "plastic-nylon-mesh" like. After a few use, the mesh starts to break down.

The towel itself soaks up a TON of water, but with my lab it still is not enough to get her dry. I still need two regular towels after this one to get her all dried off. So just keep in mind, it's not made like a real towel. It's basically a long piece of folded fabric so you can (I think?) put your hands in it and use a side to side motion to dry the dog. I'm not entirely sure why it's made the way it is, but it is odd. I would much prefer it to just be a big rectangular shaped piece of cloth with the "pile" on it to soak up the water and be a bigger size so it would do more for me in getting the dog dry after baths. However, that's not to say it's not a good product because it is...it's just not as good as it could be.

I’m not unlike most pet owners I know.  Ever since the melamine introduction into pet foods I’m extremely cautious about what I feed my animals.  I check out ingredients zealously and have, at times, run things by my veterinarian.  I long ago shifted to products made in the United States, but did my research on Bully Sticks and grass-fed raised beef from Brazil are on the acceptable list.There are no hidden ingredients or strange herbal concoctions hidden inside the Bully sticks.  I have had some trouble with my small dog and herbs.  These have one ingredient and that’s dried pizzle.  Look that one up.  Even people have been known to eat them for medicinal purposes, but I think I’ll take a pass.My neighbor’s dog Bub, a German Shepherd adored the Bully sticks.  Even with his big teeth it did take him a bit to eat one.  They aren’t totally odor-free, but do have a very light scent when I opened the bag.  And it wasn’t anything in the chemical line.  You seriously get what you pay for these days and if you want a decent chew, Bully Sticks will fit the bill.FEATURES:►  Virtually Odor-Free►  Free of harsh chemicals such as bleach or formaldehyde►  All Natural and Fully Digestible►  100% Free-Range, Grass-Fed South American Beef (Brazil)►  Great Dental Chews►  USDA certified and inspected► Single-ingredient dog chewsI cringe when people use cowhide anything because it unravels and sits in the gut.  The Bully Sticks, on the other hand, are purportedly digestible.  I had no complaints about loose stools or a trip to the vet.  If you have a dog who literally wolfs treats and foods down in about one gulp, you should take a pass on everything, including Bully Sticks.  My dear departed Brandy would gulp stuff down as if she were imbibing a shot.The Bully Sticks are a one-a-day keep the dentist away sort of treat and the gnawing Bub proved that.  You can keep them in the freezer to extend the life of the sticks.  Insects love them as much as dogs do so make sure you keep the Ziplock-like enclosure zipped up for good measure.  FYI, there’s a two-year shelf life for these (I did my homework).Low fat, high protein, chem-free, good for the teeth, and on and on.  Sounds like something that’s good for a human diet and probably is.  Most people consider their animals to be full-fledged members of their households and only provide the best, something that Bully Sticks are.Sample provided for review.
summary: High-quality treats for the valued members of our households ...

reviewText: The only kittymalt that I buy is Excel. I give this to my 5 cats twice weekly and have never seen any of them coughing or hacking up hairballs. oh, BTW, they can't wait to lick it off my finger !!

I would have given this litter pan 5 stars if it weren't that clasps do not tie upper and bottom parts together.  So really you can't use the handle to move it, since it comes apart.  Otherwise it is a nicely-sized box.

I feed my small dogs twice a day alternating between the low fat dry and regular dry food adding a little bit of canned for additional flavor.  I guess the clue that is is good is the excitement my dogs dipslay when I head their way at feeding time.  I prefer the grain free food.

This was a life-saver when out puppy was teething. I'd soak it in water and put it in the freezer. Then, when he was whining and noticeably uncomfortable from the teething I'd bring it out and you could actually see the relief in his whole body as soon as he saw it! I considered getting one or two more so that I could always have one in the freezer to sooth his poor mouth, but I never got around to it.For the record, when this one was not ready yet I would use rags tied in a knot that I had also soaked and frozen. But those were really, really messy and I would have to confine him to the kitchen and then clean up the puddles. This one never got drippy - I guess because the material is made to be absorbent so it holds onto the water as the ice melts and then just dries out as he chews. He's done teething now, but I still use it because we live in an area that gets quite hot in the summer and it's a great way to help him cool off (he's an Old English Sheepdog and seems to HATE the heat - I don't blame him!)
summary: A life saver when my pup was teething

reviewText: Great toy very durable yet springy my boxers love playing tug of war with it and my puppy love to chew on it to help cut her teeth.  This is a durable yet soft toy that so-far hasn't shown any wear or tear after a few weeks.  Great toy to play tug of war with since it springy and has distinct ends that you both can pull on.

Frontline is a great product, but be warned,.. This comes in a 6 month dose packet that you have to use a syringe with. We received this order today. It comes with the syringe to measure and apply it behind their shoulders like the individual packets. The company sends you a tiny 'tiny' bottle and the directions say to put one pack of the liquid in it. We spilled over half because it is too small to fit in the TINY bottle they send. The 1.34 ml that had to be applied to our 32 lb dog meant that we had to use the syringe twice as it only holds 1.0 ml. Looking at the packet, there is no way that it contains a 6 month treatment!We are requesting a refund (less 1/12 as we bought 2 packages  or exchange of 11 single use treatments for our 32 lb dog) as we had to apply 1 treatment because our dog was due for it. Once we receive our refund (or exchange) from the shipper (if we do at all), we will update the review.Same day: Amazon has sent me notice that I will receive a refund, and I got the return label to send back the unused treatments to the shipper. The only qualm being that it is in syringe form, and you have to use your own sterile container to keep the rest of the treatments in (if you only have 1 or 2 dogs) as the vile they send is not big enough. This is great for a multi-dog family. And the customer service is AWESOME! I would buy from this company again.

My dog is more of a plush toy chewer, but I thought I would try this after reading great reviews. It has a strong rubber smell. It's fun for a little tug of war, but he's not that interested in playing. He won't voluntarily pick up for chewing/playing.

My Maltipoo was gaining too much weight on the regular adult Core Wellness so I switched her to this.  She absolutely loves this.  So much so that I'm able to sometimes use it as training treats instead of a higher calorie treat.
Both of our labs love their Kongs and have been unable to destroy it (Yet!).  I love the many different recipies and options that Kong offers to keep your pet entertained w/ it.  Great item!
summary: Our dogs recognize that Kong means Peanut Butter

reviewText: I've used Pet Naturals products for years. At one point, I honestly believe one of their products saved the life of one of my dogs.Long story short, she had an underdeveloped digestive system. We tried everything (we lovingly call her our million dollar baby, between tests, meds, and vet bills)but it was Pet Naturals digestive support that got her back on track.This may not be a miracle product, but it seems to be helping with shedding. Once in a while these 'treats' are met with an upturned nose, but funny thing, they eventually disappear. Purrrrrrfect!
summary: Pet Naturals for Naturally Healthy Pets

reviewText: My bulldog loooves this ball!! I first ordered small because he doesn't like too large of balls as he wants to just hold them in his mouth and squeak them. The small was about racquet-ball size, maybe a little smaller. The medium is about softball size. Small was too small but the medium is just right. The feet make it bounce in unpredictable directions and he just loves this toy.

I have two dogs.  The older one, a St. Bernard cross, has never chewed any toy up.  The younger Great Dane can, in one chomp, break most toys.  Amazingly she has been unable to destroy this toy.  I'm delighted.  It takes them time to get any treats out and they enjoy working on them.The only down side is that when you wash the Orka Chew water gets into a few of the chambers and gets trapped.  Luckily I live in a very dry climate so most things will dry overnight.For my heavy chewer this has been a great addition.

reviewerName: Wandrwoman "Wise as Aphrodite, Beautiful as A...
reviewText: My 25 pound mixed breed dog is a picky eater. She insists on variety and will lose interest when fed the same meal repeatedly. I tried Chef Michael's chicken flavor and she seemed to like it for a few days but then stopped eating it entirely. I finished the bag off by mixing it with other food she preferred. Part of the problem is that if you don't seal the bag tightly after each use, the kibble can get hard and probably stale.

I've been using Frontline for years with my dogs. It has always been very effective, which is important living in a place with lots of ticks. After going on nature walks, it's nice to check the dogs and not find a single tick on them.  If only the same could be said for us humans :-).When I moved to VA, our new vet had us try another flea and tick product. One of my dogs had such a horrible reaction to it. Racing heart, panting, hyperactivity, that the vet had to give him a sedative. Needless to say, I'm sticking with Frontline. It does the job and my dogs tolerate it well.I always purchase this product through Amazon because you can't beat the price! I also make a point of choosing the 3 month supply boxes because the order is filled by Amazon. This is important to me because I know that I can count on a speedy delivery and that I receive the product I ordered.

I have a 5 month old kitten that has been on all sorts of high quality foods. She has been on:Stella and Chewy'sNature's Variety Raw NuggetsFrankenprey (raw diet)Honest Kitchen GraceShe has tried all those foods for a week at least, the raw diet being the absolute longest. I do not have any plans to switch her to Honest Kitchen 100%. I truly believe raw is the way to go, HOWEVER she loves this stuff. She liked Grace but she always preferred raw chicken. I just fed her a bowl of this with raw chicken in it and wow she's eating around the chicken! She loves this stuff, but then again this kitten is a chicken girl. I introduced this into her food because I felt like I needed an alternative to raw in an emergency. This food lasts up to a year (when kept DRY) so it is a very good emergency stock. I don't really like canned or kibble (they smell BAD) so this was my next go to food. I'm impressed that my kitten loves this over the Grace formula (even though Grace has less carbs.)Anyways back to the food. I believe different cats will like different consistencies. What works for me is 1:2 ratio of Food:Water.  This makes it a little soupy but my kitten seems to enjoy that. She also enjoys a 1:1 ratio. I would just experiment with your cats. I introduced this food after I converted my kitten to Stella and Chewy's. They have a similar texture  but I really don't think that will work with older cats. With older cats I would swap them over to a CANNED food first and then put a pea sized dallop and move on from there. This food is a very STRANGE consistency in comparison to the normal canned and kibbles.Anyways good luck!
Since my 1 year old cat is small and only 6lbs., it's not even necessary to fill the plastic cup with food. The blue tray holds enough for him to nibble and munch all day.
summary: Holds Just Enough Food All Day For My Tom-Cat!

reviewText: Ordered 2 if these - one for upstairs (daytime quiet time) & one for downstairs (nighttime sleeping). Love both! And it's the best deal when purchased on amazon vs retail stores! About 1/3rd of the price in stores! Very easy to open & close and it folds down, so our summer trips will be a breeze since we can collapse the crate & bring it with us! Crate training is super important for the well being of our pup! Gives him his own place to get his much needed downtime.

Substantial.  More attractive than the normal sisal trees.  My cats like the curved top shelf. Assembly is a bit time consuming because of so many parts but instructions are adequate.  A little pricey.

Its a big larger than I expected (I didn't take the time to refer to a ruler) but it does its job just fine. Some people complain that their bowls dont stay expanded. If it doesn't work properly, I recommend you process a return. Amazon is one of the most customer-friendly businesses in the industry; I have no doubt that they would right the situation. This bowl is definitely worth having for anyone who worries about their dog dehydrating during long summer walks. My dog is hesitant about drinking out of most travel bowls but seems to actually enjoy this one.

Both our older cat and our chihuahua love their beds. Just the right safe level of warmth is produced which makes it much safer than a standard heating pad.  I have had one of the beds over a year now, and it has stayed plugged in all winter, and going strong..  Not really easy to clean, but a hand-held vac does the trick pretty well.

I've tried several models of web-strap restraints for my dog to keep him safe during cross country car trips -- no one wants to slam on the brakes and have a dog rocket through the front windshield -- but until this padded harness and back-loop-and-seat-belt-strap version, my dog didn't find them comfortable enough to settle down and enjoy the ride.The difference is in the padded body harness, which is customizable with 4 straps that can be adjusted for a snug fit and with quick release catches that makes putting it on quick and painless. Best of all, the hook and strap that you have to use to attach it to the seat belt is a screwed on loop that will stay put. You can choose to give your dog more room to shift, turn and move around if you put around the shoulder strap or less if attached to the waist belt. It allowed my dog to get up, change position and settle down whenever he wanted without allowing him to distract me in the front seat. Perfect.
summary: Excellent safety restraint that dog appreciates, too

reviewText: I spent HOURS researching dog food.  I had it down to Wolf Pup, Taste of Wild, and this Wellness Core.  WC was my last choice as I researched that some dogs can be allergic to chicken.  I asked the vet, and she said it's true, but she wouldn't say it's common.  She said to go with chicken and save the lamb and bison as alternatives IF she would become allergic.  So then WC became my #1 choice.  It's grain free which I liked.  So we picked up the food, picked up our new puppy and started the half and half with the dog food the breeder was giving.  After all the research I almost cried as I poured in the "other brand" (knowing how bad all the fillers/corn/garbage was in the other stuff).  So we only went two days with the mixing, then I went to straight WCore.  She did great (7 and half weeks at this point)!  Never had any digestion problems, never had any loose stools.  I am hoping for the miracle food that everyone is claiming that it will produce much better fur and low dander.  We've bathed her 3 times in one week (I know, a bit compulsive) and she has no skin problems.  She is a little over 8 lbs. now, and just moved up to about a cup a day.  So they do eat less than the typical dog food.  The "other brand" was recommending almost 2 cups while WC was right on track with what she was eating at 1 cup/ day (divided into thirds or fourths throughout the day).  So I feel a little better spending the extra money knowing that it's lasting me longer than the typical bag of "other brand" dog food.  Love that the ingredients are healthy!  The only hangup I had was a comment I had read that their dog didn't like it.  I wasn't spending sixty dollars to find out she didn't like it.  I called customer service and she explained I would have a money back guarantee.  So that sealed the deal.  Our lab mix loves it, and we haven't looked back.Update:  She is now 9 weeks old and only needing a bath once a week.  She no longer has that "dog smell".  It has to be the food. :)2nd Update: 16 months now.  The only "shed" she had was when she lost her initial puppy fur about a year ago (and when she had a rash under her armpits).  We will still get hair off when she's brushed, but NO tumble weeds around the house like with our last dog who was on cheap Wal-Mart food.  It could be the 1/4 poodle, but I'm sure the food is a bonus.  No allergy issues with the children, like our last dog, either.  SOOOOO happy about that!

My dogs like these and their website assures that they are USA made.  My dogs aren't real picky but they are a wee bit spoiled so don't like just anything.  They snap these up.  Nice size, easy to break into smaller pieces.

Great time saver you get 3 cloth bags PRI filled.. no need for zip tights or stings . Bags are about 2 inch * 5 inch  and about 1 inch thick  bags hold together well ..over time as the bags rip its normally to to replace anyway  . Only thing negative I have to say is that the vendor doesn't keep a lot on hand  I like to order 4 boxes at a time  those Fish geeks . Com

We actually secured two panels of the gate to the wall in order to give our puppy a litte more room to play, we have her crate set up against the wall inside the pen. The crate so far has been able to stand up to a 10 pound boxer puppy running and jumping on it.
I don't love it or hate it. It works but it feels as if you're twisting foreverrrrrrrrr. I wouldn't purchase it again.
The heating element really didn't heat, our kitty did not like it and neither did we. So—back to Amazon it went!

I had never used a cleaning magnet on a fish tank but decided to try this for our 55 gallon tank that houses my pond koi during the Winter.  As fish people know, these guys are really dirty and the tank is a bear to keep clean.I love this magnet.  It is amazingly strong, (watch your fingers!!!!), and if the inside drops the outer magnet will immediately pick it up.  Keeping the inside of the tank is really easy and takes about five minutes every couple of weeks.Incidentally, I did purchase another brand magnet for a tank in my home that has goldfish.  It was much cheaper and it IS much cheaper!!  It is almost impossible to keep the two magnets together, the inner one will not even follow the outside one around a corner.  When the inner magnet falls to the bottom of the tank, the magnet will not pick it up and you need to go fishing for it.  It did come with an included string, but the string keeps breaking.  Fortunately, that is a much smaller tank so my frustration can be dealt with easier.As soon as I can I will be ordering another Aqueon!!
These are perfect treat size to reward our dogs a couple times a day.  They love them and we love that they're a natural treat

For 10$ you get a huge, huge bag of small-ish type dog treats.  They are perfect for training and low fat.  They are hard and our puppy didn't like them at first, but in the last few weeks he's really started gobbling them up every chance he gets. Highly recommend.

Looks as described.  Used as stocking stuffer for my cats.  they always enjoy catnip filled toys.  I'm going to quit leaving feedback, if you don't change the requirements that they have to be so long.!!!

I have been using this on my dog since he was a puppy at the instruction of my vet.  It seems to work reasonably well as he has never had any problem with fleas or ticks that I could see.  The product is easy to apply although the packages are sometimes a little bit difficult to open.  It also seems to cause my dog's skin to itch slightly as he will always start rubbing his back against the carpet when I put it on each month.  Generally, it seems to be doing its job, however.  If you buy it in a pet store like PetSmart it is sometimes $20 more than it is here on Amazon.
I love this product. It works much better with cat urine than any other product Ive tried. No complaints here!

When I received this product, it had fallen out of its plastic packaging inside the shipment box and the reflector tape was bent and crinkled, so that was disappointing.The leash is much larger than most retractable leashes and a it's a bit on the heavy side in comparison to other leashes I've seen/owned.It's very nice looking but as another reviewer mentioned, the buttons are a bit strange. I was really not fond of the way the button mechanism was designed for this particular leash.Since it had a bit of damage, I returned it. But I will say, it's a pretty heavy duty leash. While not for me, it might be what you're looking for.

This is a durable, well made soft toy.  This is the fourth I have purchased so I obviously like the quality.  We purchased the duck, squirrel and rabbit and hide them throughout the apartment daily and always find them on the sofa when we arrive home. Our Aussie Shepherd likes to stay busy while we are gone. He appears to like the duck the most because it is the most chewed and faintly damp every day, although the rabbit is gaining favor! These have durable stitching, quality fabric and are fairly realistic.  They do have squeakers inside which I normally would cut out, but because these are stitched well, I have let the squeaker remain inside. The squirrel is the only stuffed toy our Keeshond will play with.  Keeshonds do not normally play with toys but this one is well used. We got our money's worth on this one.  I highly recommend these.

This is my first crate purchase, but I am finding it quite useful. My puppy sleeps in there each night. When he has to go, which is often, he cries and we take him out. So far, no relieving himself in there!It's nice to have a safe place to put him while I clean up after him. He has a knack for getting into trouble. Next stop, puppy classes!

I love this Redbarn product, and my dogs love it, too. My dogs are on a raw food diet and I try to stay away from junk treats. I cut this roll up into training sized pieces and it's amazing at keeping their attention. It's not as oily as other rolled dog food I've tried, so that's a huge plus.

This is a great cat box systems and the pads are easy to change, absorb a ton of pee, and normally can be removed and the box itself is still pefectly dry.  Been using these (and the system) for over a year.Would never consider going back.For number 1, it is clearly number 1!

I've had this over the side filter for over a year and it has continued to perform without a single problem.  My wife is using it on her 37 gallon salt water tank and the nitrate levels are always good.  It has a little red pop up bottom that lets you know when the sponge is full of "stuff" so you can rinse it in the sink.  Unit is compartmentalized so you can leave it on the back of the tank and just pull out the various filters, media, carbon and clean or change them out.  You can also choose two flow speeds by moving the intake tube from left to right, hi and low.
summary: THIS THING SUCKS, AND THAT'S A GOOD THING

reviewText: I first got a bottle from my vet, after bringing my dog in for an ear infection.  Recently she started developing one again, and with daily checking and cleaning, I was able to make it go away!  Once it calmed down, I still check her ear every several days and do a 'maintenance' cleaning.  Some dogs just develop ear infections more easily, and sometimes in one ear more often.Keep an eye on your dog's ears and keep them clean, saving about $60 for an office visit and antibiotics is very worth it!Also, the smell is not overpowering like some of these products can be!
My pups have multiple allergies and tolerate these treats without a problem and they love the taste !In addition,  they are good nutrition without any  harmful additives !
summary: Great yum-yums for my allergic pups

reviewText: He sleeps in it all the time.f  I have 2 abandon cat outside and didn't want them facing winter in the cold so I bought this house and another one for the other cat.  I have this one on the deck and he sleeps in it all day long and when I come out in the morning he's just coming out of it to get his breakfast.  Don't be concerned they have to lay on it for a few minutes before it heats up but he loves it.  Great price and pretty easy to put together.  A great purchase.  I got him to go into it by putting some cat nip on the pillow he practically ran into it and snuggled right in.
summary: Would buy again and have reccommended.

reviewText: For my needs this filtration system is the best one available, filters are easy and totally effective. Will purchase as needed in the future.
These were okay but sort of expensive.  I will go back to purchasing cow ears.  The bag is small and they smelled kind of "off."  I just wasn't all that impressed.

My 35 lb cocker loves his new treat ball. The postman brought the treat ball in the morning and the dog spent all afternoon playing with it. Because I was busy and the dog was happily occupied I failed to notice for quite a while that the Everlasting brand chicken treat that came with the toy was making nasty stains all over the beige wall-to-wall carpet in my office. I'm pretty sure my pup isn't any more slobbery than any other avidly chewing canine. But his slobber and the chicken treat combined to create a trail of ugly mustard-colored carpet stains all over the room. In addition to a bunch of spots all over the place, I found a few large stains in out-of-the-way places where my dog had settled for awhile to lick and chew away at the toy. The treat ball itself is just fine -- I have no complaints about it as a quality dog toy. But I have serious issues with the food coloring that's used in the Everlasting treats that pop into the ball. I've just used up an entire aerosol can of carpet cleaner and an hour of elbow grease to remove the stains from my carpet. After this experience I won't be buying any Everlasting brand treats to put in my pup's new chew toy. If you're going to be using this product outdoors, then the Everlast treats might be just fine. But if you're planning to let your dog play with this toy indoors, and you've got nice flooring that you care about keeping reasonably clean, it's best to avoid the Everlast treat inserts.
We haven't actually used it yet but it is the best I've ever had. It's very cushie and comfortable inside. I really recommend it and am going to buy another on for the other dog.

I purchased a size medium for my cat (I'd say she's about 10lbs) and I actually think ordering the small would of been better for her.  She likes to curl up more than stretch out, though with this bed she definitely has the option to do either/or.  It looks comfy, very soft material, my cat loves it!  It actually looks like a sofa for a cat/small dog.  Very neat!

I bought this for my boxer when he was about 6 months old, I still have it. It still fits. I love it. It appears a bit ridiculous in the summer because it's so padded, but who cares, he's just walking from the elevator to the car, he's not going hiking in it :)

I am so happy with this!  I am crate training him and have put the crate inside the pen so he can sleep there if he wants to. I feed him in the pen and that's where I keep his water. He hated it at first but now walks in and out all day, especially to check for little mystery treats that occasionally appear.  He currently has access only to my great room, until he's he's housebroken and can be trusted on the carpet.This was so easy to put together and I love that it's made of plastic so it doesn't ruin my walls or wood floor.  I also bought aw whelping blanket and keep that under the pen for "accidents". For his size, the 3x3 is just perfect. I will not hesitate to buy the 2 extensions when he gets bigger.Great product at a great price. Pets art only had metal crates, and another brand of plastic pen that cost $150.00!Strongly recommend.
summary: Bought this for my Westie Puppy

reviewText: I use this harness on my 30# Puggle, but never thought to use it on my 90# Pit Mix.  It actually fits her comfortably around the neck and her broad chest and middle.  Also slid over her bulky head smoothly.  The test will be in using it to walk her as she does get excited when walking, especially if a dog is running loose.  Will let you know ;)
summary: I think Mya is going to love it, too

reviewText: Used it for the first time this past week during a playdate with my dogs.  They all loves it.  Only fault is that the stakes to hold it down and still pulled up faster than I would have liked.  Maybe if they were made a little longer they would hold better when pushed into the groud.  The material was strong enough and withstood both rotties and german shephards running through it.  It was also reasonably priced.

I own a Pixie Frog and a Tokay gecko.  I try to provide a varied diet for my animals.  Unfortunately Petsmart has a rampant chytrid fungus problem in their African dwarf frog populations and the same employees who count out the live foods are reaching around in the infected tanks.I didn't want to feed my animals the dried crickets because I believe they need the moisture content.  I was overjoyed when I found these canned crickets.  The large size ones are ENORMOUS!!  I have never gotten a cricket this big in any live feeder store.  My pixie frog/African bullfrog eats them enthusiastically from my tongs or if I place them in front of him and wiggle them a little with the tongs.My Tokay is less enthusiastic about the canned crickets and shows a preference for the live ones, but she too will eat them from the tongs if she is hungry.These are much easier to dust with vitamins too, since they are already dead and won't go jumping into the water dish right away.  I keep mine in the freezer if I can't use them all in a week.

I have 2 big dogs: a greyhound, and a lab/pit mix.  They both LOVE these treats and go overboard with the head-butting / exuberant panting when I bring the bag out.The greyhound is weak-jawed and it does take him a while (2-3 minutes - which is a long time to eat a treat for my beasts) to get through one.  My mix is very strong-jawed and she devours one in seconds.  (Thus I have to give the greyhound a head start-- otherwise when he is slowly working his way through one and dropping pieces everywhere, the mix will come steal it from him and that gets ugly.)If you're looking for a thick rawhide bone that will occupy your pup for hours, look elsewhere.  These are thin, well, flat sticks.  They are a treat, not a bone. I prefer these to a bone-- my mix can eat a whole rawhide bone and then she throws up.  These seem to be easier on her sensitive tummy.  If you're looking to reverse your dog's gum disease... well I don't think any treat can do that.  But if you're looking to help prevent plaque build-up, these should do the trick.BOTTOM LINE:  Apparently delicious, pretty easy to eat, gentle on the digestive system, and good for the teeth!  Win!

This is a great toy. I have 2 Jack Russell terriers who play "fetch" with it. It is a very loud squeaker (the dogs love that even more, altho sometimes it can get deafening, lol).Anyway, Bounces really well, lightweight, squeaks loud, squishy to chew on, what more could you want if you were a dog?Yes, it could get torn up, so like most of my dog's toys, this gets put in the play box when we are done.This is not the strength of a "Kong" toy.So you will have to decide your priorities:1. a toy that the dogs can't put down (95% likely). So you will have to do monitored "play/ quality" time with you, & put it away when you're done.or2. A tough strong toy, that they may not like (as its too tough to chew), but you can leave it with them 24/7.BTW, I even have a small "chewy" puppy version of a Kong, & my JRT breed of dog still think its too tough to chew on (even with peanut butter in it - altho they will lick it out, lol).My dog background over the years: 4 labs, 1 german shepard, 1 pit bull, 3 airedales, 2 Jack Russells (not Parsons).

My dog LOVED these treats.  Sadly, they only exacerbated her itchy skin and dry coat.  I think it was the brewer's yeast.  Not a good treat for allergy dogs, especially if there is the possibility of food allergies.

Probably not for the biggest, but this harness is excellent for taking your dog on a walk, without worrying if it would run to the neighbor smelling her underwear again!Keep your dog close with this harness, that keeps even strong and heavier dogs at bay.Good material, if anything negative to say about it, may be that it's made out of a fabric that gets dirty just like the dog, so it may need washing.
summary: Great, strong harness even for big dogs

reviewText: Anything pet related I love to try out and test on my picky dogs. The product states it supports skin comfort, clean sheen coat, proper skin tones, strengthening of the hair and antioxidants to promote skin health. For dogs with allergies / skin issues it is certainly worth the try to try a product out. In the past we have had dogs with allergies and products like this have done wonders. My current dogs are fine with their skin/hair no allergies. However the hair does give off a sheen look, and looks healthy as well. We have a Matlese, Shih Tzu, a Mix Mutt and a Lab. All of them absolutely love the taste of these, and if given the chance would devour them.Directions state Feed 1 chew per 25 lbs body weight, daily. My dogs do look forward to them daily!
summary: Dogs love the taste and their hair looks good.

reviewText: Dogs love the taste, so at the very least it's not a battle to get them to eat these. The product isn't as greasy as i expected (which is a good thing).I love the brand, and will come back for more!
summary: I have NO idea if it's working.

reviewText: This pen is great for my small dogs. I also ordered more panels to make their pens bigger. The panels are also great to block off stairs and rooms. My dogs are small do it holds them in

I prefer this food distribution toy because its a soft, quiet rubber as opposed to other toys out there that are plastic and LOUD on the floor or when they bang in to the wall. The downside is the rubber rips pretty easily, and therefore its not really durable and would be AWFUL for a chew-y dog.

Obtained just before the eight week old Australian Shepherd puppy arrived. It is easy to set up and followed the suggestion in other reviews and put a shower curtain underneath. A standard liner is the right size. The puppy is now 16 weeks old and it is not used much anymore. However, for those first 4-5 weeks it was very useful as she could go in there (at least once a day) to be 'devil dog' and chew up sticks, throw her toys around and generally act wild and crazy. Would put her in and as long as I was in the room reading she was fine. Also used it for naps. It is quite sturdy and easy to assemble.Now that she is older she only goes in to get a drink once in awhile and just noticed that there aren't even any toys inside it anymore.

My Beagle absolutely loves this bed.  With other beds she scratches and pulls on the material in an attempt to make it cuddle her.  She now climbs in the bed, turns a couple of times, lays down and is shortly on her back with her head laying over the side.  I can't believe I finally found a winner for her!We have owned the bed for over six months and it isn't showing any signs of wear and cleans very easily.

My medium size border terrier who is a regular chewer played with this toy for about 5 minutes before it was all ripped apart.  All KONG toys are typically high quality and durable, this is the first time I am disappointed with this brand.

In the product description they talk about these as if they are the same toy and show the two different types as "color options".  But in reality they don't work alike and are pretty different toys.I purchased the timid turtle thinking it was just a different facial expression.  But what I found when I received it is that the Timid Turtle's legs just stretch out when your dog pulls on them, but the shell doesn't open.  Not sure why stretchy legs are considered a "puzzle".At first I figured it was just me not understanding how to use the puzzle (although I normally consider myself above the average golden retriever in intelligence), but the manufacturer confirmed that pulling on the legs is the only feature of the timid turtle.The other turtle might be worth the cost, but I don't think the Timid Turtle should be sold as a "puzzle" nor grouped in Amazon as the same toy.
summary: two different toys under the same title

reviewText: My first review of this product garnered 1 star.  However, though not top of the line quality, I've purchased these pads 3 more times because of acceptable quality and money savings. Keep in mind, my dog is a 15-lb, seizure med filled urine maker. Not much output, but many times a day.  Worth the $.

Sometimes my Doberman has an unpleasant odor for reasons I cannot determine. He is mostly indoors except when going for his daily walk or some type of ball chasing exercise or to go potty etc. But, exercise or not, sometimes he just smells bad although most times he does not. I have used the Citrus Magic brand for other purposes with success and decided to give the Pet Odor Eliminator a try. Glad I did. It works well. The scent is mild and pleasant and the odor is no longer noticeable. Should have bought this a long time ago but "better late than never". This is an "add-on" item so comes at a bargain price giving you more "bang for the buck", to use another worn-out cliché. Sorry. No more.This works for me and I give it a high recommendation.

I bought the extra large size because the packaging indicated they would be big enough to fit a Great Dane. The boots themselves fit well enough on his big paws, but the top of the boot is very tight on his paws and I worry about them cutting off circulation. I probably wont be using them because of that.
summary: Not quite big enough for a Great Dane

reviewText: Virbac is an excellent ear cleaner for cats and dogs.  I have seen it for sale at vet offices, so I know it is dependable.
I thought it was suppose to be extra strong but my vizsla still broke it into pieces. disappointed. k k

I got this for my dog because she seemed to be licking "herself" more than usual. I wasn't sure if this was an early sign of a UTI or just some sort of irritation. I've been giving her the recommended dose for her size (2 a day) to her for a few weeks now and have seen vast improvements. She now barely licks herself and it has seemed to help her with less accidents in the house. She also seems to like the taste and will take them as a treat for going potty outside first thing in the morning.

My german shepard loves this he gets great exercise  and is very focused when we play with him. If you have a large dog but not all day to exercize him a 20 minute play  a couple times a day with this toy is awesome

I have been looking for a good dog treat jar to hold my dog's milk bone treats in rather than just keeping them in the box and taking them out of there. This jar was very reasonably priced and was a good size--not too big or too small for what I was looking for. The suction on my jar seems to work fine and the mechanism that opens/locks the jar works fine as well. I have not tried to wash it yet to see if the designs would go away, but I don't plan on washing it as this is for dry dog treats and won't need to be washed. I have already received a few compliments from friends/family on how nice it is. I'd recommend it for medium to large sized dogs. This jar is probably too big for smaller dogs. The price was very reasonable for the product.

I have a small American Pit Bull Terrier who pulls heavily.  I have tried many anti-pull harnesses and head collars.  The best seems to be the new version of the halti, but she still pulls.  This new version of the Sporn did not work at all.

I would highly recommend this harness to anyone working in Nose Work, Tracking, or SAR....Good quality, my girl seems to like it, and no itching problems from the fit.I would suggest ordering one size up, if your dog's girth measurement is borderline...
These hoops are a good treat for our little ferret she will take one and run and hide to eat it so you cant take it away from her

This stuff does as it says.  My dog sheds way less now (not totally gone) and her coat is much more silky and soft.  The issue I have with it and reason I gave it only three stars is that the I had to send the stuff back three times to get a product that didn't dome open during shipment.  They send this stuff via air and the seals and lids do not protect against the super low air pressure and freezing at higher altitudes, thus, open containers and an oily mess when opening.  As I said the product itself works, but if you get this DEMAND GROUND SHIPPING or your gonna have a mess when it arrives.

This is the fifth pet door I've purchased and installed from PetSafe.  I like it's design the best with the single flap and a long magnet along the bottom.  As with the other five I find it best to replace the nylon bolts with metal, but I do use the provided t-nuts.  The dog doors work.  The dogs haven't registered a complaint.

reviewerName: Doreen B. Bishop "Doreen Bishop cat parent"
reviewText: My indoor cat loves FANCY FEAST better than everything we tried. The cans are a purrrfect size and offer enough choices that she never gets tired of it. Thanks amazon for the great sales you offer.When the cats were getting sick awhile back on some of the cat foods, mine didn't, that ment alot to me :-)

Step one, put harness on dog. Step two, dog stops pulling. Magic.Note: I watched the video on their website twice to make sure I was putting it on correctly. I can see how other customers might put it on incorrectly.Pro tip: When putting it on your dog, make sure the "Yuppie Puppie" text is facing you in the right direction and you'll never go wrong.

This is actually the second time we're purchasing this door.  We had the first one for about a year and a half before the flap broke to the point that duct tape wouldn't even fix it.  We were going to just replace the flap, but the flap alone was about the same price as the whole unit.  In addition to the flap tearing, it doesn't fit all that snugly, there's a good sized gap on each side of the flap, so the cold air comes in quite a bit.  It's very cold in my kitchen as a result.  We would have purchased something different, but couldn't cut the whole any larger in my door, and couldn't find anything else that would fit the whole well, so we're stuck until we can replace the whole back door.
summary: Flap breaks and doesn't fit very snugly, letting cold air in.

reviewText: My Vet originally recommended these doggie probiotics for occasional use with my Pom who has a very sensitive stomach and sometimes has loose stools.  They appear to work very well.  I get them on Amazon for less than the Vet charges.

I have two dogs. One of them is really smart, and she took right to this thing. She LOVES it and gets so excited whenever I pick it up to go fill it. She spends about forty minutes pushing it around the house. Since this ball is made of rubber, it's a lot quieter than a lot of similar products. All that being said, my other dog, bless her heart (she's very loving and cute), couldn't figure out the ball. She just sits and stares at it, or maybe sniffs it. For the life of me, I can't get her to push it around. However, that's not incredibly surprising. She's always been a bit on the umm... not so bright side.
summary: Awesome for average/smart dogs. Not good for dumb-as-bricks ones.

reviewText: I've posted this product on Facebook (photo of my Briard wearing a red one) & got questions from breeders all over Europe asking where it can be purchased.Simple truth is that it works, unlike most raingear for dogs.It is lightweight, well priced, comes in a useful carrying pack (not like most of the useless carrying packs that are included with various products).The dogs like it & don't try to tear it off. It does not mat or tangle the 12 - 18" long hair on my Briards.The way it is made is well thought out: wide band under tummy secured by velcro so it fits many girths. Band connecting sides made in a way where fabric goes straight down to protect more hair than if the sides were tucked under the body (hard to describe but this is an excellent design point). Well made opening for leash to connect to collar.Hood is rather silly but it clumps up around the neck and keeps rain from going in there. No dog that I know will wear a hood…No problem with male dog urinating when wearing it.Absolutely no reason NOT to buy this for your dog, for a friends dog, or for any dog.
summary: GREAT product. Actually works well. Buy it now.

reviewText: My Rabbit loves it, and this is one of the few products that I found that has no alfalfa hay in it

I thought I was ordering the same bags I had received previously through Amazon.  The photo, price and description matched, but the product received does not.  These bags are very pale blue, nearly transparent, and the same weight as the produce bags at the grocery store.  I tore a hole in the bag just trying to get the sticker off to start the roll.  I would have returned them, but the time and cost of doing so deterred.  I needed the bags now so have been using them, but so frustrating I will throw them away as soon as I can get good ones.  The only reason I gave two stars is that you can actually put poop in them.

The Pet Naturals of Vermont Breath Bites Stick was an overall disappointment.  They smell gross, but the dogs jump for joy when they smell them.  I don't notice any breath changes.  I think that they eat them too fast for them to have any effect.  I have two cocker spaniels and a jack Russell terrier and the serving size is good for them, but the breath bites are more like your average treats in performance.  They gobble them up which makes me think that they are way too soft to do any teeth cleaning.  For the price I expected more.  I think I will be sticking to Greenies.

These tags were a great value.  We just got a new dog and needed the tag.  Had been to Petco, Wal-Mart, looked online and this was by far the best price.  The tag came today and it is easy to read, stands out in the red color and just a great size!!  Thank you so much!!!

This is the cutest thing ever! I love my scoopy the cat sitting next to my cats litter box. The scooper is however, a little hard to get smaller chunks with since the grid design is pretty wide, but all in all I enjoy it.
summary: Cutest way to hide your pooper scooper

reviewText: I like it, good flow, good price,good looks, quiet. Probably not  1050gph.. But close enough, I use this on a 75g (48x18x21). Kinda want another.

good thing the filling is human safe bc one dog immediately chewed on it and the filling oozed out first thing. pretty awesome. really useful since my dogs have heavy coats and love to lay on concrete. i put this on the floor and it keeps them cleaner and cool. since it's on concrete it will recharge .  isn't super cooling but good in conjunction with a/c  unit during summer. still using it now it's cold. dogs have heavy coats they are hot all the time.
summary: 1 dog logs it 1 dog tried to eat it

reviewText: My husband and I have two cats who sadly failed at toilet training (Citi Kitty, we tried!!) so the next best litter scenario was to build them a confined cat litter box room where our linen closet used to be.  In an effort to save the hardwood base of the closet, we put the litter catcher mat down (we bought it because it fit the area exactly).  It's been awesome.  Every couple weeks we take it out to shake out outside, and it does a decent job of cleaning litter off our cats' feet before they leave the room.  Also, we've been lucky that so far neither cat has had any accidents outside the box, but if (and probably when) they do, it's nice to know that there's a mat protecting our floors.
This toy was heavy, really heavy.  I'm surprised that my dog was able to pick it up and carry it around. He chewed this to bits. First he removed the squeaker, then just turned it into chunks.

the world stops spinning. My other cats stand still, transfixed as her Supreme Hugeness (Medium Length fur, gets brushed every day), sounding like a wailing sump pump, dramatically tries to bring one up.When Sweet Cee Cee (loong hair, gets brushed with a wide tooth comb every day) brings up a hairball, she sings....the same way she sings when she is bringing me a toy. I never know what's going on until I look...on the flooor....So, these nice little fishie-shaped "Vetri-Science Laboratories Feline Furball Plus Hairball Remedy Chews for Cats" with (among other ingredients) salmon oil, flax seed oil, and papain -- all of which surely are great for helping things along in the intestine --  may be their salvation. Or at the very least, they might be something tasty and nutritious for them to chew on. (As the description on Amazon states: the "formula includes Psyllium, a soluble fiber that supports G.I. tract health and function and Papain, an enzyme from papaya that helps break down the mucus that holds the hairball together. It actually helps to break up the matrix of the hairball."  We shall see.....So this may be tasty but it is more of a pharmaceutical than a treat and the recommended "dose" is one per day so don't over-do it or.... perhaps the runs may be incurred?It doesn't matter to me when I feed this Hariball Remedy Chew to them -- before, or after a meal.So, time will tell if there is less wailing and histrionics or more singing to toys only, but in the meanwhile, these tasty (I confess, I bit off a fishie tail and ate it -- sweet, gooey in a nice way, and slightly crunchy)treats are eagerly accepted by my sometimes-finicky cats.
summary: When Big Bad Baby Twinkle hawks a hairball......

reviewText: When I bought it, I thought it was over-priced. When I touched it (I'm blind) I couldn't believe it, a bent piece of metal. Nothing special. I attached a very very very light-weight bell to it. Worked for a year. Then, for no reason, a piece broke off as my dog was walking and the bell fell off. Being blind, I think it is obvious why I need a bell on my goldendoodle. I have slide tags on her collar, so the only thing hanging was the bell on the Rubit. Luckily, this happened in the house. If I had put tags on it as they want us to, and I had been outside, all my tags would have been lost. Now the bell is attached with a zip tie. Any other suggestions?
summary: Works Like A Charm Until It Breaks!

reviewText: I recently acquired a corn snake and wanted a couple thermometers to make sure I was heating him properly. I put one in the hot side and one in the cool side. They seem pretty accurate.They are a great size, easy to read, easy to stick, and they stay. As my reptile collection expands, I will be buying more of these!
I have 2 sets of these that I rotate, wash, and reuse. This works out great for me. If you use filter socks I recommend them.
My 3 cats always like Fancy Feast products. I do mix in cooked chicken and AvoDerm wet foods as well.
summary: Fancy Feast Gorment Cat Food. Grilled Seafood Variety Pack

reviewText: This seat will require you to put holes.. or apply tape that will damage your paint.  The frame is plastic and so are the "legs".  I am not sure this will be very sturdy.  I was looking for something that would be "removable" when I didn't want to leave it in the window.. and this will not do that.  Guess I will keep putting the chair by the window instead.

This is much better than my Aquatic Gardens pump that died after a couple years. However, keep in mind that this has 2 outlets that have to be connected to air tubes. IF YOU LEAVE ONE OUTLET DISCONNECTED, THE UNIT IS EXTREMELY LOUD. I don't believe there is a way to turn one side off. Otherwise, pretty quiet. If you only have one bubble bar, maybe a good idea to get a pump with one outlet....just don't buy an Aquatic Gardens.

Product probably does what it is supposed to do but wasn't my cats issue. I purchased hoping it would help IBS in my cat but found I had to change her food entirely and add lysine to her daily diet to clear up her condition. Not the manufacturers fault as Purina makes great products.

My cats enjoy this cat tree. It is somewhat wobbly if you have heavier cats but; still pretty sturdy. You are getting what you pay for. I would not pay more than $100 for it. The directions were easy to follow so must of improved them from some of the other reviews. I would recommend this to anyone whom has cats that like to climb or just be up high. The shipping was fast even around Christmas and the box was in great shape. I had no issues.
My dog comes running , this the first time I have gotten my dog to eat any dry dog food in her 8 years of life . she loves it and her digestive tract has never been better.

Very bright and attracts attention... while it works. Stopped working in about 2 weeks of daily use (about an hour a day). My dog plays a lot, which includes a lot of wrestling with other dogs, and I would assume that a dog collar would be able to stand up to that. Wrong. The button is so easily pressed that the collar turned on and off several times in one wrestling session. After about a week, the diodes started to turn off, one by one, until they were all off. I figured that it was probably just cheap batteries and replaced it, still doesn't work. Only one light, the one closest to the button, lights up now. Complete waste of my money.

It's hard to see where the perforations are on these bags and if you've got a dog pulling on the leash while you're trying to get a fresh bag it's really annoying.  The last order of bags I bought (also from Amazon) had a black line next to the perforation which expedited getting them out quickly and also showed that the open end of the bag was at the opposite end. I got smart and now I get two bags out, fluff them open and put them in my pocket before I leash up my two dogs.
amazing deal for this many bags!  not much more to say. if you walk your dog and have to clean up after him...this is the deal for you.
summary: amazing deal for this many bags!  not much more to say.

reviewText: I bought this based on the high reviews - and the concept.  It seems like this is what I needed.  It was easy to put together.  My kitties took a few days to get used to it - but did use it afer awhile so that was not the issue.  It worked well the first few days - but basically stopped working after about a week.  The poop and pee-balls didn't go into the tray and stayed in the main litter compartment. The little drawer-tray filled with clean litter intead.  So I ended up removing the pieces and using it as a regular litter box.  So . . .  don't waste your money!

Just got my dog's new tag and it's great! I love that it attaches to the collar with strong velcro so there is no jump ring to get caught on things. I also like the fact that there isn't any jingling noise when my dog runs around crazy or gets into a random itching fit. Lets see how long it takes the cats to figure out that the dog "early warning system" is no longer in effect since we have this new quiet tag. :)
If you hate scooping like I do this is an awesome box to get. You simply roll it over, pull out the tray, and done!!  It's keeping litter off the floor and ground and is so awesome I had to buy two

We have used these Nutri-Vet K-9 chewable aspirin for several years with several dogs for a variety of reasons. I've never had a dog refuse to take them right out of the bottle nor have we ever had a dog have a bad reaction to these. We have a large pack of dogs ranging in age from 6 years to 12 years old and they are very active - constantly wrestling & playing or chasing squirrels and shadows all over the yard. That means there are going to be days when a dog (or two) is either feeling his age with some arthritis aches or has just overdone with the running & jumping. Our vet has given his stamp of approval for two of these with food as needed and they always help our hounds. We have large breed dogs - Rhodesian Ridgebacks & a Walker Coon Hound, not sure how effective or what dose would be good with small breeds, but 2 tablets for a 70lb to 90lb dog seems just right.

Hands down this is the best litter box ever. No moving parts to break, no plastic shopping bags, scoops and considerably more affordable than the automatic alternatives. I look forward to cleaning the cat box now. Cleaning the cat box has never been easier.

I've bought many poop bags in the past and so far these are my favorite. The thickness is good, size is perfect for my Lab's...leavings.Buying in bulk is awesome. They're way cheaper than buying a few rolls at a time and I never run out. Let's face it, dogs poop a lot and they're not going to stop! Be responsible and pick up after them.

I have a 100+ pound wolf hybrid and two 80+ pound Labs.  The labs are big cheweres, they can destroy a stuffed squeeky toy in less than 5 minutes, a rope in several hours, tennis balls in 15 minutes, and those rugged soft toys the ones with a canvas shell in 3 hours.  I bought these on the chance they may last longer and they last us about 6 months before they finally chewed through the ring. I think the price is right and they love these rings.
summary: Big dog, big chewer, no problem

reviewText: This product is the best for dogs showing signs of stiffness, arthritis, or just plain aging pains!  Highly recommend starting this when dog reaches age 7 (senior) even if they haven't shown signs of slowing down.  A MUST for any large dog.
summary: Any dog 7 and older should be on this BEFORE they show signs of arthritis!

reviewText: My cockapoo broke the spout off of the last water bottle so I was a little worried when purchasing this one.  The old bottle was from Petsmart and a different brand.  This bottle is pleasing to the eye and has stood the test of time.  I would highly recommend it.

I LOVE this product I think it is the best one from Natures Miracle. I have a white carpet and it gets out the yellow pee stains (Even ones that had been there a while!) my carpet looks new. I told my mother-in-law about it and she was skeptical until we tried it on her carpet old pee stains she couldn't get out and ta daa...they came out! The product has a lovely fresh smell too.I will be buying this from now on.
Definitely cheaper than buying it at the pet store, especially with Prime. Mixed with Flourite and my plants have exploded with growth.
summary: Great substrate when paired w/ Flourite

reviewText: My dog likes the kong, but at this point it is just the kong; no rope.  He shredded the rope in the first hour of playing with it.  It would be nice if the rope were more durable.  There are ropes out there that my dog can't destroy, this was NOT one of them.
summary: The Kong is Great- The Rope is Not

reviewText: This is the first covered litter box our cats have willingly used.  I do wish that the spacing in the screen was a bit smaller and that the cats weren't able to push the scoop out.  I don't think either are annoying enough to prevent me from purchasing another in the future.UPDATE 02/08/13I have replaced this box with two other boxes due to an issue with my cats kicking litter out of the entry opening.  I left the rating because not everyone has cats that do this.  I had hoped that the size and high sides would prevent them from doing it, but I actually think that they started trying harder to kick the litter out.

These are well made. I ordered 2 but miscalculated the size and thought they would fit on a 20 long. I use 6500k CFL bulbs in then and they work awesome. I've been tempted to try some of the high powered LED lights.. May try that when it's time for a bulb change.

The Avant Garde Retractable leash is made in China and seems to be a perfectly adequate leash.  If color is important to you, then you'll like that the company makes this in a variety of colors and patterns.  And this model features the rope-style (and not flat line) leash.  I don't personally have a preference -- my other leash is flat and German made -- but I know some people prefer this style.Now theoretically retractable leashes should be used in training dogs to come-when-called or other similar activities.  But we all know people who use them just to walk their dog.  I use this type of leash like that, to give my pup some room to stop and sniff for a second on our longer walks.  (I know she's supposed to be at my side, but alas I'm a bad and indulgent fur-mom.)For this kind of walk the Small Avant Garde leash is fine.  And in fact it would be inappropriate for the other sort of training because it's only 9 feet long.  The other characteristics of this leash that you might want to know about before choosing is that the 'pull' is harder than on other leashes.  My own pup can sense when I'm walking on and we're nearing the end of the rope, as it were, but other dogs may not be as sensitive, so if you use a 'choke collar' you might like this leash because it gives it's signal more distinctively than some brands.  And let me clarify that it's not an outrageous pull or anything.  My little Jackabee weights 10 pounds and isn't tugged around or anything.  I'm talking about a subtle effect.The only negative I could find to mention is that the handle is really small.  And perhaps when the company designated the leash as 'small' they meant that it was for children and not adults.  The handle does fit my 9 year-old son's hand perfectly, while I can only get 3 of my mom-sized fingers inside the grip.There product's page says there is one year warranty which is nice given the price, but I don't remember seeing anyway of registering for it.  (If it is there and I somehow missed it, I'm sure someone will shortly put me to task.)A nice leash.Pam T~December 28th UPDATE:::  Darn if my pooch didn't gnaw through the lead.  I mean in one sitting while I wasn't looking.  I won't change the star rating -- basically because I don't have enough experience to make a comparison with other leads -- but thought I'd give you'all a heads-up warning.I'll also note that there is no way to open up the handle and 'fix' the torn lead :(

I have a Bengal that is super active and she catches this toy like the others, but holds onto it longer and doesn't want to release it.  My Mom's outdoor cat comes into the house to visit and even he can be engaged to play with this toy because it is so "bird like."
Fast shipping. Item just as described. These collars were bought for my 2 cocker spaniels. The large size fits perfect. Best quality collar I have had.
My 3 cats love these toys. Only problem the string is too thin and my big black cat keeps chewing through them.

It is lighter than the Deluxe XL (which I bought as well), and easy to move around. It has the scratchy surface that some dogs won't like, but my pup doesn't mind it and in fact, it helps when it is a bit slippery outside.
summary: Ramp works for short heights (think 3' or less)

reviewText: Like the other reviewers mentioned, this comes as a tube of toothpaste, a long skinny toothbrush with a small head, and a finger brush.  The toothpaste has a good scent and my cat was perplexed but enjoyed it.  Afterwards her breath was clean smelling.  The brush is not a kind that she likes (she prefers a longer bristle so she can chew on it) but it's definitely not bad for getting her back molars.. if I were in the mood to use two toothbrushes.
This bowel is perfect for traveling. Works really well. I keep it in my car for by boy b/c he likes to drink H20 a lot. I do recommend it.
summary: Your dog will love you for this!

reviewText: Overall this product is good - there are a few things I would warn someone about before purchasing but overall I am satisfied enough that I am purchasing another from the same manufacturer.One thing that has nothing to do with the product itself -  I am a little disappointed that I didn't go with the ceramic design, or at the very least the teardrop. When I had read the initial reviews I was weary that the raindrop design might be too light and it wasn't until months later when I actually saw it in the store that I found that wouldn't be the case. I am trying to "reclaim" my house from my adopted puppy a little (wooden crate, getting floors cleaned, etc) and replacing the big, stainless steel bowl (it's BIG!) in my living room would be helpful!A few thoughts on the bowl itself - First, I went with stainless because it seemed like overall it would be the safest purchase.
