(Ceramics have glazing on them, which can leech into the water)I noticed within a few days, however, that there is definitely some "muck" on the bottom of the fountain.While cleaning it is easy it does take a few minutes...and once I have dumped all of the water it seems pointless NOT to stop and clean it. So I suppose if you are using this with a single dog (like me) where they are not going to be drinking all of the water in the bowl I would recommend dumping the water once every few days to prevent that muck. Even with a brand new filter it didn't appear to help much.It also seems to me like the motor is almost too weak. I have taken it apart during cleanings several times to double-check that I have it on the highest setting because the amount of force pushing the water up the fountain is very little. It makes sense that there is "muck" on the bottom because the force of the pump isn't enough to actually circulate all the water. (Which I thought was the whole point of the fountain.....) Also, a word to the wise when I first tore open the box and tried putting it together I actually thought the pump was broken because I could hear it moving but there was no water coming up.I kept repositioning it (everything has to actually match up to work) it until it finally did pump hard enough to push the water all the way through. Perhaps it WAS actually broken or damaged and I didn't realize it - either way, it still works overall and my dog still drinks out of it. (Except when it's been sitting for too long without being replaced) I do use filtered water with it (which makes the whole process take longer since my water filter jug doesn't have the capacity of the fountain)Other than these mentioned items it's a good product - it's very sturdy (although the top piece could potentially be tipped over, but I think that could be said of most standard bowls) and holds a LOT of water. I suppose they mean it when they say "Big Max!" I finally decided to bite the bullet and replace this after a few months of use with the ceramic teardrop version. My dog seems to prefer ceramic anyway and she LIKES little bowls. (She's a boxer-rottie mix, a medium sized dog overall) who seems to not know her own size! I bought it used through Amazon because I couldn't cough up another $50 on this fountain.I'm hoping the ceramic teardrop design pleases me aesthetically more than t his one does! Hopefully I can sell this one used on EBay or something to try and recoup my losses. (Someone should have warned me that owning a dog isn't that expensive - but all the money I spend on PRODUCTS for the dog are!)
summary: Nice, Big Bowl (but too large for me) w/ Quiet Motor...w/ not enough force and a little muck on bottom of bowl

reviewText: I have a silky terrier & 2 pomeranians who love to bark at everything & I decided I needed to do something to get a handle on it. I did some research on items like this-knowing that they are not a 'magic bullet' solution, but a tool that could help-& this one had great reviews. I ordered it & what a difference it has made. I let them see it, say "No" & click it once-that's all it takes.....they quiet down immediately. After a couple of weeks now-all I have to do is say "No" in most cases, but sometimes I have to pick up it up, w/o clicking it & they stop. They definitely know what it is!I am very impressed with this little blue thing & am so glad I decided to take a chance.

I have a 55ish lb. Aussie who is extremely hyperactive and has to be secured in a vehicle, or she will end up in my lap within 2 minutes.I purchased this with limited expectations as it was less than $5 and most reviews are for small pets, although overwhelmingly positive.The adjustable length is perfect, and should be suitable for any size dog large or small. I was worried that the fastener would pop out  or the clasp would break off. My other concern not as big was the belt would slide to the longest length if the dog pulled on it, still a safety issue for the pup if something should happen.I've had this for several months now, and used nearly every weekend. And I have had absolutely zero issues with this belt. Dog is securely fastened, comfortable, and most importantly safe! I have no worries that this safety belt would fail. Buy it for you, buy it for your pet!
summary: At less than $5 this is a steal!!!

reviewText: The vet suggested I start cleaning the cat's teeth since there is tartar buildup. I bought this with that in mind.However my cat does not find this appetizing. She would sniff it and walk away. I tried putting this in her dry food but it gets completely ignored as well. On several occasions I actually find her batting it around with her paws like a toy.Two stars since this didn't work for me. Maybe other people would have better luck.
summary: Does not work on my cat, she ignores these

reviewText: This works great.  I have two digs that bark when people come in the house-  now i press the button and it shuts them right up.  Its to the point after a week i dont even use it anymore,  they either don't bark or they stop when they see me go to pick it up.  Very glad i bought it
summary: works as good as you could expect

reviewText: I got this ramp to use to help my 2 German Shepherds get in the tornado shelter.  It is strong enough to hold big dogs but the fact that it does not lock in place at the different lengths was a real problem for me.  It would slide while they were on it.  I had to rig it every time I changed the size so that it wouldn't move.  The surface was kind of like what you would find on a nail file.  My dogs didn't care for it but other dogs might not have a problem with it.  If they made this where it would lock in place then I would have given it 5 stars but for the price and the problems I had, I can only give it 3 stars.  Also, watch your fingers when using this.
The product was fantastic quality and a nice strong rubber.  I have a labradoodle puppy and the toy was way too small for his mouth.  Choking risk.
These are great treats for our dog. You can break them up and give them in small or large pieces.
My poodle loves them and I order them all the time, great product in my opinion...:O)I would recommend them.

My dogs LOVE these treats! They are tiny treats, but they work for big dogs, too. My big guy is 90 pounds and one of these is still a good reward for him. They are crunchy rather than chewy, which my dogs seem to prefer. The small size means that they don't get distracted with chewing up their treats during training. The cheddar smell is strong, and I imagine they taste very cheesy!
I plan to buy more of these as the neighbor dogs carry them off.  I placed one inside one of my husbands old socks and then knotted it.  This is my dog's favorite toy.  Buying more!

My cats won't even use the other 2 litter boxes they had been using before.  They have gone over and smelled them but haven't used them since. I bought this. The only reason I gave it a 4 star is because I have found that I do have to check to make sure some clumps were not stuck to the bottom periodically.  Otherwise, it is a five.

We bought this litterbox after carefully going over all the reviews and researching different types of boxes.  We have two male cats, one of whom has early stage urinary tract issues that we are trying to manage.  We were nervous about trying the box with him as he has associated litterboxes with pain, and we weren't sure if a new style of box would repel him.  We shouldn't have worried-- both cats took to the litterbox  just fine and actually use it more frequently than they did our previous litterbox.  For our cat with urinary problems, this is an added bonus since cats tend to develop urinary problems partly due to not using the box frequently enough.  They seem to like the privacy the cover provides.  It is easy to clean, and it cuts down tremendously on litter box odor and litter tracking.  Highly recommended product, worth every penny.

I have a Weimaraner puppy who loves balls he can get a little obsessive when he plays with them and he chews on them until they pop. It only takes him about a day to destroy them so they have to be a outside toy only. However I make an exception with this toy. He has had them for about 1 month now and it is holding up great. He likes to carry it around the house and squeak it. That is the one thing I don't like much. The squeaker is loud and high pitched. I have given the toy a timeout many times because my dog will squeak it for hours and it can grate on your nerves. The ball is easy to squeeze. I can squeeze this ball about 1/3 down with one hand. My dog can squeeze it till it is a 1/3 of the size. Keep in mind this thing squeaks. You can guess it is very loud when squeezed that far. Also because it is easy to squeeze dogs do not have to release it all the way so your dog can re squeek it before the first squeek is complete. Now keep this in mind if you are planning on getting one.The size is nice it is bigger then normal tennisballs about 3.5". This is nice because it is easy to see in his mouth. Also it does not fix under my couch. I can not stress how great this is. My dog gets balls stuck under the couch and then starts stressing over it. He will lay on the floor looking at the ball and bark for someone to get it out this can get very annoying. So large size is great.I have not had a problem with him chewing off the yellow part on this toy like some people said, but he has done this on other balls. I would recommend this toy for most dog owners it hold up better then regular tennis balls and doggy tennis balls.

Our 2yr old lab likes the ball at times only.  We need to throw it for him.  The ball is very sturdy and will last for some time. Our lab has more energy then we do, we can only throw it 5 or 6 times.

I would NEVER purchase from this company again was a rip off! I purchased a dog car seat and this was a option to purchase with it. The car seat was free shipping you would think if it gives the option to purchase with the seat it would be free. I paid 2.80 for the leash and was charged 9.99 shipping and you don't know what you pay shipping on till your invoice is emailed to you after you PAID! I contacted amazon about this and they did nothing and I will NEVER buy again from this company or amazon! Lost me as a customer! Scam!

I tested these out with my very small mini dachshund.  They didn't work out very well.  While the size was big enough, the absorbent material was rather thin.  These would protect your floor very well from the accidents of perhaps a hamster or a gerbil.  If your puppy/dog weighs over 5 pounds, do not expect anything except a wet mess when you arrive home.  I gave it 2 stars instead of one, because it would probably work pretty well for something tiny.  (Smaller than the average grown rabbit that you see in your yard).  Packaging was nice, and the pads do hold together, even when wet on both sides.
Our 2 Bostons just ignore it and still chew, i will just have to face the fact that we have to just buy our time and the one goofy one will grow up.  soon i hope.
summary: Does not work for our dogs

reviewText: I received a used toy! It was scratched, cracked and very obviously far from being new. I actually don't know if my cats would have enjoyed the toy, or not. Unfortunately, just the smell of the toy, having already been "broken in" by other kitties, kept them from even trying out the toy. After the first smell, they never went near it again. In short, this was a very disappointing purchase. Wrapping a used item in new packaging does not make it new!(I did return the toy, and I immediately received an instant refund. I had absolutely no problems with the return process.)
summary: If I could give it a zero star rating, I would.

reviewText: I have 3  very "fussy" cats and they absolutely love this cat food.  No additives or preservatives and I am a very "fussy" owner so on all counts this is the best food I have found that is both health and one they love !

My dog is pretty picky when it comes to his treats and food. He has skin allergies and these natural treats are great. My mother in law gave me a bag for him around Christmas last year. I wasnt sure that he would go for them, but he did. =) I have been ordering them ever since. Product came as described and quickly shipped. Worth the money for my baby to have natural treats that are tasty and do not irritate his skin. Thanks.

Seriously?? By whose standards??Since when are wheat starch, glycerin, cellulose, potato starch, bacon flavor (?what does this mean?) healthy?I bought this thinking it would last a few hours or days but my dog just gobbled it up in minutes.I love the nylabone chew products but I don't recommend these unless you have very large dogs that can eat them as treats.
summary: Yes, it is edible but healthy??

reviewText: Cute toy at a good price.  My dog doesn't really like pulling the toys out of these, so I give him an incentive.  I put treats inside WITH the chicks.  For the treats, he'll keep working at it until he gets them all.  Now I just buy the refill chicks which are basically balls.  He likes playing ball in the house so I use these, and kyjen eggs as balls.

Have an 15 year old Queensland male dog.  He started to develop some leaking problems.  Tried this with Vetri Science Labs, Bladder strength tabs for dogs.  Even ordered more Leaks no more so we could give it a months try.  Gave up and used an over the counter antihistamine which worked within a few days.
This was exactly what I needed for my tank. Picks up all the waste at the bottom of my tank without sucking up any of the gravel itself. Siphons fairly quickly.

We have a new puppy and since we already had this for our cat (who is now older and not a problem), we thought to try it on places we didn't want the dog scratching or digging.  It worked just fine!  There are dog ones on the market, too, but this seemed to work fine for us and if it is safe for cats, we assume it is safe for dogs.
summary: Can be used for dogs, too!

reviewText: When I was in the store buying this, someone stopped by and mentioned that it was loud.  I was more concerned with not having to fill it every day like I did with the small Petmate version.It is definately large enough.  I fill the water every 4 days now instead of every day. reviewText: I gave it 2 stars because it doesn't lie: it repels cats. Unfortunately, after only a few sprays I had to open all the doors and windows, light a candle, burn incense and hope I wouldn't throw up. My cats hid under the bed. I tried to find a reason to leave the house. It was almost comical. At least it was only 5 bucks.

Picked up a few items made by Tropiclean. This foam, the teeth gel, the chews and the water additive. My chihuahua mix has a lot of plague build up on front left and right canine teeth. It has caused his breath to smell very badly. Unfortunately he has a heart mummer so we can't put him to sleep to have his teeth cleaned, so we have tried all sorts of different gels, liquid, toothpastes, chews etc.Unfortunately spraying this stuff in a chihuahua mouth is very difficult, the few times I did get it in, he gagged.  It smells nice, but if it works(or doesn't work as the case may be) like the previous 3 products from Tropiclean I purchased then I highly doubt this works either.On a side note, when I got the box with all my Tropiclean products, this bottle was leaking, but that may have just been a bad packaging job by Amazon.
summary: Can't accurately say if it works, but smells nice

reviewText: She likes these very much.  I like them because they helped clear up a yeast infection the puppy had.  Plus, helps her digestive track.
the filters i received fit perfectly and do the job they are suppose to do by filtering the water in animals drink fountain
I have an older dog who I am trying to be sure to give healthy treats.  This is one of three of her favorites.

This brush is such a radical improvement on our previous cat brush that I can't praise it enough. We have a long haired cat, and with our previous cat brush, I was always frustrated that, despite frequent grooming and use of hairball remedies, our cat was always throwing up hairballs, and the house was covered with cat hair. The brush wasn't getting down deep enough, and the bristles just wouldn't trap the hair. Despite being marketed as a "cat brush," it was more like a regular hairbrush. Cleaning the brush was also a struggle; we would have to use a comb to try to rake the hair out of it, never very successfully. So it was always clogged, reducing its effectiveness even more.This brush by Four Paws has rows of thin, sharp filaments with a bend in the end which helps trap the hair in the brush. It looks sharp and painful, but trust me, it isn't. Our cat loves it, and will actually roll around in different positions to be sure we don't miss a spot! I am stunned how much cat hair this brush removes with each use-- literally a handful every time. It glides effortlessly through her thick fur with never a snarl or snag, getting deep down where our other brush never reached. And the brush is very easy to clean; the hair virtually lifts right off the brush in a little mat that you just throw away and, voila, clean brush.Brushing our cat has become a pleasure. Our home is cleaner, and she has fewer fur balls. You will love this brush!

Not much to say really, this food is quality and does the wonders for kittens. i got this food 2nd time for the 2nd kitten i found 2,5 yrs apart from each other. same quality , nothing has changed . keep up the good work KMR  :o)
Our dog loves this trail mix and tries to manipulate us whenever we go near the kitchen treat jar. I appreciate the ingredients being all natural. I would highly recommend this product.

This item holds a 30lb dog food bag nearly perfectly. We chop the top off the dog food bag and slid it into the unit. When we get to the bottom we just toss the bag. We have four dogs so anything that makes feeding less of a chore is a big win and this certainly does that. We simply wheel it from the pantry to the counter and back again.
My cat Ichigo was in desperate need of a new collar and this is so freaking cute and it fits like a glove. I absolutely adore it. If you're looking for something cute and durable, totally get this.
i got this for my 60 Gal freshwater tank. I have a filter in it like normal but this bio filter helps too. the shrimp love it.

I'm guessing I could fit 2 large bags of food in here.  The lid is easy to open but closes tight enough that my dog can't push her way inside - though she is not one who knows how to open latches so YMMV.I'm giving this 4 stars instead of 5 because of the price.  And I think the price is in part due to the wheels.  I don't use the wheels.  I can't think of any reason anyone would want to be able to push their container of dog food around on wheels.  I've seen comments on how great the wheels are.  What exactly are these people doing?  It seems really strange to me.  Put the container in a corner, fill it up with food, and take the bowl over to it when you want to fill it.  Is that hard?  What happens when your dog figures out that if you push the container, it rolls around?  I want my dog to eat her food, not play with the container.I would have preferred a less expensive option that did not include the wheels that I threw out unopened.  Still, as a container it's great.
summary: Fits a LOT; what is the point of the wheels?

reviewText: First of all, it doesn't come in a big tub like the picture shows, but the weight seems to be the same. The large ones are definitely large...I purchased the smaller ones the first time around, and they're actually easier to use in my dog's Kong and Kong bone. I break the larger ones into pieces. I'll probably get the smaller size next time.I have a very active border collie, so this is in the "preventative" category. I hope it works!
It says every 2-4 week but is there a sign??? I have no idea so every 6 or so weeks I change them. I guess they make a difference although I cant really verify that.
summary: I dont know when I am supposed to change these out

reviewText: We have a Yellow Lab puppy and he's a BIG chewer.  We found out about this stuff from the dogs trainer.  It works for many puppies/dogs, but not all.There is no odor given off.  HOWEVER, BUY A NEW DIFFUSER EVER COUPLE MONTHS OR YOU'LL SEE THE CHEWING RESTART.  I'm not sure why.My husband was very skeptical about buying this, but now he's a believer.

LOVE THE PRODUCT KEEPS THE DOG FOOD FRESH AND DON'T HAVE TO HAVE A BAG LYING AROUND LOOKS NICE

reviewText: My dog loves this sucker.  This is my fourth "Tuffy" toy and my favorite.  The arms are stiff, and can be used to wrestle with my Blue Heeler.  She will pick this guy up and play with him extremely roughly, and while he's torn a bit, he's holding up extremely well.My dog eats raw bones.  Literally just chews beef ribs and swallows them like they are butter.  I wish I was exaggerating.  She is ridiculously destructive on her toys.  Tuffy's simply are the only toys that last more than a few minutes with her.  They are a tremendously good value if your dog tears toys up before you've even thrown away the receipt.They don't last forever with dogs like this, but they last weeks or even months.  And if your dog is at all civilized about her horseplay, you will never have to throw this away.This also fits perfectly over the headrest of my car, creating the appearance of a demonic alien behind the wheel, and is ideal for startling the children and elderly.

I could only fit about 22 pounds of dog food in the 33 quart size without the bag. Different kibbles weigh differently so just keep that in mind when ordering so you can get the right size. I can fit a 15 pound bag of taste of the wild in easily, but the 30 pound bag was too big even though i had already poured about 1/4 of the bag out.
These are very good dog treats, enjoyed by all.  My doberman absolutely loves them and cannot get enough.  Highly recommend.
This stand is nice for two reason......looks attractive......don't need to pick up the bowls to clean up underneath.....convenience is important.

Quiet dog dishes of a moderate-gauge stainless steel...these are not the dishes you'll have dreamed of and recalled from your childhood...you remember, your father's multi-purpose gun-dog who was the ultmaye family dog, protector and provider...? You, the child filled that heavy, no-tip bowl every night with a gaines burger and some table scraps...these are not that....but, they are quiet, easily sanitised and the rubber silencer is affixed, it is not a gasket which will be removed by your dog in the first 30 seconds...
This is a must have product whether you have one cat or twenty!  It cleans up every aspect of kitty mistakes.  Now that I have it, I don't know how I managed without it!!

I am a foster parent and I used this to bathe 5 kitties (you can use the same preparation for all 5 kitties at a time )  and it worked wonders. Ringworm is very difficult to remove and after 5 baths they already started showing hari growth - clinical sign for recovery.Thank you for the product!We are satisified!

I received this collar in the mail yesterday and am currently using it primarily on my four-year-old, approximately seventy-five pound Boxer.  He has never had terrible leash manners or any significant dominance issues, but as I've recently brought in a German Shepherd pup to my house, I've decided it was time to crack down and remove all of the remaining minor dominant tendencies from him so he sets a proper example for the growing puppy.I took my Boxer on his first walk with the Illusion collar last night and was almost instantly convinced that it will be a great help.  My Boxer was completely unable to tug on his leash even when we passed other dogs (which is usually the point that he gets a bit excited and wants to meet them).  After about five minutes, he was walking properly (ears back, head down a bit) most of the time.By the end of the walk, he wasn't even raising his head much when we passed other people.  When he did, I issues a quick tug and correction, and he resumed the submissive position.  It was pretty amazing how easy it was to correct him with this collar opposed to any others he's ever worn.To be fair, this collar isn't some high tech piece of technology.  You still have to be assertive to your dog and offer tugs and corrections when he does something he shouldn't.  This collar simply makes it significantly easier to control a large dog and offer corrections that actually get through to him.The only downside to this collar is that it is pretty overpriced for what you get (hence the four stars).  All it is is a couple of adjustible straps that hold up the actual collar portion of the thing.  It probably costs less than two bucks to make and they're charging fifty.  Twenty-five to thirty bucks would be a much more reasonable price for this collar.Still, it works and it works well, so it's hard to complain about too much.  I'll definitely be buying a second one for my Shepherd when he's big enough and has a strong enough neck to wear it.

I was iffy on buying this product because I didn't want to spend that much on a "big tupperware container,"  but it has proven to be worth every penny.  We have 2 large dogs so we wanted a dog food container that would hold a very large quantity of dog food (about 35 lb.) and keep it sealed from little critters so we could store it in the garage.  This does all that, plus it's very sturdy.  We recently moved to another state and I was almost expecting it to break in the process, but I was glad to be wrong.  We had to get the container out when we'd get to hotels and then load it back up for travel.  This held up without any cracks or breaks...or really any sign of wear at all.  Plus, the casters are great so you can store it under a table or something and pull it out easily even when it's full.
summary: Big and Sturdy, Worth the price

reviewText: There are an awesome thing to buy for your pets. No more awkward posistion for your pets to eat and drink. Very good and well made bowls and stands. A+++++++++++
Put it on a 3 gallon Betta tank. Threw the filter that came with the tank in the trash. Super quite and not enough flow to bother my betta. Keeps the tank sparkling clean.

For a collar that as it turns out, you are NOT allowed to use for walking the dog and you're NOT allowed to leave on the dog for more than part of the day.... they sure make it difficult to put this collar on and off the dog.  Why put a buckle on it?  Why not velcro or quick-release?  I HATE using this collar because here is my schedule:1) Wake up and take deog for walk.2) Come back and remove walking collar and fuss around with putting bark collar on.3) Afternoon:  Remove bark collar and put walking collar on.4) Come back and remove walking collar and fuss around with putting bark collar on.5) Evening:  Remove bark collar and put walking collar on.6) Come back and remove walking collar and fuss around with putting bark collar on.9) Night:  Remove bark collar and put walking collar on so dog can sleep safely overnight.Okay, that's eight times (or more) each day that I have to remove or put on this collar.  They REALLY needed to put a quick-release buckle on this thing.Oh, and it randomly turns itself off and I won't realize until the dog is already outside and barking.  So I have to round up the dog and fuss around with turning the collar back on.
We used this for our rabbits (found a new home for them) and we use it for our caged bird. Helps with odor and works well.

I have an older dog who has started to have the occasional accident if I don't let him out immediately when he gives the sign. This stuff worked very well and took away most of the odor immediately!It's a little pricey but I like the fact that you can save what is left in the bottle for months.  Of course, I haven't tested this, so I may change my rating if it doesn't.  Don't want to recommend it yet.

I thought I'd give this product a try because a TV personality recommended it as best for removing pet stains and odors. I did not have much in the way of success using it on pet stains and odors in my home.
summary: not much success at my house

reviewText: This is adorable, its basically a green boa with a squeaker head and googly eyes. It's longer than I expected, I'd say about a 12 inches total, definitely light weight. It seems to be an instant hit. Can't beat feathers, a squeaker and a long stringy toy. I can imagine I'll be re-ordering this once she destroys it.

I absolutely love this toy, but not as a chew toy. As a chew toy, this kong ring does NOT live up to the durability of the kong name. The squeaking function and toy itself can be destroyed in a matter of hours (or even less) if your dog really goes at it.The reason I still love this toy, however, is that it is one of the most fun and unique toys to play fetch with! If you hold it perpendicular to how you would hold a frisbee and throw/roll it on the ground it bounces and rolls extremely far. Using this technique and really hurling it at the ground, I can make this toy go much further than a tennis ball. My lab absolutely loves to chase it because the toy bounces up with every little bump in the ground and it takes a little more strategy to fetch than a tennis ball.I have bought 2 of these (medium and large) because my lab loves to fetch it so much. Every time I take it to the dog park and start throwing it, people ask me what kind of toy it is and comment on how fun it looks. My dog carries it around and acts like he's the coolest kid on the playground.The first one lasted several months (I wouldn't let him lay down and just chew on it, it was for fetch only), and my second one lasted 2 months. The weak point in the toy are the two seams where the two halves of the donut fits together. This seam is held together with an adhesive that is prone to weakening in heat (don't leave it in the hot sun or in a hot car all day long). In fact the toy itself warps considerably when left in a hot car all day long. One of mine broke apart at the seam after a couple of weeks and I super glued it back together (this made it last another month and a half).I debated giving this less than 5 stars because it has some very obvious flaws, but I just couldn't because my lab loved it so much and for 10 bucks it was well worth it for me. I will be buying another one.The squeaking is loud until it stops working, which happened quickly on both of mine even though I only used it for fetch.
Perfect size for my cat and very nice and sturdy.  My cat likes it to hide in in the house too. I prop open the door and she goes in and out of it at will.
I bought both versions and my kitten enjoyed it when he was small but my older cats paws had a hard time fitting in the slit and now that my kitten is bigger he's also having a hard time with it.

I like the idea that it has different modes.  I use the one where it starts with a low correction and goes up as the dog continues to bark.I have a puppy who is very vocal.  He quickly learned not to bark when wearing the collar.  Hopefully over time he is less vocal and we can allow him to bark occasionally.The  unit is very easy to change modes and it stays charged for a long time.  The blinking led that indicates it is on is very bright in a dark room.
Nice bowl. Heavy enough so the the pooch doesn't slide it around. I would buy another when the need arises.

i bought this for my dog and he loves it, he sleeps in in all of the time and if i tell him i am gonna sit in it when he is not in it, he runs and lunges into it...a great buy and well worth the money.
Look like decent pads. But when i come home after a 12 hour workday, they leak through. will not order again.

Just please understand what you're getting and the potential downfalls of relying solely on a hydrometer.

That's 5 star in my book as long as its accurate when new  keep it clean with fresh water and look close for air bubbles ...i have had 4 Instant Ocean SeaTest Hydrometer that the counter weight fell out with no way to fix  and 3 instant ocean testers that didn't work at all  ThoseFishGeeks. comCounter weight falls out
No problems. I have not attached them to my dog's crate, however I don't think there will be any problems.

I have a pit bull at home that shed's quite a bit.  Since they have short hair I didn't think they need to be groomed but I googled it and saw that many people recommend this ZoomGroom brush.  So I ordered it and tried it yesterday.  My dog seems to enjoy it because she just laid down on her side and let me brush her and it did brush out some loose hair.  The unfortunate thing is that we left it on a table and my dogs got a hold of it and chewed it up the same day.  That was very disappointing but at least the price is good so it doesn't hurt that much.  I just reordered another one.I bought a smaller size one for my poms as well. reviewText: Working out great!Finding quality canned food with actual beef in it is hard.  This was a hit with our three giant Maine Coon cats, and the crude protein analysis is VERY good.
It's a great package.This will last me for months to come.I use this to filter my shrimp tank.Water is very clear.Even in the dirted planted tank.You can see everything in the tank.

I have tried using everything from clippers to files to cheaper grinder alternatives on our dogs and the same result... either I get hurt, they get hurt, or I cannot even get close enough to get to use them. I finally splurged on the Dremel Pet 7300 and couldn't be happier.  I have used it on all four of our pugs and our chihuahua with great success.  It comes with a small baggy full of replacement bands and it is more than powerful enough to grind down or just round off pesky nails.  The sound is nearly non-existent.  Our chihuahua is super sensitive to any strange sounds and he didn't even flinch while I used it.  I tried using it on our basset hound but unfortunately the bands are not aggressive enough for his giant talon-like nails.  I will have to find another alternative or different bands for his hard thick nails.  Overall, very pleased and satisfied.
summary: Great Tool for Medium and Small Dogs

reviewText: My dog loves these milk bones. Can not find them this long except here. Keeps my dog busy for at least a couple weeks. I have a Bishon that is a chewer. He has never chewed on my furniture but do not want to give him a reason.

Don't know how I got along with out it. Great product well made and sturdy will last a lifetime I'm sure. Most handy tool in my entire fish tool box. Used when transferring fish when getting new fish accustomed to my tanks parameters. I use this thing constantly for so many different reasons don't ever want to be without one.

This fountain is easy to take apart and easy to assemble. All the parts are dishwasher safe except the pump and the filter (of course). Also, the filter looks like you may be able to use aquarium filter media if you so desire, just find the right size and slip it into the plastic housing provided. It is virtually silent and doesn't make any splashing or gurgling sounds. I wish it didn't have the ugly logo on the front. Although I have not measured it, my dog seems to be drinking a significant amount more, I would estimate about 2x as much water. The reservoir is kind of small for him probably (he is 17 lbs) but very simple to refill, just pour water in the bowl. It has a fill line and everything so you don't mess up. I am pleased with this purchase and think it is a great deal compared to products like theDrinkwell Original Pet Fountain(though that one you can buy an extra reservoir attachment for that one, unlike this one) or the other pet fountains I considered.UPDATE: I've had this product stop working once and once sort of halfway stop working. Both times I disassembled the pump as per the directions (you can find them online but only 3 parts come off and they are very simple) and soaked the parts in vinegar for a few hours. Reassembled and it worked like new again. So if you have problems, make sure to clean the pump before tossing it.

So far, pretty good on keeping the neighbor's cat away.  I have heard him close by but then he seems to disappear which I hope is about the cat alarm "going off."  I'm using 3 of the devices, 2 in the back of our house and 1 by front door.  Having a cat spray your front door is totally disgusting.  It annoys me that neighbors think it's OK to let their cat run our neighborhood,  my 3 cats are totally indoors and happy.  The issue is I have two males and the neighborhood cat is also that.  Talking to the neighbors about the problem did not work but we think the CatStop is doing the trick.  I secure the device in a flower pot filled with dirt.  That way it's been easy to relocate as I find what works best.

I got this because I read that some cats are more likely to drink moving water then still water. My older cat didn't use it much, but he's not a big drinker. My new 4 month old kitten absolutely loves this though, and I think he's teaching my older cat to drink more. My kitten likes to rise up and drink from the top well most of the time, which is weird but cute. My only gripe is the the filters, which also buy here, are way too expensive. It's just plastic with carbon, so why is it so much? Nevertheless, he multiple levels of wells make this is a nice fountain and I would buy it again.
Our boston terrier kills all toys so far this one has lasted over 24 hours. Also if you use the Zukes training dog treats they fit right into the holes perfectly!

This is a nice fountain that gets very rarely clogged. I will need to turn the pump speed down a bit though, because on high I am completely refilling it at least once a day. We have 3 cats, and none of them are really big drinkers. It is nice that even if the water is low the top two pools are always full regardless of the reservoir level.

I have another folding kennel which is way better (link is at the end of this review). But it was just a bit too large for a tight space in my camper. So I bought this one. The construction is definitely cheaper and none of the door latches open / close easily. It's like they don't line up correctly. It's so bad that I have a separate clip that I use to secure the door instead of the one that comes built in. It is just too much work to try to get it latched or unlatched. Now we use it for our two small dogs while we are in the camper and so they are not trying to get out. However, I agree with other reviews that a dog with his mind set on getting out could probably do some damage! Especially since the doors don't close well. There are also larger spaces between the bars so that seems less secure to me, too.If you want a sturdy, well made crate, go with this one instead:B0002TKBUS
summary: Kept it only because the size was perfect for a tight space in my camper

reviewText: This is a great chew toy for my dog, its a little large for my puppy right now.  He is 5 months old and 25 lbs, but he still loves to try and chew on it and it hasnt splintered or chipped at all yet.  He isnt an aggressive chewer, more of just an habitual chewer.  Every day he sits down and chews on an one of his chew toys and he does like this bone.

it  is a bit flimsy and would recommend this for cats only. the only thing i didnt like is that in the picture it shows two locks on the door but when i got the product there was only one ):i use this for my kitten to sleep in, if i dont she would be jumping all over me and my husband and we would get no sleep haha all that matters is that it does its job !
The bag looked fresh and the hay was kinda soft still and very green. I received it very prompt and my bunny loves it! It lasts her about a month.
This works well on my little guy's room when I have to be away for more than an hour or so.  I like him to be hydrated and this is just right and it stays where I put it on the cage.
summary: Good for when you have to leave your pet in his room for more than a little while

reviewText: I bought this for my dog because the dog "carseat" that I had purchased made him nervous at quick stops.  I was hoping that the hammock would make him feel more secure and prevent him from flying forward at any quick stops.  So far it has done the job fine and was extremely easy to install.  I noticed that some reviews mention this product having a bad odor, which I haven't noticed at all.  Perhaps it was more of an issue with purchases before 2011.

This is a lot better than corn and wheat litters, but it has quite a strong unique smell which is especially strong the first day after a refill. I was quite happy with the products for several months, but eventually the smell got old and obnoxious. No, it doesn't smell like fresh wood, the kind you put in the fire place. It's more of chemically treated sawdust kind of smell. Just like the World's Best Litter smells nothing like fresh dry corn, but rather smells like chemically treated spoiled corn. And of course, both manufacturers claim their products are pure and free of chemicals. Well I trust my nose better.I switched to Walnut pellets and this is the best smelling natural litter I've seen. However unfortunately it doesn't break up from moist nearly as easy, which I guess might be a plus for some people.One last thing, if you are new to pellet litter, this is to be used with a sifting tray only. I like putting cheap absorption pads underneath, the human incontinence kind. They seem to reduce the urine smell. Though odor-wise, the whole system is less effective than crystals, but at least with this you can be sure you are not harming anyone's health.
summary: Good if you don't mind the smell

reviewText: I bought this to try and releive dry skin on my house dog from the winter months. It has an odor to it. I have used it several times but can not see a difference in this skin. He did stop scratching as bad but the dry skin is still there.

I ordered the cubes thinking the Alfalfa cubes would be shipped to me.  I received the Timothy Cubes, which are different than the picture.  The Timothy Cubes were harder than a brick.  I would never give my 6 year old guinea pig old something old and stale. I threw them in the trash, and Amazon refunded my purchase.

This was thin, unlike the last xtra large that I ordered from this supplier.  I think it will still work for the dog to chew, at least until is shrinks 2 inches or so.  Since my dog is a mastiff, I'm afraid that he'd try to swallow the thing whole if it gets too much smaller, due to its thin diameter.  So far, he hasn't shown much interest in chewing it.  I think  he likes the taste of the elk and moose antlers better.
summary: definitely not my idea of xtra large

reviewText: Well - First off, I must say if it wasn't for Feline Pine we would no longer have our wonderful kitty.We took him in after some friends who adopted him from a shelter were not able to keep him. When we first got him, both my husband and I would keep sneezing like crazy. Neither of us were ever allergic to dogs or cats when being around them before, but neither of had ever had an indoor cat before. We were so worried that we were allergic to him because the only option was for him to go back to the shelter. We did some research and found out most people are actually allergic to the dander or litter. Thankfully for us, it was the LITTER! We tried Feline Pine and the sneezing stopped YAY! I feel good knowing that our kitty isn't licking up or breathing in chemicals when he cleans himself or uses the litter. I didn't give this product 5 Stars because it is NOT "self cleaning" as I've seen it advertised before. The dust doesn't simply fall to the bottom tray - you have to scoop the poops, then sift the box quite a bit so ALL the dust falls to the bottom tray. It is very good about urine smells- It just smells like pine, but it doesn't cover the smell of poops. To be fair though, our cat is rather stinky. Even the old litter with deodorants etc didn't cover his stink- he has a clean bill of health from the Vet but he is stinkier that any of my friends cats.Also, FP DOES track. Especially if you don't sift out the dust entirely. We find whole pellets around the house sometimes. I imagine kitty kicks them out of the box then they get elsewhere.HOWEVER - I believe we have found a solution to that pellet problem. The only litter box we could find for this litter was uncovered (Box from the FP website). Just today, I went to Walmart and got a cheap $5 large plastic container, then cut a "door" in it being careful not to leave any sharp edges. PRESTO that container fit like a glove around the FP litter box. Now we have the FP litter box WITH a cover and it looks good!
summary: We still have the Kitty thanks to FP- still some tracking though

reviewText: I LOVE the way these look on my dog, they are too cute.  she will keep them on too while we r driving, but when we stop, she is all like "NO take them off!"  XD

I've kept Bettas for many years. My current male developed a case of pop-eye and (alarm bells ring!) refused to eat. I immediately ordered this (since I don't have easy access to a pet store), it arrived 2 days later, and my fish was lying at the bottom of the tank looking dead. He would not have survived without this. The 1st day was touch-and-go. The 2nd day he was up and swimming, and by the third day was acting normally. He still had a big eye by the 8th day, but the swelling went down gradually and he seemed to feel good. I have a piece of bamboo in his tank and left it in during the whole treatment (so he could prop himself near the surface to breathe). I don't know if the bamboo will survive long-term, but it seems to have done fine. So for anyone out there looking to treat pop-eye or Dropsy, Maracyn-2 works great if you can get it in time and keep the fish oxygenated.

That's what she said.  No seriously.This thing is HUGE!  It's extraordinarily large for what it is.  I didn't know exactly what to expect when I received it.  I didn't put much research into it.  Once I saw the "package" I knew it was going to be a monster.  Once I unpackaged it, I realized the enormous size of the thing.  It's like a third leg when you hold it.  My girlfriend was even shocked at the size of this thing!It works great so far!
summary: Oh.. My.. God!  This thing is HUGE!

reviewText: These short leads are great for trips to the vet,Pet Smart or any crowded situations when the dog needs to stay close to you. (Hate going into the vet's waiting room and having other people's dogs crowd me at the end of their six foot leads.)  The size is good for large and medium dogs but might be too short for miniatures.  Way overpriced but dog equipment, toys and foods have recently gotten outrageously expensive.
The little Yorkie was not really excited with these.  The bag is a small bag and does not have much of the product. Probably will not order these again.
summary: Not a whole lot in the bag

reviewText: Okay just not very much in bag

I had initially bought the medium size and found it way too big for my beagle mix puppy even though her weight range was in the "medium dog" size.  I had completely tightened everywhere I could and it hung off of her.  My husband was supposed to return it but never did so I ordered the "small" figuring we'd have better results.The size discrepancy between the two sizes was ridiculous!  The small was so tiny even fully extended for it's full size that it wouldn't even go half way around her chest area.  We still had the medium to compare it too.  As it had been awhile since we bought the medium and she had grown a bit more we tried it on our dog again and although still big it wasn't as loose as it had been but it still did not fit tightly as the instructions told you to adjust it.  It was quite loose around both her back and around the front and the only part that we could adjust it enough so it was fitted right was around her belly area.  I ended up gathering up some of it across her back and sewing a few stitches in it to get it to be as snug as the directions indicated.Although the front was still a bit loose we decided to give it a try and took her out for her walk. Seemed to make the walks much better as she was still pulling but not as much as she had been and the walks were much easier with her being much easier to control.  So that was a few days ago. Went to put the harness on her today and noticed that the part of the harness where you attach the leash the material there had split halfway through and if I hadn't noticed it I'm sure it would have ripped the rest of the way and my puppy would have been loose. Glad I noticed because we not only live on a busy street we live in a heavily wooded area with a marsh in the back and lots of coyotes and we never want her to be off her leash for fear she could get hit by a car or disappear into the woods.So definitely a one star for me, product does seem to work but the discrepancy from the small to medium makes it impossible to find a size that will fit properly and the fact that it was in danger of breaking all the way through after just a few outings is really bad.  I did sew up the tear and will continue to use it but will be checking it constantly to make sure it hasn't started to rip through again.
summary: Problems with sizing and broke after a few uses.

reviewText: my cats love this-they play with it and throw it up in the air and run after it and roll around on it.it comes with a generous refill of catnip

I run 2 of these on a salt water macro algae tank.. They work good, but for a while I had clogging issues from the sand getting sucked in. Since running them for the past 7 months they are doing great.

She does enjoy the other flavors, especially the spicier ones, but these original flavor make up the staple of her preferred foods during the day.She especially enjoys our late afternoon routine, where she sits on my shoulder as I read, and she nibbles on one of these.

Our litter box sits in a small utility room with a vinyl floor.  Before the advent of the smartcatcher mat, there was litter strung through the utility room, out into the berber-carpeted house, as far as the door mat by the exit door used by the cat.  After six days with the box sitting on the smartcatcher mat, there are litter granules on the mat in front of the box opening, and NONE anywhere else in the house. We use Precious Cat clay litter, for reference purposes.UPDATE --June 26, 2014-- Having used the mat for a few weeks, it looked like time to wash it.  I put it through my HE washer with some towels, using high spin and dried it in the dryer on medium.  It came out perfectly and it back on the job. I cannot say enough good things about this product.
summary: Smartcatcher lives up to its name

i feed my crickets this and they live a very long time. my crickets live a very long time and they seem to love it

great toy.  sturdy lasts forever.  Easy to throw  lightweight flexible soft on the dog's mouth.  I am on oxygen so my service dog gets exercise by chasing/catching frisbee. Birds need varied shape and size to keep their feet strong and healthy, the varied sizes in these perches help give them some variance. I assumed all "small" busy buddy toys would take the same size refills.  I was wrong.  The small Jack takes small refills; the small Bristle Bone takes medium refills.  The refill packages show which toys they are compatible with.  Zoom in to read.

reviewText: This sinking pellets are loved by my goldfish and they devour them like no tomorrow.It is also a good size for my large goldfishes because most sinking pellets are very small.The waste produced by the fish from eating these pellets easily diluted in water but it will change the color of the water in your tank.If you don't have charcoal in your filtration system to polish the water, the color of the water in your tank will turn brownish.
summary: Good size pellet for  medium sized goldfish.

reviewText: This is a trusted dog food I've used for years and it seems to keep my dog feeling and looking good.

This product says it is suitable for cats. My cat will not touch her food with this on it.  The instructions say to put it in water, if they won't eat the food; that doesn't work for her either.  Apparently it works best for dogs.  I received it quickly, and the packaging was fine, I just cant use it!12/2008:  Okay, I got some Friskies "pate" style canned cat food and mix up a bit with the food and my cat will eat the product.  I've been giving this to her for about two weeks now and her eyes are clearing up nicely.  I'm going very light on the dosage, so I'll update again in a few weeks. I got this for my cats as a christmas gift.  It was hidden in my closet and, big shock, they found it.  Needless to say they love it!  My little guy was batting it around all day and my fat boy cuddled with it at night.  They do vary in colors as decribed by the seller so I was happy to get at least  purple instead of the pink.  I don't think the boys care too much about the color.  I love kong prducts, they are extremely durable and our babies love them! It kind of reminds me of the old Mc Donalds Fry Guys.

I have been buying H2OK9's since they first hit the market a few years back. I still have the original that I bought when they had a waiting list because they were so new. I have purchased several over the years as gifts and for raffle items for the dog clubs I belong to. I know the quality. I was VERY surprised to see them on Amazon for $5 less that what I buy them directly from the company for. But now I know why. Although it is the same design, and the same company, this is not the same as what you get directly from the company's web site. The wall of the metal is thinner and you can actually feel give to it. The ones directly from the company are thicker. The one I bought directly from the company has been used and abused (not literally abused but tossed, dropped, sat on, stepped on. One time actually ran over when it accidentally fell out of my truck in the field and I did not know it until I saw it laying there in my tire tracks on my way back) and aside from a few scratches on the metal, looks as good as the day I got it over 5 years ago. I would be almost afraid to do that with the one I bought here.I cannot give this one a 5 star. But the ones I get directly from the company I would give a billion stars if I could.
summary: Not the same bottle as if you bought directly through the company.

reviewText: I have a big Shih Tzu, not fat, he is just on the larger side of the breed. The Small collar was way too tight.  I ordered the Large Dog and it is way too thick and confining.  Yes, I did cut it down but it is still too thick an restricting for a small dog.  I truly wish Seresto made a Medium size for all the in-between dogs because this is the only flea and tick product that has not given my beautiful dog a violent reaction.Please, Bayer, make a Medium size!!
summary: Need an in-between size to the Small and Large Dog

reviewText: I bought this for my 13lb Boston Terrier. She can pull with the best and instantly becomes a sled dog when fitted with a regular harness. I researched no-pull harnesses for days and decided on this one based on the overwhelmingly positive reviews. Now I have used the harness regularly for over a week, I cannot give it more than 3 stars - here's why:(1) Annoying to fit. I knew this before I bought it, but seriously, I spent a good hour trying to fit it just perfectly.(2) The straps get loose after you use it one to two times, so you have to refit the harness often.(3) The harness decreases pulling but does not make my dog walk like an angel by any means. (side note: we are going to puppy classes which has helped somewhat.) The first times she lunged at a couple other dogs, she fell on her face, flipped over, and kept tripping on the leash. While I suppose that could deter her from lunging, it was an unpleasant experience. The other dog owners were questioning why I was letting her be so destructive to herself, but I really had no control over it. She was in the zone where no amount of food or instruction would help. She does not pull to this extreme anymore, but she knows just how much she can pull without getting into that sort of trouble.(4) Probably the most disappointing of it all - CHAFFING. It was my fault that I continued to use the harness after I thought I noticed it was making her belly/armpits lose hair, but I honestly wasn't sure. She didn't seem to hurt or be bothered by the harness and she has pretty short, thin hair on her chest/armpits/belly. Then yesterday evening, after a number of long walks and going to puppy training class, I noticed she had quarter-sized raw areas under her armpits! I was horrified! This apparently is a common problem with this harness.I like that this harness did discourage lunging and pulling hard, as compared to my other traditional harness which seemed to encourage pulling... But the chaffing issue is still a problem. I'm toying with the idea of sewing sherpa or felt around the chest and armpit area to see if it helps, but I'm not betting on it.

I agree with most of the other reviews - for the price this could be much more durable to make cleaning less tenuous, but - it's a neat idea and superior to other product along these lines. A fair priced liner (not the outrageously priced one currently available) would be a nice adjunct to this product. It took my cat no time at all to convert to the 'plant'.

My little white dog had tear stains all the time.  We have been using this product and now the stains are gone!  I noticed an improvement within a couple of weeks.  The only reason I didn't give this 5 stars, is because I don't think my dog likes the taste all that much.

I love this litter box!  The size is great and it looks great in my family room. No one can tell it's a litter box. I placed it in a corner and people just think it's a planter.  I scoop my litter boxes every day but I have never noticed any kind of an odor coming from this box.  I have 2 litter boxes upstairs but I needed to have one downstairs for one of my cats.  I have 3 cats and they all seem to really like using it.  As some of the other reviews stated it is a little hard to get the top on straight but you just have to have a little patience.  I still love it and would recommend it if you need a hidden litter box.
Too high for my chihuahua and my 2 shih tzus.  Even when adjusting hight to lowest setting it was still too high for them to eat from.

reviewText: My dog ( 8 month old border collie/retriever mix)  chewed through the nylon rope in about 3 minutes. Will just get the Squeaker ball next time.

Can't praise the Orbee-Tuff toys enough.  The dogs absolutely love them and they are almost indestructible.  Between 3 dogs in our family, we must have 10 of the Orbee-Tuff balls; and all are still in good shape.

I bought this toy because I (and my dog) are extremely happy with other JW Pet Company toys.  This one, however, isn't tough enough.  My lab had it ripped open and was chewing small rubber bits within 15 minutes.  I'd stick with the more solid rubber toys (see my other reviews) if you want something that will last.

I have Visi-therm heaters of various sizes (100-150 watts) in three of my fish tanks.  I have never had one fail.  One of them has been putting out heat for 10 years!  I keep my house at 62F in the winter, so I use one size up.  I like that the boxes on these  heaters tell you how many degrees it will heat the water for a given size tank.  I don't think most manufacturers expect they will have to raise the water temperature 14F.  The light when the heater is on is easy to see.  These come with a 2" holder that has the suction cups securely attached (but removable), which prevents the suction cups from falling to the bottom of the tank.  I don't have a lot of decorations in my tanks, so I don't have to worry about breaking the glass.  The glass on these seems pretty thick.  Since warm water rises, I mount these horizontally near the bottom of the tank.  These heaters aren't the cheapest, but they are very reliable and worth the price.

I have never left a product review of a dog toy but this ball deserves it.  It is bouncy, squishy, chewable, lightweight, and durable - all the qualities important for both ball-loving dogs and those humans who are the ones purchasing them.  This is the third time I have bought this ball and my dog LOVES LOVES LOVES them.  Why the third time? The first time, she lost it - not the ball's fault.  The next one lasted over two years before I had to final replace it from being chewed up.  And that is with us playing fetch every single day and with her chewing on it obsessively (again, she LOVES this ball).

It works as indicated, however it comes loose while the dog is wearing it.  The front strap is the problem.  I finally took to stitching it and it is okay.  There should have been something to hold it so it won't come loose.

I liked this ball because I was looking for alternatives to squeaky toys. (got tired of hearing squeaks)This ball is made of a very durable material, and the "ball" inside is like a plastic bottle. So as the dog chews, it makes a crackle noise, similar to the sound if you are squeezing a plastic water bottle.My pup loved it for the first hour, but then lost interest. He hardly plays with it now. It is a little heavy, so you can't really throw it far for fetch. When you throw it, it falls to the ground with a loud "thud"
summary: Good material, but Pup lost interest quickly

reviewText: I try not to take the dogs out for a walk at night. I cannot really comment on how reflective these are, but they are sturdy and our walks are much more enjoyable.  I purchase this harness to have a more pleasant walking experience with my pups . . . me walk them, rather then they try and walk me.  My expectations were meet, I am very happy with the purchase.  These harnesses are sturdy and will hold up to my dogs, half lab/half husky.  I would not hesitate to purchase another.

reviewText: My beagle sheds like that his only business and fur gets everywhere. I found it impossible to get fur out my car particularly the carpet and rug, but this stone used in tandem with a vacuum gets everything OUT! Fantastic product and I am glad I stumbled upon it by accident here on Amazon, the same product under a different name is sold for 20 bucks.
Not sure what it is, but my cats hate these, and my cats are not finicky eaters.  I finally gave up and just tossed the bag out.

With 6 cats it's nice to have a way to feed them that doesn't always require me to 1)be home, 2)fill a food bowl every day.  With 5 slots, I can program these trays to turn once a day (5 days) or twice a day (2-1/2 days).  The batteries last a long time.  The most important thing to consider, if you have multiple feeders, is to coordinate them so they all turn at the same time.  If you want to leave for the weekend, you can fill the feeder on Friday and know that the cats are getting there food until you return home on Sunday.
summary: Recommended to always ensure your pet gets fed on time, even when you're not at home

reviewText: I routinely leave my cat alone on the weekends and need something so that he doesn't eat everything in sight while I'm gone. For a while, I was leaving a self-feeder out for him, but he was eating himself sick (and chubby). So, I decided he needed something a little more controlled and thought this might be it.  I was a bit concerned about what some reviewers have said about their cats figuring out how to turn the bowl themselves, but after about 6 months now, I haven't had any problems with him figuring that out. He's not scared of the whirring and knows exactly what that means - food time!There weren't instructions on the lid like in the picture but it wasn't hard to program. It takes a little getting used to, but its easier to program than my alarm clock which might explain why I often leave this set but empty to wake me up in the morning to remind me to feed the kitty.Things I wish it did:  Actually have room for 5 meals.  The first compartment is uncovered so that doesn't really count. Also, it says that it can accomodate wet food, but that isn't true either. There is no way to keep it cold for any amount of time.  I tried to put an ice pack underneath in this little reservoir but it didn't keep anything cold, was too small a space for a normal-sized ice pack and was under the open compartment which doesn't really need to be kept cool anyway.It keeps the munchkin fed while I'm gone, but I sometimes regret paying as much for it as I did.  It doesn't meet enough of my needs to feel justified but I'm not sure what a better alternative would be. =/
summary: Not really worth the price for me

reviewText: Dog likes it. It is claimed that the enzymes from the cow stomach helps the dog digest, not sure this is true, but I have continued to feed my retriever this brand.

At first this seemed like a great product, but after a few times tightening the hose down I heard a crack.  It would seem this is the barb not the nut or threads failing like others have experienced and written about.I wasn't using pliers and I'm definitely not stronger than an average person but the threads on the top are plastic, and the nut is plastic, and it just seems like a horrible idea when everything else in my multi tank system is brass!I haven't had any leaking but I'm scared to touch it ever again for fear it will break in half.  I guess time will tell how long before I develop a problem, but I'm lucky enough to be using this in a vacuum system (where the CO2 is being pulled from the tank via venturi into a pump) so there's no pressure in the lines which is definitely helping in this situation.  I would imagine if it were pressurized (tank to ceramic diffuser for example) I would have thrown it out far sooner as CO2 would be escaping from the hairline crack.Also the mount is cheesy, it just kind of pushes together like a single lego block.  With any kind of force which your CO2 lines will inevitably give you'll soon be ready to super glue the little tab in for life.Other than all that negative it is easy to see and count bubbles...if it'll stay working for long enough.  So for $4 it's a gamble - great while it lasts -  but a whole tank of CO2 is on the line whenever this thing decides to crack.

I cannot say enough good things about this toy. Our Busy Buddy has taken almost a month's worth of daily abuse from puppy teeth and shows very minimal signs of wear on the rubber outer portion, in addition to this it has been run through the dishwasher several times and has come out grime free and retains no food odor (a boon for me because I don't particularly love the meaty smell his treats and kibble have). I loved the adjustability of the "difficulty" by snipping the inner teeth, at two and a half months old he had a very hard time getting the food out, a quarter inch snip on each tooth on one end had him interested in it again. I do recommend a minimal amount of supervision when using this, if only for the fact that it can easily become lodged under couches or coffee tables, which kind of ruins the fun if they can't get it out. The pup gets this when chores need to be done around the house that require both hands (dishes, gardening, cooking) so he's not constantly getting underfoot. One thing that I'm not thrilled about with this toy is the noise that it makes rolling about on hardwood floors (it's pretty loud!), so if you live in an apartment with hardwood you may get complaints from the neighbors, but I can live with it because he enjoys this toy so much.
He played with it for not quite 5 minutes, in which time he ripped the feathers out, then he walked off and that was the end of that.  *sigh*

I purchased the Litter Robot second hand from a thrift shop. I've been using it for about 2 months now, and it works great! My cat is about 1 year old and previously used the smaller Booda dome as a litter box so transition was not that difficult. The Litter Robot actually seems to have more space inside than the Booda dome, so I think any cat transitioning from a similar covered litter box would also have minimal problems. I left the Litter Robot off for 2 days while she got used to it, only turning it on twice a day to let it cycle. After the third day, I left it on and cleaned up the old litter box. My cat has been using it ever since.I had a few issues to start but they are all dealt with now. First, my cat was leaping into and out of the Litter Robot. This caused it to not cycle since pressure on the step into the Litter Robot is required to set the cycling timer. I solved this by turning the Litter Robot to face a corner so that my cat had no choice but to use the step to enter.My cat is also a kicker. I found a lot of litter outside the Litter Robot from where she kicked it out while using the litter box. To fix this, I purchased the Litter Robot fence and lip extender for $24 ([...]). The lip extender is required for the Litter Robot fence to work. I want to note that my version of the Litter Robot seems to be the original (there isn't a number so it doesn't look like it's a LRII), but the lip extender/fence will fit it. I know some people posted that they have problems with cats that don't turn around, causing urine to splatter all over the step. I guess the lip extender would fix that, but my cat has never had that issue.There is a smell...if you stick your face right in front of it (but what did you expect??). About a few weeks in, I did notice that I kept getting wafts of an unpleasant smell in my room. I live in a 1 bedroom apartment, and the Litter Robot would not fit anywhere convenient so it is in my living room. I realized that the smell was most likely due to me moving my air purifier away (normally it sits between my desk and the litter box) because I was rearranging some things. I moved it back, purchasedAPI Ammo-Carb, Half Gallon Carton, Net Weight 37-Ounce, and plugged in an air freshener. Since then, I've had no problems. I don't even know if the Ammo-Carb is necessary, but I put some in the waste drawer in the liner (which I change every month) and in the trash bag (which I change once a week).I am using 13 gallon kitchen trash bags in the waste drawer. This is fine for one cat - but it's not big enough if you find yourself having to sweep a lot of litter over the step. The step deposits into the drawer but it's very difficult for you to make sure it actually lands in whatever you have lining it. I haven't had any issue with sweeping litter off the step since I installed the litter fence.Finally, I used this with 2 types of litter. Initially, I usedPrecious Cat Ultra Premium Clumping Cat Litter, 40 pound bagwhich worked fine. I switched from this litter because I read that the dust from clay clumping litter is not good for your cat. Now I useSwheat Scoop Multi Cat Natural Wheat Cat Litter, 25 Pound Bagwhich also works fine. The only issue I noticed with Swheat Scoop is that it smells much stronger (more acrid maybe?) when you empty the waste drawer. But I still can't smell it with my current setup.In summary - I very much recommend the Litter Robot. It's extremely pricey (I am lucky I got it heavily discounted), but I think I would probably purchase it at full price after trying it.Edit: After using Swheat Scoop for a month, I'm switching back to the Precious Cat litter. Swheat Scoop just doesn't work as well in the Litter Robot - it tends to create a sticking layer to the rubber interior that requires prodding to get rid of during a cycle. I've come to terms with the potential hazards of clay litter (there are no scientific studies, Precious Cat is extremely low dust, and my cat does not eat litter).Edit again: If you are using an air purifier nearby, the Ammo Carb and air freshener aren't even necessary.
summary: Litter Robot accessories may fix your issues

My problems with this litter are twofold - clumping and gluten. Re clumping, I wish I'd read the reviews here before buying this at my local Pet Supermarket. I had been using World's Best multiple cat formula for 2 years without complaint, but since my Rocky is a raker, I was interested in a natural litter that would clump better. There was no problem with my two 2-year old kitties adopting SWheat, but the clumps are broken up by Rocky much worse than with WBCL. That's my reason for the low rating.The wheat issue is not part of my rating, simply a personal issue: today, one week into the SWheat litter, it occurred to me that wheat dust in the air is a definite no-no for my Celiac husband. And whatever is on our kitties' paws is all over surfaces in the house. That's cross-contamination bigtime. I can't believe I even bought a wheat product when I'm so careful with food shopping. That's my mistake, but I thought it might be helpful to other Celiac households who might not think about it.

I bought this extra large size for my toy poodles, 5-12 lbs.  I believe it is important to have this larger size because dogs move around when they are pooping, at least mine do. With the larger pad there is less chance of missing and hitting the floor. Also, I have found that the pad holder having the edging around it seems to keep the dogs inside the holder when they poop and pee.  When I had the pads on the ground not only did they get moved around and bunched up at times but there were many 'misses' as they wandered off onto the floor at times.Everyone with a dog should own at least one of these.  I always hated to leave the dogs home alone to have to wait  for me to take them out when I got home, in the "old days".  I also don't like being woken up for "potty time".  I imagine it is painful for them to hold it for very long when they have to go and no need for them to have to do that with these potty pads.  Not to mention it saves your flooring if they can't hold lt.  I think crating them for long periods so they won't soil the floor is cruel too.  I used the pads for years, so was very happy to find the holder.  It makes sit so much easier. This one is easy to clean and use. Each end lifts up and down to replace the pads.  It is very sturdy plastic. A small price to pay for the added benefits in using doggy pads. I am going to order another one for the downstairs area.I like the larger potty pads made to fit this the best but have found it is more economical to buy the small ones by the 100 and use two at a time. Using two works because the holder around the edges  keeps them down so they don't get all bunched up. I prefer the Iris brand as they are just better. The urine does not seem to spread out as much.  I buy the other at the store now and then, but these are superior.Do yourself and your dog a favor, start them as puppies using this and you will never have the problem of having to clean your floors and carpet so often.  It saves soooooo much time and expense.  My older dogs learned to use them too but it is just easier to start them off this way in the beginning. That way you can keep your dog in the house where they are so much safer. In our area I don't leave my dogs outside as I have friends who have had their dogs stolen and they get out accidentally when someone leaves a gate open.  An Owl swooped down suddenly and took another friends precious little Yorkie while outside going potty and my friend was standing right next to it. There are all kinds of wild animals that prey on pets these days with building going into their habitats.  Avoid the possible heartache and keep your little dogs inside the house.
summary: THE BEST PAD HOLDER - CONSIDER THE LARGER SIZE

reviewText: The dogs like the Monkey and they are not nice to it :) I have a German Shepherd puppy, that is teething and a bored Jack Russell who shews on everything, the Monkey is still in tacked, just crusty from all the slobber. I will buy more, I wish they were bigger.

reviewText: I usually give my two 100 lb. dogs Kirkland brand dog food from Costco because it has quality ingredients. They don't fall all over themselves to get to the bowl, but they don't turn their noses up to it either. I usually add some sort of cooked meat or yogurt as a treat, so they are kind of spoiled.So I opened a bag of the Pro Plan Savor, Chicken flavor and they immediately seemed interested. They picked out most of the Pro Plan over the Kirkland brand food, which says a lot about the taste. However, the ingredients are still not up to snuff with Kirkland brand. Here are the ingredients below. The ones I take exception to (low quality fillers) have an asterisk.I really don't like the additional corn. If your dog gets ear infection easily. Check their dog food for corn. One of my dogs is allergic to corn and gets ear infections when she gets too much of this stuff in cheap dog food. I'm waiting to see if it causes problems.Also poultry by-products can be anything left over in the slaughter house--beaks, feet, bones, whatever. Gross.The chemical at the bottom, menadione sodium bisulfite complex (source of vitamin K activity) is controversial and unnecessary.Ingredients: Chicken, brewers rice, *whole grain wheat, *corn gluten meal,poultry by-product meal (natural source of glucosamine), *soy flakes, *whole grain corn, *corn germ meal, animal fat preserved with mixed-tocopherols (form of vitamin E), barley, *soybean meal, dried egg product, fish meal (natural source of glucosamine), animal digest, glycerin, calcium phosphate, *wheat bran, fish oil, salt, potassium chloride, potassium citrate, calcium carbonate, zinc proteinate, vitamin E supplement, choline chloride, manganese proteinate, ferrous sulfate, sulfur, l-ascorbyl-2-polyphosphate (source of vitamin C), copper proteinate, niacin, vitamin A supplement, calcium pantothenate, garlic oil, pyridoxine hydrochloride, vitamin B12 supplement, thiamine mononitrate, riboflavin supplement, calcium iodate, vitamin D3 supplement, *menadione sodium bisulfite complex (source of vitamin K activity), folic acid, biotin, sodium seleniteNone of these are in the Kirkland brand. The other thing about Pro Plan is the price. Feeding 200 lbs of dogs at this dog food price. Ouch. So, the dogs liked it, but I sort of see this as lower quality food, like eating hot dogs instead of pork chops. It's okay, but I won't be using it as their main food.
