This dog food is OK, but they stretch the truth by claiming it is "super premium dog food."The ingredients are:Chicken, Chicken Meal, Ground Rice, Corn Meal, Soybean Meal, Poultry Fat (preserved with mixed tocopherols), Corn Gluten Meal, Brown Rice, Oatmeal, Dried Plain Beet Pulp, Natural Flavor, Dicalcium Phosphate, Salt, Calcium Carbonate, Dehydrated Alfalfa, Dried Peas, Dried Carrots, Dried Tomatoes, Potassium Chloride, Choline Chloride, Olive Oil, Vitamin E Supplement, Zinc Sulfate, Ferrous Sulfate, Iron Oxide, Dried Parsley, L-Ascorbyl-2-Polyphosphate (source of vitamin C), Mixed Tocopherols, Niacin, Manganese Sulfate, Copper Sulfate, D-Calcium Pantothenate, Biotin, Sodium Selenite, Vitamin A Supplement, Riboflavin Supplement, Vitamin D3 Supplement, Thiamine Mononitrate, Pyridoxine Hydrochloride, Menadione Sodium Bisulfite Complex (source of vitamin K activity), Vitamin B12 Supplement, Potassium Iodide, Cobalt Sulfate, Folic AcidSo, some of the ingredients are good, like the chicken and chicken meal.  There are also some fillers in here, like corn products which are of no value to a dog.  Also soybean meal and beet pulp, eh - fillers.  Salt?  Absolutely not necessary.  The fat source is non-specific (poultry) instead of specifically chicken, etc., although it is preserved with mixed tocopherols, which is good). Some of the other ingredients are good, like the dried veggies.So good yes, maybe even slightly above average as far as some good products like veggies, but there's just as much bad as good in it, so it is NOT premium or "super premium."As far as appearance, it is an average size kibble, good for small and medium dogs, as well as large dogs, although a big dog may prefer a larger kibble.

My dogs go bat s*** crazy for this stuff. Don't need to use a lot since and smells really good to humans too. The only thing is my pointer mix likes to take her food put on floor and roll in it....weird.

INTROMy wife and I have more recently made the decision to be more active, which means of course that our little rescue Poppy is along for the ride! We are always looking for accessories that will make our trips easier on all of us, and not having to carry our pup's necessities was something that we both thought would be a good idea. I grew up around working alpine-rescue dogs, and always loved their little backpacks, many of which were custom-made by the Alpine Rescue Team simply because that sort of thing wasn't readily available. This backpack seemed absolutely perfect for our needs! As one of boycott boring's product testers (the distributor), I received the medium size backpack in exchange for an honest review.QUALITY/CONSTRUCTIONAs with all Outward Hound products, this backpack is VERY well made. Constructed from what I believe is very durable nylon (think hiking backpack), it is absolutely up to the task of any rough and tumble that can happen while out on hikes/at the dog park, and comes clean very easily. I can't find any official word on whether this is machine washable, but a damp cloth works wonders and we have yet needed to put it totally in the wash. I assume it will be fine, but will update if and when that time comes! All of the buckles and the velcro and equally as pleasing in their quality, and I have no complaints here! Despite only having single stitching, all of the stitches are well done, which is usually a sign of good quality overall.DESIGNWell, there are several important points to mention here. The first is that the frame itself is nicely adjustable via the straps included. While this won't fit perfectly every time for every dog, I have found that cutting the straps once they have been fitted and burning the edges will allow for you to dispose of any extra length that may be present depending on your dogs size, without any fraying. The overall design of the frame is excellent, and does a good job of distributing any weight by using a wide surface area, and a harness-type set up at the front with two additional straps around the chest. The inner frame also has a handle, which is excellent for keeping your dog nearby when distractions are present.Moving on to the backpack itself, there are two large saddle bags that hang down on the sides, each with an interior mesh pocket along the inside. If I had one complaint about these saddle bags, it would be that there aren't smaller interior pockets for better organization, but more on that in my product suggestions. The backpack and frame have a total of four areas that have reflective material on them. This is great for night-time walks, allowing motorists to see that you're not the only one walking!FITOur dog is a 25lb whippet-shepherd mix (full grown) and has a pretty awkward body. We have the medium backpack, and while the frame fits very well, the saddle bags are a hair on the large size for her. She's pretty long (therefore tall when on her hinds legs) but pretty low to the ground. Still, I was pleased that this thing fit at all - I can't begin to list the many MANY accessories that simply don't fit our pup because of her awkward shape!PRODUCT SUGGESTIONSI have already spoken with the distributor about the following suggestions, and I am pleased to say that it seems as though the product designers are thinking along the same lines for one of two of them!- I think a good idea would be for outward hound to offer some sort of choice in terms of mixing and matching frames and backpacks. The medium frame is perfect for our pup, but as I mentioned the saddle bags are too big and I think the backpack section from the smaller model would be a better fit overall.- I would love to see some modularity be integrated with this backpack! By this I mean having some extra attachments that can be used besides the large backpack section that comes with the frames. Ideas include some smaller pouches that can be attached for those shorter trips - small compartments for treats and waste bags etc. That way you could attach smaller compartments for walks or trips to the dog park, and the bigger bags for longer excursions/camping etc. Something that I would LOVE to see would be a pouch that could fit a Camelbak-type water bladder that would distribute the weight of water evenly, rather than having a water bottle that pulls to one side.- I would also be very pleased if there was a way to attach a felt/flannel lining to the inner frame. That way the frame could be used by itself to keep a pup warm. Our dog is part whippet, and we often have a jacket on her in winter to keep her nice and cozy, but of course that adds extra bulk that makes the backpack a little uncomfortable. If they added the softer side of velcro to the frame, it could be worn by itself without discomfort, but also have the ability to add the warmer lining during the winter months! This is something that I will do to the internal frame anyway, hopefully I'll have pictures that I can put up soon for inspiration!OVERALLSimply because there is room for improvement, I would rate this product at four and a half stars if Amazon allowed it. The design and quality is simply fabulous, with a few areas of improvement (in my eyes) that can be made on the organizational aspect. Overall, however, I do love this product and therefore have awarded it five stars with a strong recommendation as a great product overall. If you are active with your dog, enjoy long hikes or camping, this is an almost-perfect accessory that is made to last!
summary: A detailed review of an excellent backpack!

reviewText: This stuff is great, I do backcountry search and rescue with my dog. I love having this in my pack for if either of us gets a skin tear (or he breaks a claw). It provides an instant stop that stays stopped. There is a slight burning sensation when applying it to yourself, but only for a second.

I first learned about kongs during a dog training session with my 6-month-old lab.  He was restless so the trainer gave him a kong to play with, and it was love and intrigue at first sight.  After the class, I bought him a small one - the same size the trainer had.  It became his pacifier and security blanket.  It was just small enough for him to hold it in his mouth by the top and he carried it everywhere and chewed on it even when it wasn't filled with treats.  He took it to bed with him at night and sometimes fell asleep with it in his mouth. I then read where the proper size kong for his size and weight was the larger one, and I got him that one.  He played with it while it was full of treats but then wouldn't touch it after that, preferring the small kong. Eventually the bottom part that holds the sand in the small kong became dislodged and the sand came out, which was actually a good thing since he was fond of dropping it full force on our tile floor, or dropping it down the stairs and watching it roll down until it crashed into the wall and on the tile.  We were afraid it would crack one of the tiles, but he loved it so much we couldn't take it away from him.  However, once we were able to get the sand container to adhere to the bottom again without the sand, it was much lighter and he still had his companion.  It didn't wobble as much, but it still wobbled enough to entertain him.  Not long after that, he figured out how to unscrew the top from the bottom (I KNEW we should have those dew claws removed...lol) and I found the two pieces chewed up to the point where they could not be screwed in together again.  He still brings me the top to fill, and I have to explain to him how it doesn't work anymore because he broke it.  He drops it and looks a little sad, so I'm going out today and buying a new one for him.  I think I will drill a hole in the bottom and drain the sand first to avoid the tile breaking issue.Bottom line......great toy for labs!UPDATE: In total, my lab has now completely disassembled and destroyed 3 of these Kongs - one being the largest they make and two being a size smaller.  I decided to go with the black Extreme Kong several months ago, and so far so good.  He likes it and plays with it, and has not (yet) found a method by which to destroy it.  :fingers crossed:  :)

I am always looking for something that is grain free.  Excessive grains can cause long term issues in cats, particularly IBD.  Their system can't handle a lot of grains, so it wrecks havoc on their lower digestive system.  I know because my old cat got IBD and I fed her Purina cat food all of her life.  Towards the end of her life, (she is deceased now), she had uncontrollable issues that involved many accidents in the house.  I had to put her on medication in order to stabilize her system, and even then she still had terrible issues.I recently adopted a new kitten, and I am striving to find grain free food now.  Only time will tell, if doing that eliminates the painful digestive issues that my prior cat had.  Cats need protein, that is what they eat in the wild.  Feeding them excessive grains is like giving them junk food everyday.My cat dug right into this food.  The little pieces are flat, like a small disc.  Any size cat should be able to eat them.  At the time of this review, my cat is 5 months old, and devours this cat food.  I am still feeding herHill's Science Diet Kitten Healthy Development Original Dry Cat Food, 7-Pound Bag, because she is a kitten and want her to get all the vitamins she needs, but when she gets older I am going to switch solely to this grain free food.  If Science Diet had a grain free kitten food, I would purchase that instead.  I also feed her a grain free, wet cat foodSoulistic Pure Bliss Tuna Whole Meat Dinner Adult Canned Cat Food in Gravy.  If you haven't tried the Soulistic, I seriously recommend you do.  It is the only cat food my cat will eat, consistently, even out of the refrigerator.There is a lot of food in this 11 pound bag!  It should last a long time.  It closes with a Velcro flap, which is so much more convenient then the Ziploc.  I had a hard time getting those cheap Ziploc's, that they put on cat food bags, to close.  So, if you are looking for a grain free cat food, from a company that has a good reputation, and is recommended by vets, give this a try.  If you buy it from your local veterinarian, ask them if they have a return policy.  Science Diet backs their food, and will take it back if it doesn't work for you.  My local vet will take back food that isn't used up, or doesn't work for my cat.  I believe that Petco also has the same policy.

This has become my yorkie's bedroom. Whenever we leave the house, she jumps right in. It fits her bed, potty pad, food & water bowls and her toys. She feels safe here. Doesn't like to be left out when we are gone. I lined the bottom with a cheap shower curtain to prevent accidents from damaging the carpet. I love it. One of the best purchases I ever made. It's all one piece and folds up, easily fitting the trunk for vacation traveling. A must have for small, indoor dogs.
summary: A must have for small dogs

reviewText: One of my male cats has started peeing on the floor rather than in his litter box (litter box and litter box materials have not changed).I tried this Feliway comfort zone diffuser and it did nothing to stop the floor peeing. In fact, the pee spots got closer to the diffuser.  It has been about 3 weeks since the diffuser was first plugged in & there has been no change in behavior.  Sadly, for me, the Feliway is not a solution to my kitty problem.(I also put his most feared thing in the room - vacuum cleaner - but it was not a deterrent either.  It would be a deterrent if I left it running, but that is neither an efficient nor long-term solution).
summary: Not a Solution for My Neurotic Cat

reviewText: Worked well in both a Toyota Corolla and Ford F-150 with an extended cab, we have two dogs, the mastiff puppy could climb over the front center, the design seemed to discourage it and the sides do have velcro stripes to try to tighten the sides but the same mastiff puppy would end up putting her head in the corner until she found a way between seats but once I put a blanket there it was fine... the price was perfect and it protected the seat from sloppy jaw water and was easy to use, kept pet hair off the seat and allowed us to use the space between the front seats and back as storage
My dog loves to play with this Kong toy.  He acts surprised every time a treat comes out of it.

works great keeping my puppy in place. Cant stand the latches to open the door to get puppy out. It really looks simple, but for some reason at times, it takes ten tries to get it to open. I saw others had said that was their frustration too. They weren't lying. I dont regret getting this bc it was so much cheaper than all the others i looked at. but, I do get aggravated by it. I can tell you it is very light and if you plan to put a big puppy/dog in there, they will knock it all over the place. But, my doggie is only 8 pounds and I have it set up in a small room so he cant push the walls around too much.
I have two dogs, a Cav. King Charles Spaniel, and a Comfort Retriever. Both of them LOVE these. And they are cheaper than Petco. Plus, they are actually good for the little buggers (:
summary: Over $1 cheaper per bag than Petco

reviewText: 4 1/2 starsI greatly hesitated to buy a fountain because of the trouble--cleaning, filters, etc. This is SO easy!! Filling and cleaning are no trouble at all, and I don't find the noise intrusive. I've removed the tubing completely from the bowl and flushed it to remove blockages and popped it back in without sweat or tears. I'm also VERY glad to have tubing and electric cord of a decent length, something manufacturers of fans would do well to copy.It took a week or so for them to get used to it, but it's now MamaCat, the Ancient One's, favorite drinking spot. Others have fallen in line to use it too. The only thing keeping it from a 5-star rating is the soft tubing from the pump to the bowl. This crowd tends to be extremely mouthy, and I'm waiting for the day when the lack of bubbles means that the tubing has been chewed to pieces, not knocked loose from the bowl. I'd prefer at least an option of heavy-duty tubing, or even protected tubing. I'm amazed it's made it this long, so who knows? Maybe Petmate knows something I don't and has somehow made the tubing less toothsome to the fur set.edit: The bubbler finally stopped working a few weeks ago due to chewed tubing, as expected. I'll replace the tubing and run it through beverage dispenser tubing; it seems to either taste bad or to destroy the mouth feel of the protected object, including electric cords.

Bought these for my 2 Chihuahua puppies. They love them. They are not quite as small as I thought they would be for "Petite" size, but my tiny pups are able to chew them and hold them in their front paws  just fine. They have been working on them for almost 3 months and they have just started to break pieces off of these. It keeps them busy when I don't have time to play with them.
Good product , easy to use, except my wife has to do the reading of the test because I am color blind.
summary: does what it is suppose to do

reviewText: I recently saw this at Costco and figured why not give it a try - as their products tend to work just as well as the name band if not better.  We got this one put it on the dogs every month to the exact date.  It just didn't work the dogs were itching like crazy and then took them to the vet to find out that they did in fact have fleas.  The vet then gave an oral treatment for the fleas and now I have to treat my house for them as well.

This backpack is for my 5-5.5 lbs yorkie.  It's bigger than I expected so my pup had enough room to lay down comfortably if she wanted.  Or she can just "hang out" to see what's going on.  The product is sturdy and comfortable to carry around.  The shape of the backpack holds better than I expected but I would've liked it if the bottom part held better.  I cut out couple of 1" thick sponge in D shape to give extra padding on the bottom and use it as car seat which works great.I'm considering making a modification on the side to cut out a little "window" so my pup can stick her head out while sitting.
This seemed to work for a few minutes, but then the dog just started barking again.  It also came loose very easily.
summary: It didn't work for the dog.

reviewText: Haven't used them, but use this product from another on-line store is a proven item with keeping my cats more calm.  I definitely notice the difference when I forget to replace the refill on a monthly basis.  I have just adopted another cat who is not being accepted well by my oldest cat, so I'm very glad to have the Comfort Zone.

My cat  was not too interested in this toy, I thought she would like it since it moves and has the feathers on it, she will play with it a few minutes and then loses interest. I was hoping it would keep her occupied for a longer period of time but not the case. it is a nice toy.
Takes a little more brain power and nose power to get the treats out since it doesn't simply roll around.
summary: good treat flow and a challenge

reviewText: I'd be a little leary of cranking this out every day for my two homeys,but it is a great mixer for the good (and expensive !!) dry food AND good for the occasional stray that comes barreling out of the woods....It's a GREAT thing to have an emergency CAT FOOD stash with winter on the way - and this is a BIG BAG !!
summary: Good mixer for expensive dry food !!!

reviewText: It keeps her busy for hours.  It also comes apart so it can be washed easily which is a big plus.

This food was an absolute blessing when one of our cats became very sick & just plain wouldn't eat anything that she normally would go for. The ingredients are AMAZING (!)...raw meat & some vitamins in a freeze dried (no smell) product. My kitty liked both the dry version (right out of the bag) and wet (I mixed a small amount of broth with it) with very little waste since I could mix up whatever I needed at any given time (rather than wasting it by having too much...as often happens with canned food). I have another kitty that considers the medallions a treat, but sticks to her usual dry food (or likes a "dusting" of a crushed medallion on top). If your cat has health challenges (or is older & has sensitive digestion), I cannot recommend this highly enough. It's healthy, packaged in a super convenient way, and lasts a long time if you need to store it (a perfect pet food for food storage purposes!). I adore this product and have told my vet & several friends about it...it's THAT good! The BEST pet food I've tried....EVER!

Ordered this for our aquarium in our bedroom liked the different look of it. A smooth low profile dome . Was skeptical of the price considering most aquarium lights are far more expensive. but was pleasantly surprised after installing it on our aquarium although the hood is quit flimsy and doesnt't fit perfect leaving a slight gab in the front edge between the hood and the front of the aquarium. (very slight). It does look really nice and the lights are the best part,on the day setting it is very bright and really shows off the fish and decorations. The moon light setting is also very impressive it's actually brighter than our marineland double brights moonlight setting. Overall we are very pleased especially considering the price, very reasonable. Would definitly cecommend this hood.
summary: Nice Hood ! Great Light ! Great Price !

reviewText: These work great with our boxer.  They're durable, and cheap enough that we can have one at each door of the house so they're always handy.

My dog actually has fuzz all over his back and tail.That hasn't happened in a few years.  He's been taking it just a few weeks.He doesn't like it much.  We have to hide it in other food, then he accepts it.It's a green powder, that's very fine.  It doesn't stink, and it only takes a tiny bit twice a day to work.I have been finding that if I put it in a very fatty food, he seems to like it better and seems to feel better.  His skin is very dry and I have noticed the fats helping him even before I started this - so my strategy is to put it in a bit of cheese or chicken skin, or a cooked egg.He is scratching a lot less and his skin is a lot healthier looking, and the fur IS coming back.  At this rate it will take another month, but he has had these problems for years and nothing has worked this well.  I also used Goodwinol ointment.  He had a negative skin scraping but I thought I'd try to cover all the bases.
Best deal on these is the Amazon Prime offering. Wish they sold more at a time but it's easy enough to increase the quantity, so this is probably the best way to sell from a consumer perspective.
Don't expect this to last more than a day or two.  My macaw had fun and then it was gone!
It is easy to use this product. The readings chart is of good quality. Works well. More cost effective than the quick dip strips.

After having several different pet food storage containers over the years I finally came across this one. This is a great one! The one I had previously the dogs could open and then the chickens would also get in there and I could never keep food. With the Vittle Vault that problem is no more. It locks securely to keep animals out and freshness in. Highly recommend it!
I think it's great but only if I can get my dog to fetch the ball back to me when we are outdoors! But at least I don't have to pick up slimy balls with my hands!

I had seen this dog food advertised on tv and figured i would give it a try.My dogs like it very much.They love people food but i know its not good to feed that to them.It comes in different sized bags and of course different varieties.I feed the dogs twice a day and that seems to be just right.Purina makes a good product and its a good company.The food is priced very well also.I highly recommend this product and im sure you will feel the same way.

The actual ingredients of NoviPet Calming Aid for Dogs - such as poultry meal, palm kernel oil, beeswax, pea protein, chamomile extract, vegetable oil, carnauba (palm) wax, l-taurine (organic acid found in animal tissue), thiamine monitrate (form of vitamin B1), lecithin (animal fat), ginger root, l-tryptophan (protein), a-tocopheryl acetate (vitamin E related) - suggest that giving the dog a fraction of the chamomile (extract) human dietary supplement dose equal to dogs weight divided by your body weight stuck into a small piece of chicken or similar dog's treat should do the trick at a fraction of the cost of these.
My mailbox is TWO BLOCKS from my condo.  Do you know how fun it is to carry a box of 24 cans of cat food TWO BLOCKS????  Shit, if I wanted to do that, I would buy my cat food from the grocery store!
summary: Amazon is now shipping these packs by US Mail!

reviewText: This came just as described. The cat goes crazy when I first put in the catnip, but the smell must wear off quickly (maybe would be good to buy higher quality catnip separately). Toy seems to be pretty durable.
My Akita heard the squeaker and immediately wanted to play with the toy. Can't wait to give it to him on Christmas
My two American bulldogs love Nylabones. I have to buy them dura chew items because they just shred all others. They like the texture, shape, and taste of this item a lot.
Very good heat emitter, keeps my Uro warm.  Has been working for weeks now, no cracks or chips, Highly recommend, have it in a Zilla 150Watt 8 1/2 dome.
summary: Very good heat emitter, keeps my Uro warm.

reviewText: This jacket is much bigger than the specified measurements - it is way too big for my dog and there is no hole for the leash to go through.

The bag says that it is PRE rinsed...don't believe it....I place in a 5 gallon bucket and ran water a hose at high pressure for about 15 minutes and it is still chocolate brown. I am afraid it is washing away some good silt, but the bag says to do it..I will bet I lost about a pound of silty material...it looks like small pieces of lava rock  or cinders..we'll see what it does later

When I first rescued my 2/3 year old black lab, he must have been a bit stressed out because he absolutely refused to eat these treats. I tried to be sneaky and put them with his kibble and he ate everything except the treats. I thought to myself, "great, what a waste of money", but once he got comfortable in his new home I tried the treats again and he absolutely loves them! He comes running up to me as soon as he hears me opening the bag. The nice thing is that these don't smell awful like most other treats. He doesn't eat any other hard/crunchy treats, but, like I said, he loves these. The ingredients list is super simple and doesn't have any ridiculous chemicals that I have to Google. I'm going to try a couple of other flavors from this company because I'm really satisfied with the way this one turned out.

I had planned to reorder at 2 months and 1 month after starting this treatment burn spots quickly returned. It is amazing but "two month supply" is inaccurate. As it is the only solution that works I am reordering now. Dogs were oblivious. To the rocks.
summary: Works perfectly although lasts only 1 month!

reviewText: However somehow they manage to pull them out of the accompanying rubber toy these are intended for in a short matter of time.  So unless you have a small and I mean petite dog I doubt these will last as long as desired.
summary: My dogs do love the taste!

reviewText: I own 2 different scoops by Zoo Med. One is more for scooping up big scoops of sand to sift through for cleanup. The other onetappers down more for getting into those corners where its had to the sand out. I'am so happy that Zoo Med came up with thesescoops.If your looking for something to clean that sand up quickly, this is what you need.Its a A+++++++++++ in my book.If Larrythe cable guy was with you, he would hand you one of these and say. Getter Done
My small dogs love this chew.  They still have it and the chihuahua will get it and climb on the couch with me.  She chews it while I watch tv.
My three boxers love the Chuckit Squirrel for outdoors... and decided to try the indoor version.  So far they are having fun with it and it is still intact.  I would purchase it again.

My puppy ignored this toy for weeks. I left it in his exercise pen filled with food.  One day he realized how to work it and now it's a favorite way to play. The item size needs to correspond to the dog size to ensure its not too easy or hard. My 10 pound dog has a small and it takes him about 10 minutes to get a 1/4 cup of food out of the toy.
Not too expensive, not too cheap. I have not noticed any rusting but then again I've had this for about less than 3 weeks. I like it, it's simple and does the job.
good product excellent, the large is big enough for my 130 lbs Rottweiler and he loves it because it stay's cool withjout having to cool it! A+ product

I'm not a fan of chain collars in general, but when I have to use one on a dog I prefer this half-chain martingale stye - which, if fitted correctly, cannot choke the dog. I used this one to help my new adult dog make the transition from wearing a full chain collar to wearing a flat fabric collar for training/working. The color of the purple 1-inch, X-Large collar I received isn't nearly as bold as the picture appears on my computer screen, but it's still an okay color. The nylon fabric is soft, not stiff (even after washing), and the collar is sturdy.  I also really like the reflective thread stitching that runs near both edges of the collar - a bit of added safety for early morning or evening walks.

This thing is just terrific! My pup mows through food like she's starving to death and someone is going to take it away from her. This thing slows her way down, helping with her digestion and defending against bloat. It's a terrific tool for occupying her mind and energy when I need to leave her alone. I was worried about the hole being too small, but her kibble is really little so it dumps out pretty well when she topples it around. If it were bigger kibble then I'd still wonder about the hole maybe being too small... I highly recommend this thing.

Keeps my 2 year teddy bear busy. He likes this toy very much and it makes him work a little for his treats. I've had it for about 6 months and its still working however its obviously torn up a bit. I see myself ordering a replacement before the end of this year.

I don't know when/where I got my first fire plug. It probably came with a rescue dog, because I don't normally buy toys that are this expensive. However this item has been SO successful that now I am looking to buy more of both sizes. I feed kibble meals in it, and if I put a bigger biscuit in there the dogs learn to insert their entire lower jaw so they can break the biscuit and get it out in pieces.  After mealtime, the fire plug (and the everlasting treat ball) are coveted toys on the playground.  :-)  I don't understand why the squishy, stretchy-but-strong material holds up for some dogs and not for others, but I can say MY everlasting items are holding up BEAUTIFULLY with long-term abuse from several dogs, including a typical 80 pound destructo-Lab.
Both of my cats play with this squirrel partly because it is good prey size, but mostly because they try to eat out the catnip inside.  I love that it is easy to refill with catnip.
summary: Cats love it.  You will need extra catnip.

reviewText: I know these are super expensive in the store, thought I would take try on this discounted one.  My dog wouldn't touch it.  I was actually afraid it would splinter it is so thin.

I only gave four stars because I really don't know if these products work, but they certainly are easy to use.Been using them for a couple of months now, and so far no tartar. But, saying that, my dogs just had dental cleaning at the vet prior to this purchase, and I'm using these to try to prevent future vet dental cleanings. Of course,  the "spray" is the easiest to use. I am wondering if it's as good as the paste used with my doggie toothbrush??? I use the paste about once-a-week, and the spray daily.  The dogs seems to like the taste just fine.
Probably due to packng however no nozzle was sent with item, Shampoo is great though and if had the nozzle would have rated a 5

Can not use the tube, will not fit inside of tank. Great filter for a fry or shrimp tank. I will use without the tube but with an air stone to quiet the air bubbles because the tank is in the bedroom.

reviewText: My Boston Terrier puppy looked too small to play with this massive soft rubber tire. Oh, but he loves it!  We've threaded toys through the hole and he slings it around outside .. He just liked to gnaw on it a lot--- he's cutting teeth and the cool soft gel must feel good on his gums. He had all the Orca toys and he loves them all!
summary: Another Great Orca Toy!!! Love It!!

reviewText: My dog normally eats ANYTHING.  In fact, he ate my $130 Senheiser headphones just three weeks ago.  And he usually scarfs up doggie treats in two seconds.  But when I gave him this bone, he started to eat it, but then just left it alone for a few hours.  He eventually ate the whole thing.  Or buried it, I don't know.  I can't find it now.  But he doesn't bury anything AFAIK.  So,,,, the non-picky eater was picky with this bone.  I was shocked.  I was going to give it one star, but hey... maybe this was just a bad one or maybe my dog had a stomach ache.  Either way, I'm not buying again.
summary: Nope, dog didn't like it for some reason?

reviewText: This nail dremel runs smoother and faster than the average store bought trimmers in comparable price range. Faster trimming means less stress for you and your pet. Does great and handles nicely. Always cut your pets nails first before filing. Dont use a dremel to completely trim your dog's nails, you'll spend forever doing one nail and wasting many batteries and your dog wont want to spend hours waiting for you to finish his/her nails.

I use these pads in some of my older power filters, which are now dedicated for use as mechanical micron filters.I have six planted aquaria, so weekly micron filtering is an important part of keeping the water columns in these tanks - as well as their fauna and flora -  healthy.I use Aquaclear filters to micron these tanks.  The lowest pad is the sponge which came with the filter. I then add one of these pads, and then for fine filtering a Buon Vino 0.5 micron filter pad.  This gives me the ability to remove particulate down to a half a micron in size. This is even better than a diatomaceous earth filter.

This de-shedding tool works alright on dogs with the correct length hair - if their hair is too short, or too long for the specific de-shedding tool, it doesn't work all that well. I have 3 dogs, with 3 different types of fur - it takes too much hair off of my Sheltie, and not enough off of my short-haired dog.
Needed for certain Marineland canister filters, works as described. Aids in the cleansing of particulate matter entering the filter. 5 Stars.

Long story short- I've become the crazy cat lady at only 25. I have 4 indoor cats. Two from college get along like best friends and two not so much. My late mother's cat, and an aunt that moved, left me with a mess. My aunt's male is anxious and my mom's female is territorial. This combination has caused the cats to take extra time to get acquainted- lots of spats and occasional hissing/growling. The female was spraying. She seemed to stop and now the anxious male started spraying...great!AFTER VERIFYING THAT HE HAD NO MEDICAL ISSUES SUCH AS A BLADDER INFECTION via a full blood chem panel and urinalysis at the vet's office. I tried the calming collar. He and my mom's cat now wear it. They have both mellowed out: the girl is sweet and loving, she doesn't over lick causing skin issues, the boy doesn't run every time there's a loud noise, he's stopped spraying, and they both seem like they might even play together one day. They've been living together for about 6 months now.My local vet is the second vet I've had to recommend calming collars and/or Feliway. I swear it works. I know some people say it doesn't- which it probably doesn't for them. Not all cats react to catnip, so it makes sense that not all cats will react to the pheromones, but it's saved my house. I can't imagine life without this product! It's worth the shot of spending $20 to save your sanity, furniture, clothes, house, and ensure your friends aren't scared to come to the House of Cat Pee.

I vary my dog's food every bag and notice a significant difference in energy levels, stool consistency, and shedding and dander.  My dog is also a picky eater so taste plays a role as well.  Here's my experience:Quality:  it does seem like a high quality product with good ingredientsStool:  soft and smallShedding:  a lot of hair and a fair amount of danderTaste:  he's indifferent towards this one

I have historically taken my GSD to PetSmart for "Furminator" de-shedding treatments. I considered purchasing the Furminator tool for home use, but found the cost a bit prohibitive. But, when I saw this tool, I was game. I paid 14.97 and it works GREAT! I am amazed at the difference in my dog's coat after using this. If you have been considering the Furminator, but would like a less expensive option, this might just be the product for you.

My dog is spoiled. She was a rescue, but I think she forgets this. When I buy her food with crunchy dog food and soft pieces mixed up, she typically only eats the the soft pieces. And when there are both red and yellow soft dog pieces, she picks out the yellow pieces first. So, due to my dog's finicky eating habits, I did not have much hope that this dog food would impress here. Still, I try to expose her to different crunchy dog foods in hopes she will like one. True to prediction, my dog was not interested in this particular dog food.
Yes it has memory foam and includes two covers. WhenI first opened it I thought I would not like it but as I put the cover on and put down It was great and my Austrailian Shepard loves it,
is huge!  easy to set up even without instructions, well made.  my dog loves it even more than his regular metal crate.  has plenty of storage pockets to keep all of the little items.
I ordered 2 of these and got them yesterday, my pups love it!. They chew on every part of it and it keeps them occupied for a long time!

My goof.  I guess I didn't read it correctly.  I like the litter the clumps, this is the old way litter....it does not clump.  I have it in the back of my care for weight in the snow, and to help if anyone is stuck.
I always look at pet stores for this product, and the price is easily double what I paid for this. I really appreciate knowing that there is a better deal - thank you for providing it!

I bought this because my dog pulls all the time and a trainer had suggested a nose type collar. My arm hurts all the time from her constant pulling and she has a few times almost made me fall. This collar would not fit her right with no amount of adjustment, it put pressure on her eyes. I don't know if my german shorthair's eyes are placed any differently than any other dog but the strap would not stay down on her nose at all. I do not want to do any damage to her so I returned the collar.Note--  I do not see how playing tug of war would make a dog walk on a leash properly. (a poster from above) I have tried using treats, voice commands, etc and nothing works to control her pulling.

Another dog training device I should have returned.  Bought it to keep the dog out of the laundry room where the cat food and litter are.  Took me a couple of months to work up the nerve to use it. When I took the time to read the directions I realized it can't be used around appliances - which of course I have in my laundry room.

My dog is spoiled. She was a rescue, but I think she forgets this. When I buy her food with crunchy dog food and soft pieces mixed up, she typically only eats the the soft pieces. And when there are both red and yellow soft dog pieces, she picks out the yellow pieces first. So, due to my dog's finicky eating habits, I did not have much hope that this dog food would impress here. Still, I try to expose her to different crunchy dog foods in hopes she will like one. True to prediction, my dog was not interested in this particular dog food.  My dog is about 15 lbs and the food, if she likes it, would a type that she could easily consumed as the pieces are not overly large. When I provided her with a bowl of the food, she licked it and picked out a couple of pieces, rolled over the pieces, and then proceeded to look at me like I was a bad owner.  While this food was not a hit with my dog, I'm sure it would work for a less spoiled dog.
summary: My dog was not a fan.

reviewText: This is my second go-around buying this product.  The 1st one broke at the joint that connects the two panes of glass after about only 1 year.  Now to be honest I don't completely blame the manufacturer.  I'm subjecting them to a good amount of heat.  I'm using them for African Spur Thigh Tortoises and tend to keep the terrarium temperature at around 80-95 degrees.  I'm sure that has contributed to their premature deterioration.  On the other hand they fit perfectly on the tank with very little loss of heat.  I would recommend this product, but if you're using it like I do just expect to replace it in about a year.

Lady Mary Katherine's a Maltipoo, so smart that she's actually posted messages to Faceb**k on my behalf and once -- with paws striking keys as she searched for crumbs on my desktop -- g**gled up some used-car dealers in Istanbul. (It's that Poodle brain, I think.)It goes without saying, therefore, that Lady Mary Katherine's a splendid analyst, critic, and judge of dog toys. She prefers those that squeak, squeal, or yelp pathetically, since those are more likely to engage Daddy (whom she adores) for good or for ill. (Again, it's that Poodle brain....)Lady Mary Katherine has three toys in this series: The Dog, The Goat, and The Sheep. Each makes an obnoxious noise sufficient to distract any Daddy so obsessed with his work that he foolishly believes he hasn't time to play with Lady Mary Katherine. Her favorite and most likely to be played with at bedtime, as we are trying to fall asleep, is The Sheep. But when The Sheep can't be found, The Dog or The Goat will do fine.None of these toys makes a sound anything like the animals they were designed to emulate. But Lady Mary Katherine likes them all. And is likely to buy more when I'm not looking.Not for strong, destructive chewers. But for those who like to carry toys about the house, darn near perfect.

We have two of the Orka toys which have lasted years.  Unless your dog is a very powerful chewer, this toy will last.  Our German Shepherd did destroy one of these, but our lab and pointer mix have had it for over a year now with no issues.  Great also for puppies or older dogs.  Our lab has broken a tooth before on a Nylabone (which required a $250 tooth extraction), so I love it that I don't have to worry about him doing that with the Orka products.  Highly recommended.

My cats have eaten Natural Balance dry since they've been kittens and of all the foods I've tried, this is the food they enjoy the most and their health has been perfect. Shiny coats, clear eyes, no allergy problems or health problems of any kind. My only vet bills have been for annual exams and vaccinations. I've recently added Natural Balance canned to their diet and I'm happy I did. They both love the food and seem a little more satisfied than with only feeding the dry food. I feel good about feeding them a food with high quality ingredients and the reduced calorie formula is great for my cats since they're strictly indoor and one of them tends to put on a little weight on regular calorie food. I'd recommend this food to anyone who wants to give their cats the best food for their health.
summary: Cats doing very well on this food

reviewText: I've had all 4 of my dogs on Frontline Plus as long as I have had them. I've never had a flea problem and rarely if ever find ticks on them. I am a Vet Tech and at our office we don't sell Frontline anymore as people were complaining  that it wasn't working, but I personally have never had a problem and am very happy with it.

I am a pro trainer and use e collars. To my dismay the doxie that arrived a week ago,was only 5.5 lbs, not ten lbs, and screamimg loud enough to break the gates of hell. I first made a lot of life adjustments for the cute thing, then used this.When used properly results are stunning. Miss moppet is quiet, comes from 100 feet off leash and is well mannered. does not jump up and will drop the toy now.I really did not think I could find a collar small enough for this dog. This collar is just a bit big for her, and it works.Its not rechargeable, I cringe every time I forget to turn it off. Batteries are standard, not speacle, which is nice. I did not buy on amazon, I could not find it at the time I was having a panic attack, but will buy in the future. Used carefully its a great tool, this dog is not a creampuff.update, I have bought three of these from amazon. sometimes yu get a dud, sometimes the the switch under the batteries needs to be lifted for proper connection. its a cheap , cheap collar, but it works, worth fuzzing over .

This is a must have with a litter of puppies who find dragging their training pads around to be high entertainment.  But a constantly moving pad or one that is crumpled up is not going to properly potty train them.  When I saw this item I was so happy, such a simple thing can make your life so much easier.  Now the puppies know where to find their pad AND they can not play with it.  PERFECT!
My dogs loves the treat and doesn't have any adverse reactions like gas. I prefer this treat to biscuits with flour and fillers.

I, like probably many of you, have been going nuts about this "Jerky from China" situation...  Every product I have found has" Made in China" in small print somewhere at the bottom of the package.  I don't think using pet treats from China is a good idea right now...  I have been researching companies and this is what I found from The Real Meat Co. sales dept:The Real Meat Company products are made in the USA and meats sourced from USA, New Zealand and Australia.1. The meat in our products is sourced from only the finest farms, free ranging and humanely raised without growth hormones or antibiotics and our fish are from the deep clear oceans of the South Pacific.2. There are NO ingredients from china.3. We do not use any grains and have no wheat or gluten.4. No preservatives, no anti-biotic, no flavorings, no growth hormones, no colorings.5. It is not irradiated.6. Every shipment of meat carries USDA, FDA certification. (believe it, they check all small companies)7. They're YUMMY! HEALTHY! And four footers LOVE Real Meat Foods and Treats.====OK - No "Made in China" and no "irradiation" - Yah !!!!  These sound like a safe option.  I have ordered the lamb and the venison and am hoping for the best....Update:OK - These came yesterday and my dogs love them - they actually all took off to separate corners to eat their treat.  I like that they are small and easy to chew or tear... no choking...

Hill's Ideal Balance Grain Free Natural Chicken and Potato Recipe Adult Cats Dry Food provides my cats with an optimum diet that keeps them healthier. In my opinion, spending a little more on quality pet food means spending a little less on future vet bills. While no food is a guarantee against every health problem, keeping your pet at their prime with the help of a good, high quality food like Hill's products is a good start.One of my cats, an abandoned cat I took in, has a history of repeated UTI's. I'm hoping the cranberries included in the ingredients will help her bladder stay clear of the infectious nasties.My cats love the flavor. They were satisfied with the recommended amount fed too.
summary: All Natural Blanced Diet All My Cats Love

reviewText: I love them and so does my 100lb golden retriever.  He has had lots of trouble with teeth, gums, tartar and ulcers.  These along with brushing teeth, and dental gel have helped a lot.  It has taken all to bring under control and keep under control

This product is a real bargain, considering the fact that dogs love liver. I've used this as an addition to another dog treat product I use for my dog. My dog goes nuts when he knows that he's about to be rewarded withPro-Treat Beef Liver treats. The instructions advise to give 2-3 pieces per day when using. At this rate, the container will last you a good while. The product itself is very fresh and the pieces are all of various sizes and thickness. Average size of treat is small rectangular pieces of different thickness. They're easy to break into smaller pieces if necessary. My Springer Spaniel pup is 5 months old and he just loves these. I tried this product on my girlfriend's 10 yr old teacup Poodle, who is pretty slow at this point in her life. She absolutely came to life and jumped all over the place for a taste of one of these treats. Buy it....your dog will love it!

Everything you need to get your water changed and PH buffered correctly. I use before and after every water change and after a while you really can not live without these little quick dip tests. I stuck one of mine in a cup of coffe once to check the PH and it was actually reading a 4.6 which happens to be the average PH of all Coffe.Go for these test strips with a PH 7.0 buffer for keeping your fish happy. I triggered an algae bloom my first time buffering and I wish I  was not out of my test strips at the time because between this and a seachem stick on PH meter that happen to work for 1 year....you cannot beat a water change with a slow PH buffering solution which is basicly baking soda or calcium carbonate. It works almost like Tums.
I am not sure how accurate but they seem to work fine.  They could make the color chart more waterproof.  Be careful when comparing.

I tuck this Heartbeat Pillow in Anoush's crate under her mat.  When she goes in her crate I activate the heartbeat you hear too and shut the door.  I don't know if it helps her, but it helps me knowing she hears a heartbeat.  I would buy this BEFORE you get your puppy.

We have lots of animals, who all get along, EXCEPT one of our dogs tortures our black cat Gabby. Gabby tried to find a safe place on top of a dresser of drawers, but the dog kept leaping up at her and barking. The dog was trying to play, but the cat was frightened, and felt unable to protect herself. To the rescue came the AlphaPooch cat tent. It opens automatically, so it was ready to go in a few seconds. It's soft all over, which means it's very comfy, even for a frightened cat. It's ultra portable, which means we can easily transport the cat inside the tent. No, the dog hasn't stopped trying to jump in Gabby's face, but the tent has made things much better. So we ordered one for our other cat, and now she's nice and comfy too.
summary: Our cats love their AlpaPooch cat tents

reviewText: My dog has a horrible coat, looses hair etc so he needs omega 3s - this has a pump! None of the others I have used do and seems to work as well as the more expensive brands. My budget forced me to try something that costs less and I am so happy I did try it! My dogs coat is still looking good.

reviewText: We have tried MULTIPLE devices to stop our Border/Aussie from commencing with her high-pitched annoying emotional barking that she does only at CERTAIN times over CERTAIN activities.  Like when daddy leaves for the day, even though she knows he ALWAYS returns!  Anyway, this is ok, except that we have TWO rescues, and the other is calm and wonderful when daddy is leaving.  It is very difficult to use this for only one dog because it is not used 'in combination' with a collar, so it affects both.  The one that DOESN'T need it seems to hear it and react (unpleasantly) and the one that needs it, just disregards it as not as important as what is going on that is exciting her, LOL.  We got better results with a prior gadget which I thought we also got from Amazon and had a green 'remote'.  We went back to it.
summary: Decent, but if you have more than one dog, iffy

reviewText: Long lasting chew.  Takes my Lab longer to eat through this than eat through any bully stick. Often take it away so he's not eating all at one time.

The Large tray is actually 41 x 27 1/4".  The size discrepancy doesn't matter for me because I'm using it as protection under the cat bed and water bowl.  My cat has developed urinary issues in her old age and sometimes has accidents in her bed.  In addition she uses her paw to dip it in the water and lick it off. reviewText: My 10-week old puppy loves this carrier.  It is very much like being carried by his mother.  He feels safe and secure.  In fact, he often falls asleep while in it.  He can see the world around him, yet he feels safe close to me and in a natural position.  I am so glad I took a chance on this.  Worth every penny!

reviewText: The PetSafe Gentle Leader Headcollar was so easy to fit and use.  It was hard to believe something so small and so light in weight could tame the puppy so quickly.  Unbelievable.  Really was a pleasant surprise.  A million thanks.  Ron

reviewText: I have a 10 lb and a 75 lb dog.  This is impractical for neither.  It's too big for the 10lb dog and too small for the 75 lb dog (who treats it as a chew toy).  The ID tag holder is VERY flimsy and the leash is like the ones used in the dog shows (about 1/16").It does have a good advantage that when traveling the leash is always there on the dog, but the dog doesn't like it and the leash measures 3' 10" long, with a recoil spring that will hit your dog in the face if you let go of the handle.Overall, neither of my dogs nor me were impressed with the product - it borders on 2 stars.

reviewText: I have used this for my 8 month old GSD.She does not have the best recall yet and until i know she will have a good recall she has to be on this 50 foot lead.I use it on dirt roads, hiking, for her to play in a field with. These are just really cute and our little dog must think so, too.  He carries them around and only occasionally will decide to remove the squeaker by taking off the leg.  The mouth stitching is weak and the first to go.  It should be more of a continuous stitching instead of a long thread attached on each end.  The design is cute enough even for little kids and adults who are charmed by such things.  Why they call it a squirrel when it looks like a chipmunk is a bit quirky to me.

I like it, although it was smaller than I thought it would be.  I looked under litter boxes for large cats, but it is big enough for my smaller one. Another funny little toy.....sounds like a Chimp! Like the Kitty, his voice is soft and funny, not nerve racking!My little rescue Chihuahua has to carefully bite around a bit before he makes it squeak......all the more entertaining for him!I would highly recommend these small soft animal toys for tiny teen or adult dogs....but then I guess it all depends on the dog!The manufacturer's tag tells you not to leave your pet alone with any toy that has a squeaker...I think thats wise.

Yes, these are expensive cat treats but Amazon is the best value and I think they're worth it.  My cat has had some digestive issues and these treats are very high quality.  I did buy the salmon and beef varieties also but these are the only ones she eats.  We will keep buying as they do last quite awhile.

We have a German Sheppard and he loves chew toys with squeakers.  It's a bit small for him but he likes it just the same.  He did manage to kill the squeaker in about 4 chomps but still picks it up and caries it around on a regular basis. my three cats love this product, especially my little one who is only 5 months old.  It gives him something to do besides chase and bite my two older female cats.  When he first saw it he was awed, he keep waiting for the mouse to come out and when he did, he (my cat) tried to catch him.  It is so much fun to watch them, they are my little bundles of joy!  Thanks Guys at Amazon for such wonderful cat toys and God Bless!  Clara

The WalkieWay Safety Collar (in Small) is a collar with a retractable leash built-in.  The idea of the product is that your dog will wear this collar and you will always have a leash built in, just in case you go off-lead and Fido decides to bolt.  You are supposed to reach down and grab the collar, at which time, a thin, strong leash will unreel from the holder.  It has about a two-finger wide handle attached to a thin lead.Here is the major problem with this product (and I tried it on both my dog and gave it to my sister-in-law to try on her dog--really wanted to like this product!): When your small dog has this collar on, the leash part is heavy and bulky.  Because it is the heaviest part of the collar, it naturally ends up under the dog's neck. Both dogs were very irritated by the leash holder, as it bonked against their chest as they tried to walk (my sister-in-law's dog tried to chew it off).  When trying to quickly grab the leash, it was almost impossible to grab because the leash was underneath the dog.  I ended up grabbing the collar, flipping it around and then accessing the leash.  In the case of a quick grab, this product did not help at all.  Also, the leash is not that long.  Imagine a small dog, only about 6-8" max. above ground.  Once I had a hold of the leash, the total length was barely enough so that the dog could walk (and I am a short person).In summary, I would not recommend this product for a small dog.  Perhaps the larger models work better, both due to the size of the animal/leash holder ratio and the height from the neck to the hand of the owner for leash length.  But for a small dog, no way!
summary: Not a product for small dogs...at all!

reviewText: Great ball, but make sure to use this as a kick ball and not a chew toy. Very first day I got the ball my dog was all over it. She began biting it and tried taking chunks out of it. She practically bit my head off when I tried to take it away. She definitely loves it. It is made pretty rugged and should last you, so long as you dont use it as a chew toy. Use it for fetch only. Otherwise, Im sure a dog can take this thing apart if left alone with it long enough. My dog has been able to puncture the ball with her teeth in many areas of the ball. But the ball is still solid and has not been torn to shreds yet. The great thing about this ball is the ease with which a dog can grab this thing in their mouth. Its the only ball of this kind that I have found. It kicks straight like any other ball, ragardless of the gaps and ridges on the ball. I personally think its money well spent.

My Weimaraner hates anyone messing with her feet, and it's a chore to trim her nails. I saw the TV ads and thought, hallelujah, finally something to make it easier on her and me. But she cannot get used to the noise (even thought I follow the instructions and try to get her acclimated) and hates the vibration against her nails. In fact, she runs when she sees me coming, PediPaws in hand. The PediPaws seems to run down the longer you use it, and for me is hard to use - trying to make sure I've trimmed the nail (with a squirming dog) just the right amount.All in all, it's better than the clippers and more safe. Here's hoping a better version comes along.

My dog really likes these treats. They deserve 5 stars because of that, but I had to give them 4 because they were quite salty. The ingredients does list salt on there, but maybe they added too much. I love salty foods they are too salty even for me. Yes yes I tried a tiny piece of the treats, and it wasn't bad at all! It tasted just as I thought dried salmon would taste hahaha Anyway, I might contact the company to see what they say and if they would consider cutting back on how much salt they use!update (3/22/2013): just realized I didn't give much detail about the treats. They are kind of like freeze dried bites if you've ever tried it. These treats aren't jerky. It was probably ground up fish that were molded into 1.5 inch by 1 inch and then baked or however they dry it. These can get messy if it gets crumbled too much, but I'm sure my dog will just lick it up off the floor. Anyways, other than the salt issue that I have, I do recommend these treats!

Although Amazon Prime is still over a hundred, it's priced lower than what I paid a couple of  weeks ago. Previous to this one, my two adult cats enjoyed the one at half the price (Go Pet Club Cat Tree Beige Color).  It's a great introductory tree--if you can anchor it to the floor.  Soon my cats were toppling the entire structure on a regular basis.  The pictured one, however, has a much wider base and is, overall, better balanced and more stable.As others have mentioned, it's essential to tighten all parts to the max.  I regret not applying some extra muscle to the parts assembled by my wife, because the highest platform broke loose on the second day when my heavy black cat jumped up to its surface. I have yet to test the company's responsiveness to a request for another platform.  In the meantime, my cats are quite content with two platforms instead of three.Compared to the less expensive tree, this one has wider platforms with ledges, and my cats obviously take to them more than the smaller, plainer platforms, remaining content to sleep on them or to simply survey the curious humans below for hours at a time.  Moreover, I'm finding that the previous, smaller and lower tree still can be used productively, since cats are more than bird-catchers: they enjoy "flying"--from one vertiginous precipice to the next.  But expect to hear the sound of periodic thunderous crashes--unless you're able to anchor the bases securely.Of course, there are parts that go unused, making me wonder if the manufacturer actually tested these cat attractions with real cats.  Neither of my cats (one a runt) ever used the lower enclosed part on the earlier model.  On the this model, they've ignored both ladders altogether (may as well toss the lower one), and only the higher, smaller enclosure has occasionally seen some occupancy.I've owned 10 cats (or vice versa), but most were obtained as kittens, which I was able to convince were dogs.  In each case, the relationship took priority over cats' more "picturesque posturings."  But since I began adopting adult cats from the shelter--animals with ingrained habits and inherited traits--the tree towers have given both the cats and their guardians the greatest gratification.
summary: Easily worth twice the price (buy direct from Amazon, tighten all parts thoroughly)

reviewText: Our cat absolutely loves this.  It is big enough for a large cat and so far the toys have held up.  Easy to put together.

This tool grinds my 61 pound Standard Poodle's nails without clipping. He is comfortable with it. It does use up batteries fairly quickly, so you need to stock up. Might try the Pedicure tool instead, if you have multiple dogs to do. But this one works better for us than the Pedicure.Unlike the Dremel, this tool does not release nail dust all over the place. I have been ill from that, and don't dare use a Dremel for dog nails any more because of it.Also unlike the Dremel, this tool does not catch dog fur when working. That is fantastic.The speed is fairly slow, but actually it needs to be slower than a Dremel can go. That's really too fast for dog nails.I like the big sanding band on this. It's much bigger than the one on the Pedicure, and seems to work much more reliably.This tool is not perfect. But it is really good.
My dogs have been on The Missing Link Hip & Joint for years now and it has done wonders to their skin, coat, digestion, joints, and energy.  Can't go wrong adding Missing Link

My little dogs LOVE these- They smell really bad, but that is why my dogs love them. I have a big dog and he needs to eat several of these to make the dose.  He does seem to like them - he'll come over to get them, but he will only eat about 3 and then he is done.  They might make him thirsty, a few times he has left getting treats to go to the water bowl.  I have to divide his 'dose' in half and give him the treats twice a day instead of once a day.He's an older dog with arthritis, and he has been very active since he's been getting these.  I noticed it about 3 days in.  I'm not sure if that's a good thing though, because he's mainly just barking at everything in sight and wanting to go in and out of the house, like he's nervous.I've used a lot of products in this brand, and it's a brand that I trust.  They seem to know what they are doing with their supplements; my old cat has benefited greatly from them.ETA I ended up buying these repeatedly, as they did help my dog be more active.  After he ran out, it was easier to tell they helped.  He never would eat but one or two at a time though.  He finally died of old age, but he walked good, it was only the day before he died that I could tell he was having trouble.
