Very happy with the API FW/SW PHOSPHATE TEST KIT. It is so important to test for phosphates to head off algae issues. The kit arrived on time and works well.

My 3 year old lab loves this toy!  He like to play interactively with us and the toy, or just entertains himself by carrying it around and squeeking it.Caution: my dog is not a heavy chewer of plush toys.  I'm not sure how this would hold up to a dog that loves to destroy plush things. I hide this toy when my dog's friend comes over since his friend destroys all plush toys and my dog loves his Nubby so much.
summary: My lab loves to squeek his Nubby!

reviewText: Elk is the choice of Antlers my dog likes and he is a picky one.  He is a Pit Bull and can chew up most anything in a matter of minutes, not these elk antlers.  These last a while for heavy chewers and the price point on Amazon is great!  Buy a few and give them at the same time.  No dog is bored with these and they love getting to the center, kinda like a tootsie pop for dogs :)

Very easy to use test.  Very easy to read chart.  Clear and easy to understand instructions.  Called the water company to get their phosphate levels, checked my tap, got an accurate result.  Now I can maintain my water properties for my planted tank with confidence.

I was totally surprised at the quality of this product when I removed it from the carton.  It is made of heavy duty stainless steel and for $9, I was expecting something light weight and cheaply made.  It has a rubber rim at the base to keep it from sliding, though luckily, it fit right into the raised feeder.  I was happy that I read other peoples comments about the sizing and bought the medium bowl as it is perfect for my 110 lb Rottweiler----a large bowl would have made it too easy for him to eat and defeated the purpose.

Certain copper tests don't work with certain copper treatment because of the type of copper they test for. This test works with Coppersafe, which is what I use for treatment in my hospital tank. It works extremely well and is easy to read and accurate.

My Frenchie loves it.  She eats almost all of it (we feed her 2x/day) and stops when she's full.  I usually add 1/2 tsp of greek yogurt to her breakfast portion.  Her stool is firm and she's eats and goes on a pretty regular schedule.  It's pretty stinky when she passes gas, but it's not that frequently.  I haven't found a dog food to solve that problem though!  Overall, I'm very happy with this food for now (we've only been on it for a little over a week).  FYI stats: our pup is 12 weeks, eats 1-1.5 cups per day, about 8.5 lbs

I decided to get "Purina Fancy Feast Mornings Medley with Trout in Sauce" for my Cats to try it, anything with Sauce they like to lick their Bowls Dry. I was Amazed to see how much they like the Rich, Thick and Tasty Sauce and they eat most of the Tiny Pieces of Fish. I'm always looking for different flavors and Brands of Cat Food since my Cats are a little Finicky and they get bored when eating the same flavor too often, I give them "Mornings Medley" and they enjoy eating it maybe once or twice a week. The List of Ingredients is Long and Complex with all kinds of Vitamins, Minerals and Nutrients all supposed to be Good for Cats. I'm glad Purina Fancy Feast has such diversity of flavors to choose from and make my Cats Happy and Healthy. I get "Purina Fancy Feast" locally where I live, I prefer to buy a couple of Cans for my Cats to try it out and see if they like it, so I don't get stuck with 24 Cans if they don't. "Fancy Feast Mornings Medley with Trout in Sauce" they do like it and is another Great Cat Food for my Cats! ...Thank You D.D.

Saw a similar pen at a retail store for four times the cost. Decided to take a chance based on other customer reviews and we love this pen! Perfect for Ella, our very active Maltipoo puppy. She's a small dog so there's room for her fleece bed, toys and training pad for when we have to leave for a little while, or if I'm cooking and can't supervise her every move. Good quality and I like that you can adjust the size. Literally you can make it a 2' square or expand it all the way out. There are eight 2' panels all together and they are assembled, just all folded up together so setup was a snap. There is a reason this is top rated on Amazon and I'm soooo happy I found this for our baby! Will def take it outside in nicer weather. There are ground anchors as well for those who may need them.

My large dog eats 5-6 cups of medium size kibble daily.  He literally inhales his food. For the past 2 years, I've been using the Skid Stop Large Dog bowl, but that only slightly stopped my dog from wolfing down his food.The Kyjen Slo-Bowl Slow Feeder is wider than the Skid Stop, but it is shorter.  I was concerned that it wouldn't be able to hold all of the dog food needed by my large dog, but, surprisingly, the Kyjen bowl will hold the food with just a little mounding.Once my dog eats down the mound of food, he has to really work at getting the rest of his kibble - his eating has slowed considerably!The Kyjen bowl works well - highly recommended!
summary: Works Well! Significantly Slows down My Chow Hound

reviewText: I ordered Bio-Groom Natural Oatmeal ANti-Itch Dog Shampoo & Bio-Groom Pet Silk Moisturizing Creme Rinse. I was made to believe that if i buy both, i could get this for free. I guess it didn't coz i got charged for it. Oh well.Pump didn't work for a few tries.I attached it on the gallon container of the bio groom creme rinse, fits perfect but I had to pump more than 20 times and repositioned it 4x for it to work. Eventually it did work!
summary: I thought this came in for free

reviewText: WOnderful starter bowls for little puppies!!Used these when my 2 were very little. Have had to upgrade bowls-not large enough for water. dogs weigh 16 lbs now. Still use and take to grandmas on trips!!
It's hard to complain because you do get what you paid for and understand this is just a cloth that wraps around your dog but that's what I Snuggie really is.
summary: You get what you pay for

reviewText: Worked right away.  Been going for a few months now.  Won't really be able to say it is a great indicator unless we have a water problem b/c it has always been yellow.  A long as my Oscar is feeling good and it is yellow I am happy.
Nice harness! It adjusts from very small, for a kitten, to large. It certainly will fit up to any "normal" size large house cat.

My picky cat doesn't adore these, but he will eat a couple now and then. I don't think the flavor/smell really is all that tempting for the cats, so if yours is a picky eater this might not work out for you.In terms of health, the ingredients are good. They almost always are with this brand, which is why I regularly get their stuff. If your cat enjoys these treats, then you're doing right by them with these treats.

This sticky paws is essentially an overpriced large piece of tape. My cats clawed right thru it and didn't care about the sticky (because it was only sticky for a day). Then my cats started chewing pieces off! Not for my household of 6 cats.

I love the unit but wish they would have added four more bolt holes to it. Even though it is designed for up to a 15 pound cat, I wanted a little more security between the two haves. They included extra nuts and bolts which is a plus. I drilled four more holes and added the nuts/bolts. Great unit
summary: Petmate Sky Kennel for Pets Up to 15-Pound, Light Gray

reviewText: My dog loves the flavor.  They are corn, wheat and soy free so there is less chance of allergies for dogs with sensitive stomachs. They are z-shaped and easy to separate into smaller pieces.  They would be perfect if they were round so they would more easily roll in her treat ball. I also recommend keeping them package zipped.  They will dry out in a day or two if left out.
My dogs absolutely love these treats and I like them as they are hard so it is a good work out for the teeth and gums.  Have 5 labs so always but a 20 lb box.
This ball was bigger than I thought it be and is hard pastic.  This would be a great toy for large dogs.

I have to admit, I originally only gave this 4 stars, but then reconsidered because of my reasoning behind it.  This unit charges quick, holds a charge for quite some time, and works great, but it is under-powered for my 70 pound puppy.  When it first comes off the charger it works great, but after half a day of being on, I have to crank it up to 90 or 100 to get a response from her.  Usually it is for silly things like chewing her dog house or digging under a fence - just little behaviors that I'd like her to reconsider on her own without me opening a door and having to scold her.  So, it's not a huge deal if I have to turn it up, but I'd never trust this unit to stop her in her tracks and get her attention if she was really focused on something.I did use it on a deaf French Bulldog for barking in her crate after she was done eating her breakfast a few times, and it worked great.  40 totally got the job done, and she's now very quiet and waits patiently until I let her out after she eats.  We are hoping to use the vibration mode on the unit to teach this dog a recall since she can't hear us and she can't see us unless she's looking in our direction.  We live on 100 acres and would like to let her run loose with us, but without a solid recall, I'm not comfortable doing this.  I think the IQ will allow her more freedom and me some peace of mind!
summary: Nice unit, works great, good customer support!

reviewText: This really only gets played with with our other outdoor Jolly Pet toys are not out, so it is the least favorite. But it stands up well to the pawing and chasing.
I like the ruff weather ones better by Ideal but if you want to save money these work just fine.
I have a guppy tank, started with two males and females and said let them breed.  Doing a good job growing.They attack the fish to eat more of these can other stuff
summary: fish eat a lot of this

reviewText: Our destructo Australian Shepherd seems incapable of destroying this ball!  He's gotten to where he can put his teeth into it to bring it back to me, but it hasn't deflated!  SCORE!!!  He's in love with this ball and the bonus is it wears him out!

I don't consider my kitties picky eaters and when the vet recommended a hypoallergenic food for my older one, I gave this a shot. My 7 year old female manx was the only one that chowed it and when given the option, she wanted her "regular" food. I mix some in with her other food and she will sometimes eat the Natural Balance and sometimes leave it. I can't speak to the health benefits since the taste wasn't that palatable for any of my 3 kitties with only one saying "meh" about it.
My dogs love these. They are a healthy product and easy to use as training treats. I am glad I found them
We ordered two, one arrived broken and Amazon was quick to replace it.  I wish they were bigger for our two bengals, but that is not the products fault.

I got the 14" size, thinking my dog would be interested because she enjoyed destroying my 14" therapeutic soft yoga ball. However, my dog is not interested in playing with this hard toy. It would have cost me too much to mail it back, so  I will donate it to the SPCA,
summary: Nice item, I'll donate to SPCA.

reviewText: These really do seem to work.  Are keeping my cat from clawing various things.  Plus they are virtually invisible.I do have a problem getting the outer cover off the sticky stuff once it is on the furniture.I have to really get in close and work at this.  I bought a similar product on a roll and it seemed easier to get the outer part off.  But the sheets do cover larger areas so that's a good aspect.The only other problems are: when it gets covered by, say, lap robe fluff and loses its outer stickiness.  Or the ends get folded down - like the front edge of an easy chair or the back part of a recliner.

Bought this door because of it's reviews. I was a bit worried about the plastic bolts people were complaining about but I was ready to head to the hardware store and buy metal ones to replace them. To my surprise the packaging already included the metal bolts. I guess enough people complained where they decided to make a switch. The door itself is very sturdy. It was very easy to install (not counting the time where I realized my back door was made of metal and not wood). My only complaint would be that the plastic flaps are a bit loud but partially its my dogs fault for going through the door at the speed of light.

My young border collie puppy really loves this ball. It's noisy when it clatters around on tile, and when dry kibble is banging around inside of it. I was worried that her small mouth wouldn't be able to carry it around since it's all hard plastic, but she doesn't seem to mind one bit! Plus, when she's a little older & bigger, it seems like she won't have much trouble picking it up.Only problem with it, in fact, is that she has so much fun chasing after it and making noise with it, that she doesn't realize food is coming out of it!The 1st time I used it, I put a lot of food in it -- BIG MISTAKE. Kibbles were EVERYWHERE.When you first get it, only put maybe 5-10 kibbles or treats into it, so you can gauge whether the dog is more interested in the treats that come out, or the sounds it makes.Since then, I adjusted the center part to have a very small hole, so it's really hard for kibbles to come out of it. That seems to work very nicely.The ball would probably be too big for very small breeds of dog to play with, and doesn't seem like it would withstand the rigors that a really big (100+lbs) dog would put it through. But it seems to be very nice for my mid-size dog.Also, if you don't like toys that are noisy, AVOID! The SECOND they start getting after this ball while on a hard floor, the sound may drive you nuts :P

For safety, I use a Tri-Tronics Sport Basic G3 remote shock collar for two issues.  First, this collar has assured me that my dog will "Come" when commanded.  I also used this collar to stop a problem in the local dog park that my dog was causing. And it worked!!! It has been one year since purchased, and I now rarely have to use it. Training my dog was a snap too - 1 day.  VERY IMPORTANTLY, I recommend you initially supplement your dogs training using TREATS after any shock. When you see the look on your dog's face after his first few shocks, you'll understand why this is a great, and humane, training method.  Treats, and lots of petting, were used to let my dog know that everything was OK, and he obeyed my order.  "Good boy!  Here's a treat."  I believe it really made all the difference in how my dog interpreted those initial shocks. Additionally, if you take your dog out for off-leash fun at night, purchase the optional (red, white, or blue) light that can be added on to the collar for $44 or so.  So far, it has passed the rabbit chasing test and has not shut off like most cheap clip on type LED lights.  Highly recommended for off-leash.
summary: Is Your Dog's Safety Worth the Purchase?

reviewText: After reading another review regarding the manufacture of this Product in India, before I placed my order I called Virbac in Fort Worth, Texas and spoke to a sales representative.  I asked about the product being manufactured in India, and she assured me that it was not.  Said that had been considered, but it never happened and the item was manufactured in the US.I clearly stated, "So, if I purchase this product, when it arrives, I will receive a product manufactured in the United States?"  She said oh yes.  Please be aware this was not an Amazon contact, this was direct by phone to Virbac in Texas.WRONG.  Item received today and right on the label it says MADE IN INDIA in all caps.  I immediately went online and returned the product for a refund; with no problem from Amazon.Since there is apparently no way to know where this product was manufactured until it arrives in your hand; I discourage purchase.  Perhaps we should check at local retailers for label information.  Pet Tabs have been a good product for years.  I am sorry to see this decline in manufacturing QA of a consumable product.  I intend to call Virbac back tomorrow and express my disappointment.
summary: Made in India -- Virbac asssured not!

reviewText: While our Golden prefers the Teaser Ball, our Aussie loves this HUGE tug-n-toss. He will carry it around proudly and chase after it in the backyard for a long time!

Moved and needed a new door for the new place. This door came and was easy to put together. The windows are nice and it works great.  Ideal Pet modified the tabs on the lock-out panels so they are easier to use, the old style was harder to use. It is pricey for sure, but it is really nice.

The shield around the pan prevents over-sprays - a problem we had with our male cat.  It also works well for any cats that fling litter high up in air to cover up their business.  I've tried the closed-top litter pans, but my cat didn't like it.  I think it was because he couldn't see what was going on around him.

We purchased this for the hollow door leading to the garage to put cat litter boxes out of the house. We have 2 medium sized cats (~8lbs), and one special needs "kitten" sized cat (she was semi-feral) who to the best of my knowledge never saw a cat door. Installation was not an issue for us. The hubs didn't use the template. We currently only use one flap, and have blue painters tape over the magnet on the flap as it freaks out the special cat.I LOVE being able to use the removable 'door' when we have to open the garage door, it saves me from thinking I lost a cat.The cats love access to a whole new 'world'. Teaching them the door was a process, and they thought for months the cat door and real door lead to different places. However, after almost 3 years the door has held up perfectly. We have the one flap on the 'outer' side of the house. There are these soft bristle like things on the door to help with air drafts, side benefit? They are furr catchers, as the cats go through the door the bristles catch furr that I vacuum off once a week.This is not just a dog door. It is also a good thing for cats.
I know they sell these vitamins at some vet offices for much more.  This is the best price I've found.
summary: My dogs LOVE the taste.  We use them as night treats

reviewText: LIKE THE TITLE SAYS, IT IS TOO SMALL FOR PUPPIES BUT IN A FEW MONTHS, THEY WILL GROW INTO IT. SEEMS VERY STURDY. I LIKE THE ONE SNAP AND IT'S ON.

I walk my dog on a retractable leash and he roams around and is sometimes behind me which means when the leash is attached to a no pull harness or a flat collar it gets wrapped around him more so I wanted one that attached at the top. This is not a no-pull harness nor does it claim to be. He can pull more on it but I only use it for his 'fun walks' not going to the vet or some other public place where I need control. The other thing I like is that it is not a step in harness. He does not have to lift a paw to get it on which is easier for me. He is older and has knee trouble and is sometimes unsteady if you pick up a front paw. The only thing I an not crazy about is that if he is behind me and I tug to get him moving it will shift around. Not sure if I need it tighter or if that is just going to happen. The result of this is that it seems like his coat is a bit roughed up where the harness sits. Not a bid deal I guess. All in all I am happy with it.Also I have the chest plate harness made by EzyDog that I use in the car to clip to the seatbelt leash I use. That one is a bit of a pain to put on partly because he has to step in but partly the way it is designed. I was hoping to use this one instead in the car but because it still puts some pressure on the neck I am not sure it is safe for that purpose. It is not marketed for that and I am not faulting the product for that, just thought I would mention that for others wanting to use as a seatbelt...UPDATE 1/2013: I got a second dog who is smaller but right on the line in the manufacturers size chart between large and extra large so I ordered the large and it is much too small. The chest strap on its largest adjustment doesn't allow the harness to go far enough back. After reading other reviews talking about rubbing under the arms I am pretty sure many reviewers have it adjusted too small as it is supposed to a few fingers be behind the armpit. On my other dog when it's adjusted right it sits where it should but does ride forward where it could chafe though it doesn't seem to sit there enough. All in all this is my favorite harness and every one comments on it. If your dog is on the line as far as size particularly if they are wide in the chest I would go with the larger size.

As I wrote on the other pet tabs, my puppy loves these tablets.  I feel that he is getting all the nourishment he needs to grow into a healthy adult dog......strong bones with the calcium pet tabs and all the other good health with the orig. formula.  I recommend highly.

My little puppy dog, a 13lb cavalier, loves these.  She's actually not a picky eat in any way, shape, or form, but I like these, too, in that they are small little healthy treats that are great for training.

Well, this looks just like its Purina sister...Fancy Feast Classic....but with a different name and label.  Unless there is a real significant difference I am missing, it looks just like the Fancy Feast product on the inside.  Same consistency, color, same amount of juice, same density and texture, but at a higher price.  Hmmm, my cat likes it just the same.
summary: Looks like Fancy Feast to me...

reviewText: I ordered this for 2 Maine Coon kittens and they ate it along with various other foods and I think they liked it.  They are chow hounds and will eat most anything.  Since then, however,  I have stuck with grain free foods as I feel grain free is best for their health.  They are about 18 lbs already!

I have purchased these chews in many flavors. This one and the puppy chew are my pup's favorites. They smell nice and herbal, not meaty. Apparently they are very tasty. And it is a small thing I can do to possibly help my pup with his dental health. He is about 8 and has crowded teeth that tend to attract plaque.

The Alfie Lifestyle Yellow chase ball with the spring teaser works fine. Only two comments - on the photo is looks like the top is greenish. In reality it is nice yellow color - no green tint at all. The bottom is darker unsaturated orange, as shown. The base is fairly lightweight - so it turns over often when cats play with it.
i never thought he would stand there,, for some reason with being on the turn table and the little leash around his neck.. he's like a  a stone  dog froze in place lol
good construction.does well with my large breed Goldens. Much easier to figure out than other harnesses I have purchased in the past.
Nicely made and attractive.  Will enjoy having this for the inevitable "necessities".  Nice choice of colors.  Would recommend to others.
This is a wonderful product.  So easy to use and keeps everything smelling fresh thanks to the bags in the refill cartridges.  Any one who has a cat litter box should use one of these!
As always, Hikari makes a top-quality product.I have used various Hikari fish foods for years, and my fish always thrive (and dive) on it! :)

I have had this cage for my chinchilla for over four years now and it's still going strong! The doors open all the way, making cleaning much easier than in her old cage. It's also pretty easy to assemble (I did it myself!)The only issue I have is with the pans, as they are plastic so I had to replace them (chinchillas and all rodents chew constantly and can get sick from plastic)... However, seeing as the cage was designed for FERRETS, it's not a huge problem.Over all though, I couldn't be happier. Thanks for reading!
summary: Built-to-last, but change the pans for rodents!

reviewText: I thought my 1 1/2 year old Lhasa Apso would go crazy over this ball.  She loves her toys and is very posessive over them.  Each time you touch this ball it starts to babble away. If pushed again it starts all over again.Sassy was not interested in this ball in the least, however if you have a busy dog that will entertain her/himself I would spent the money and give it a try.My 9 year old neice and 11 year old nephew loved the ball.Ball came quickly and was well packaged.
summary: Babble Ball does babble...ALL THE TIME

reviewText: I've used this as a water toy for two large dogs, a Pit Bull and a Golden Retriever, and it is still in great shape after 18 months. Of course, I don't let them chew on it, but for fetch and tugging, it's great.
I will just go with the generic Petco brand from now on. These are not moist enough and, like most eye wipes, do not dispense properly from the cannister.

I bought the small for my schnauzer/jack mix, she is 23 lbs. She has a sore on her face that she has scratched and our puppy has licked into a mess. Her neck is 11" around and her head size is standard for her mix.  I could have gone with a medium but I feel it would have been too large and way to heavy for her to carry around. The small is ok at the neck, it allows me to leave the neck a little loose (minimal overlap right at the neck) and still have overlap out at the end. The collar is close to being too small right at the neck, but the instructions say allow 2 fingers space in the neck which I have, but it feels like the weight of it will press down on her throat so I'm keeping a close eye on her. I also bought this today in an emergency situation for 39.00 at a local large pet store.Basically, the small fits her, she has a shorter snout so can eat without having to fold it down, and it's keeping her from scratching her face. She has long legs but can not reach her feet or stomach so this would work for a spay. She's very comfortable laying down and because there's a lot of overlap at the outside edge, the smaller neck opening is working for her. The weight is tolerable, but to have overlap the entire length of the cone like the picture shows, I would have to go to the medium which was very heavy and would not have worked for her.  When I first put it on she tried to take it off but within seconds was fine with it.  I think the size of the dog is what will make or break this collar. If she had less body it would be too heavy, if her snout was longer she could get to her front feet, if her neck was shorter the weight would likely hurt her throat.  My suggestion would be to take your dog to the local Petco, try one on, then order the size from Amazon to save yourself $20.00+. You can get it delivered before a spay and have it for those emergencies that sometimes come up.  While she slightly unhappy at having to wear this thing, she is comfortable and her wound is healing. I am extremely happy with this purchase, just wish I had bought it from Amazon and had it waiting for a situation like this.When she was spayed I tried the plastic e collar, it was terrible. I felt like I needed to hold her and try to make her head comfortable, I finally threw it out and just keep a tea towel taped around her and kept a close eye on her. It was a long week. As small as she was at time of spay I can't imagine this working for her in an extra small based on the weight of the thing so check it out in advance to make your best friend as happy as possible.
summary: So much happier than in the standard pastic e collar!!!!

reviewText: This is a good product for a great price.  I will always use this in my pet's water as it helps their teeth and breath.BB
summary: My Dogs and Cats both benefit from this product.

reviewText: At first my little dog didn't know what to think about this toy...but has been warming up to it and it is so funny!! The voice is so cute.."ohh puppy, grrr, oh-oh, I'm gonna get you, giggle-giggle, hot diggity dog, bada bing-bada boom, come here puppy" all done in a little chipmunk voice. Very entertaining for all of us!
My dogs like this treat pretty well.  They are a little on the dry side, but I have bought other treats that were also dry and they seem to like these better.  I would buy them again.
This is pretty good. I think my 2 cats may be too much for it though. Well, if I cleaned more often I suppose it would do better.
summary: Good for a small apartment with floors.

reviewText: I have a 120 gallon tank and use 2 Hydor 400w to heat it.. They work great, for the price, this is truly a BEST BUY!!!!

It took my puggle a bit to get used to this toy. She's skiddish around noise, but once she warmed up to it, it's become one of her favorites.PROS:It kept her interest. Although, I find the babbling repetitive and annoying, my puggle seems happy with it.Indestructible, it's one of the few toys that has stood up to my puggle's teeth. It's been dropped, it's been chewed on, it's been thrown, yet it's still working.Replaceable batteries, I haven't had to replace them yet (it's been seven months) but they are supposed to be replaceable.CONS:It's hard plastic, so if you have wood or tile, it's going to be noisy.It's small and will roll under couches and tables depending on your furniture.I'm glad that I took a chance with this because my puggle loves it. She really seems amused with it.

I bought this to use on my stairs, since I didn't have to worry about outlets and dragging the cord around. I love this for quick runs throught the whole house. At first I wasn't sure I was going to like it but after a few uses, I am totally in love with this!!! It picks up A LOT of hair! battery lasts for what I need it for, and then I plug it back in so its ready for its next use.

My dog eats his meals in less than a minute. I just received this today, and my dog finished his food in about 10 minutes. And I know he enjoyed the challenge! At  first he was a bit puzzled, but when it comes to food, he will do pretty much anything, so he figured it out fast. And yet even though he learned how to get the food out, it still took him a long time to eat. The company claims the plastic is safe and without bad chemicals, so I believe Kyjen cares about dogs.
this shampoo is great it only takes a little bit to do the job. Rich lather and a wonderful scent that lasted at least two weeks. It is easy to use and really cleans well. Will buy again when needed.
I have a little 9 pound Cavachon that hates to get brushed. She seems to like this  bristle brush also well made.Also very fast delivery!

One dog loves, it the other one doesn't bother with it. But it it constantly making noise and talking which freaks me out in the middle of the night and I walk by it and not realize it's there. The voice is really creepy.

Purchased this for our 80 lbs golden retriever pup. I was assured a "large" was appropriate for a golden retriever. I should have paid closer attention to prior reviews. It's way too small. Dog wears a 21" collar. Had to reorder an XL.

Our mini schnauzer travels with us, if it's a fun planned vacation, or fleeing new orleans ahead of a hurricane. Either way the Midwest canine camper is a great addition. It folds compactly making it easy to throw in the car, she is belted in using a doggie seatbelt. When we get to the hotel we can give her a safe place to hang out and sleep. Izzy isn't hard on kennels, she sleeps on one at home, so there is no biting or trying to get out of it. The camper is easy to travel with and easy to pop up then close back up to come home.

Dogs didn't mind it, but I didn't feel like it made enough of a difference for me to continue using it. I went through a bottle of it and the dogs' breath may have been slightly better, but it was nothing to write home about. I now use Dental Fresh and can see and smell a significant change for the better.
The scent is so strong that my Yorkie jumped back into the tub of water! I've never seen her do that before I gave it away

I have one cat, and she is full grown at about 6 lbs, meaning she is a small cat.  I scoop her litter box daily to every other day because I don't like the smell.  I also don't like getting litter all over the floor or having to run a garbage bag out to the garage because it has smelly kitty litter in it. Though I don't have one, I am told this works the same as a Diaper Genie... I can't really help on that as there are no diapers in the house.The Good:* The odors are kept to a minimum* The Genie is easy to use and set up* It currently doesn't cost an arm and a leg to buy* Visually it is easy to hideThe Bad:* Refills currently cost as much as the Genie new.* There is some waste of plastic in the knot tying -or you could use rubber bands rather than tying the knot to cut down on loss of plastic.* You are dependent on refills, if you can't get them, this thing is worthlessOn the whole I am glad I have this, it is worth the purchase, though I would stock up on refills if you find them on sale.  I cannot comment on how this would work with multiple cats as I only have one.  It might create more rather than less work if there is a lot of daily scooping to be done.
summary: Very interesting idea - Diaper Genie for cats

reviewText: Okay, this perch completely and totally changed my relationship with my bird, for the better. When we first got Conner the Conure (a green cheek conure with the pineapple mutation), he was a sweet bird, but he was a little nippy and very independent. He liked tickles on his head and neck, but when he was done and had enough, he'd bite with no warning. He wasn't a cuddler or anything like that either. This was hard for me, since all the birds I've had when growing up were all very cuddly and sweet. In fact, all birds I've known are cuddly sweet like that, at least some of the time.I loved Conner (my conure), and he was fun and full of personality, but he just wasn't very 'friendly' over all. He wouldn't stay sitting on my shoulder (or anyone's) for very long, wouldn't let us tickle his neck for long, nothing. Affection was available, but only in short bouts before he'd bite and then fly back to his cage.Then I bought this perch for him. and I put it on the outside of his cage, so that he hung over my shoulder while I sat in the recliner and did my routine. I work from home, and usually sit in my recliner when I'm working, and now, his cage beside me, I'd let him out and work. This rope perch was right over my shoulder the whole time I was working. I'd basically ignore him, and he'd eventually come down and walk out on the perch and sit over my shoulder. He say, "Watcha doing?" and I'd talk to him. He liked to watch my computer screen (especially when I played Candy Crush, with all the bright colors--but you know, I was, ahem, usually working!)And in just a couple of weeks, he went from a standoffish independent birdie who didn't interact much with us, to a bird who came straight to his rope perch the minute I let him out. So I started rubbing his neck and scratching his pinfeathers when he was on the perch and he would come and sit as close to me as he could while on the perch. In just a couple of more weeks, he was leaning against my head when he would get tired and was sleeping on me like that.Today, he sleeps in my hand, cuddles with me all the time, comes and lays in my hand if I put it up on the perch next to him. He gives kisses and asks for tickle-tickles on his neck. He hasn't bitten anyone in months and months now.Using this perch to let him be close to me, but not actually feel trapped by me, let him get used to being around me, and slowly, we learned how to interact with each other. I can now literally turn him upside down in my hand, cuddle with him on my chest or under my hair, you name it. He's the sweetest, funniest bird.And his rope perch is still right there on his cage and he sits on it right by me all day long while I'm working. I plan to get a couple more of these so I can put some perches up in the bathroom. I want to see if he can get used to taking a shower with me now. I've heard birds like that, sometimes, because it's like bathing in the rain for them. We'll see if it works. Also, I thin his little feet like the softer surface of the rope perch as  a change for the little talons sometimes.The rope is stiff but wiggly enough to position however you want. it's held up well. I do have to turn it over every now and then, 'cause it will start to droop downward at the part near the connectors, but flipping it over will fix that right up, until it starts to droop again, then just flip it again.A good, quality product and very safe for birdies and works great with the cage. Note: This doesn't have the suction cups for using on walls or glass/windows/mirrors. This has a plastic screw on connector that's mostly made for connecting inside cages.
summary: Completely Changed my Relationship with My Bird

reviewText: I have a stick-obsessed German Shepherd who simply adores these things.  We get the small - the others are simply too long and big for me to throw and he seems to like the small ones the best.He used to run with (real) sticks in his mouth and once stabbed himself with one of them when it caught in the ground while he was moving.  That was the moment when I decided that we would have no more wooden stick play...enter, Kong Safestix!These are perfect for us.  No risk of tooth or mouth injury, we can play tug with them all day long (seriously, HE can go all day long, my arms can only take so much) and they're pretty easy to find in the long grass.  The suckers even float which has come in handy when he goes to get a drink from the stream and drops his Safestix in the water, making me have to run downstream to try to get it out...sigh, he's not a retriever, he's a shepherd.  I'm the retriever.My guy likes me to throw it high and spinning so he can get a bead on where it's going and try to get there just as the Safestix is coming down.  I hurl it by one of the rounded ends to give it a nice spin, which helps him spot it against the sky.And I'll tell you, he bites down on these things HARD, but hasn't damaged one yet.  We play tug every day with me dragging 80+lbs of dog around with them and they hold up great.He doesn't chew on them, though, and I know some folks have had issues with that.  My guy just wants to fetch and tug, so for that they're awesome.I do wish that they were a bit brighter/more solid color just for visibility (especially in water), but that's the only improvement I would need.If your dog is a fetching machine like mine, I really recommend these.UPDATE - 7-9-14 - Well, we finally broke one today!  As the stix get bitten/tugged over time, they get cuts in them from sharp doggie teeth and they seem to stretch a bit.  No big deal, but today his favorite stix (the blue one - I think it's easiest for him to see) snapped the end off during a game of tug.  Considering that this one was the most heavily used, the fact that he is a very large/strong dog and that we play hard fetch/tug EVERY SINGLE DAY with the things, I'd say that was pretty darn good wear time on a toy.  We've got back ups (thank goodness) and I'll be ordering more!

DAP and it's counterpart FELIWAY were recommended to me as a way of helping animals deal with stress.  We have a rescue dog who is adapting to a house with 2 cats who have had full-claim of their home for several years.  Both sides are stressed at the changes and have been showing it in various ways.Our puppy is crated to sleep, and usually likes her little den and bed.  During the night, though, she will bark, yip, and whine for anywhere from 15 minutes to an hour, 3 or 4 times per night.  We've gone up to 4 hours straight of barking right in the middle of the night.  Any time there's so much as a strong breeze which shifts the house she'll start up.  We're afraid to get up for water or anything like that because any noise (or sometimes even no noise) will set her off.I can't overstate how skeptical I was about this product, but this was a last-ditch effort to save my sanity so I figured it couldn't possibly hurt.  I plugged this thing in right above her crate.  For the last couple weeks it has been running non-stop and there hasn't been a single incident of mid-night barking.  Not a single one.  No whining, no yips, no howls, it's like we have a new dog.To take this a step further, normally if someone walks near her crate after she's been sleeping for a bit she'll jump up and start hopping around in there.  She'll bark if you don't come let her out.  She actually destroyed one crate this way, and has broken several of the metal bars on her newest crate.  This morning I walked right past her den and she stood up, yawned, realized I wasn't coming over to her, and lay right back down calmly.  She waited that extra minute until I came over to let her out, then stepped out slowly, no mad bull-rush out the door.I'm still skeptical, part of me can't help but feel that this must be coincidence, but I'm willing to pay for a monthly refill if only for my peace of mind.  I highly recommend trying this product out if you have a hyper or stressed out dog, it's saved my sanity.
summary: Very skeptical, but it works for our dog

reviewText: I've owned dogs most of my life. Or the other way around maybe. The last of my rotties passed last summer, and I fed them Canidae their entire lives. All three of them enjoyed a sick-visit free lives. Why is this pertinent to Iams? For one, it is proof that the price for this product pays itself off. Your dog is what he eats. My rotties all lived over 10 years with no joint or bone problems. None of the dreaded osteoscarcoma. And I attribute it to the food they ate 1000%.So fast forward a few months and Vine offers me this Iams Sensitive Naturals. I no longer have a dog, but I know a few underprivalaged pooches. ;) The taste test was a hit, the ingredients are right. Fish is the first ingredient, rice is the second. Look at the food you feed your dog. Is corn the first ingredient? Are the meats real meat or by-products? Are there beets in the product to aid your dog's digestion? What about nasty dyes?The ingredients, per the item description:Ocean Fish, Brewers Rice, Ground Whole Grain Sorghum, Fish Meal (source of fish oil), Ground Whole Grain Barley, Animal Fat (preserved with mixed Tocopherols, a source of Vitamin E), Dried Egg Product, Dried Beet Pulp, Fish Digest, Brewers Dried Yeast, Dicalcium Phosphate, Potassium Chloride,Salt, Dried Apple Pomace, Dried Carrots, Dried Peas, Fructooligosaccharides, Minerals (Ferrous Sulfate, Zinc Oxide, Manganese Sulfate, Copper Sulfate, Manganous Oxide, Potassium Iodide, Cobalt Carbonate), Dried Spinach, Dried Tomatoes, Choline Chloride, DL-Methionine, Vitamins (Ascorbic Acid, Vitamin A Acetate, Calcium Pantothenate, Biotin, Thiamine Mononitrate (source of vitamin B1), Vitamin B12 Supplement, Niacin, Riboflavin Supplement (source of vitamin B2), Inositol, Pyridoxine Hydrochloride (source of vitamin B6), Vitamin D3 Supplement, Folic Acid), Calcium Carbonate, Vitamin E Supplement, Beta-Carotene, Rosemary Extract.A few things of note -Tocopherols vs. BHA are used as preservativesApple Pomace - just a fancy term for skins, pulp, seeds, and stems of applesBrewer's Dried Yeast - good for skin and coat, may increase bloating and gas.Most of these ingredients are vitamins and minerals. There are 6 fruits and veggies in the kibble, which of course is a step above your average kibble. The value of the kibble is in what is absent - corn.I would suggest comparing labels with your current brand. If you are feeding cheap, you might be saving money in the short term only to spend a lot more on a sick dog later on. Good dog food is not going to be cheap, because the ingredients aren't cheap. Personally, I am very fond of Canidae because it gave our dogs such wonderful health (and as I am sure you know, rottweilers are so prone to health issues) and it is also an economical choice in food. However, this offering from Iams is a very solid dog food with a similiar nutritional profile. It is quite a bit more per pound than my preferred food, so I took off one star as I feel it would be a better value at a lower price point..

The rating is just wonderful.  It is going to take some time but he is reacting well to the chews.  Anything that taste good is no problem feeding him.  So what a great product and yes I would recommend to friends.

Sprenger collars are generally regarded as among the best in prong collars; they are made of steel in Germany. The chrome one here comes in a medium size which Sprenger regrettably does not make in its stainless steel collars. However, the chrome one will probably last a while even if you're out in the rain some. With this "medium" size, the 3.0mm links offer a slightly better degree of adjustability, so if you have a dog whose neck is in between sizes- as I do- sometimes you can get a better fit with this one. Also, the links on Sprenger collars are very rounded, making the correction much easier on your dog, and the links are fairly easy to get apart and back together.

We decided to get rid of retractable leashes years ago when a dog trainer told us that they can lead to undesirable behavior and can be dangerous.However, when I was given the opportunity to receive one of these new leashes in exchange for a review, I agreed because since one of the dogs is now elderly, I figured it would be okay to try it with him.Even though he's elderly, he still loves to walk, and with the standard leash I felt like I was jerking him too much.This has turned out to be a very good leash for him. It feels like quality and heavy duty. One of the nicer things is that the retractable button is much easier to use than the ones I had in the past. It seems more intuitive. We both enjoyed the walk very much, and I can see that the leash will hold up well.I still have some misgivings about retractable leashes, but this one works quite well with him.

This is an organic dog food and if you are gonna get your pet on that, it's a decent start with a couple of things I wanna note... Most of the ingredients in lamb and tater are meaty, with the only controversial stuff in the tater line being pea based. If you're doing organic for a fur friend, you probably don't want the potato line by B2B, but their regular meat line instead.

Stock up.  Keep a large supply on hand.  You will be replacing this media at least once per month, depending on your situation.The Fluval U2 underwater/internal filter uses a total of five filter medias: 2 coarse foam, 2 poly/carbon pads, and 40 grams of ceramic bio-media.  This is the one that you would need to replace frequently.  The coarse foam can be rinsed out and re-used, being made of inert material.  The ceramic bio-media can also be rinsed out, but should only be replaced if they are extremely dirty.I do not know how ceramic bio-media can get dirty enough to the point that they will need to be thrown away, but I suppose it can happen.  Here's a potential scenario, if you used copper to medicate the tank at some point in the past, and now you want to keep invertebrates, then yes, you will need to replace all of the media in your filter.  Even the ones that are considered inert, since even a small trace of copper can harm your shrimp.The Fluval U2 will run just fine without a poly/carbon pad installed.  Set up as such, it will still function as a coarse mechanical filter and as a submerged biological filter.  You just lose chemical filtration.  This is an advantage to you during those times when you have to add medication to your tank.How well does this filter pad do its job?  It does a fine job of filtering out smaller particles.  These are particles that are too small be captured by the coarse mechanical filter.  However, it does a poor job of chemical filtration.  This is not surprising, when you consider that this pad does not hold granular activated carbon.  Instead, one side of the pad contains bonded carbon.  There is very little actual carbon in the product.  What you have is carbon bonded to the filter material.  Do not expect this filter pad to remove tannins from the water.  It may remove a little bit, for a short period of time, but do not expect it to keep the water from turning yellow if you have driftwood in the tank.  There may be enough carbon there to remove medication from the water.It is hard to review a filter media without taking into the consideration the whole system.  The Fluval U-series of internal filters are excellent products.  The smallest model, the U1, provides simple mechanical filtration.  The rest of the series, provides complete filtration.  So these systems can be a replacement for a hang-on-the-back power filter.  The Fluval U2 will do a fine job of mechanical filtration, primarily because of this filter pad.  But you do have to replace the pad often.  If you are not too concerned about chemical filtration, you can replace the poly/carbon pads once per month.  You can even alternate, by replacing only one of the pads, instead of both.I do recommend replacing at least one of the pads, every month.  Mechanical filtration captures solid waste and puts them where they cannot be seen.  However, please keep in mind that they are still in the water.  The trapped solid waste in the filter pad is still decomposing within the tank, releasing nitrates into your water.  Even if they are no longer in the water column, they are still in the path of the water circulation.  The best strategy that I have found is to use a simple filter that is very easy to clean.  Clean often.  Remove as much solid waste from circulation as possible.  This will help keep nitrate levels down and may help keep algae under control.  This idea is also the reason why I have gradually replaced my canister filters with simple, HOB power filters.  Many years ago, I kept some wild-caught pike cichlids.  I was using a large Fluval 403 canister filter.  My routine back then was to put as much media within the bucket/canister as would fit.  And then only open the canister for maintenance every 3-4 months.  After all, the service interval for canister filters are long, right?  Sure, the canister will hold a lot of waste, but just because it's in the container does not mean that it is no longer polluting the tank.  You are better off spending your money on a modest filter and cleaning it out often, rather than spending a lot of money on a filter that you will not clean out often.  Am I saying that simple and cheap are better than a pricey canister filter?  No, not at all.  My point is, whichever filter type you choose, to clean it often.  If you want a canister, and you are willing to go through the hassle of cleaning it once a week, then you have the best of both worlds.  I suspect that most people would be more consistent in monthly filter maintenance if it were simple and easy.While an internal filter like the Fluval U is not as easy as your typical HOB power filter to clean, it is still easier than a canister.  And having pre-made filter media makes the job even easier.  Stock up on the replacement filter pads.  Replace them often.  That is an easy way to remove solid waste from your tank.  This is a much better maintenance practice than letting the waste accumulate.  You can make it even more convenient if you buy the pads in larger quantities.

Our Goldendoodles (8 months and 5 months) absolutely loved this toy.  The squirrels are ideal for self play, easy to sling around in the air, toss, juggle, throw, fetch, hide; and they loved digging the squirrels out of tree trunk as well -- this kept them occupied and never bored.  Problem: the squirrels are not durable... within one day of getting our 5-month-old (a chewer, but not an extreme chewer -- he doesn't even have all his adult teeth yet!), he easily ripped off the tail of one of the squirrels and swallowed it whole... now we are very worried that he is going to have to have surgery to remove it from his digestive system.  Hopefully it will pass through (gross).  We are never letting them play with these squirrels again because they aren't safe.  Maybe we should have purchased the larger one or maybe Kyjen should  make the squirrels more durable to cater to larger breeds with stronger mouths.
summary: great fun until somebody swallows a tail

My wife's Toy Yorkie(Ginger) became a shivering, cowering mess whenever a storm was coming. That happens almost every afternoon in Southwest Florida. It didn't even need to be thundering, lightning or raining.  Just the drop in barometric pressure was enough to send her scurrying behind the washing machine or under the bed.  We even found her on the lowest level of a bookshelf once.The very first time I wrapped her into her new Thundershirt--after initially putting it on the wrong way--there was an immediate transformation in her behavior. She stopped shivering. She was not cowering. She didn't run and hide. We were both surprised, but after all, this is why we bought it.I would imagine that every dog will have it's own unique initial reaction. And I could see how it might take awhile for some dogs to adjust to it. But it was an instant hit with Ginger. If you ever swaddled a newborn in his/her blanket like a little sausage, you'll know how snug you need to make it.
summary: What A Difference This Shirt Makes!

reviewText: I like this product as well as my cat Sparkle.  I especially like the new plastic liners  and the solid lid.

I'm glad someone has finally figured out a way to get cat urine smells out!My female has lately been aggitated with strays coming up on the porch and she started spraying around the house.  I was in tears.  This stuff was recommended to me by a trainer, and I think it's very, very good.  I just found out it comes unscented as well, and I think next time I will get that because it does have its own "fresh" scent which I'm not crazy about but it's sort of chemical smelling at first. It lingers in the air for a few days but it's still better than smelling cat urine.I have used it on the couch, carpets, and woodwork, and it has not stained or discolored anything. I've just sort of cleaned up the areas with warm water and dish soap, and then saturated it with the Icky Poo and left it to dry on its own. No need to spend hours scrubbing. My only concern is that in the summer when it's hot and humid will the smell return?  I don't know.And as an added note, my kitchen drain sort of smelled funky one night. I poured about half a cup down the drain and let it sit overnight. In the morning I ran hot water for a few minutes and the smell was gone.
Soo quick, convenient, and amazingly easy! You have to have a water hose tho so a top story apartment I could see this being kind of difficult

I received this collar today and it's so darn cute with the little reflective fish on the collar with the matching clasp, I could hardly stand it.For those interested, the bell is tiny and not overly loud but I removed it because I read that these bells do harm kitty hearing.  On the clasp, I substituted a small black id tag that I ordered also from Amazon.I clasped this collar on to my gorgeous 11.6 pound Siberian kitty tonight and so far she seems just fine with it on.  She is three years old so mostly full grown.I had my kitty micro-chipped but even though she's an indoor kitty, she does periodically make a break for freedom and this reflective collar has me feel a little better if she should get beyond my home's area.  My kitty is robust with very long fur.  The collar does seem to disappear into her fur and so far she does not seem disturbed by it (it's loosely around her neck).  The collar is quite adjustable so don't be concerned about it being too small.  There's allot of room for it to expand.  If she manages to keep this on, it's a really cute buy and I recommend it.BTW - I actually was thrown by the name of the company - which I thought meant the collar was red....duh, no...it's orange like the photo and description.Next day update - collar still on - kitty ignores it completely which is great - now if I could see it due to all her fur!  Certainly not the fault of the collar.  Here is the link to the little ID tag "super tag" which I highly recommend.  The inscription was perfectly done.B00BS1I5N4I chose the small black round tag.  Her name is on one side with my cell phone number and on the back is my address.  It all fits perfectly.So upshot - Adorable collar that helps me feel my kitty is somewhat more protected and that's what this is all about.

Our cat that lives in our barn likes to roam the fields at night and even though we live in the country, I do worry he might cross a road that could have a late night car on it. This does have great reflective properties and really stands out in the dark when lights shine on it. I feel much better about him roaming with this on, I believe he is much safer with it on.

Our big Ridgeback loves his bully sticks and rawhide chews, but they last about 15 minutes. This is the only chew we've found that lasts--and it lasts WEEKS. It takes him about a week to chew through the ring, and then at least a couple more weeks to finish the rest. It's very, very thick and so it's a lot safer than unbraided or narrower rawhide. The taste must also be great, because we've tried other brands of thickly braided rawhide sticks (even the basted ones) and an expensive elk antler, but he isn't interested in them after a couple minutes. If you have a very large dog or just an assertive chewer, this is a "Best Buy"!
summary: Lasts a Long Time with Strong Chewer

reviewText: I was really glad I got this from an amazon seller. At Petsmart it would have cost $45, but from amazon it was only 20+ some shipping. Outstanding deal!  I already knew the attachment would not fit on either my bathroom or kitchen sink but I had planned on replacing my old bathroom faucet anyway. Once you get it connected to your sink at least, it works great. It definitely made changing the water in my 125g much easier. Rather than carry buckets of water to empty the tank, then refill it with the same buckets, all I have to do is hook this bad boy up and watch the water drain. Just be sure to also keep an eye on it when filling it up so it doesn't overflow. If you want to go even cheaper or need a LOT of tubing just get the whole faucet attachment and as much tubing needed from your local hardware store.  Also watch the product video on YouTube for instructions on use.

This thing isn't terribly consistent in the amount of food it dispenses. Then again, it doesn't truly need to be... a bit of extra food one day and a bit less food the next averages out over the week and the fish are typically happy.Try sitting down and manually dispensing a bunch of piles in a row on a table, and then look at each pile. You'll be able to average these out and adjust for the amount of food you want to give over a period of time.That said, it reliably dispenses at the given time each day, and it's extremely easy to mount on the tank. I definitely recommend it as a cheap, easy item. If you have expensive/larger fish with expensive/larger foods, I would recommend getting a Super Feeder instead (I have one for the cats which is awesome). But if you have a tank under 100 gallons, chances are this thing will be just fine for you.

The item arrived as promised as it was fulfilled by Amazon. The sellers description was accurate. It seems to be sturdy enough. It is for our 100 lb Lab. We haven't used it yet so I will let you know about the sturdiness. I did however insert it into the seat belt receptacles on both my car and the truck and it fit great. I chose the red color so I could locate it and keep track of it while in use. The seat color of my vehicles are black and a black belt would just blend in.....I may need another one and if I decide to get another I would definitely buy this one again.

We have a small 12 lb Boston Terrier that is 13 inches tall. I had a very hard time choosing a dog carrier, mainly because I wanted it to be a carrier for any/all situations (around town, car, airplane, act as a make-shift crate, etc). I had read great things about this carrier and it seemed to be the best all-around choice.PROS:(1) Larger and taller than other carriers for the pup's comfort. Our dog can move around in the carrier relatively easily, but it is a bit tight. She has to bend down a tiny bit to get in or out, but she looks comfortable once she turns around inside and curls up.(2) Although it is larger, it does squish down and would fit in a tighter space if needed.(3) It really is sturdy and made with great materials. I was worried about the mesh in particular, but it is  a strong plastic type material. My dog can lean against it or paw at it a little bit, and I don't worry about her accidentally breaking through.(4) There are plenty of ventilation windows - two on the top, one on the front, and one on the back. They open as well, so I can pet my dog without her hopping out.CONS:(1) There is only one door! I agree with another reviewer, if you have a smallish-medium dog it is kind of awkward for them to get in and out (they have to turn around to face the door and unless you have a teeny, small framed dog, it is tight). A number of times, it was awkward for me too, because I unzipped the wrong side and had to turn the carrier around to get to the door. Perhaps I am still getting used to this carrier...Not a huge deal, but 2 doors would definitely make this a 5-star product!Otherwise, we like the carrier and our dog seems to be fine with it as well.

The main squeaker broke in less than 5 minutes and th e2nd sqeaker in less than 1 hour.  Cool looking toy but very overpriced and somewhat cheaply made. For almost $20, it should last a long, long time.  My dog loves it but it will not survive ANY lengthy tug-o-war games.  In fact, it has been less than 60 minutes and now has several small rips due to the cheaply manufactured sections made of cloth.
summary: Squeaker broke in less than 5 minutes

reviewText: Thru the years I have had alot of pet water fountains.  Some were nightmares to clean.  And then try to put back together.  This is simple and easy and can be cleaned in just a few minutes.  My dogs and cats all use it.  It has a large filter so I know the water is actually being filtered,  Had a Catit it years ago and that design did leak.  This newer model is greatly improved.  Also holds a fair amt of water.  I would recommend this unit.  I believe it is the best one on the market.
summary: Simple design and easy to use.

reviewText: The cats love these. They're everything cats love in a treat, tasty and crunchy and not too big.  And they actually do seem to reduce the incidence of hairballs on my carpet.  My only real issue with them is that they're REALLY small and according to the instructions the number of treats you're supposed to give at a time is pretty high.  As a result, we went through the bag rather quickly.
my kitten loves it he has the round of the house but I find him in the bed in his bed room
summary: Would buy again soft and cozy

reviewText: I love it,my cats love it. It stays clean. Just have to add water and sometimes clean it out. But, it is never dirty,just some fur around the electric slits.i actuaaly have to buy filters for it. I want to buy one or 2 more.
summary: hagen catit design fres and clear ca drinking fountain

reviewText: I've got a tree that is about 15-18 years old- about 25 feet tall.  This hook is perfect for the bird feeder I got, and is at just the right level for me to watch the birds from my living room.
summary: Great for my bird feeder in a smallish tree

reviewText: This is not as long as the other one we purchased.  I'm sure once we hang it (not on a tree, on a balcony), we will be able to reach the feeder with no problem.We wanted a backup.  We live on a second floor back condo.  That's the best!  No people to distract the hummingbirds!  Hooks are the best to hold the feeders. This will be great!
summary: Great as a Hummingbird Feeder Hook Backup.

reviewText: This really does work at calming my cat down without nasty lethargic or hyperactivity side effects. And it is unnoticeable to me. Each plugin refill lasts about 1 to 1-1/2 months. Great deal buying this in bulk!She doesn't meow so aggressively and seems to use the litter box more consistently. However, it's not 100% effective since it hasn't gotten her completely out of the habit of inappropriate urination when stressed or the box hasn't been cleaned for a day. So if her environment gets out of whack, Feliway doesn't seem to be the cure-all for poor kitty behavior. Keep that in mind and try to make your cat's environment as chill and stress-free as possible used in combo with Feliway.My cat still seems stressed with the addition of our dog (she just does not like him!), so I'm considering the "prozac" approach per my vet's recommendation since she still seems to urinate around the house. It's tough since she doesn't have a complete aversion to the box so I never know when she is and isn't eliminating on the carpeting until it's too late.The vet said Feliway is the step cat parents should take prior to considering prozac for a cat with anxiety/inappropriate elimination issues, so try this before you medicate your cat.

I knew what I was getting into when I purchased this MagSafe Power adapter.  This is the second refurbished charger I have owned ... the first one was bought off a popular auction site and lasted about 9 months before some fraying at the junction of the plug and cord happened (I believe that this is one of the most common points of failure for the MagSafe adaptors).This charger came packaged well, was clean, and even had some clear plastic protection placed on the charger.  It does come with the wall plug as expected but DOES NOT come with the long extension cord.  Please note this before buying.If you have your OEM adapter, you should already have the power extension cord that came with your original charger.  My OEM charger is still in tact but I did not want to spend $80 to have a spare.  I buy original Apple refurbished chargers (sold through 3rd party sellers, not Apple) for spares and am pretty rough on them.  If I can get 9 months out of one, I am happy with that.This particular refurbished charger is clean, packaged well and looks like a keeper.  I expect to attain a normal lifespan out of it.  Given that, if I were to purchase another I would probably buy straight from Amazon.

My golden retriever puppy was not interested in this toy or any of the Nylabone toys she has. The only thing she love to chew on are bully sticks (which are gross and smell bad) but with her puppy chewing instincts, whatever makes her happy we will provide!! :)
I like the bed and so do my cats.  Most of my cats like being inside something to take a nap.

If your dog pulls during your walks you'll rub your hands raw with this leash.  The reflective strip is woven throughout so the entire leash is the most reflective leash I've ever seen or used but because of that it is very very rough.  Unless you're wearing gloves you'll feel that roughness right away and if there's any pulling on it it'll hurt very quickly.Since my dog doesn't pull at all though and we live in the city and go on long walks in the evening all the time I absolutely love this leash.  It's almost entirely reflective so the best product for my needs.  I will admit though that there's no way I would have used this leash during my first month with my dog because she was a big time puller and my baby white collar job hands would've paid the price.
summary: Very reflective leash but because of that it's also very rough

reviewText: I was hesitant to buy this because the ingredient list contains vitamin K, which is synthetic and not fed to my animals.  However, the list isn't correct after checking and rechecking on the Natural Balance website.  It does not contain the fake K, so I ordered some.  My 2 cats who can eat chicken, love it.  A winner for their rotation.
summary: 5 stars mean I love it...and so do cats!

reviewText: Keeps them busy when I can't. They don't notice when we have to leave the house. It wears them out before bed time. It's great!

reviewerName: K. Winfrey "A chained dog is a lonely dog!"
reviewText: I wish there were some sort of support to help prevent it from falling over.  My cat knocked it off the table and it broke. (When I turned it on, the light didn't move and it smelled like it was burning)  I bought another one because they like it so much but I just wish it wasn't so easy to tip over and I wish I could turn the timer on for longer than 10 minutes at a time. Overall, I love it and it's a big hit.  I also like the way it moves, it entices my cats to go after it.  When the batteries are fully charged, the light is very bright and easy to see.

I bought this to help my 3 homemade sponge filters along since I wasn't sure they were enough for my tank. It seems to work, but I keep the bubbling low, so I don't see water spew out of the top if I lower the water level. It is definitely attracting debris, so something is working.Arrived before expected arrival date.

My dog loves these and just the sound of me opening the package sends him running to get one.  Very fresh and packaged in a zip lock bag.  Made in USA not China!!!  Just ordered 2 more bags yesterday and I will definitely be back for more.
I bought this at the recommendation of my trainer and have used it for a month with no complaints.  So far so good.
This bone has really held up to the tortures of three large dogs.  Cleans their teeth nicely and it still is in one piece.

My little shiba (15lbs) loves all her balls but she loves this one the most. She loves that it has random bouncy movements so it is more fun for her to run after it in the hallway and she can grip it better than her balls. Definitely her favorite ball and I am buying more of them!

The only thing cheaper and equally as mesmerizing for a cat would be a brown paper bag. My cat absolutely loves this mouse. She runs through the apartment with the mouse clenched between her teeth like a lion transporting its kill. My cat could be sleeping or in hiding and as soon as she hears the squeak of the mouse she comes running. Unlike mice that do not make noise, this mouse keeps her occupied for ages. Often I will be watching TV and then hear the squeaking in the background which lets me know she is back to playing with mouse. Usually, I need to throw the mice that don't make noise in order to get her interested but she will start playing with this mouse on her own--no prompting needed. This is the best cat gift yet and you can't beat the price.
summary: As close to a real mouse as an indoor cat can get

reviewText: Cute and fun. Dogs love the handles all around it to carry it and throw it.

Pros:Ingredients are undeniably good.Made in the USA (Texas).Merrick offers a decent variety of other type of dog foods, grain free and otherwise, that are also great.25lbs bag offer more bang for your buck.Calories per cup are great, you don't need to feed a lot to your dogs.You get what you pay for.Cons:They don't make a 30lbs bag, making other brands more attractive - regardless where the food is made.Might be too rich for sensitive diet dogs.You get what you pay for: price is equivalent to other 30lbs bags, making more "expensive".Suggestion: you can't go wrong buying any Merrick pet food; quality is great thus the price reflects it.

My kitten loves these balls! She picks them up, carries them around the house and hides them. I found some in our wood pile once. She'll also pick one up, jump into the chair I'm sitting in and dump one in my lap, then jump down and wait for me to throw it for her.
Very nice comb.  My cats are indoor cats and don't have fleas; but, at local cat shows, I've frequently noticed owners using this comb to groom their cats.  I decided to get one, and I like it.

Our shih tzu was not a big eater when we first got her from the rescue.  They told us to feed her nutro as that's what the foster home used, but she didn't seem to love it much.  She likes the Merrick a lot once she settled in and started eating more.I generally rotate between different proteins (the buffalo, duck, going to try the beef next) so she gets some variety nutritionally.But overall I like it.  Well packaged, good ingredients, good kibble size, the company has a good reputation, and it has a mild food like smell rather than a gross smell.

I have been looking for something like this to help control our little guy who is like a dog Houdini at escaping from our yard.  I had planned on placing it next to the area near our gate that he is able to jump over.  However, he is a pomeranian and only weighs 3 lbs.  This item is only for dogs over 5 lbs.  So, we borrowed a neighbors Border Collie (who are also amazing at finding ways to escape from fenced in yard.  Worked like a charm!  It only took two "redirections" before she was unwilling to go within 10 feet of the gate/fence area.  So if you're looking for a good way of retraining your dog to stay away from areas you don't want them digging in, climbing on/over or running through, this is much more inexpensive than the electric fencing and can be moved from place to place (like taken on vacation, apartment dwellers, etc).
summary: Worked for us....but not for small dogs/cats

reviewText: I have two 80 pound dogs that drink a lot of water! I was refilling their water bowl everyday and even though it wasn't exactly inconvenient to do so, I just wanted a bigger and better watering dish. This is it! I'd recommend this product to everyone with a big dog/dogs. This jug lasts my pups almost a week! What a great price too!
I have tried all different kinds of premium dog foods, but this is the bestand the great thing is that my dogs love it. It is also the best price outof all the premium dog food.
summary: This is great food for a great price

reviewText: I'm not sure if we received a defective unit, but not only did it eat through batteries in a matter of minutes, it completely stopped working within a few days of receiving it. It was OK while it worked, definitely kept our cat occupied for a while and god knows a tired cat means a happy owner. I just wish it had not died, its a shame because it had a lot of potential to be a great product.
Our dogs cannot get enough of these discs.  They are soft on their mouths so you don't have to worry about their teeth.  They love to use them as tug toys, too so we just keep buying them....

This is a very creative way to get your cats to exercise.  These didn't cost near what those other rubber toys cost (these are plastic), but they work just as well and a lot less expensive.  I put dry cat food in them instead of actual treats and my three year old cat still loves to bat the ball around to get something out of it.

This pet bed is just fine for our 10-year-old Welsh Terrier, who seems to love it.  He fits in it a bit snugly, but that's what we think he prefers, given his past behavior.  The bed is very nicely padded, and although the sides are a bit high, Duncan has no trouble sleeping with his head on them. The only slight issue I have with the bed is the opening in the side, since sometimes Duncan's head hangs out of it onto the floor.  It doesn't bother him, though.  I certainly recommend this for medium-small dogs.
summary: Brinkmann Pet Paw Print Pet Bed

reviewText: My female Beagle is a sweetheart, but she is also "The Destroyer" when it comes to dog toys. The rope on this was shredded in less than 30 minutes. By one hour she had it completely destroyed and I pulled the remains from the ball.Now then, the rubber ball is great! It is very rugged, and it goes wild when it lands after being tossed and my dog just loves it like mad!I think Nylabone Co should make a dog tug toy with a 'rope' made of the same rubber material as the ball. Then I think my little destroyer would have a much longer lasting toy. :)
summary: Rope shreds quickly but the rubber ball is awesome!

reviewText: This treat maker is lots of fun! We have a Chihuahua and two toy poodles and they love their treats. We love to spoil our babies but to be honest I wouldn't have purchased this for the price listed. It isn't a necessity. Maybe I would buy it if I found it cheap at a garage sale. If you are looking for something to make organic treats for your dog as their primary treats, it's worth the price but if you are just playing around with it like me, I don't think it's worth what they want for it.
She sits in her bay window, perched upon her purr pad covered with a towel. Soft, warm, and contented. What more could you ask from a product?
Excellent fish food. Fish devour it, it won't cloud your tank, your chemistry stays good, and everybody wins, including your black calvus.

It took less than an hour for my 6 month old puppy to totally destroy this although she did have a wonderful time doing so.  It took her at least a month to destroy the cat's toy.  I wish there were a place to upload the pictures here to show you what she did.  I will attempt to post them in the description.  Very disappointed.
Right from my first initial go at setting up my tank, I've been using this product. Works great and is easy to use.

I checked out several different dog foods before choosing Merrick. It's high quality and excellent standards make this dog food one of the best on the market.  My dog had terrible allergies (to grains) and scratched himself all the time until he had terrible scabs on him.  I was taking him to the vet every few weeks for a shot of prednisone to stop the itching because it was SO bad!  After switching to Grain Free Merrick and switching his shampoo his itching stopped, the scabs have healed and I no longer take him to the vet for anything other than his yearly checkup and shots.  This dog food made a huge difference in my dog's life.

A few months ago I adopted a 9 month old border collie/lab mix who has endless energy.  Fortunately she loves to play fetch so we can TRY to wear her out with this activity.  The problem was that within a few weeks of adopting her, my throwing arm ached like crazy.  I didn't know launchers even existed when I turned to the internet to solve my problem, but my husband is an engineer so I decided if I couldn't find something, I would ask him to design one.  Well, it didn't take long to find the Chuck-It and I ordered two of them - the long one and the mini.Side note: my 13YO son was unaccountably excited when he heard I'd ordered a ball launcher and surprisingly disappointed when it arrived.  It turns out, he had visions of rocket launchers and had envisioned a machine that would launch the ball out of sight and couldn't wait to see it in action.  His disappointment was in its simplicity and the fact it would require actual manual effort on our part to get it to work.  LOL.I, however, am NOT disappointed.  I use the mini most of the time and love how far I can throw the ball without my arm aching at all.  It was so easy to learn to use and with a little practice I am accurate enough to hit a tree (if I want to) with it so the ball goes exactly where I want it to, every time.  My dog LOVES the launcher.  She starts dancing in circles as soon as she sees me pick it up.One of the best features of the launcher is that I no longer have to handle a soggy ball.  When she drops the ball at my feet, all I do is scoop it back up in the launcher and throw it again.  At the end of the session, I scoop it up and it lives in the launcher until the next session.
