This is such an incredible bonus they should charge extra for it.My husband is better with the long one.  I find it harder to get the ball to release in time so it doesn't go as far for me as with the mini.  I know its just a learning curve and I need to learn to flick my wrist back slightly to release it at the best time, but I'll confess I haven't taken the time to practice this.  Also, the large one, having so much longer a handle tends to flex when I try to pick up the ball so its actually harder to do this.  I would like to try the in-between size to see if I can throw the ball further than with the mini but still pick the ball up easily.
A total winner....a short legged dog like mine can make it up to the sofa, chest with dog bed, etc.

I purchased these steps for my miniature dachshund puppy who insists on leaping from my bed which is 25" high. Not sure if I can teach a new dog new tricks, but every day we work at it a bit more. After a few days, she climbs the stairs to the bed like a seasoned pro, but we have yet to get her to go down the stairs on her own. They are not steep (certainly no steeper than the 10" stairs we had in our house before we moved), so we're still trying to figure out why she is reluctant to descend. Maybe it's just more fun leaping and flying across the room!In any case, the steps "feel" solid, but I'm not sure they'd really hold 200 lbs., but since our little girl weighs only 9 lbs, we won't have to test the weight limit. The stairs are covered with a washable cover, so when the time comes to throw it in the wash, I'll try to remember to update this review and let you know how easy or difficult getting the cover back on is. So far, so good.
This is the only water bowl my cats will drink out  of so I love that I can get 3pks of filters without going to the store.

I add the suggested amount of powder to the raw meat I feed my cats. Also add it to cooked poultry to make it a completely nutritious meal. I add a few teaspoons of water to make sure all pieces are coated. The cats don't seem to notice it is in their food. I feel comfortable knowing they are receiving human grade meat (as I buy it at my grocery store) and that they are getting complete nutrition without any chance of adulterated ingredients or additives. Great product!
summary: A few shakes of the container and the cats are all set!

reviewText: I have two short hair tabbys, one is 1.5 years old and one is 4 months old. I used to get nutri-cal for them, but lately they've not been too keen on it. My 1.5 year old used to eat the nutri-cal like it was a treat, but now we have to chase him to eat it. However, he comes running when he hears the cap open on this vitamin! He absolutely loves the taste. My kitten was less keen on it, and the first few days I had to smear it on his paw for him to lick off and eat, but now he eats it off my finger. I have two negatives about this product though:1) it has no taurine, which apparently is very necessary for the cats, and most other vitamins have it. I'm not too worried though because even the Kirkland brand dry food has taurine added to it, so they're probably getting enough in their diet.2) it has a disproportionate amount of fat in it. It seems like a high-calorie vitamin, which my slightly overweight 1.5 year old doesn't need. I wish they would make this a high calorie version and offer another, low calorie alternative.Overall, my cats like it and that's a plus, but I'm not sure if I'd get it again because of the high fat/calorie content.
Nice to have a package of three.  They came quickly and my local pet outlet doesn't always have these in stock.  The price is OK too.

Our dog had terrible itching last summer. We tried shampoos and prescription creams, flea medicine, tick prevention, and diatomaceous earth in his bed. Still, scratch scratch scratch every minute!  At one of our vet follow-ups the vet tech recommended this dog food. Within a few hours we'd purchased our first bag of Merrick. Doggie has done exceptionally well. We add water to it, and occasionally a spoon of grain free Merrick canned food mixed up with the water. No more itch!

They gobbled it right down, and they are quite picky about their food. I love that it's natural. One of my cats, an older gent of 18, has sporadic stomach upsets with new food, but had absolutely no issues with this. I plan to buy more flavors ASAP.
Really helped calm down the cat.  Working extremely well on her behavior and is like a different cat .  very happy

I have a Jack Russell terrier that is mixed with goodness knows what but she is so very excited all day every day looking for something to play with that will not be ripped to bits in ten minutes, so I bought this toy to find out how long it would last and it is still 'partly" together. Two of the 'donuts' have been destoried but the bone and the other three donuts are still a challenge for her to play with, so it was worth every cent to keep her out of my way for about a half hour, thanks!

I purchased two of these for my Bernese Mountain Dog. She was having some hip issues, and we needed a place for her to lay where her bones were cushioned. She sits outside our restaurant for long periods, and because we're at the beach the cement deck can get extraordinarily cold. This cot gets her off the cold damp deck and allows enough 'breeze' for her to still be cool. Now that we have a spaniel that sits with her, we find that tossing a blanket on one end is perfect. Our Berner lays on the cool part and the Spaniel snuggles on the blanket because it's warmer and softer than that ground. We have the second cot at home, and the Spaniel has claimed it as the world most comfortable bed with the addition of the Berners old stuffed bed on top of it. Our customers are always asking where we got the great cot.

Am in need of a treat that is small, bite size for a 13 lb. pup.  Equally important the treat needs to be made from fish.  Our pup is in obedience, agility and now therapy dog classes (not all at the same time).  We are not able to use this product because it cannot be cut into small pieces. It crumbles if it is cut.
I bought this for my puppy and he and his siblings (whom I'm fostering) absolutely loves it. They play tug-a-war with it and chase whoever has it. It's was a great buy!
These smell like p-butter so I don't mind the pups chewing them near me.  The dogs enjoy them and prefer them over the other ChewChip flavors.  They are thin enough that my 20lb dogs can chew them.

I started using this years ago after my senior male cat was diagnosed with renal faiulre and began having occasional accidents outside of the litter boxes.  I wanted something that took away every last trace of urine smell, I wanted to lower the chance of him or any of my other cats to think any area outside of the litter boxes were a good spot to pee.I have always been 100% satsified with this product's ability to completely remove the uring odor.  It wasn't until recently that I also found out that it also works wonderfully as a stain remover for pet stains - and not just urine.One of my other cats recently had a bout of "tummy troubles" and unfornately was not only leaving little poop spots here and there around the house from having diarrhea, I also woke up one morning to find five separate puddles of dark colored vomit on my two month old red, microfiber sofa.  I was beside myself, not knowing how in the world I was going to get those stains out.The bottle does recommend that you do a spot-test for colorfastness but I figured what did I have to lose here, either it would be a bunch of stains or it would actually work.  Following the directions on the bottle, I removed as much of the material I could with paper toweling.  Then I sprayed the remaining stains with the Nature's Miracle "JFC" and gently scrubbed around with a clean cloth.  Then I gave it a final wipe-down with another clean, dry cloth, stepped back, held my breath a bit and waited.The areas dried relatively quickly and I am thrilled to report not only did it not affect the color of the fabric, it completely removed the all of the stains!  You can't tell there was ever anything there.  I am a customer for life!
summary: Best stain and odor remover for cat owners

reviewText: This was helpful in removing the stain and scent of cat urine on the carpet.  My vet recommended it to me.

I'm working with my 9 year old rescue - with a trainer and we are doing clicker training.  This bag is perfect!  Also works well for me in the car - my dog barks at any animal within his range:  cows, horses, goats...you name it.  I live in Montana.  I'm using the clicker-treat training to work on this.  It is working and we've started backing off treats, but the bag is so helpful as all is handy, even when driving.I love the "coin purse" closure and the pocket for phone and hook for keys.A helpful tool.
summary: Perfect bag for training with treats (and clicker)

reviewText: My dog, who would ideally love to be on the couch, seems to really like this bed.  I've had it for a month, and it's been stable and has held up under her not-always-totally-trimmed nails pretty well.  It is a little clumsy to transport, since it's not meant to come apart easily.  But overall, my dog spends more time laying (and chewing messy treats) on her bed rather than on the carpet, which is what we were going for.  (But a family member's pugs, which usually love any kind of bed they can get, seemed to be uncomfortable with this bed and avoided it, so I guess it depends on the dog.)

pun intended.This solution is a solution to my weekly fish tank vacuum and 10-20% water replacement task.  I do not have to go and purchase cloromine free water.  I use tap water and add this conditioner to the gallon jugs before putting into the tank.  I've been using this product successfully for over a year now and will continue to use it.  You will also be pleased.

My dogs love this ball. I sit it on the window sill and at night it lights up very brightly. Makes for a good game of fetch in the dark :) The ball also has a nice bounce to it. Will be ordering more.
I have had these in my tank for over a month now and they have never lost suction. I use them outside of the tank as well, works geat for power cords.

I have an 80 pound dog and this toy is big enough for him yet priced the same as small toys. He loves tossing it shaking it and squeaking it.  He is an aggressive chewer and toy destroyer. Any toy that is strong enough not to be eventually destroyed is too hard for his mouth, isn't fun for him and he won't play with it. Yes he does eventually chew this monkey up, but look at the price, it's in expensive enough to replace. It is a cute toy from my point of view and my dog loves playing with it, it's his favorite.

First of all.  I did not buy my PoochPads on Amazon.  I got a package of 2 of the large size (30X 32) from PetSmart.  Before finding these, I was buying huge supplies of the disposable pads.  Those worked just OK, but were not as absorbant as Poochpads, and were much less economical.I've had my PoochPads for at least a year and they work like a charm.  I love not having to constantly hunt for the larger disposable ones at a good unit price.  I especially like that these are made from recycled materials and wash and dry quickly with no smell at all.  They are very lightweight to handle, wet or dry.  I hang to dry when possible.  Even washing with bleach each one about every other day, they are still looking almost like new - just a little sag.I was unaware of this product until I saw it at my local Petsmart.  It is the only washable pad brand I've used.  PoochPads has their own web site, I notice. Since i purchased from a retail store, I cannot speak for the 1-star reviewer who had a problem with non-shipment and poor customer service.From googling just now, I see there are other brands of washable pads available so shopping around by price might be advised.  I certainly am not a shill for any one brand!  Just be sure to take shipping charges into consideration.  I notice that the PoochPads now all have a cutesy print on them.  Mine are plain beige and grey, which I much prefer.  I saw another brand that had both solid color and print so when I need to replace, I may be switching.  A sewer might also consider making their own if they can find the right materials.I do use my pads in a floor protector tray with lock down frame.  This might be an answer for those with puppies who scrape and/or chew.  I didn't have that problem.  My tray is so my blind old dog could have discernible boundaries.  Might also help also where the pad has to be on carpet.All in all, I highly recommend this product.

I have a sight hound that I take lure coursing and racing.  I bought this product to use as a preventative measure for when he is running on dry fields that might cause him to blow a paw pad.  He hasn't blown one before but I want to be proactive about preventing injuries if possible.  With that being said I can't really say if this product has actually helped prevent them or not, but I can say a few good things about it.... It's in a great little container, it's the perfect shape, you just take a paw and dab it on the product.  It's small and light weight so it's convenient to pack, but at the same time it seems like it's a lot of product and should last a long time even if you used it daily.  Also as far as I can tell, it doesn't stain surfaces and it doesn't smell like anything.  My dog hasn't ever noticed when it's on him either, doesn't try to lick it off or anything.
This is a great brush all the way around. Soooo easy to clean and the cat loves it. He'll roll over and then get on his back to allow me to brush him.  Definitely recommend.

Doggy (and me) loves having variety.  She has this ball, the animal sounds ball and the regular babble ball.  There are times when she specifically wants to play with one vs the other two, which is cute.  The ball is small, so I put it in a 5" Hol-ee Ball.  She can play and I don't have to worry about her breaking a tooth on the babble ball.

Premier Twist and Treat / B0002I0RLWThis is a nice little treat dispensing toy, but it's a bit tricky for humans to handle. The toy is shaped like a child's spinning top, with two halves (top and bottom) that unscrew from each other. You unscrew the top half, and try to balance the bottom half with one hand while you pour doggy kibble and tiny, cut-up treats into the bottom half. Once the bottom half is full, you use your "food pouring hand" to screw the top half back on. It's a bit of a balancing act, and I prefer theOmega Paw Tricky Treat Ball, because the Omega ball is much easier to fill. Maybe two parent families will have an easier time with the Premier.As for doggie enjoyment, my puppy likes the Premier Twist and Treat well enough, mostly because he's discovered that one really hard bat of the paw will cause the toy to spin on its axis and pretty much expel all the food right away. (My puppy is currently 4 months old, and 12 pounds.) Once again, for a better time-to-treat ratio, I recommend the Omega ball.Still, the puppy likes both the Premier and Omega and I like giving him a variety of toys, so this gets 4 stars from me. I have not had any troubles with toy durability, but I'm also blessed with a puppy that doesn't chew very much (yet!). I *highly* recommend filling this toy primarily with the dog's usual kibble, with a few treats interspaced in the mix as "surprises". There's really no need to stuff it full of treats - the puppy enjoys the toy just as much, and it makes "dinner time" a more interactive and exercising experience! I chop my doggie treats up very finely for training purposes and my puppy is always eager for the taste of a treat without filling up or getting sluggish or fat.~ Ana Mardoll
This is my second purchase of my brewers yeast I love it and so do my pets.I don't have the problems with fleas.

This dog food container works well for long trips. There is a bowl on top and bottom. The bowls are nice sized so if you have small hands it can be bulky to unscrew from the food container. But it keeps a good seal. The one improvement I'd like to see is a small spout on one bowl to make pouring unfinished water back into a bottle/receptacle. Because of the wide moth returning water to a bottle is difficult and if you're in motion there's nothing to do but roll down the window to discard the leftover water.
These wipes are too small to clean the ears and after a while, even though the jar is closed, they sort of dry out.
The cats like these balls, but they have a very short life and then the light is gone forever. Wish they lasted longer..
Works well and is easily adjustable I would highly suggest. The suction cups seems to do a good job keeping it in place

The toy is very hard plastic and easy to set off. If you walk close to it it will make noice. Also there is no off switch. My dog toyed with it for a few minutes then got sick of the noice. May work for some pets. DO NOT LEAVE PETS ALONE WITH THIS. It will break into sharp pieces.

Fantastic medicine I have used in the past and will continue to use! This cleared my dog's ears up right away and they are still clear weeks later! Am very pleased with the quality and results. FIVE STARS for sure!!
summary: Cleared My Dog's Ears Up Right Away!

reviewText: I care for a colony of feral cats in the woods in the woods behind my house and freezing water became a big issue quickly. This keeps their water thawed and ready for drinking - which is a big deal in super cold temperatures. I can attest to a readily supply of thawed water (no ice chips) at single digit temperatures with a slight wind chill on top of that. I don't use it for food, just water because it's much more critical given dry food will suffice in a pinch. So, if you live in a similar part of the country, you should be good to go. Solid, well made product overall.
I like being able to bring our own food for our puppy. We give our puppy food that is suitable for her and friends or family may not have. It is nice so she will always be on her own food and diet.

My little Maltese/Bichon could hardly wait until I took this toy out of the packaging and took off the label. He loves these soft "animal" toys he can shake. It does not look like a fox though. It looks more like a skinny chipmunk.
the shape is convenient for my small senior dogs,,Easy to pick up w/ little teeth . A small amount is quite filling for them 7 still satisfies their need to crunch

I kept trying to get him to chase the 'top' to get the treats out.  He really wouldn't play with it.  I too, put nibble sized food inside.When I tried washing it in the dishwasher, it just turned a powdery purple color ... that even I didn't like.save your $$
summary: my dog thinks this is stupid

reviewText: This leash is perfect for our 50lb dog. The leash has held up very well, but she is also a dog that does not pull at the leash. I would be wary of it with a  bigger dog who pulls a lot. The strap seems tightly woven, but is very thin. I love the lock and release feature, so much easier than some other leashes I have used.

This, along with the dry food, is the only thing I feed my 2 Miniature Poodles...there are so many BAD foods out there that contain NOTHING of value or nutrition for my dog..this was a no brainer. I did my homework and research of all available food and Chicken Soup was always #1 or #2 in what I was looking for.Being able to order from Amazon is just another BONUS9/1/2011just got another shipement - what is going on!!!!  The food is NOT in the original case--it's almost loose and of the case 14 of the cans are DENTED  what is happening to AMAZON ?????
got these for park walks so the dogs can roam safely. Great quality leashes. I do however caution that you need to always be in control bc accidents can happen easily with these leashes.
Havent had a problem with this yet.  Easy to use, retracts well.  The lock comes in handy to keep my pet from wandering into dirt, etc.
All my dogs love these snouts - even the one oddball that doesn't usually eat treats!  These are not greasy nor do they have an odor that lingers.
if you want your teething puppy to get through a bone really fast, buy this. for me i was looking for something that he would have to chew on for a while so this was not the product for my puppy
Not Sure if this stuff actually works. I think i may actually make things worse. I added to my tanks water last night, and woke up this morning with a thin film of algae over EVERYTHING in the tank.

I brought my pup a Puppy Nylabone when we first got him. It was a great alternative because he was learning to bite the furniture. The Puppy Nylabone actually smells like a flavor while the Dura Nylabone doesn't.Once my pup started to lose his baby teeth I still gave the Puppy Nylabone to him because his gum hurts a lot during this process. So it's nice to have something he can gnaw on for this time period. Once his adult teeth started showing up, about over 50% I immediately had to take this Puppy Nylabone away from him because he was starting to bite bigger junks off. We switch to the Dura Nylabone which took him a while to adjust because it didn't smell like anything even though the package stated that it's bacon flavor.Overall I think this product is great for Puppies' chewing needs!I actually like this better than their Dura products.This is a must buy for any new puppy owners or new puppies in your home!!
I was a little worried this would be too small for my pit bull who is an aggressive chewer and destroyer of all toys. We've had this for a few months and it's still holding strong.
I don't think my dog has the DNA they found.  Maybe they didn't have her DNA because it's a rarer breed.
summary: Wisdom Panel Insights Dog DNA test

reviewText: My kitty likes to be "up" on things.  So this tree is right down his alley.  I leave treats for him on it, and we use it as a play area also, not to mention he loves the scratching post too.  We're both glad he has it.

I got this for my spoiled Princess, as I imagined she would like a tree. Putting it together was very easy, it didn't take me very long to do. I put it in a corner of the living room imagining that she would enjoy watching what was going on here, but she seemed disinterested. So I decided to move it to the dining room, where she could watch the garden or me, depending on her mood.I have tendinitis in my left shoulder, so I was a bit sceptical to move it myself, but it is very light, so I managed to lift it up on the sofa and carry/drag it into the dining room. I wrote it off as yet another purchase the cat wouldn't use.Well, as time went by, she decided it was a nice place to rest. She didn't go to the top level for some reason, and she couldn't care less about the play ball. She doesn't go into the "hideout", but I never expected her to do that. She doesn't like to be covered, my little cat, too scared for that.Anyway, the last few days I've found her resting on the top level. Seems she's decided that even that is a good place to sleep. She gets her tree to herself, she can look at what she wants, and sleep in the darkness of a room that isn't in use. So in the end, it was worth it.Now, my cat aside, it is a good tree house. It has lots of areas to scratch on, it's very soft to rest on, lots of levels to jump on, high enough to look down on most people, and has hideouts and play things. It is easy to put together, feels sturdy and not easy to push over, yet light enough to lift and move by a single person. I would recommend it for anyone looking for a tree.ETA 2012-05-26: I have had this tree for about a year and a half now, and it's become a beloved furniture in the house. I moved earlier this year, and this tree was manhandled, not very gently. It was not taken apart, moved as is, and the only damage is that the ball had disappeared. She is using more of the levels to rest on now, and it has moved into my office, so we can hang out. No regrets on getting this tree!

I have both the Feline Recliner and the Simple Sleeper.  These units have quality carpet and sisal rope that not only look nice but that my cat enjoys scratching on.  I've had other cat trees/scratching posts that he just didn't seem interested in.  The advantage to this unit is the larger base and two resting stations.  My cat loves to run and leap onto the top bed; with the Feline Recliner model he has tipped it over a few times.  The Simple Sleeper has stayed upright without tipping over no matter how big a flying leap he makes.  If you have it at a window the cat can use the lower perch to observe the outside world by peeking out the window which my boy loves to do.  Both sleeping areas are big enough to fit a large cat.  My cat has a long body and he fits just fine.  I highly recommend Molly and Friends for quality products.
summary: Perfect cat tree for the active cat!

reviewText: Our finicky kitty who has chronic tummy troubles is easily able to hold this product down. Her coat is shiny, she plays like a kitten, and her troubles are kept at bay with only occasional upset, thanks to Royal Canin Special 33.
summary: Best Cat Food money can buy

reviewText: This is the second one I have purchased. My sister loved my first one so much that I gave it to her to use for her two cats. After 4 or 5 years of service, we donated to the local Animal Shelter because it was still in great shape and going strong. Actually the first cat tree I bought was an off brand and a cheaper price. It was cheaper material cardbaord and paper. It didn't last but a few month. Don't buy the lesser expensive brand - you will regret it. I stay with Armakat.
summary: You Can't Go Wrong With The Armakat Brand

reviewText: Dogs destroy things its in their nature and mine just so happens to do it faster then most. This toy is easy to repair and doesn't cause a mess

Always a favorite for cats.  You will be amazed how attentive yourcats will become when you offer them the option of Kitty Kaviar asa treat for responding to you.And, it's healthy! No fillers or grains.
Goes well next to a sunny window, very nice quality which stays put when a cat climbs or jumps off n
This is a great toy for the chewer, my dog hardly puts it down. She will carry it from room to room. She really enjoys this toy.

My dogs don't have any interest in this for some reason and the chuckle part was over in about two days without them even really playing with it much. Was a waste of money in my opinion. Should have just spent the money on another Kong which is a mainstay here.

I payed for a $45 bottle of medicine to stop my cats diarrhea meds from the vet. It did not work at all and I tried other expensive meds and lots of costly tests and trips to the vet to try to figure out why my cat was having the runs. FINALLY I came across this and it has worked miracles for my 20 pound Maine coon cat. We later found out he has a food allergy and we no longer need this. We do give him a dose if he has cat treats or gets into something and it prevents him from having the runs. It also works for my 70 pound lab. She also has a sensitive tummy.
They love these, and they smell so good,, thought the price was good but the pet store in town just got them and they were less,, big surprise a very high store

This is a cheep version, but it does work good.  The OUT training Pads we use are a bit big for it, but it works good.  The only complaint I have is that its difficult to lock the pads in...the locking device is poorly made.[...]
summary: Iris protect tray - pet training pad holder

reviewText: My 3 cats will occasionally play with these, but not as often as they play with the hoard of little furry catnip toys they own.  I like the idea that these would help with dental health, but even when the cats play with these, they don't seem to chew on them.  They just throw the toys around and chase them-no chewing takes place.  I wouldn't buy again.

Never would have believed this cheap little toy would become the biggest source of entertainment for the kitten and the 3 year old cat!  They love it.  Attached to the stair banister and hangs off the side, endless entertainment.  Will purchase again and again.

I bought this one and a couple with the fur padding, but I prefer this one, because she is a puppy and she likes to chew the other ones, this one has more of a fabric covering, so she doesn't chew on it. Seems to be comfy, has enough padding. it fits my i Crate perfectly 24" L x 18" W.She loves to lay on it in her crate.Would recommend it...I'm going to order anther.
summary: Pretty in pink, comfy, just the right a mount of padding

reviewText: I have Border Collies that are not rough with their toys, but the plastic frisbees crack and cut their mouth very easily. I have tried most dog frisbees out there since I work for a pet store. This is by far the best! Lasts and lasts plus flies well too!

My cats love Da Bird cat toy but for whatever reason they are not in the least bit interested in this.  They are probably just spoiled, but if you are looking for a cat toy, you are better off spending a few bucks more for a Da Bird, than wasting your money on this.  Just sayin...

We go through a lot of these bones in our house.  We have two small dogs (a schnauzer and a terrier) and these are, by far, their favorite bones.  Unfortunately, each bone only lasts about a week as my dogs are pretty heavy chewers.  I've tried giving them the Dura Chew bones instead but they just lick those and then move on.  My dogs tend to chew off one end of the bone and, at times, they have swallowed small pieces.  As a result, I now switch out the bones whenever I see that one is getting too "used".
summary: My dogs love it but not as durable as I would like.

reviewText: Received last night.  In looking at the tag, it states that this item is made in China.  Do we want to give anything to our adored family members that is made in China, especially when they're small and only a small amount of poison will kill them????There was NOTHING in the info on the ad stating that it was made in China.
summary: RUN.  It's made in China and it wasn't disclosed in the product 'ad'.

reviewText: My dog can't get enough of these.  She chews and chews and chews.  They are her comfort toy.
summary: My dog loves them and I love the price!

reviewText: Our four-pound Coton de Tulear puppy climbed out of the pen the first night. The rungs enable the dog to climb out. Don't bother. Just get the regular metal kind. Very disappointing.

I would have bet that my cat would not eat this if her life depended on it....I would have lost that bet.  I have a very finicky cat and he loves this.  You just take the large pill and break it into pieces with your hands and my cat comes running.  It has worked for hair ball problems and I will buy again.

I bought two of these for my new puppy. She is still getting used to using them, but I do love that they hold the pad in place. I can fit about five pads on at a time, so I just remove the top one when it gets soiled. The bottom is plastic, so nothing seeps through. Especially great if you have to place it on a carpet, etc. I spent forever, reading reviews and trying to figure out the proper size holder, pads, etc. I chose to get the 100 pack of Iris Neat 'n Dry pads, size regular (R). They fit perfect and the price was decent. This is a good size size for a puppy or small dog.
summary: Great idea for puppy or small dog

reviewText: I received a package of the Canine Plus Senior Bite-Sized Chews and immediately began to give them to my three dogs.  I have a 15 year old, an 11 year old and a 7 year old.  I wanted in particular to give them to the two oldest.  Especially the 15 year old as he is getting to be a bit picky about what he eats.  Also, he can't chew anything that is hard.  They liked these geriatric chews.  They are very small, smelled a bit like a vitamin does and they just loved them.  They recommend for 20-70 pounds, which is what my dogs weigh, 2 chews daily.  They liked them so much they always wanted more, but they didn't understand that these were not treats.  They have an "appetizing chicken liver flavor" and an "appealing bone shape."  My dogs don't know what bone shaped is, so that really didn't factor in.  I think that is just for dog owners who buy the products.  It has a long list of ingredients on the back of the bag one of which is Bromelain and an over the counter bladder drug I take contains Bromelain which is for relaxation.  That may help a senior dog feel better.  I did notice that my 15 year olds appetite was better while I was giving him this supplement, but they seemed a bit "hard" and they weren't real easy for him to chew.  But considering they are so small, he mainly chewed once or twice and then just swallowed the rest.  I like the idea of a vitamin chew but for the price of around $16.00, I would look for something cheaper.
summary: My dogs loved them but they are a bit pricey!

reviewText: I bought 3 types of finch food.  Two regular types and spent a little extra on the Fancy Finch type.  The bird feeders with the other two finch food still have food remaining for over a week now, but the bird feeder with the Fancy Finch was totally gone within 3 days.  The birds went crazy over this food.It's hard to find a small bird food, and I loved this food for my birds so much that I just re-ordered 2 more bags.  Thanks!
Great line of dog products.... Really heavy duty, last a long time & give the pups hours & hours of chewing pleasure!

My dogs really dislike this...which makes it almost worthless because they won't let me apply this to their teeth.  And when I read the list of ingredients, I was really disappointed to discover it contains parabens.  Ugh.
summary: dogs don't like it snd it contains parabens.

reviewText: Since my dog cannot tolerate the taste of this product it is not effective. For dogs that can tolerate the taste this might work but I cannot tell. It is a bit pricey so if you think you want to use this system I would try to find the smallest and cheapest sample and see if your dog can tolerate the taste first.
summary: Tastes Bad to Dog - Tasteless to humans

reviewText: This is a much better place for Harriet to play while I clean her condo.  She has a ball, but it gets caught under furniture and there have been times when I've lost her and it was hard to find her.  I love the mat, and the playpen is also where I give her the bath.  She runs around it and I know she's having a great time.
summary: Convenient place for my dwarf hamster to play while I clean her cage.

reviewText: We have a mini poodle who is allergic to everything including but not limited to, wheat, corn, beef, chicken, pretty much everything but cheese and fish. So to find him a treat is very hard. He loves these and so far so good there are no side effects, I only give it to him for a little while and then take it away to save for another day. There is also no real stinky smell to them:)

I bought a small package of this some time ago as I was having trouble finding something to hide their meds in (both cats and dogs). They love this stuff!They haven't gotten bored with it, or learned that I sometimes bury their meds in it.  Works way better than pill pockets, pieces of cheese, peanut butter, or even a bit of roast chicken. When using it to hide meds, it's easier to soak a piece in a little broth. The pill doesn't have to be completely hidden, just kind of indent it in a bit, let the dog smell that treat and he'll gobble it right down.Also, there are always crumbs and bits at the bottom of the package that I sprinkle on their dog/cat food and they seem to enjoy that a lot - one of my dogs won't eat anymore unless he's got the chicken crumbles on his food.I'm completely sold on this product.
The inclusion of a zipper makes this case very easy to carry around, and I just hook it onto a carabiner or key ring when it's not in use. Good size for medium to large breeds. No complaints.
So glad there are refills.  Our cat plays so hard with it he tears the feathers up and since it is his favorite toy it's nice to be able to replace the feathers.

Our cats absolutely LOVE this.Use caution when playing and never jerk it away from your cat - their claws and teeth can get caught, as with any toy. I've read reviews of similar products where the buyer says the wire caused damage to their cat - any toy can if not used with caution.Even our Jack Russell loves to chase this. I've had to put him in his crate so the cat actually can get to play with it.

My Border Collie gets a lot of junk, dirt, dust in his eyes from running and hanging his head out of the car window while I drive. I've heard that's not a good thing for dogs to do but I'm guilty of letting him do it. So I do use Vetericyn Eye Wash Liquid on my Vet's recommendation to help keep his eyes clean and refreshed.

These tablets are almost indestructible. They say to feed them to your cat but they are super hard, and too large. My cat could not even chew it (she is 3 years old and very healthy). It is the size of an adult pill. I had to end up crushing them with my muddler and mixing it into her wet food. It probably is a good supplement, but due to the inconvenience of actually administering it, I gave it 3.5 stars.

I am very happy with the results. I only wish the light would identify if it was the cat or the dog! (: company also sends comprehensive instructions via email. Really helpful to have on the phone to reference with first use.  Very pleased.

I purchased this because my Golden Retriever has learned to catch a frisbee but the plastic ones break apart and are dangerous.  I thought this would be a good alternative. Upon receiving it I was happy with its construction.  An hour later we were at the park and then I realized how terrible this product actually is.  First, it doesn't fly like frisbee. It's basically a heavy hunk of rubber that barely produces any lift at all.  When you throw it, it goes maybe 30 feet before falling straight to the ground.  You might as well throw a rubber ball - at least they bounce around when they hit the ground.  So right off the bat I knew I was going to return it.  Then my dog headed for the lake.  All the other frisbee's I had purchased floated.  Even the ones that were cheap (like a buck at the local CVS) managed to stay on top of the water.  On my first toss into the lake this disc sank like a rock.  So now I'm out the money I spent on this after playing with it for about 10 minutes and no where on the packaging does it say not to use this product in water.  Other than this company's primary chew toy, I'll never purchase another thing from them again.  This was a total waste of money.  If you're looking for something for your dog to chew on you're just as good cutting out a piece of an old tire or getting him something else.  If you want a rubber frisbee that actually flies, do not purchase this product.
summary: This is the worst Disc that I've ever purchased

reviewerName: Carolyn Bragg or C. Bragg "Carolyn Bragg"
reviewText: I bought this corner litter box because the one recommended for my kitty's playpen was too short and she kept kicking up kitty litter that went everywhere.This High Side corner litter box is tall, which is very good because there is very little kick-up mess.I took off points because there is a ridge inside on each side of the "entrance spout" that goes from top to bottom so it is difficult to run the scooper along that side. This is especially hard for me because I have a lot of back pain so ...bending + leaning = lengthy pain.  Also, it takes up substantially more space! Instead of being tucked in a corner like the shorter litter box, this one takes up almost 2/3 of the bottom of the playpen so kitty doesn't have much room to play on the main level when she has to stay inside the pen.
summary: Very Tall Sides -- To stop kick-up mess!

reviewText: My 9 month old puppy has been chewing these since she was about 5 months old.  It used to take her a very long time (two or three weeks) to get through an XL chew, but now it takes a week or less.  She loves these better than her antlers or bones.  She likes the microwaved pieces too.  In my microwave, it takes 2 minutes for it to fully expand -- probably because it's the XL and it's about 2.5 inches long when I take it away from her.  It leaves a bit of a mess on the carpet because she doesn't eat all the cheese pieces, but it doesn't stink like the bully sticks, and I don't mind vacuuming.  If it wasn't for these chews, I probably wouldn't have any furniture left!
summary: long lasting, healthy, and saves the furniture

reviewText: I try hard to give my boys the best of their food and treats.  I don't much care for this size, but the treats ... they LOVE them.
Third one now.  They go everywhere with a precious little Shitzu.  They even have to be carried outside on walks!

This rug is stellar, not only is it comfy for humans to walk on, it collects so much crud! I live in the south, so my yard for winter unfortunately has a lot of bare spots that are nothing but sand and clay. Yuck. Then with the rains we get, I am cleaning my floors twice a day, this doormat has been a huge help, it collects so much sand, mud & water. Def lives up to the hype. THe non skid backing is a HUGE plus, since I have to wild hounds running around! this prevents them from slip sliding everywhere!The pups also love to lay on it when they are chillin' chewing on an antler! :) I would definately recommend this product. In fact, I will be ordering another, in extra large.
It's one of the bones my dogs like to chew on, especially our Rottweiler.  It's holding up well also so I may consider getting another one when this one wears out.

Nylabone Big Chew Beef Bone is by far the best chew toy that we have tried primarily because it lasts for months and it occupies our dog without our involvement. We have previously bought the Nylabone Wishbone and it took our 50# dog less than a month to sharpen it to the point where I no longer felt safe giving it to him. Due to the size and the shape of this product, it provides more chewing material that so far has lasted for 3 months. At the rate that our dog is going, we should be able to get at least another 5 months out of the bone.The other benefit of this toy is that it occupies our dog and keeps him from bugging us when we are tired and don't have the energy to play with him. With the exception of stuffed Kong, all of the other toys he has require our involvement because we need to either play tug or throw them to him in a game of fetch.The only negative of this chew is that it leaves small plastic crumbs in places where our dog chewed the bone. Although it is harder to break off large pieces of plastic from it, occasionally our dog ends up swallowing what he manages to scrape off the bone. According to the manufacturer, pieces the size of a grain of rice or smaller should not pose any problems. And so far, most of the pieces that I noticed were much smaller than that.
summary: A great lasting product that occupies our dog for hours

reviewText: My cat loves this and it redirects his scratching. he doesn't just scratch on it, he pulls out pieces of it and leaves what looks like shredded pieces of brown paper (tiny) easy to pick up.  Once he has pulled out most of it which takes a while you can pull it apart and turn it over and he'll use that.  I did that and it didn't fit the same way, but it didn't stop my cat from using it.  I even broke it apart and he scratches on all the pieces because he's learned that must be what its' for.  So we have several pieces now and he's sits amongst them deciding which one to use.  Of course he has better leverage with it as it is in the picture, and he even likes it so much he was sleeping on it for a while.  So, Smokey likes it.
summary: Very good product - Smokey loves it.

reviewText: Several notable folks use these and recommend their use, as do I. This last batch didn't seem quite as sticky, but they are working well to deter the dis-assembly off our home and furniture by our six kitties.

Mitzy, the once ferrel cat, moved in via the dog door and is now queen of this cat tree. She shimmies straight up the poles and doesn't bother much with the landings/ steps. Top platform is her favorite and holds her now 11 lb frame comfortably. Slight wobbling occurs when she jumps about wildly or launches an attack on fuzzy ball. She is rough but I have never worried it would ever topple over. Impressed by the stability in spite of the small footprint. Well designed and easy to assemble. Bottom poles allow for full stretch and scratch. She shows no interest in the rope but her love of fuzzy ball makes up for it. Find it easy to move to new locations to add variety.
summary: Sturdy/Easy assemble/Light enough to move about/ Small foot print/allows full stretch/scratch

reviewText: I'm surprised our St Bernard is STILL chewing on this time a month later. She has a massive mouth with a very strong bite and has been unable to break off pieces. She's just scratching it to death. =) We did put some peanut butter in it to get her attention... she liked that. Her huge tongue can't get inside of the stick, however, so we had to wash it to keep the peanut butter left inside from going rancid. Also - I was afraid of the "bacon scent", but honestly I didn't smell anything after the first day.
My cat's vet suggests this is a good snack for cats. She warns "Don't overdo it, because it is a snack" but its not junk food like many other snacks we see commonly in stores.
summary: Mr. Kitty Cat likes these treats best!

reviewText: My little 8lb Morkie fits in this like a hot dog in a bun. It does the trick. Before this he would be behind my neck. We use this when we both are in the car. He loves it. Only problem is it's inconvienent if you need to get into your middle console. We have a Toyota Camry and the straps are a little too long but better too long than not long enough! Does it's job!!!
This works perfectly. The moment my dog sets foot on the sofa the high pitched squeal goes off and he hates it and leaves.  It sounds like a smoke alarm, so it's highly irritating.

As of 11/17/10Cost of this set:  $64.90 which includes Platinum fountain, 3 replacement filters, and cleaning kit.Individually:Drinkwell Platinum Pet Fountain:  $45.20Premium Replacement Filters (set of 3):  $7.29Drinkwell Fountain Cleaning Kit:  $8.49Total:  $60.98
summary: Great fountain, lousy deal... buy pieces separately

reviewText: Both my dogs liked this initially and now don't ever touch it..not sure what happened..maybe the bacon smell disapeared?

Our boxer eats Natural Balance dry food.  We always go to the Pet store for this.  I searched one day to see if Amazon had it and they did.  Not only did they have it, they had it at a lower price than any store.  With Amazon Prime, free shipping.  No more lugging the heavy bag in the car and into the house.  Have it delivered like me and avoid all that.

I recently went to a limited ingredient diet for our 10 month old Lab puppy.  She is just loving loving these treats and her new diet thanks to the awesome variety Natural Balance has with Limited Ingredients .
summary: My dog eats better then I do

reviewText: Keeps my 3 terrors busy chewing, which they love to do! Very durable for my largest at 32lbs yet it's also fine for my smallest at 20 lbs.

I love the bounce of this toy and the fact that it's is chew worthy for my Dojo. He's a power chewer. This one is safe to leave in his run to play with. Can also be stuffed with treats. Kong products rock!
My cat's loved this toy! The only reason it's not getting 5 stars is because my cats tore it apart within the first 2 hours.. it became unstitched. besides that, perfect for cats!

Anyone that can't program this is an imbecile.  Very easy to set up.  Works better than I imagined.  Now I fill it once every 2 weeks and it takes care of feeding the cats.  I have no complaints about it at all.  Just use a fresh battery and you are set.  Anyone who complains about the clock drifting a few minutes a month is neurotic.  Really, the cats don't mind if dinner is 4 minutes early.  HIGHLY RECOMMEND!  Caveat - this is for cats.  I don't think it works as well for dogs - you've been warned.
summary: Awesome - just what my cats (and I) needed

reviewText: Just used this for my Bichons and it worked fabulous! No cuts and it went thru their hair smoothly.  Made my job much easier!
summary: Just used it for my Bichons

reviewText: I just got 2 new kittens and gave myself a kitty shower in anticipation of their arrival.These springs were one of the presents I gave myself. I included them in my shopping cart only because I lacked a few dollars to get free shipping. I got one bag of large and one bag of small springs.The kittens took to them right away. They love batting them around, more than the mice. Mine are plastic, and not the dangerous metal that others have described.addendum: I have now had my two Exotic Shorthairs for 2 months, and these springs are the favorite toy of one of them. He cannot get enough of batting it around, pouncing on it, and carrying it in his mouth as a trophy. The other kitten likes it too, but her favorite is the dangling "Da Bird" feathers.

I purchased the 250 watt Aqueon Pro heater to replace a 30 year old Supreme Heetmaster 200 watt immersible heater that worked great but I broken the glass tube.  I figured the 250 watt Aqueon Pro heater would hold a temp of 86 since it was rated 68 - 88  degrees but it couldn't. I keep my aquarium at 86 degree for my discus and angelfish. My old heater would raise my 25 gallon tank to 93 degree in a blink of an eye. Since it broke,  I was using a 100 watt and a 50 watt heater to maintain the temp of 86 degrees. When I switched to the Aqueon Pro heater, my tank was at 86.5. I put the Aqueon heater to 88 degrees and was checking it every 1/2 an hour to make sure all was ok but it wasn't. The temp of my aquarium was dropping every time I checked. The red light would come on for a couple of minutes then turn green but the temp would never raise. It just kept going down. When the temp hit 84.5 I decided it was enough and switched it back to the 100 watt and 50 watt heaters. The 250 watt Aqueon Pro heater couldn't keep a 25 gallon tank at 86 degrees or 85 degree. I don't know how high a temp it would hold since I switched it when my tank dropped down to 84.5. And I had the setting at it's highest - 88 degrees. Also, one needs a heater that can bring the water temp to at least 88 degrees to help fight an ick outbreak. I am returing the heater and looking for a different brand.
summary: Does not heat aquarium high enough

reviewText: This is good to use as a supplement instead of CO.  We use this to help supplement some of the planted tanks.  I've also heard of using this to fight BBA, but I can't speak for that.  This is less expensive than what it costs in local fish stores and is a good thing to try before you spend a lot of money on a CO2 system.  Try this in conjunction with good lighting to grow plants in the aquarium, then if it works good, then consider upgrading ot a CO2 system.

it is a big pillow and our two small (15 lb) dogs love to curl up on it.  When it first arrived, the stuffing seemed overly fluffy, but after a couple weeks of use, it compacted a little so it is a good size.
This is a decent clipper. If you can get your kitty to stay still and cooperate, this will get the job done painlessly!
I have a LOT of cats and this toy is rarely played with. I think it would be better suited for puppies and small dogs.
Since using this I have noticed better color and better growth in a variety of aquatic plants.  Would recommend this product to everyone.

I bought every flavor of Nature Balance biscuits and these were the only ones my Shih Tzus seemed to like.  They all have a smokey flavor to them but the Sweet Potato and Chicken Formula were more crunchy and easier to chew for my dogs.
summary: My 4 Shih Tzus think they're ok

reviewText: I mix this in with CS Puppy Dry food, my puppy loves it and it has the best USA ingredients.

We have a Siberian cat with dense long hair, very fine and soft. He has trouble occasionally with poop getting stuck on his butt fur. He also has trouble occasionally with matted fur on his tummy, at leg joints.On the positive side, this clipper is nice and quiet. Alas, it is totally non-helpful for our situation.  The instructions say explicitly that it should never be used near a pet's anus, because it could cut into the skin of that sensitive area. Well, that goes our major motivation for the purchase. The instructions also say that this clipper is not helpful for matted fur, which matches our experience. You are supposed to purchase a different device for matted fur and use that first. That was our 2nd motivation, and thus my 2nd problem with this clipper. Finally, this clipper is pretty pathetic at cutting our cat's fur. Admittedly his fur is a challenge, being very soft while densely packed and long.On the positive side, the unit itself is very well built. The manufacturer contacted me and tried to help, which very much impresses me. I am sure this device works well for other pets' fur, just not mine.
summary: Not for use near anus; not for use with matted hair; poor for dense thin cat fur

reviewText: Very nice and sturdy crate, wonderful for my toy poodle, can't keep him out of it lol. Wonderfully made and I definitely recommend.

I haven't received this yet, but have had one before and it's awesome! I used in the back of my Tacoma and it worked well! If the puppy's wet? No worries, this keeps the seats clean & dry.Yes, I would recommend

My cat prefers canned food, but I like to have dry food available to him.  He would not eat most dry food until I discovered grain-free (healthier for him, anyway).  He LOVES this brand, and although he eats less dry food, he eats this regularly.

First let me say that we are giving 4 stars for one reason only.. there is so much information on this card that it is nearly impossible to read it.That being said, it is a great product for it's usefulness if needed and provides all necessary information that should be shared in the event a person with a service animal might be questioned.

Good value but my puppy has already destroyed two of the three beds I bought. I'll probably get more of them because they're well made it's just that she's teething and a ferocious chewer.....These beds are a great value for making a pet kennel more comfortable.

I bought this after reading all the excellent reviews, and was seriously disappointed when my cats, who I thought were fairly smart, totally didn't get it, or really seem to care about its existence.But after several days of me batting it across the floor for them to show them how it works, they figured it out.  Well, one of them has, anyway.  It's so cute to watch her swat it across the carpet to retrieve her snack.  My other little guy isn't very food-motivated in general, so I'm not sure if he doesn't get it yet, or if he's just content to wait for the easy-eating wet food.My only complaint is that the "lock" that keeps your hole-width setting isn't as secure as it could be.  Sometimes I pick up the ball and notice that it has shifted around and the holes are closed, so no food can come out.  That's probably somewhat frustrating and bewildering for my cat.UPDATEMy other cat figured it out a couple weeks later :)

My puppy adores this toy and it is like there is a plastic bottle or heavy cup inside that the puppy is chewing on when playing with the dog. She adores this toy to play with.  Thank you again for this item.

My dog likes these treats a lot, as much as any of the other Dogswell jerky treats. I don't think the lavender/chamomile does much for him though. He remains pretty anxious/wound up even after eating them.However, I can imagine that like any treat, they provide some help with anxiety by simply being a distraction. I'm satisfied with this treat, but will probably get a different Dogswell jerky next time, like the ones for joints or good breath.I do love the size of this bag. TONS of treats in it, lasts me forever.Also, for real anxiety issues, I have heard the ThunderShirt dog wrap is amazingThundershirt Dog Anxiety Treatment- (Medium) - Heather Gray. I am considering getting one.
My plants looks so much better after regular dosing of iron. Its a needed fertilizer since you have to dose it daily.
I will only buy human grade pet food, sourced and produced in the United States.  This is a product of Thailand.

Ok guys I'm someone who tends to do alot of research before I spend money on an item. I had an idea of what I was looking for but not a 100%; so I had purchased the evolve 2. First, I notice the tank was too small for my needs which is only a 1.8 gal; I thought it was a 2gal. I found out after ward that evolve4 was a 3.4 gal and this suited my needs a little better and therefore decided to go with this one. This is a  nice looking tank compared to the other brands I tried for example the tetra 2gal and  a few others. However, I do have to agree with a few of the other reviews when they said that the pumps were a little too big for the tank. what I did was put a filter sponge on the end where the water gets filtered out to the tank and it did the job. I have a small beta fish so the current could not be too strong. be sure you inspect the tank be for you take the tank home from the store I found one that had a broken part on the pump. good luck friends.Update 1: Dec.1,2012well I love the tank but found out that the sponge trick isn't working so im going to have to find another alt. Does anyone have any ideas? So far everything is working fine and Ill update in about a month to see how it holds up.final update:it's been a while now and I still love the tank good luck and all parts work fine. still five stars for me.
summary: Great tank don't listen to anyone else.

reviewText: These are the only ones that we ever buy for our pups at home! They love them, will chew them ALL DAY if we let them, and they tend to last pretty long for our 60 lb huskies.Haven't found any they have liked better for the relatively low cost of the bones. Always buying from them.Would be 5 stars if not for:Even though I use Prime sometimes it takes as long as 7 days to get here which kind of defeats the purpose of using Prime for its expedited shipping option.

summary: My cat is either stubborn or stupid

reviewText: Rachael Ray's line is carried by most grocery stores and online making it easy to purchase at your weekly food trips. Its a good balance of nutritional value and the price I would rate is in the middle. I've seen cheaper food (but less nutritional) and more expensive food (more nutritional) as well. So its a good happy medium. There is no artificial flavors or artificial preservatives and no beef by product fillers, meaning real beef is the main ingredient. As far as how it tastes.. well we have 5 dogs... and they all enjoyed eating the food, they had no issues with it.
summary: Real Beed, Holesome Grains and Veggies - Dog Approved

reviewText: My dogs love these Duck treats and I like them because they give my dogs added  health benefits for their joints. I used other brands before and later discovered they had anitbodies in them which isn't good. Happy Hips is a brand I trust. I give this purchase a 5 star for the quality of the product, the seller's customer service and ability to deliver as promised on time, which as a shopper I appreciate.  My shopping was made simple and I will buy this again.

Cee Cee, whose long hair spans two adjoining states, loves it even more. How she can get detangled one day and have hairlumps the next, I do not understand. But because this wonderful rake has ROTATING ROUNDED TEETH, there is less yelling (on the part of both of us) and MORE detangling ... with PURRS. Ah yes!!!

As noted, measure carefully. That said, these hold up well to NW winter, clean easily, and keep our little dude toasty. Well built, solid materials, priced well, definitely worth your dollar; this is our second, because fashion matters too, right?

If you have a kitty that:1) likes to inhale his food and barfs2) or is a kitten more interested in playing than eating3) or is a bit overweight and just needs to slow down to have the time to realize they are full...then you may be interested in the feeding station I setup!  (see picture)I picked up a few of these food distributor balls and a couple Bergan Turbotracks from Amazon and created a little area to contain the food ball, so you don't end up stepping on kibble as the ball gets pushed around who knows where.The distributor ball is plastic, but its dishwasher safe, brainless easy to use, durable, adjustable, and takes seconds to fill as you just twist the top off and scoop it right into your bag of kibble, no need to measure since you can just fill it half-way or full and easily know how much you're feeding.  =)
My cats did not like it, so i donated it to a my vets office, they sometimes need to let other people try this on pets who have allergies.
You can set this at either angle you wish.  Whether long ways or sideways.  The cage with my dog was a great thing.

Both our large dogs love these, even the one that isn't so crazy about regular rawhide treats.  I break them in half to make them last longer.  These also don't seem to cause constipation like regular rawhides can if overfed.  This large pkg is the best value I've found for rawhide sticks.

Description said to pair this bulb with the Ultra Sun Trichromatic Super Daylight Bulb for best tank color and plant growth.  This is the second time we have tried this pairing only to see the our aquarium plants continue their downward spiral.  In between these two attempts, we used two 6800K bulbs by another manufacturer and our plants looked really great. Not sure why a so-called "plant bulb" would not be better for the plants, but we'll go back to the two 6800K bulbs.

I wanted a large enough cage for our golden, so when we had to put him in it he'd be comfortable. This is definitely large enough for him to move around in, turn around, get comfortable, and rest. Has a removable bottom tray I guess in case you need to clean it out. I use a dog bed in it as well. Was a simple design and setup was easy; everything just folds out and clips together.The only real problem I had with this is one day the dog managed to get the side door open. The latches are really loose sliding latches. So enough jostling of the cage over enough time (the side door was never actually used, so I never bothered to inspect the latches), and they worked themselves free. I had seen him do it with the front door latches one at a time before (over a single night), so I should've expected this to happen to both latches. I now use carabiners on one latch per side. Makes it easy to take off and secures it from being accidently worked opened.I had a similar sized full plastic carrier cage years ago that I liked a lot less. While that one was more "mobile" (although hardly anything that sized and with a dog that size is carry/mobilized), the hard plastic started to become brittle with age, and broke apart at latch points and handle points. I think this metal one will last a lot longer, and I like that it's more open for the dog. It does come with small carrying handles but I don't know if I'd try to move it with a dog in it. For the size and the price you can't go wrong with this (if you watch it on amazon it frequently drops down around 45$).

I can't really speak to the durability of this halter because I have only had it for about a week. I have become a fan however and have recommended it to some people at the dog park. I have a seven month old mixed breed puppy who weighs about 45 pounds. He is a great dog, but he wasn't very good on a leash, so my husband didn't like to walk him. This halter has changed that! So now Max gets to go for more morning walks. I also am able to control him much better. The main problem was at the dog park where he would take off because he was so excited to get in. But now I can keep him mostly walking right next to me without gagging him. I use the halter with his regular collar without a problem. When we get home or to the dog park, I just unclick the neck clip and my dog steps out of the leg areas. It takes an extra 20-30 seconds to get him strapped into it, but it is SO worth it. Try it for your dog. If it doesn't work, pass it on to another dog owner. For the price, it is worth trying, but not everything works for every dog, so there may be some who don't improve with this halter. But for my dog, this was a difference maker!

I originally purchased a much more expensive collapsible crate and was really disappointed in the quality when it arrived. After returning it and purchasing this one, I'm ecstatic!  This crate is a great size and the included divider makes it so that it will grow with my puppy.  He would barely let me put it up and kept getting in while I was putting it together.  Each time I put it up or take it down it gets faster, and I LOVE that it came with two handles which makes carrying it even easier.  The divider has already been put to good use and is keeping the puppy nice and cozy. I did notice that a toy slid under the divider and he couldn't get to it so I'll have to adjust how I put in the divider next time (this is for overnight visits outside our home, not his primary crate).Overall, I'm thrilled with the quality and ease of use of this crate, especially for the price!!!
Works great just like it says it does!!!!!! would buy again!!
I first bought these at Petsmart awhile back for my dog and he loved them. Especially the peanut butter flavor! Slightly cheaper on Prime and totally worth the cost. Definitely recommend.
summary: My dog is in love with these!

reviewText: Once my Portuguese water dog's adult teeth came in(about 6 months), this toy didn't have a chance. He pulled at the fabric with his front teeth and tore holes in it to tear out the stuffing and squeaker. If Kong wants to test any of its stuffed toys for durability, my dog would be a great test subject.
summary: Cute, but not for strong, teethers.

reviewText: Neither of my dogs care for this treat ball and both of them eat out of treat balls so they are no stranger to them.  It smells like rubber and I think that really put them off and it is a pain to fill.  I just ended up purchasing another type and I made one as well.

This is an easy toy for your dog to get the food out.  I have to leave the top on though because TOO much can come out of there.  She just pushes it with her nose or feet, the kibbles come out and it keeps her busy for quite a while.  I would recommend this one.UPDATE:  I downgraded this toy after having it for a while.  Now it just sits in the cabinet.  It seems to just be too big and clumsy for my little Missy (a mini schnauzer/shih tzu) to get her food out, so she just walks away from it.  She seems to like the smaller ball with holes in it better (Treat Dispensing Chew Ball here on amazon.com).
summary: My dog loves this one....UPDATE ON THIS REVIEW

reviewText: Truthfully my cat like the milk carton rings better. Thought these would be a good substitute, but not. She batted them around a little and that was it.
Very poorly made-Squeakers fall out within minutes! The Zanies are 100% better quality and last ALOT longer. This item is expensive garbage & dangerous to dogs that could choke on squeakers!

In the past I have purchased both the Floppy Disc and the Tail-Spin Flyer.  Although our dog was rather tough on both flying discs, I gave them high scores since I liked how light they were and hung in the air longer than the rubber/plastic type flying discs.  With this latest purchase of the Chuckit Large Paraflight, I am impressed with the heavier material but the true test will be with our chocolate lab & if the disc lasts longer than a month or so.
summary: I gave them high scores since I liked how light they were and hung in the air ...

reviewText: My cat is in love with this thing. She even rolled over so I could get her tummy and other side. She's a long-haired cat, so proper grooming is essential to avoid knots and mats, and she sees the kitty brush as a toy. This grooming glove does the trick! Since it picks up the scent of whichever cat you use it on most, I'm going to have to get another for my other cat (since, sadly, they are decidedly NOT friends).

Kitty loves this! I also have the similar straight tunnel by ABO. This one is great because with three sides it is stable and doesn't roll over. It has a slightly larger circumference and the same white fuzzy ball hanging inside. The fabric is a touch lighter weight than ABO, and more crinkly (noisy).Be aware this ships from China, and will take about two weeks to get to the US.
summary: Good for both kittens and cats

reviewText: These are the ONLY doggie waste bags I will ever purchase.  The size is perfect, they are durable and they have a pleasant, light scent.  They are easily removable from the roll by the perforation and fit perfectly into a standard size bag dispenser.  I also love that they are truly biodegradable.  Other companies advertise as being so, but are not truly.  Highly recommended.
summary: The best ever doggie waste bags!

reviewText: I've been mixing these in with other bird treats for our tray feeder in the backyard. This large feeder is a popular spot for birds, and there's almost always comings and goings during the day. The nuggets disappear rather quickly so one doesn't have to worry about waste or spoilage.I can't be sure which birds eat the nuggets, but woodpeckers, jays, finches, cardinals and assorted small birds are regular visitors. Occasionally blackbirds, bluebirds, and chubby doves also find their way to this covered tray feeder.The peanut nuggets are an ideal wild bird supplement for wintering birds who use the energy produced by the rendered suet to keep warm. The peanut and raisin content of the nuggests also is an attraction for a variety of birds. I like handling these nonsticky nuggets better than the greasy blocks of suet that we also put out for the birds.For the money and multiple benefits for the birds, I consider the C and S Peanut Nuggets a good value.
I keep buying this brand as it works and the bigger one is better buy. Try to DNS gallon size but don't see it much.

This is a typical small heater for a small tank. The overall quality is good and it works well. My only issue is that the temperature adjustment knob at the top is hard to move. After it is installed in the tank, it's next to impossible to adjust the temperature on this thing, especially in small incriments as it becomes slick and takes a lot of force to move. I would still recommend this purchase, but wanted to point out the issue I have with it.

The Bob-A-Lot was heavier than expected, so I wasn't sure that either of my corgi's would be interested in it.  I put some kibble right into the bottom and opened the little sliding door fully.  Within seconds my high-drive dog was all over it.  After that I opened both the top and bottom doors just enough for the kibble to get through.  It makes it a little more challenging, but he still empties it out just fine.My other dog is less self-assured, and it took a few minutes to get him interested.  He really enjoys the toy too - just takes him a little longer to empty it.My dogs are trained to know that whatever one gets the other gets too.  On the plus side, there are never any fights over food or chews.  But, with my brazen boy all over the toy, the less assured dog just stares at me waiting for his.  So, I'm back for a 2'nd Bob-A-Lot.  Can't believe that I'm spending ~$40 for two of these toys, but both boys really like it and it's a lot of fun watching them maneuver it.Only negatives I've found is that it'd be hard to clean the bottom part (wish it came apart).  And, it's loud on hardwood floors.  We've also got a tug-a-jug.  But, even when there are great treats inside, neither of my dogs have any interest in it.

This is a much better small heater as you can actually adjust the heat. On a lot of the smaller heaters (like the paddle shaped, super thin on - or the tiny black one with just an on/off light) they are supposed to just heat to a pre-programmed temperature and turn off, but don't allow you to adjust any of the temperature settings - and on some of them they even suggest you remove the heater from the tank on hot days (I assume because they are not very sophisticated), but this one is just like a big-tank heater only small. It's slightly larger than some of the other ones in this tank-size range, but it's worth the extra space and money to give you the option of setting the temperature!
summary: The better of the small heaters

reviewText: Have one cat who it was bought for loves this ball. He prefers it to his bowl & he seems to eat less. He is a fat boy & less food is a good thing. He carries it around by the top where it screws on. It does roll under the furniture often which kills my knees. It is a little worn out from turning for size control .
summary: Cat likes it better than a bowl

reviewText: My vet suggested one of these based on her assumption that my dog is anxious.  It's had no effect so far, but my take is that the dog is ANYTHING but anxious.  He's just easily excitable, especially in the car (which he loves to ride in) and barks like crazy at anything that moves - cyclists, runners, flags, birds, it doesn't matter.  Traffic cones seem to set him off too.  He has a huge smile the whole time; he's not anxious, he's having a blast.  I gave 2 stars instead of 1 because I think this is a treatment for a problem my dog doesn't have.I'm also trying a DAP spray and a calming dog chew called Composure (both also available on Amazon) and they have had no noticeable effect either.  Acepromazine works, but my vet frowns on anything more than very occasional use of it in special circumstances.  Sigh.
summary: No noticeable effect after 2+ weeks, BUT...(read)

reviewText: I love this thing, and my dog does too! Unfortunately, she's chewed the top off of her second one after less than a month of having it, and after she threw up some plastic I decided this is her last one. I'm going to try the Kong Wobbler instead for her safety. My dog doesn't chew through any other items (no shoes, nylabones, soft toys, etc) so it was disappointing that the Starmark folks didn't get this crucial aspect right.Pros:You can customize the settings to make it harder or easier for the dog to get the foodThe hardest settings would keep my smart dog occupied for 30 min!Clean. You can pour kibble right in, no need to stuff by handCons:Supposedly chew-proof plastic is *not at all* chew-proof
summary: Great! But not for any level of chewer

reviewText: Excellent food for my wonderful dog. My vet agrees that it is a reasonably priced excellent dog food.And you can't beat the price!

Amazon had a great price, the only thing I was concerned about was if the size was right for my dog.  I have a 25lb cockapoo, and this was the perfect size for him.  The assembly was simple, just unfold it, no instructions needed (although they are provided).  It includes a partition (divider) so you can gradually increase your puppies living space has he grows. My dog is already grown so it was not needed, but it's a great feature for the puppy parents.  Highly recommend this crate.
My terrier (all 7 pounds of him) managed to rip part of the inside lining away in the first couple of hours of play, but the overall toy is sturdy. He likes opening it up to find treats.

My cat really liked the design...open on the side so she could lay down next to the toy and slap at the ball.  But the design is painted on the ball in a puffy paint and prevents it from rolling smoothly.  Unless I'm sitting there playing with her and keep the ball moving it gets stuck half way around...and she loses interest quickly.  So for us, this toy is not great.

Mr. Piggy has become an important part of my dog's toy box.  It appears to be her favorite.  There is no more nose, all of the insides have been scattered to the four winds, it definitely needs a bath.  And although he has been put through torture and abuse he is still the first choice of my almost three-year old Golden Retriever.  Mr Piggy continues to keep her happy and has provided our household some real laughs.

I bought 2, one for the two play floors the cats hang around at. They randomly play with this toy, They will usually lay down beside it and bat the ball around, sometimes 2 of them will pay together back and forth. I recommend it. I play it with them sometimes too. I have 3 cats.

There are 2 dogs and 6 cats in my household, and not one of them will eat these tab's, not even the dog who inhales anything that's offered to him.  They all love plain brewer's yeast tab's, but combined with the garlic, nope.  I'll donate them to someone who has pets who might eat 'em.
summary: Would be good, if my critters would eat 'em

reviewText: I was looking for a dog bowl that will hold at least 1 gallon of water as I have 2 thirsty dogs. The fountain is a great idea because the water doesnt become stale. There is also a filter to help clean the water. My one dog took to it right away and after 3 days the other one now drinks out of it. Both of our cats have also decided it was better then there regular cat water bowl! I love it and for the price its a steal!!!

Our 3 month old GSD was tearing into her food, causing her to yack it back up shortly after eating.We tried the 'ol rock in the bowl trick, but this is a much better alternative, especially given the reasonable price.We have been using it for about a month now, and the bowl works as expected.  It does cause her to slow her pace of eating.The bowl we ordered (large) will be too small for her big ol muzzle within a month or two, since she is growing like a weed.
summary: Just the thing for that fast eater!

reviewText: I ordered this fountain for our two dogs (medium sized- 50 lbs a piece).  I was tired of cleaning and refilling the water bowls several times a day.  This worked great.  Had to clean it out only once a week, had to be refilled every other day or so.  We used filtered water as we do have well water.  I replaced the filter that came with the bundle package. The dogs loved it!  Problem is that it did not last.  We bought it in Dec 2012, it is now Feb 2013 and it is dead.  Our poor dogs are very sad trying to stick their tongues into the hole of the fountain.  I did just order another just cause I liked it so much (and maybe we got a lemon) and will see if this one lasts.
My dog didn't like this product at all.  I have bought other products from this company but unfortuanetly this one he didn't care for.
This replaces the original foam filters used in the dogit large water bowl. They fit pferfectly to replace the original.
It is amazing. It hangs easy, and is super cute! It also says "HAMSTER" on the purple cube, I thought that was really cute. She chews on it with joy; definitively a recommendation.

I have a 70lb lab that loves stuffed animals. He is not super aggressive with them; he loves to bite them and hear the squeaker. This monkey has lasted me for months.
