I've had other Kong Cozies that do not last as long if they have long floppy ears or something that he can really easily get at. The monkey has lasted us the longest out of all the Kong Cozies.
summary: Very durable for a stuffed animal

reviewText: do not recommend.  Dog shows no interest at all....the squeaker function disappeared after a month.....now only has the crinkly sound.  Would not buy again.
summary: The squeaking noise was gone after a month

reviewText: Our pups love these as a nice afternoon treat. Usually has good sized chews that aren't too small. They don't stain the carpet but there is usually a white mark that easily wipes off.

It  works for my BIG mix breed Rhodesian / Bull Mastiff / Pit (100+lbs) and my medium dog (45lbs).The big dog would finish her meal in seconds, now it takes several minutes.  She has to work for her food, but it IS healthier for her to eat slower.The "brakes" can prevent the dog from getting to the food if their snout is wide or you get a bowl that is to small. Our dog has a big wide mouth and the Jumbo is OK, the large is good for the medium dog.....bigger is better.Even though the bowl can slide across the floor, without the non skid bottoms the bowls would be all over.....the dogs have to work to get the food, and that's OK.The item is well made. Color is blue in photo, we got white, which was better.I which I knew about these years ago.Smart item.
Several finicky cats rule my house and finding foods that all will agree on is difficult, but Deli-Cat is viewed as a treat and each and every one comes running when I open the container.
These tiny treats are the perfect size for a treat ball or a puzzle toy.  Even my Chi can get it on the play now that we have treats he can eat as well!

The main reason I'm writing this review is to compliment the great customer service of Midwest Homes for Pets. When my item arrived, the plastic crate pan was broken. I called up Midwest Homes for Pets, got someone on the phone almost immediately, and she took care of it right away. I got a replacement pan in no time.Aside from that, this crate is everything you'd expect out of a crate and does what it advertises. Sturdy, easy to put together and collapse, easy to carry (but a bit heavy for my petite self, but still doable; not complaining b/c the crate is sturdy metal after all), just perfect.We just got a greyhound and have needed to move the crate back and forth from the bedroom to the living room as we crate-train him and it's been easy.I'd definitely recommend it.
These bags work well. My only complaint is that they are a bit thin. It's my second order of them and I haven't found a better replacement.

We've used Zymox Otic for about 10 years, but I hadn't been aware of a topical version. I decided to try it on Ace, who is a severely allergic fella and who has had a hotspot on his neck for months. After only a week, the spot is scabbed, and the scab is starting to come off to healthy tissue. AMAZING!! I'll be sure to keep this around for emergencies.

I have 4 7 week old kittens and this unit comes in so handy. I use a very small litter pan so they can have more room on the floor though. The upper and lower doors are so convenient and easy to lock/unlock. Hubby put the unit together in under 30 minutes, but it took him some time to put the wheels on correctly and firmly. He said that was the only hard part. I'd definitely recommend this to anyone with kittens, especially for feeding time if 'Momma' likes to steal their kitten chow LOL. My older cats don't seem to like it at least with the gates closed. Maybe with time they won't mind. btw The price is very reasonable.
This one is good also. It wipes up well, keeps it's shape and the dogs like playing with it as well as using it for a pillow..

These came in the mail yesterday and I asked my husband how in the world I was going to get my German Shepherd (Schatzi's Shadow) to the keyboard and have her give an honest review.  After we laughed, I showed her the package and she just about grabbed it out of my hands!  She could smell the bacon, and so could we.I'm not sure what "size" these are supposed to be, they are very small for a German Shepherd and she could gobble one up in just two bites.  The second one, she sort-of coughed and choked on and I got worried.  Shadow was fine when I offered her another one and after I told her that she didn't need any more snacks until after supper, I put the package in the fridge (just as the directions said).I think it's safe to say that she liked them; she whined at me and went over to the cabinet where her snacks are usually stored and was wanting more.  She's like my teen son:  a bacon lover!My only concern is that she did choke once, so we will give them to her while we're with her and not just pour any in her dish.  I think I remember reading that these are supposed to be safer than raw-hide bones but she's had raw-hides and never choked.So, Schatzi would give this five stars, but because of the choking incident, I removed one and give it four.
This is by far the best cleaning product out there for animals.  It works insanely well and even smells nice. I use it for non-animal stains even, just because it's so effective and pet friendly.

This stuff is a LIFESAVER! My dog has allergies and gets rashes frequently. After too many visits to the vetat $200 a pop, I decided to try this and it works amazingly! Clears up a rash in a day and also can be used forcuts and scrapes! I am sure to never run out and take it on trips in case of emergencies. Has cortisone in itfor inflammation, but caution cortisone cannot be used long term on any area (over 10 days) because itcan thin and damage the skin with too much use.(I work for a dermatologist)
summary: A MUST for everyone with a dog that has allergies

reviewText: Our dog just doesn't like to stand still (unlike my cat with the cat version) but when we do get the brush on him, it seems to work well. I think it's a bit intimidating and hard edged, so the dog has some fear to this. We'll keep trying since it works well on getting rid of the extra hair.
summary: Dog not a fan but it works well!

reviewText: I have had many different dogs over the years including German Shepherds and long coat Collies and thus I was shocked by the amount of fur put out by the rescue Black Lab we just adopted.  None of my brushes or combs that worked so well on our other dogs did much to eliminate the vast amount of black fur we were getting all over the house.  As a result I decided to try the FURminator and it is fantastic.  I can't say enough good things about how well this brush works on the Black Lab.  Basically a 5 minute brushing about every 3rd day cuts the fur found all over the house down to maybe 10% of what we were getting before.  This brush is an outstanding product, but it does pull a bit more than my older type brushes and combs, so you do need to start out gently to get the dog used to it, and then over time you can be a bit more firm as you brush to get more fur out.  Only downside is it fills very quickly so you constantly have to empty it every couple swipes down the dog, but the self cleaner does work extremely well.

Out of all the bedding i've used over the years, this is my favorite. It doesn't smell like bark or pine or anything really for that matter. Its easy to clean and use. PLUS....I like to be able to change up the colors too.

We took a gamble on this and figured we had a good chance of getting a green or blue bowl for our little boy.  Nope!  The pink one arrived and we were a little dissapointed.Fortunately our local pet store was able to swap it for us for free.Otherwise, the bowl has held up well for the past 3 months and it works great.  Just wished i could have picked the color.  Be warned!
summary: Great bowl but cant pick color

reviewText: Very easy to use and easy to clean.  My dog is an aussie/malamute mix so she has a ton of undercoat and if it is not brushed at least once a week (often 2x per week) then her skin gets dry and flaky and little patches of hair are all over the house.  She doesn't mind this brush at all and I love how easy it is use.

My cats really like the fancy feast food in the grilled variety. I think they like the small pieces and gravy of this variety vs the solid chunk of the classic variety. Their favorite flavors are the seafood but they like these as well. I like that it's one of the few cat foods that actually has meat as it's first ingredient.
I bought two of these for when I travel with my dog.  They are pretty small when collapsed so they fit easily in the side pocket of her kennel.  They are well made and easy to clean.  Great for pets!

About the only time they are not snarling at each other is when they are eating.  I love Fancy Feast, my cats love Fancy Feast - we are a much happier family when we have this.  Which right now is not the case.  I have some more in my cart, but can't place the order until next week when I get paid.  Hurry up paycheck!!
summary: A favorite - all my cats love this!

reviewText: Product works really well--a little pricey--but then it does work and keeps the fleas off my cats!

My Dog would give this 5 stars, as she loves it- but I have a couple of issues with it.Pros:1) Does seem really tough- my dog destroys stuffed toys like nobodies business (most stuffed toys are lucky to last more than a couple hours)- and she has played with this one for every day for a week and not one single wear spot to be seen.2) Floats- this is good as it won't soak up too much if it gets wet in the yard either.3) the center is a bright color which makes it easier to find in the dark4) dog has an easy time picking it up by herself due to the shape of the rim (think doughnut)5) Bounces and will roll on it's side sometimes which can be a fun changeCons:1) There is a tag on it that says it is "100% Chemical Fill"- I have no idea what that is or if it is safe....2) it is MUCH heavier than a normal Frisbee which makes it harder to throw- it sort of goes a ways and then falls and either rolls or bounces.... which my dog is fine with- but if your dog likes to catch in the air- might not be for you.3) The tag I mentioned in Con 1- is hanging off the toy so if you have a dog like mine she will keep trying to chew it off until you cut it off just to remove temptation.So overall the pros outweigh the cons but they are still there- and still somewhat of a concern depending on what kind of a dog/player you have.
Love the scooper. Easy to use. Perfect for grass of any length. Rinses easily. Will probably buy another one soon.
I keep coming back to this brand because it takes care of the fleas and ticks for a good long while on our cats.

I've been using this for over a year now. I have two dogs that just can't quite grasp the whole potty training thing 100% and I feel good about a product that doesn't just cover up the odor but organically kills it at the source; destroying the enzymes that cause the odor by using enzymes that break them down. It's non-toxic and doesn't have a strong scent.

I put this product in front of our closed in roofed litter box.  We use crystals and they were getting all over the bathroom.  This product worked great for a couple of days, but the crystals did eventually get past.  However, I would say overall, it does cut down the mess by around 85% or so, which is still MUCH better than normal and may be the best you can come accross period.  Those crazy cats, they will eventually make a mess regardless; this product does help to contain it (but is by no means full proof).  I recommend this if you are a realist and realize you can't stop the mess, but only hope to contain it.  If you are looking for a product to stop 100%, keep looking.
I have been feeding this dog food brand and variety to my terrier for a while now. She loves the taste.

have been buying this brand of dog food for a while now for my elderly dog and she seems to like all the flavors i have bought now.  it seems to be a really healthy product and i will continue to buy it  and would recommend it to others.  my daughter also buys it for her dog who has alergies and he does well on it.

I wish I had the bigger size too, as other reviewers have said...my cat box is approx 16x22 and I would need two of these as I have an open litter box and they throw litter everywhere.  This has really helped with the litter that is thrown out of the box...I just take the mat outdoors and shake it off...so I don't have as big of a mess as before that I have to sweep.

I agree with all the other users that trying to make this scratching post stay upright is almost impossible.  It gets knocked down and scares the cats.  But, it does the job laying down.  I love this product because it's indoor / outdoor and this one stays outside.  My cat Mittins now uses this (most of the time) instead of the outdoor furniture as her scratcher of choice.  My other cats normally scratch elsewhere as well but I put a little bit of catnip on the post and they started using it too.

From the point of view of my 12lb American Bobtail ... this horrible scratching post has a life of it's own. She only tried it twice - the first time it fell on top of her (don't bother trying to secure it to anything, doesn't work) and the second time it became stuck to her claws. She hissed, spat and shook it off her paws then ran with much sputtering and hissing to hide behind the bed. She most definitely was not amused with her scratching post.

I initially bought this for outdoor strays.  However, our neighborhood didn't seem to have any this winter.  Weird.  Anyway, indoor cats inherited it, and there is nearly always a cat on it.  They love it.  The heat is apparently just right for maximum pleasure.

Great addition to feline dental care! Although this does NOT replace regular vet tooth cleanings, etc., these treats are great to give your kitty on a daily basis for maintenance. Warning: they are HUGE.. That's kind of the point though- It forces them to have to really bite into them and chew them, which helps scrape some of the tartar off of the teeth. I'd start off maybe with a smaller bag though to make sure they'll eat them- One my cats refuses to because they are so big and you can't really break them in half, as the outside is more of a hard 'skin' vs. a crust and they will basically fall apart once attempt to do that.I highly recommend this product!

My husband thought I was too optimistic when I ordered the bed. It's not a crazy hit with all of my 5 cats, but 2 like it and can often be found lounging in the curved bed or digging their claws into the cardboard. As it wasn't too expensive, and 2 of 5 cats like it - I'd order it again.
I have a 135 gal tank stocked very well , with corals etc.. They seem to like this salt alot.. I willl buy it again..
summary: Great Price for a great REEFER product!

reviewText: This is a terrific dry shampoo and much, much cheaper than some other waterless shampoos for dogs.It has a pleasant, fresh scent.It is perfect for cleaning up dirty paws before stepping inside.The price is great.I'm very happy with using this shampoo between baths.
When I got my kitten he literally urinated on multiple spots all over the house and on the couch and carpets.  This stuff took out the stains and the smell.  I am life long user
I guess I should have checked the dimensions.  This bad boy is HUGE (that's what SHE said)... but it works great and the pups have nice clean drinking water.  NO complaints.

What is better for my beagle than an Easter bunny?!  She's 11 weeks old today and we love to play, "Go get the bunny".  It's a little like playing with my son when he was small.  In fact my son loved it as much as she did.  (He still loves stuffed animals).  I make it hop and she goes nuts.She carries it around with her and loves on it one minute and chews on its ears another minute.  The squeak part lasted about 20 seconds.  Somehow her needle-like teeth got thru the squeaker.  At least she cannot remove it from the animal.Excellent choice for puppies and small to medium sized dogs.
This is my rabbits's FAVORITE hay!!!! I was disappointed tho, with this purchase of it, because it was not fresh, at all, and my bunnies wouldn't even eat it!!!!

After wrestling with housetraining issues with a rescued 15 lb. Pomeranian for a year, I gave up and purchased these.  This sweet little dog now has the run of the house and is well on her way to living a life of leisure....one she deserves.  She is no longer confined to a pet pen when I'm home.  She now interacts with all the other 4-legged children in the household and mom doesn't worry about her urinating in the house while learning to be housetrained.  I'm hoping this will help with the training process.  But if she is incapable of being housetrained, my carpets will be saved and I won't be stressed.  This product is well worth the money.
I like knowing there is a limited amount of extras in the food. It does not smell bad. My dog loves all the flavors.

These were bought for my 5 yr old Yorkie. They are made on the small side which is great because she has very tiny feet. She really seems to like them. They keep her little paws warm on the ceramic tiles in our house ,and she doesn't seem to slip and slide around like she did before. My only complaint is that they seem to stretch when she wears them, so sometimes they fall of. Washing them puts them back into shape though.
We have a cat that is almost 20 pounds and she fits through the door. most pet doors are too narrow, but this one works.
My Havanese loves to shake this sweet bunny. I think she likes grabbing the nice long ears. Have seen no damage to the toy and my dog can destroy anything not extremely well made in hours.
very cute my dog LOVES it and so far has held up very well...She is hard on toys so it must be made pretty well.

My cat is a 14-year old that has seen it all, done it all. I've spent hundreds of dollars on pads, toys, motivators etc. I have enough left over feathers to rival Fredericks of Hollywood. Most get sniffed and then are ignored until I give them away. This Omegapaws Scratch 'n Massage Bed is one of a handful of items he has loved over the years, currently loves and likely always will love.He scratches it for his claws, sleeps in it when he gets bored with his other spots, and has me follow him over to it when I get home at the end of the day and scratches his own head on the corner of it while I massage his back. As the title says,  a low cost all in one feline mini entertainment complex.Despite what other posters have said, he has never used it for a cat box and it is NOT JUNK. It's sturdy, uses good cardboard that doesn't shred like copy paper and something I missed at first: you get three layers of ripple board. When he is through with one, I've got two more beneath to use. I don't know how aggressive your cat is in scratching but one of these boxes can last months with the extra boards supplied.There are only a few products I would even bother writing a review about, but when someone has an offering that consistently works so well for me, I like to tell others. This one is a great product that I will keep repeat ordering.PS Their Roll and Clean cat litter box is also very interesting. It is not fool-proof, but for those who hate sifting cat litter to clean it, this little device can cut down on that task by orders of magnitude. Also well worth checking out if you're in the market for a covered litter box.
summary: Low cost all in one feline mini entertainment complex

reviewText: If you have grass (long or short) and you have a dog or several for that matter, this will pick up your dog's business.  I'd like if it was a little tougher / stronger metal, however it can be fixed just by pressing the metal against the ground. No big deal.  So far it has been a good utility to pick up the poop!

I thought I was getting the proper size to replace the pump for my Pioneer Pet fountain.  Unfortunately this one is a bit big, but if you are so inclined you can sand down a bit of the space in the fountain base and get this to work.  It has a bit more power and I think the cats like this better.  It is also quieter
Handle fits a small hand very well, and the hair is easy to remove using a bristle brush.  My dog appreciates the skin stimulation and good scratching it provides.
summary: Nice curry for a short haired dog.

reviewText: This is one product we like well enough to buy again now that a second canary has fluttered noisily into our lives. Lucky Ned Pipper, our handsome yellow Gloster (with a dapper brown feather "hat" and his signature air of good-natured nonchalance) has been enjoying his for a year or more, and recommends it highly to all small birds of his size, stature, and personal aesthetic, which runs to an eclectic mix of modern and traditional design elements. Now his newly adopted brother, Lucky Red Pipper - a handsome, if yet more somber Red Factor - will have his own inside-the-cage tub, too. My birds clearly feel safe in this tub, and I like it because even though it's not fully enclosed, it somehow contains the mess that some birds have been known to make in and around their bathing facilities. Every morning I bring Lucky Ned his sparkling, cool, freshly drawn bathwater and he greets me (or more likely, the tub) with a song. Either way, we are happy. And that's something to sing about.
summary: Well made, easy to use - and no mess!

reviewText: I have an old cat who has chronic renal failure and, I suspect, is a tad senile.  She will poop in her litter boxes but she does number one on carpet or other soft absorbent surface.  We (my cat and I) are now living in the non-carpeted part of the house.  I have been using Iris brand training pads and was anxious to compare their performance with these pads.  For my cat I place a small folded blanket on the vinyl floor and cover it with a training pad.  I use the blanket because my cat seeks out cushy (which equates to absorbent in her tiny mind) places to pee on.  The system has been working well for us.  Because my cat has CRF she drinks a lot of water.  She holds it until she is about to burst and so she puts out a lot of urine all at once.  The training pads have to work hard to keep up and both brands do an acceptable job most times depending of course on how close to the edge of the pad she squats.  I am home a lot  and when I go out, three times a week, I am only away for two hours.  So the pads are used only once and in our situation I can't imagine them being able to hold more.  I used to immediately go to deal with the pad as soon as it was used but I've learned to wait at least a few minutes because the pad needs time to fully absorb making for a tidier pick-up and dispose process.  These pads are a few inches larger than the medium sized Iris pads and they have a smoother slicker waterproof backing.  Also these pads are fluffier and the absorbent side feels more cloth-like than the Iris.  Bought in 100 count packs from Amazono the Iris pad are around 22 cents each and these pads in the 50 count pack are about 25 cents.  If these pads out-performed the Iris or if the larger size mattered to me then I would switch brands.  But the two brands are equally effective and the Iris are large enough for my purposes so I will stick with them.  I thought the softer cloth-like feel of the Pruven pads would cause my cat to prefer them but she usually picks the Iris one to go on.

reviewerName: Time to walk the dog, Dave
summary: My budgies (parakeets) have played with these daily for over a year

reviewText: This brush was well worth the money. We get 2 dogs worth of fur off of our dog every time we brush him with this. I recommend it to everyone!
I have a Yorkie and her eyes water and she gets gunk on the corners.  I cut these pads in half and they last a really long time.  They are good for cleaning up her whole, very small face.
This is our second one. We have a medium for every day use and now the smaller one for traveling and use in other rooms when needed.
Both my labs liked this toy.  However, it didn't last very long before the stuffing from the toy was strung out all over the house.
Milk bone is always good

I bought this to use on my two little dogs. The reviews were all good so I splurged. My mom is allergic to them so I thought it would be worth it. Little did I know this stuff STINKS!! It's horrible. I was tempted to wash my dogs with this then use their regular shampoo over it to take away some of the smell. When I visited my mom, she asked me when I washed them last beacause she could barely breathe. She had no idea that I washed them the day before and used this stuff. So if you want to waste you money, this would be a great product to do so!!

This was one of several re-orders of this product.  I recommend it highly and find it to be an incredible value under our Amazon Prime membership.  I love it, the dog loves it, my wallet loves it...perfect!

Nature's Miracle has long been our standby for pet messes (and lately kid messes).  Not only does it do as good of a job as normal carpet cleaners at lifting stains, it does an excellent job preventing and eliminating smells.
summary: Fantastic at removing stains and smells

reviewText: I bought this for my persian cat when her old Le Bistro feeder just got too grungy to use any more (after nine years). I must have been asleep at the wheel when I ordered it (hey it looked just like the old one in the picture) just four times as big. These feeders work great for almost any shape dry pet food. This size holds about half a 17.5 pound bag of Science Diet adult cat food. Now Murphy has enought chow at any given time to weather the odd catagory five hurricane, or a nuclear attack.
Will order again if the price remains the same or lower. I have 2 cats and the refill last for 3 months. Cant complain

When I opened this, first thing I did was smell the material, no smell.Then I put it together, easy.  Read directions, put on double pane sliding doorput 20lb cat on it.  No problems, nice product nice price, happy cat.
summary: Just have it installed and used by cat

reviewText: We have two toy poodles and we try to take them out often to keep them socialized.  We keep this in the back of the car, they love it and so easy for us.  Works great, easy up and down, light weight.  If treated with care it will last a long time.  Our poodles weigh 4 and 6 lbs, about full grown and they fit perfect.

I never want my cats to go through the misery of being without water.  This automatic waterer lets me be sure they have water whenever they want it.  Clean water.  I can fill the bottle and know no matter how long I'm stuck at work I don't have to worry about the kitties going thirsty.  And it's very easy to clean.I had invested in some of the electric-pump filtered water fountains, but my cats ignore those and go to their old faithful Bistro, so I'm unplugging the fountains and adding some more Bistro waterers around the house.
summary: Makes my life easier & my cats happier

reviewText: I'm always looking for something to distract my busy kitten and these looked worth a try.  At first she didn't seem too interested.  I kept a few in my pocket and fooled around with them with her on the couch (compressing them and letting them "jump") and she started to play with them, even abandoning her favorite mice for awhile.  She can carry them, rolls them on the wooden floor and, yes, loses them.  She is a chewer and I saw her chew on one without damaging it at all.They are obviously snipped from a long coil of plastic and there are some rough bits on the ends.  I solved any issues with this by smoothing them with a nail file.  I'm only giving her one at a time anyway so it's no problem to smooth 2 or 3.  I bought 3 pkgs. because I expect her to lose them all eventually.

I couldn't stop my puppy from marking all over the house, despite all sorts of training interventions, and after a couple days of mild discomfort in the belly band stopped the behavior in its tracks! I definitely recommend this as a quick and cheap solution to a very messy problem.
I was amazed by the great price for this.  The bottle is huge, about twice the size of what you buy in the stores.
We have two small dogs and they really enjoy the bisquits!Sometimes my two dogs are like cats being picky about what they eat!!!

This window seat is not going to win any points for aesthetics.  When you pull it out of the box, you will probably think that it feels so light-weight that it can't possibly hold anything better than a tiny kitten.  Reading through some of the negative reviews, the consensus seemed to be that dirty windows were the cause of some seats coming unattached.  So, I gave a very half-hearted cleaning to my windows and suction cups, and stuck it to the window.  My 12 lb cats lay on it daily (one at a time), and it's completely secure.You might think that you can only hang this seat on unadorned windows, but my windows have wooden blinds, and I still hung this seat.  I typically keep my blinds down, with the slats open during the day.  But I set the seat up at a window by sticking the "strings" with suction cups through the blinds to adhere to the window.  I raised the blinds a few inches and adhered the suction cups on the seats to the window.  At the end of the night, I remove the seat from the suction cups and drop my blinds, since this is in my bedroom.  It take a second to set it up again in the morning.As I mentioned, I don't know how they could have made this any cheaper-looking. From the white plastic attachments to the blah-colored seat made out of an industrial strength tent material, it's lacking in beauty.  I also didn't think that material would comfortable for my cats, so I laid a soft towel on it, and they both seem to love it.
summary: Cheap-looking, but holds up to my 12 lb cats

reviewText: Our cats enjoy playing with these springs and pull them out of the toy box frequently.  Warning however, they're not easy to see on carpet and rugs so you may step on them.

I used to use the other flavor Kong stuffing (peanut butter flavor for puppies) in the taller cans that my dogs seemed to love also, but one of my dogs is now on some meds that are in tablet form. I bought this new? flavor in the 8 ounce can to put the meds in, and she gobbles it all up pills and all. Unlike some other reviewers, my purchase of this product is fine, and there is no loose liquid seperation of the contents making it runny at all. It comes out of the can fine.

It's quite a strong smell like a new factory product.  However, that smell wears off over time, a week or so, with or w/o use, even without washing. The size is perfect for my 4.5 pound chihuahua with room around him to spear, maybe for a small blanket.  The hooks inside are a bit heavy considering it's for a small dog.  The bottom compartment contains a board for support.  Over all, it's an alright buy. No major complaints from me.

My dog loves this toy.. it's the only one that has lasted through her teething phase (other than a rubber kong toy or two). I love the material, it's tough enough to play tug'o'war but it's not stiff or plastic-y like most rubber toys. Lucy chews and chews on the black threading at the ends but she hasn't quite gotten the thing open yet... the edges have become quite worn but so far it's still intact. Those teeth can do quite a bit of damage so I try to use this toy for tugging and throwing only - definitely no unsupervised chewing (as with all dog toys, right??). I purchased this product a couple of months ago and I'm very happy to say I haven't had to replace it yet.I don't consider Lucy an 'aggressive' or extreme chewer but she usually goes right through most soft stuffed toys and she adores pulling the stuffing out of them. For some reason, this one still has her stumped. Overall this toy is great for my dog, me and my wallet. All that being said, I know some dogs are power chewers and could surely rip this thing into pieces. If you do purchase this product, I hope it brings you and your pupp (or pupps!) lots and lots of fun!!

Keeps water crystal clear and doesn't make a lot of noise. Had some algae issues awhile back and this thing took care of the problem within 24 hours. I keep it running all the time and the water always stays clear and clean. Would recommend.

I've had my dog in a large wire crate since we got him, but because of a move overseas we needed to purchase a plastic crate for the plane ride.  The Sky Kennel seemed to be the generally accepted standard for airline approved crates, so that's what we went with.The crate is well-built, and I particularly liked the vault style door in the front.  The locking mechanism for most kennels has two pins that lock into the top and bottom of the crate.  While generally it's pretty secure, it is possible to not get both of the pins seated sometimes which can lead to the dog getting out.  The vault style has four pins, and they insert into all four sides of the crate.  While my dog isn't an escape artist, this four-pin lock can only be closed if all four pins are inserted properly, so you don't have to worry about partially securing the door.  It's either locked or not, and it's pretty obvious when you do it.There is also a safety latch on the lock which prevents it from moving accidentally.  Again, this is just another added measure to ensure the door doesn't open accidentally while in transit.  The last thing I need is my dog running around the belly of an airplane ripping everyone else's bags to shreds!
Will probably keep buying these over and over again. They work perfect for our 80lb Golden Retriever. We no longer worry about clips.
My kitty loves it! She always kneads in it for awhile (the foam and fleece must feel nice) and then she sleeps for hours. She is so comfy she isn't even waking me up for breakfast anymore!

I have two senior dogs who will eat just about anything. Unfortunately 1 dog only has 3 teeth, and I found these to be a little tough and dry for her. I can break them in half and she can swallow them whole, but for senior dogs I think things could softer and less leathery. The ingredients do look healthful, though, just not something I feel I would purchase again, unless I was certain they were softer and easier to eat.

I wish I'd purchased this on my laptop instead of my phone. With the small picture and no reviews to read, I wrongly assumed this was a *plastic* mesh roof for the IRIS exercise pen.This is made of cheap, thin fabric netting, like a mosquito net or a delicates bag for your washing machine. The pen itself is only $40, at a $20 price point this should definitely be the same plastic material used for the pen (or priced at about $5.)At the very least, the description should be amended to include details about the materials.
summary: Roof is made of fabric, poor quality for the price

reviewText: I was hesitant about buying this choker. I didn't want to hurt my dog but couldn't take him for walks because he is so big and strong. He is a 1 year old Rotweiler. I can actually walk my dog now when using this choker. It's not painful him unless he pulls hard to run. I tried walking him with just a harness and had no control. This is a great choker for training a large dog.
summary: Finally I can walk my dog

reviewText: This is for our golden. A must have. Works so well with her hair. She also loves it so its a win win.
Make sure you have more than one dog for this package...My MinPin does like these lots, especially  the different flavors, but next time I will get the smaller box.

I poured the food out in the dry food bin and my cats sniffed it and then turned back to some wet food they were eating. Usually when I pour out fresh dry food, they turn to eat that but not with this product. Not much interest.
summary: My Cats Turned to Their Other Food

reviewText: My GSD sheds like crazy. The furminator helps to pull that loose hair out before she leaves it all over the house.
Good price, for tasty treats for the mutt.  Dog is happy, so owner is happy.  We limit these to 1 per day usually.
summary: Tasty, good price, worth the money

reviewText: Magic Pet Hair RemoverIt works very well.  I have two long haired cats.  I love that I can rinse it off and reuse it again when it dries.  Unlike the rollers that you toss.  As long as you go one way it does well.  Read the directions.  I do not like the smell of this product which is why I only gave it 4 stars.  Also, it is a little big for my hands to use.  I do like that it gets the hard to remove hair off my comforter.  It is worth a try.

I really like this lead for walking my 6 month old Black Lab.  Believe it or not,  my pup likes to be on a lead!  However, my husband mistakenly tied the pup out with this lead and pup chewed it apart in about five places.  Since it is cotton and he loves to chew, the lead was destroyed.This is my second lead like this one and he has destroyed both.  I suppose I am too organized, to have a lead for walking and a different type one for putting pup outside, and then to hope they would be used that way. Just proves, we don't live in a perfect world.  Sorry if I sound upset, I really am.  I really like this lead and it would have worked well for me.  I had it all of one day and didn't even get to use it.  If you have a dog that chews, be watchful.  Otherwise, it is a great lead.  It is not the lead's fault it gets chewed up!Would recommend otherwise.
They play with them, lose them, find them, play with them some more, lose them again, and on and on and on.  Very sturdy construction.
This doesn't hold enough for larger cats compared to another brand I bought. It wore off after three weeks also.

You have to keep applying this OFTEN for it to make any difference. This isn't the universal cat problem answer that others have made it out to be. remember cats are individuals and if they wanna scratch they're gonna, whether it smells like kitty already or not.

I foster dogs, and have purchased many a Nylabone. If you have a dog that is driving you crazy and he/she doesn't have a Nylabone, buy one now! Most dogs have a need to chew. If you don't give them something of their own to chew on, they are going to chew on your things or their need will manifest itself in other ways, like excessive energy that drives you crazy.  It's really important to give your dog toys, and I really recommend the Nylabones.  The ends get nasty as the dogs chew on them, this is normal.  I have this size, which is predominantly chewed on my pitbull.  It is just under 8 inches long. You are definitely going to get your money worth from this Nylabone, or any others you choose.
summary: Nylabones are the safest choice for your dog!

reviewText: With the arrival of spring, I started looking for a good flea and tick product for my dogs!  I am not sure how well this will work as it's new and I just put the first dose on my dog, but the smell is pleasant and the dog did not do the usual rubbing and wriggling when I put it on her - that is a big plus!  I didn't feel a need to wash my hands with disinfectant after applying it and when I took her for a long walk in the woods, I didn't see any critters on her.  If there is a problem later I will update this review, but so far, so good!!!
summary: Spring has arrived along with the worry over fleas!

reviewText: I was skeptical of this product working, but after reading all the other great reviews I gave it a try.  At first I didn't notice any difference even though I was using it daily.  It wasn't until I switched from using my finger to apply the gel to using a toothbrush that I saw huge results.  My corgi's completely brown tooth is now almost white!  I have recommended this products to friends and they have all seen great results.The only downside is the flavor.  My dogs HATE the gel even though they all love normal doggy toothpaste.  If you have a dog who does not take to body handling too well, this will be very hard to apply.  I have not used the new salmon flavor, but according to friends the dog's still hate it AND it smells bad.  I would consider trying the spray version of this stuff but have not yet tried since I didn't notice the difference in my dog's teeth until I used a tootbrush to do some scrubbing.

The one concern I had about feeding my dog a vitamin is whether or not she'd like it.  She does!  It's a treat she looks forward to.The vitamins come in a little tray.  They are soft, and I'll bet they taste meaty.  For dogs under 30 pounds, we have to cut them in half.  I find it easiest to use a butter knife and cut them while they're in the tray.  I wish the maker would just make them in half sizes and people with bigger dogs can just pop out multiple chews.To give you an idea of how long each package will last, my box has 30 chews.  Dosing is based on weight:under 30 pounds -- 1/2 soft chew daily30 to 59 pounds -- 1 soft chew daily50 to 99 pounds -- 2 soft chews daily100 pounds and over -- 3 soft chews dailyThis vitamin isn't as complete as BioSpot, but my dog likes it and I don't have to struggle to give it to her.
Have a nervous anxiety filled border collie and these did nothing. tried them for 30 days and no results. they just dont work for our dog, maybe they will for yours.
summary: Does not work for our dog

reviewText: I began purchasing this food after my vet recommended a grain-free diet for my cat due to digestive issues.  Both my cats used to throw up a lot, and that has decreased tremendously since we switched to this food (we used to feed Purina One).  My cat with digestive issues is doing much better.  In fact, she used to eat almost no hard food before and would only eat soft, but since we switched to this hard food she actually eats it.  She only gets soft food occasionally now.  So best of all, both cats seem to really like this food and I know it is healthier for them.
summary: My cat is much healthier now

reviewText: Did not last to long since my dog tears stuff up, but was worth the money and the squeaker works great!
Our pup can hold this between his paws and chew on it from any side.  He will also play with it, throw it, catch it all by himself.  It is easily digestible.
I use it to avoid severe grass yellowing and dying in the yard because I have two large dogs and sometimes more. I am not too sure how effective it is because I still have some grass issues.

Nice interactive game between dog and their human. Read instructions to start with easiest "find treat" option.  Once they understand, then add to the difficulty levels. Keep out of reach when not playing.

reviewText: My Platys love this stuff as well as any of the other Tetra fish foods.  This big can lasts me a long time.

Picking up poop isn't on my "oh joy" list, however, these lavender scented bags make ithe job so much easier.

I have a six-year-old GSD with light hip dysplasia and an 11-year-old dog with severe arthritis.  Both need glucosamine/chondroitin with MSM.  When taken regularly for 4-6 weeks and then continued on a maintenance level, daily supplements are beneficial to the dog.This stuff, while tasty to both dogs, however, is expensive.  Even for one dog, four tablets a day is just a week's supply. That is not enough to get started to see results.  There are other products such as Dasuquin with MSM, that are very effective (and highly-rated) and more affordable.While this product is fine for a dog on a maintenance level, pet owners of large dogs may want to consider other products such as Dasuquin.  Ultimately the decision will be based on the dog, as my dogs find the taste of this product to be very good.This product is made in Israel.

My two bengal kittens love these.  They want to play fetch with them, as well as play with them in "solo play", batting them around, tossing them up in the air etc.  And they are both very protective of this particular toy.  I'm going to have to order more, as the ones they have are getting worn out, plus, as I said, they get jealous about "ownership" of these.  Two paws up, says they.

reviewText: Okay cat food.

Three kittens and 1 cat absolutely love these. They bounce and roll, and can be easily carried. They keep the kitties occupied and amused for hours! Excellent product at a wonderful price. I would definitely recommend this item to others. Very pleased.

I have resorted to using a baby nail scissor to cut out clumps if I can get him to lie still for half a second.

The bed is not as it is listed online. We were very unhappy upon receiving this item. It wasn't soft, and it felt like there wasn't enough stuffing in the pillow. I did not get any from Amazon--yet--but will the next time I need to get these, but they are terrific.  Pay no attention to anyone who says they are "worthless." However....CORRECTLY USED  (e.g., rubbing in the right direction)...they are a fur and lint/dust magnet. The zippered closure seemed stuck.  I tried to work the zipper loose, but it would not move. reviewText: My cats love all of the 100% catnip stuffed toys.  They toss them around, grab them and bunny kick them and usually end up just laying on the floor licking them.  It a good thing the toys are very reasonably priced; although they are extremely durable, the incessant licking makes them appear dirty.  Of course, the cats don't care, that part's a human thing.  I highly recommend these to cat owners!

My cats love this toy and this brand!!  The cat nip lasts a long time...they play with the toy and when they go back to it later, it seems like the first time they have seen it!  Fun to watch them play!

This is a really cute, soft toy of a nice size with a rattle in it.  Its light enough to toss around and the legs are great to nibble on!  I don't know if its just my cat or what but the Kong catnip toys don't seem to be so "catnippy" so I only gave it 4 stars. However, I do like them because my cat does.  I remedy this problem my keeping all of his soft toys in a toy chest (a container with a lid) and I keep loose catnip in it too..  This works out great and he can't wait to play with his toys.

reviewText: I have a staffordshire/german shepherd mix puppy, who is pretty good on soft toys, but once one pops a seam he's very interested in the stuffing, and I worry about him eating it. This toy has no stuffing and is very well made. It comes with a bunch of replacement squeakers, and my puppy is always carrying this beaver around with him. Exactly what I'd expect from a Kong product!

My cats adore these toys - they carry them around, sleep with them, and fight over who gets to sit near them.  I've made homemade catnip sacks in the past and these are much cuter and durable - I would highly recommend!

These beef marrow bones are super! When we go out for the day they keep our 3 Labs entertained for hours! When they have cleaned them off pretty well just re stuff them with cheese for another go round. Honestly the price was great free shipping with prime membership and happy dogs what more could you ask for!!

He is so cute carrying this around in his mouth. And it's not just that he's cute, which is so very true, but that the little snake is cute, too. It is packed full of catnip and is very, very pungent. He seems to like them very much.
summary: Our Norwegian Forest Cat loves these

reviewText: I tried this product as I have several other products for my very old toward the end of life female Yellow Lab.. I heard about it in one of the reviews. None of the products I tried were detrimental that I could see. Whether or not they made a difference I just don't know.
summary: may or may not have worked

reviewText: who unfortunately died shortly thereafter.  Pretty sure this didn't have anything to do with it, but I certainly cannot give any feedback about whether it helped his dementia.

reviewText: Low-fat and tasty..perfect treats for my Labradors who have one every night before they go to bed! A must for every dog owner who enjoys giving cookies to their 4-legged kids!
This is a well made dog toy, but I have a small dog and he isn't able to get his mouth over the balls. I would recommend it for a medium size dog .

Now if I can only convince my kitties to hold still.Of course, I am VERy careful about GENTLY applying it to their little moufs !!As always, check with your veterinarian before administering this to them (in small amounts of course!)Purr...............

Fish love bloodworms.  Even finicky eaters will eagerly accept bloodworms.  The most appealing form of bloodworms is naturally, live bloodworms.  Unfortunately, most hobbyists do not have the time to manage and farm bloodworms.  So, your choices are generally frozen or freeze dried.  The fish prefer frozen, but they will eagerly accept freeze-dried almost as enthusiastically.  And of the freeze-dried commercial foods in the market, Hikari seems to have the best reputation from hobbyists, as determined from internet forums.These are actually not worms, but rather insect larva.  They are not your typical strongyloid, internal parasite that you may find in livestock.  These "bloodworms" are similar to mosquito larva.  They sell them in different sizes.  Some are small, like mosquito larvae.  The ones that you can buy frozen from San Francisco Bay Brands are typically much larger, more than a half-inch long.  If you have smaller fish, say neon tetras, get the smaller variety.  You can even get frozen "glass worms", which are mosquito larva.  The Hikari freeze-dried product is the same size as mosquito larva.  Maybe they started out larger and the drying process cause them to shrink.  This freeze dried bloodworm food is small enough to feed to neon tetras.Should you feed frozen or freeze-dried?  That really depends on how picky your fish are.  Some wild-caught specimens may not accept freeze-dried at first.  You may have to start them off on frozen, as that will be the closest thing to live food.  But, if your fish will accept freeze-dried, that is what I would recommend.  The freeze-drying process most likely eliminated the chances of the food bringing unwanted parasites into your fish tank.  It's safer than feeding live or frozen foods.  What you are hoping for is that eventually, you can transition your fish into flakes and pellets.Highly recommended.

Maintains my temp more than 7 degrees above room temp, more like 10-12. But Im also running it in a 2.5gal tank. In a very cold AC room this is really good. I wish I had picked something with temp control but I needed it to fit inside an AC70 which this does.So far, 1-2 years of use, and exposure to air when on and still no failures. It's a decent heater.Still a few degrees too chilly for optimum reef tank, but it works.
For two of our longer fur cats this product seems to work better than Frontline Plus, which we continue using for other pets due to a cheaper generic price.
summary: Seems like a good choice for cats with long fur

reviewText: Love this bark collar, our Wheaten Terrier is very young and barks at the slightes noise and this back collar stops his barking unless it is really something he needs to bark for.
Bought for my 2 cats. 1 is a little anemic and the other is indoor/outdoor 12 yr old.
We used it for a trip to CA and it was perfect! No spills and we didn't have to worry about the cats not having water when they needed it.
They come compressed in a dried cube. I didn't know this and brine shrimp that I have had in the past have been individually frozen. This stuff just crumbles and turns into dust. I do not like it.
great to have it delivered

This product is quite simple.  It was easy to attach the legs and the "L" shaped bracket on the inside end sits nicely on my window sill.  If you look at the picture, it almost looks like where the feet meet the wall, that they are angled in a way where they sit flat against the wall.  That isn't the case.  They are angled, but not enough - they don't sit flush.  The rubber socks that go over those feet are what keeps it steady, in my opinion.  The bed itself is wood, with padding and a fluffy cover over it.  It's not a posturepedic memory foam bed, but my cat likes it just fine.  My cat is petite - just a little over 6 lbs.  I might think twice if she was 15 lbs. but she seems to be very happy on her new hang-out.
I've been using Bayer's Advantage products for decades on my dogs and cats. I NEVER cut corners for my pets and only buy the best for them. I HIGHLY recommend this product.

The goal of this product is to help the dog with stressful situations.  The directions say to give the medication to your dog seven days before the noise event.I have a 40-pound mixed breed.  The directions indicate one pill.  Several hours after giving the dog a single pill, he was lethargic.  Not only was he mostly asleep but his personality changed and his appetite vanished.  These developments were alarming.On top of that it did not relieve the dog of stress induced behavior problems.I was unwilling to risk test this product beyond the one pill... so it may work beyond that... but I was not going to try it...

I bought this set of toys for my new boy kitty because I don't know his preference.  He has batted these around and I am pretty sure they are all under furniture pieces by now.  I have to go find them and bring them back out for his play.  He prefers the mylar krinkly balls since he likes to carry those around in his mouth and play fetch with me.  So he doesn't "lose" the mylar balls under the furniture.  I rated these 5 stars because it does offer different options for a kitty while an owner is learning their preference for play.

Zero out of four is really bad-- considering Ninja is a walking garbage disposal and enjoys everything from high end expensive urinary health treats to some Friskies... and whatever she can pull out of the garbage from time to time. reviewText: I like buying these treats for my kitties as they are a bit healthier than the average treat. They use natural ingredients rather than lots of fillers. And, most importantly, my kitties absolutely love them.

This mix has a healthy blend of seeds, grains, fruits, veggies and vitamin supplements.  My finches love it and I will be buying more to keep my birds strong and healthy. The packages are sealed using a CO2 treatment process for freshness and labeled with a date of manufacture and use-by date.

reviewText: It doesn't look like much, but you'd be surprised how well it works depending on how you use it.I initially bought it as a dinner feeder, but food alone falls out pretty easily (especially if your dog likes to throw treat toys). But when I switched to using it as a treat toy, it became a lot more entertaining for the dogs.I usually fit it with flatter, larger treats (like chicken jerky), and then I smear a coating or two of peanut butter on the monster's mouth. I freeze the toy, and then it becomes a great time-consumer.

We love all of the Vee PURRfect brand cat wands, and this one is one of our cat's favorites.The cats only know that these wands are bouncy, springy, feathery fun, but we love that they are also the safest wands we've found. There are 3 things that seem to make these wands safer than other choices on the market:1. This company uses only non-toxic, food grade dyes to color their feathers, and the feathers are natural and non-toxic, not treated with chemicals that shouldn't be in our cats mouths.2. There are no metal fasteners on these toys.  One of our cats chases and grabs wand toys aggressively, and I always worry that he'll damage his teeth/mouth on the metal hooks on toys like Da Bird.3. This toy features a springy wand that is long enough for chase games, but does not have a long string that can get tangled around cat's neck or paws. We try to supervise the toys, but I feel much safer about leaving this one out in the house!Our feather bouncer wand has been chased, quarreled over, drug around the house, and "groomed" so much that it looks terribly ratty, but it has survived a year of kitty love without shedding a single feather or having any damage to the wand portion.Vee makes a whole line of PURRfect wands, including wands with a crinkle sound, natural peacock feather wands, and wands with leather tassles.  All have been a hit with our cats, and we love providing them with American-made toys from a safety-minded company.
summary: Best wand toys on the market!

reviewText: This is so easy to use and keeps me from having to constantly refill the water bowl. Easily holds enough for a long weekend and doesn't take up much more space than the regular water bowl. The glug of it refilling the base is not scary or loud, and refilling without spilling is easy if you just take the base on and off while its upside down. Definitely glad I bought it!

Arrived quickly ans packaged great.Walking in from the mail box I was greeted by my 10 year old RG who is a Catnip addict.Sprinkled a bit on the carpet and instant Karma it was so strong she had to back off and shake her head and then dive back into it again.Now I have a new addition to my household an 18 month old jet black DMH her prior owner had to go into a Nursing home.Minnie did not react to my prior brand of Catnip and she also did not react to Kong. Some Cats are immune to its affects and she seems to be one but aside from that I think Kong is a fine product.UPDATE:The catnip dries out very fast and loses it potency. It becomes just some dried out GRASS CLIPPINGS.
I love this pump so easy to use powerful very quiet  big but works on my tank I use for  salt water, and fresh water reactors  I really highly recommend works every penny

reviewText: This has been great training our Havanese pup not to bark or whine. If you don't mind the scent of Citronella, this is a great, safe, animal-friendly way to train your dog!
Dogs never cease to pay attention to me when I pull these out...Great training aids.Highly recommended for pups.

My vet recommends and carries this brand of pet food, and in light of continuing issues with our cats we switched to Hill's Science Diet.  I thought I would give it try for the dogs as well.  They eat this food with no problems at all, and I feel much better about feeding them a higher quality food.  Plus, the price on Amazon is the best I've found anywhere.

Amazing product and instantly takes care of barking.  It works by spraying a little bit of citronella fluid out in front of the dogs face when it senses a bark.  This spray is so unpleasant to the dog although not painful.  It stops them in their tracks every time.  Kind of like a big fat guy coming up and farting in your face I suppose.  Each time I tried the collar on the different dogs, after a few barks the barking stopped.  As long as the collar is on there will be zero barking.  At first, when the collar is off there may still be a little barking.  Soon, there is no barking at all even with it off.  The cons are that on a couple occasions it has gone off when bumped even without a bark, and my unit leaked and I had to send it back for a free replacement.  The cannisters last for many refills as do the batteries.  If you look at the stats on these the effectiveness rate is around 90% vs shock collars at 40%.  Also no pain so humane.  Dogs - 2 pit bulls and a black lab.
summary: Amazing! Has worked immediately on 3 different dogs. Humane(no pain) and effective.

reviewText: Have had a hard time finding bully sticks that are tolerable.  There is a small smell if you are right next to the bully stick, but most of the time I don't smell them at all.  Will definitely buy again.

After a vinegar/alcohol solution and a prescription ear medication failed to clear up my dog's chronic ear infection, I used Zymox for 1 week.  The dog's ear infection is gone and has not returned after a month.This is the most effective product I've use on canine ear infections.

I've been using wee wee pads of various brands for about 4 years now. I first trained my Havanese to use them as a puppy when I lived in a New York City apartment. I've continued using them for convenience while I am working and because he prefers them to going outside in poor weather. I now have a second puppy who is also training on them.My absolute favorite brand of wee pads is called Paw Trax. They have an incredibly fast absorbing gel inside that nothing I've found matches. I've only found them online on two dog specialty websites, but they are pretty pricey at about $.50 each! Not wanting to break the bank, I went in search of other brands. At first I discounted Wee Wee Pads because my local pet superstore sold them at such an outrageous price that the Paw Trax were a better deal. Then, I found them on Amazon at a much better price, especially for the 100 pack.These pads, while not the best in my opinion, absorb fairly quickly and are more absorbent than some of the other bargain brands. The only problem I've experienced with them is that sometimes the pee seems to expand fairly wide when it is absorbing, which means it's only good for one use. Having two dogs, sometimes that means my second dog will not use the pad if I'm not around to change it.  Other than that issue, I've never encountered anything else negative such as seeping through the plastic liner, etc.I'm also fond of the Nature's Miracle Advanced pads which are larger and better suited for multiple uses. While these don't seem to absorb as quickly, they don't expand out as much. That combined with their larger size makes them ideal for my multi-dog home. Had I only had a single dog though, they might be a bit too large unless I was planning on leaving them out for extended periods while away.
summary: Good Quality Pads for a Good Price

reviewText: I buy this food for my rats because it was recommended to me by a friend. The rats like it because it is a mixture of all types of things. It reminds me of bird food. It has everything from regular rat food to whole peanuts to sunflower seeds. It even has chunks of food which they love!Recommended.

For our two cats we have a Platinum Drinkwell Fountain. We also live in a VERY hard water area. There is nothing about the fountain or the filters that will "soften" the water, that is not what they're for.  The idea is to get cats--descended from North African Desert animals---to drink more water.  Its better for their kidneys; they'll likely live longer. ( A high percentage of older cats die from kidney failure, it is very common. Many veterenarians now are encouraging the  use of some canned or "wet" cat food in a cat's diet to provide more moisture, since most cats aren't big on drinking....thats in part what all this is about.)As other posters have commented, my former cats always wanted the tap water on a "thin" drip or flow of water. It had to be "just so"...not too much, not too little...but they preferred drinking that water over their water in bowls, no matter how often the bowls were changed/cleaned. (Yes, I tried glass, ceramic, stainless steel, every recommendation about what type of bowls cats are said to prefer...)When the cat water fountains first came out I was skeptical at first...but it made sense, obviously this re-created what the cats preferred.  The running water, the sound....so I got one.The critical element after buying the fountain is maintaining it.  READ the directions!  Change the filters "every 2-4 weeks depending on the size and number of pets using the fountain".  Thats from the back of the Drinkwell filter package.  And please use Drinkwell filters if you have a Drinkwell fountain!  They are made to work together.CLEAN the fountain...including the little parts around the motor.  We take it apart about every other week and put the entire fountain, minus motor, in the upper section of the dishwasher, and run it, with the usual dishwashing detergent,  which works great.  The motor area can be cleaned with q-tips or the special brushes sold by Drinkwell.  If the fountain is not kept clean  and the fiilters are not replaced, the whole thing will stop working, though long before that your cats will be drinking recycled dirty water.This isn't hard, just a bit of reminding yourself.  Just like with your car, there is basic cleaning and maintenance required.Also, reading some other posters: please don't use BLEACH to clean the fountain...plastic of all kind (think Tupperware) absorbs odors, I can't imagine a cat with his/her sensitive nose drinking water after the unit the cleaned w/ bleach, no matter how dilute.  Also the vinegar and water thing....thats better than bleach but are you really cleaning the unit?  Not that it has to be sterilized....just cleansed the way you would your family's dishes and glasses.BTW we also keep a bowl of water available too, "just in case".
summary: Drinkwell Fountain for cats/ Get Only Drinkwell Filters for Replacement

reviewText: These are great treats for my dog. I was surprised she loves them so much due to its color and the fact that the treats feel kind of rubbery. Even though she is a large dog, I get the smaller ones so they last longer. Here again, I can’t really say it has made any improvements in her breath though, but she does love to eat them.

This stuff is awesome. I spray it and come back later to find all of the dead fleas that came out of hiding to desperately find fresh air. Keeps my house flea-free (in Georgia, this is not easy) and I will continue to purchase this product and recommend it to my friends.

One star off a bit reluctantly because it wasn't 100% effective immediately.Fleas are tenacious little buggers.  We have two, long haired dogs.  It's tough to see the fleas on furniture or in carpet, easier to find them on the dogs.  In the past, Frontline Plus seemed to control or prevent the problem and prevent a house infestation, but not this year. Maybe it was the dry weather. It was a battle.  We tried over the counter flea bombs, two brands; someplace between  immeasurably marginal and a total waste of money.Based on the vet's recommendation, we tried the canned aerosol and this pump sprayer.  Either is OK, more for your money with the pump sprayer. Also used a sticky paper Victor Ultimate Flea Trap (Amazon), but we use the flea trap more as a measure of how bad the infestation is; it will not solve the problem. Count the fleas trapped in 24 hours, when it gets down to 1 or 2 you just about have things under control. Zero and you can break out the champagne.The Siphotrol products seem to be largely effective immediately.  The label says it kills adult fleas on contact and I won't argue with that but the critters seem to hide or hatch continuously.  It certainly knocks down the population but it takes another week or so to eliminate the problem.  It did not require a second application.  Also, if you've chased fleas you know they're fast and elusive, but after the Siphotrol, if they're still living they're pretty lethargic.We used the Siphotrol product on the carpet and furniture, and Barklogic's Lemongrass Tick and Flea Pet Wash (Amazon) on the dogs, one application each and the problem was maybe 90+% resolved the first day, stragglers gone within a week.  The Siphotrol has almost no smell, nothing residual. Though the dogs love to swim, they have always loathed a bath.  FWIW there's something about this Lemongrass product that they both liked, very mild, pleasant aroma and you could see the fleas going down the drain.
summary: Effective, Mostly Immediately, 100% Takes Longer, Good Stuff

reviewText: This must feel good in the mouth...my pooch carries it around and finds the squeek interesting.  So far, it has held u to his chewing.

I've been feeding my fish Omega One Super Color for...what, 7 years now?  And I've never gone back to any other kind.  The flakes are nice and soft, not the stupid crunchy kind that merely break when you touch them (I'm looking at YOU Tetramin!).  I wish I can say I notice a difference with my fishes color, but seeing as how this is the only food they eat and their colors were always bright, maybe it's doing its job.  I just never fed them different food to see a before and after.  At any rate, the most important thing is that my fish love them so if they're happy, I'm happy.
summary: Well actually, my FISH love it

I got this for my 2 cats for one reason only. Because they are indoor cats I knew I was going to get their front claws removed. I was so surprised when it came in. I thought another bad deal. FAR from it. Both cats love it. They do use it for their claws and that works great. But the company sends some catnip with it. Both have taken to it for crawling into it and playing hide and seek. I put the catnip on it before I go to bed and the cats play with it and then come into the bed and proceed to love me to sleep!!! I love it and it will last long past the surgery!!! Cats are fascinated with running water and will drink more when they are provided with such a source. In many cases, this can be good for your cats health. Bengals are especially attracted to running water.Now, they sell these large plastic fountains for your cat or dog. But this nifty idea fits right into a regular bowl. reviewText: My dog goes insane over these!  Will practically bite your hand off for them...LOL!  If they taste anything like real bacon at all no dog will ever be able to resist? I believe most people can't resist bacon themselves! I got an AMAZING deal on these, was totally worth the wait to receive them!  I will probably never find another deal like I did on these ever again.  I thank you and my dog thanks you!

My cat tend to used a bit but they are older cat so they are not as motivated as a young cat would i guess,  We used to have a cat house you know those thing where the cant can climb up and scratch away, that had one scratching area the cats used to tear that thing apart, I'm guessing due to the fact that they were used to using that post, is harder for them to used this or is just not as appealing,  The make of this box is simple is just a box with scratch pad,  In my opinion after looking at it I'm pretty sure the making this item didn't cost them more then 7 bucks maybe 10, but is sold for 28 almost 29 dollars,  So it's a bit overprice if you don't believe me on being overprice go ahead and order one, and then take a good look at it, is just basically the scratching pad surrounded by the box.

reviewText: I have 3 cats and they love to play with this toy. My oldest cat is 15 years old then I have a 3 year old and 2 year old. It is now there favorite toy to play with. It is fun to watch them playing with this toy I can get them to jump in the air and sometimes jump/ flip backwards. 2 of my cats use to just lay around and sleep now they are up and active ( my 15 and 3 year old). Considering there ages that is awesome. I highly recommend. It looks and feels just like a real feather and comes in different cool colors.The pole is very good and sturdy as of 2 of my cats are big and heavy. On the other hand it could use stronger string my cats have broke it  and chewed it up. I had to put new string on it.

My dog has scratched up the cabinet trying to get to these. She leaps inthe air when the canister comes out of the cabinet.  I break the sticks in half because they are big and they ARE fattening. She loves them, they are made in America and the price is right. Pure salmon with no additives.  My sweet dog is allergic to just about everything and these appear to cause no skin troubles for her. And she is addicted. Great product. Not sticky or stinky.

These dog treats sounded so wonderful.  Didn't know they were made in China!  Wrote email to SmartBones and they assured me the product is safe. I will never trust animal products made in China.  So many products for dogs are made there. My dog hasn't gotten sick from the bones.  I suppose each consumer must make the choice for their own animals.  I looked for the Smartbones on several sites and didn't see China on the ads.  Seems like homemade might be better.  There is nothing like made in the USA.

Bought an Oster A5 clipper and it came with a #10 blade.  I needed to use the guide combs since my dog is double-coated and very long.  My friend (who is a groomer) told me I needed to use a #40 blade if I was going to use the guide combs...the guides do not work well with a #10 blade.  The 40 blade is fantastic!  It took me over 2 hours to get the job done and the blade was still cutting like new.  I also used the Kool Lube spray as necessary, to keep the blade a good temp.  My dog is not "professionally" groomed by any stretch, but he looks good and feels even better.  Also, he loves lying on his side and letting me "massage" him with the clippers.  He only stands up for the finishing touches on his tail and legs.  I also bought a 5F and a 7F blade for finishing touches and his tummy.  The #10 blade I use for his paws, top and bottom.  The whole outfit is fantastic and was purchased from Amazon!  Thanks Amazon!  A must buy!!!

It has been almost a year since I have purchased this brand. My cats love something one day, and turn up their noses at it the next, as all of you "cat parents" know all too well.  I now have several brands and varieties for the little darlings. My job is to guess which one they want today! The "Mature Adult" line of Hills is better for my cats with renal disease because it has less phosphorus. Too much phosphorus and they feel ill and don't want to eat at all. I also mix this with some aluminum hydroxide phosphorus binder as well. All of my cats (5) are older and they all love this tender tuna chunks flavor. Hills has a nice variety of mature adult flavors. Since I have never personally tried this food, I must rely on my cats who gobble it up, to say that it must be flavor full. !!!
summary: Good, and lower in phosphorus than other varieties

reviewText: I have recently switched my cats to a raw food diet.  It is a slow process because they have been used to the commercial canned foods and all the added teasers to get cats to eat.  I ordered these once before and forgot how much the cats loved them as treats, so when I saw them again, I knew if these were sprinkled on top of the raw food, they might go for the "new" food easier.  It worked and the cats are eating more raw food than canned (because you have to add some canned to the raw in the beginning). My experience so far with raw feeding my pets is it is well worth the research to find out what exactly to feed and which supplements are required. Once you know it is not really alot of work to do because you make large batches and freeze in small portions.  FYI, dry commercial cat food is even worse for your cat than commercial canned.  If you can't get your cats to switch to raw than at least get them off the dry.
summary: Just open the lid and they'll come a running!

reviewText: I worry a lot of where things are made for our animals today and what they contain..I have no worries with this product..highly recommend

I already have one of these on the faucet that has lasted for almost 6 years now. I bought this one as a backup just in case. My dogs love these and use them all the time. As soon as the weather gets above freezing, until the time it gets below freezing, the licker is on the faucet.  I wouldn't be without one of these for them. They always have cool, clean water whenever they want it.
I got this for my two papillions and it works great. There is two connectors in it and it has plenty of room for each of them to lay down.

Unfortunately, when this came, the plastic tray on the bottom was cracked and broken, so we had to return it.  However, in setting it up, we noticed that it was a bit more flimsy than the ones we saw at our local feed store.  It's okay if you need a medium sized kennel, but I wasn't really that impressed with the quality overall.

My dog has worn boots for quite some time and we have tried many other brands, but always seem to come back to Muttluks - they wear well (they will not last forever, but neither do human shoes) and keep his feet clean and dry.  He does not mind these at all (there have been others that seem to impact his walking).  Usually these are for the really cold or snowy days, but it also works for the times when the snow is melting and things are getting ugly out there.  Another plus, they do bring a smile to almost everybody that walks by when we are out walking :-)
summary: Best boots for the cold weather

reviewText: I was researching over the counter relief for my puggles a couple years ago, due to their constant ear infections.  It was costing us over $100 each time we took them in, and it seemed like at least one of them had an ear infection once a month.  Of course they HAVE to do a culture each time, and we would always end up with the same meds.  Washing their ears and keeping them clean and dry had no effect.  I came across Zymox on clearance and debated on getting it.  I came home and did some research and saw a lot of good reviews and thought it couldn't hurt to try it.  I was amazed at how quickly it cleared up my dogs' ears.  We did one 14 day treatment on each dog, and it not only cleared their ears up, but we seen a huge drop in the number of ear infections they were getting.  We went from one ear infection a month, to 1-2 a year per dog.  WOW!  We did not use is consistently, only when the dogs had signs of infection. We no longer have our puggles, but have a 1 year old black lab.  She likes to dig and loves the water/snow.  So I was not surprised when she woke us up last week in the middle of the night digging her ear.  Sure enough I looked in there and it was nasty.  I told my husband HE was taking her to the vet since she has not yet started her obedience training and is awful on her leash.  He asked me why I wasn't just treating her ears with the zymox.  I had completely forgotten about it!  So I immediately came to amazon to order a bottle.  And within 2 days of starting treatment, her ears look 50% better.  I cannot recommend this stuff enough!  Sure it is a little pricey, but only about 1/4 of what it costs to go to the vet, have the culture done and start meds that may or may not work.  So you might as well try this!!
I have a 12 pound tabby.  I wasn't sure if he might be too big for it, but he loves it and uses it all the time.  I'm very glad I purchased it.

I appreciate being able to try the Nutrish food tubs.  Our aging terrier really likes these.Each tub provides two meals for her and is very easy to serve and store the leftover half for the next meal.The food looks good with plenty of sauce and a variety of identifiable ingredients in it.  Our dog has lost some teeth in recent years so wet foods comprise the majority of her diet.The only reason I didn't give it five stars is the price.  It looks good and our dog loves it, but I think the price is a little high.  I will keep it on my list of foods to choose from because I like to rotate what I feed our dog rather than rely on a single brand or flavor.  There are too many recalls on a regular basis.Since Rachael Ray is both a dog lover and a food expert, I have a little added trust in a brand with her name on it.
summary: Must taste as good as it looks

reviewText: He loves it - uses it all the time.  Plays on it and it was so easy to teach him to use this!  Will order again when he wears this one out!
The Zymox products are wonderful. We've used them on all our dogs with great results. One has sensitivities to shampoos and these products are non-irritating.

Rachael Ray Nutrish - What can I say. It better taste good. I like her cooking shows and recipes, I'm sure it tastes great for the dog as well.
