He really eats it fast, so he must be loving it.The packaging is quite easy to open, and the tupperware is nice that I don't want to throw it away. (but I don't want to use it for people food afterwards either). They do make good pet treat containers or storage for small parts.This really is a premium dog food line. I would say that it would get quite expensive if this was all I was feeding my 60lb dog with. Otherwise for a miniature or teacup size dog then this would be what I would feed exclusively.Good ingredients, good packaging, a label to trust. 5 stars.

My cocker puppy started to eat his food from his bowl in under 30 seconds. I needed to get something that would excercise him and slow him down when eating. This was great! I bought it from petsmart and was higher priced but it was worth it. It is a noise maker when he knocks it up against a wall but its worth the little agony for him eating slowly. It took him no time to figure this out.

This food came along for my dog at just the right time. She has severe allergy problems and lamb kibble is all she can tolerate. Unfortunately, however, most lamb kibble also has not so healthy or necessary ingredients such as corn and other grains that dogs don't really need. In fact, corn raises blood glucose levels and should be avoided in pet food.I'm not convinced that dogs need rice either, although this food contains brown rice and ground rice (it doesn't say what kind of rice the latter is). But the most wonderful thing to note is that dreadful ingredient that it is hard to avoid in almost all dog foods is absent:  byproduct meal or fillers. That is just nasty stuff and I hate giving it to any dog.Another plus is the beet pulp, a fiber source, and lots of vitamins and minerals.And to top it all off, there are no food dyes, artificial preservatives or flavors.My dog loves it and I feel so good offering it to her. I would say that her itching and scratching due to food allergies has lessened considerably and I have only been feeding her Just 6 for a few days. It will definitely be her new and far better diet.
summary: Much Healthier Than Mainline Supermarket Canine Fare

reviewText: The front velcro strap seems to pop open all the time. But, other than that the jacket is great. I get so many compliments on it and the reflectors are a life saver (literally). It's not bulky but still seems warm.

Cat likes playing with it sometimes, but doesn't bother with the scratch pad, even though I put lots of catnip in it (could be because she's already an entire couch as her scratch pad).  The toy also tends to move across the laminate flooring when she pounces at it and it can be kind of loud at night when it scrapes across the floor (not a problem with carpet though).  But she does like to play with it.---Edit: It's been over a year and she does use the scratch pad now, maybe because we no longer have the couch.  But she still scratches other things, so I'm not entirely sure if it lessens her desire to scratch stuff at all.  But I've gone through 4 of the cardboard scratchers and she still likes playing with it.
summary: Good, but not as awesome as some of the reviews make it out to be

reviewText: I use these for my new puppy while my older dog gets denta stix.  They both feel special getting their own treat and everybody wins.  The pup loves them and they keep her engaged for a few minutes leaving me time to do other things.  I've used them both stuffed in a kong or on it's own and both ways work just fine.  My only reason for not going 5 stars?  For the amount you get you will want to use them sparingly.
summary: Good product but I wish they came in bulk

reviewText: We keep our kitty litter in the garage, right across from our gym equipment. So, it is imperative that the kitty litter smells be kept on lock down! Not only is this gadget convenient for dirty litter clumps, but it is also very effective at hiding any residual smells that your kitty litter couldn't mask. I use Scoop Away Complete Performance Cat Litter and I find that it works the best with the litter locker, every thing clumps up perfectly and goes right into the litter locker - NEVER TO BE SEEN OR SMELLED AGAIN!
summary: How did I live without this?!

reviewText: My 7 month old boxer likes these ok.  My 9 month old boxer has an underbite and cannot chew them.  They are hard.  Not easily broke into pieces.  I like to break my dog treats into smaller pieces to make them last longer.

The jacket is a little larger [medium] than what I thought it would be for my Shih-Tzu (18 lbs.); however, it appears to be nice and warm and is easily applied.  The large collar protects the ears in windy weather.  It is nice and soft and of good quality.
I got the red large.It looks cute on my boxer/beagle!Easy to put on.The length and neck are prefect but its too loose around her chest.I wish it had more of an adjustable velcro around the chest.
My two small dogs just love these treats These are very nutricious and must taste great. Yours will love them.
I bought this for our cats for Christmas. They smelled it and walked away. Just not interested in it. Kinda disappointed.
summary: The cats were not interested in it.

reviewText: I bought two of these exactly alike and the dogs still fight over who has which one...  You know what I mean if you have two dogs!  At least they enjoy them!
The cats loved it. Good price.  Good plastic jar container so I didn't have to use my own container. Thanks.

Good size for our Maltese...plenty of room to stretch out.  As this will be a primary bed at night the room will be good for her.  The clips that hold the top and bottom shells together seem like they may have a breaking problem in the future but we won't be taking it apart muchif at all so should be OK.  This size only comes in this color which does not fit any decor I've ever seen...must be made for airline travel where color doesn't count.

Thankfully, my dog doesn't mind getting a bath.  I researched a lot of shampoo and conditioner and settled on Earthbath.  It smells good, the shampoo lathers well and the conditioner leaves my dog silky and smooth without being greasy.  This is my second time purchasing this conditioner online and will continue to purchase it in the future!

I have a small mix puppy, and the bowl did not hold up her for one hour. The bottom rubber came off the first day I used the bowl and became my puppy's new toy to chew. The bowl is not heavy at all so any dog would probably play and kick the bowl all over your house. It hold the dog food, but that's about it.

We have a cattery and are never without Bene-bac.  We use Bene-bac in both this form (mixed in with wet cat food) and in paste form for individual dosing.  It is my first go-to remedy for loose stools for adults and kittens.  One of the things I like best about it is that it is gentle on the cat's system, and introduces microbial organisms that are helpful to the cat's digestive system.  I can even give it to young kittens and pregnant queens.  It is easy to give to the cats and they don't seem to notice when it is mixed into their food.
I have purchased this product multiple times. My cats really love it. It smells fresh and is clearly good quality. Treat your cats and enjoy their antics!
For the price and the service I gave it a five star rating.  It was really easy to put together.
Our cats love this cat nip and so does the neighbors cat who comes over for a daily visit.  Would buy this product again! Fast Shipping and Highly recommend.  Thank You!
My dog loves it, a great snuggle fleece hoodie, size medium fit perfect from neck to tail, (16 inch). Schnoodle.

I think this is a great alternative to Emery board cat scratcher. The only difference with it is it does not have the abrasive glue and sand the Emery board has on its card board scratcher. I have shown my Cats how to use it but the cat nip has not enticed them enough yet sure hope they learn what this is for soon so the furniture is not all scratched up.

Our dogs always eat Taste of the Wild dog food. We've tried a few others, and they have always snubbed them. I was excited to try this high quality grain free feed to see if we could get another brand they liked, as not every store carries TOTW. They absolutely LOVED it! We feed five dogs, an aged Boston Terrier, 2 Dachshunds, a Chihuahua mix and a Belgian Terv/GSD cross. ALL of them gobbled it right down. And most importantly, zero potty issues from a switch in feed! This is a winner!

We've purchased too many of these knot toys.  Our dog knows how to destroy within moments.  (He even started looking forward to Amazon boxes with the hopes that another toy to destroy would be within.
My 2 doxies have liked everything that Zukes makes...however, I think the lamb jerky is their favorite...nice and smelly, just what a dog wants.

This toy is a total hit with my five-month-old kitten who has never been outside. She will play with it night and day. It is noisy, so don't put it in your bedroom. It seems indestructible. She is not obsessed with it, but returns weekly to play for 30-45 minutes. My nine-year-old indoor/outdoor tom could care less about this toy. If you have a sophisticated, cynical and intelligent cat who has tasted the great outdoors, this is a total waste of money.
summary: Indoor kitten loves this, outdoor adult sees it as pointless

reviewText: First of all, my dogs love this.  The food is all one color and is in an approx. 1/2 round ball like shape.  The first ingredient in the Healthy Weight variety is deboned turkey, and the rest of the ingredients are dried rice and other grains, followed by dried vegetables.  I didn't see anything I couldn't identify until the very end of the long list of ingredients.  So, it appears to be very wholesome dog food from what I can see.  One real nice thing is that part of the proceeds from this dog food go to an organization called Rachael's Rescue, where several different dog charties are supported.  That's something I feel good about.  I'd definitely buy this on a regular basis.
This is soft but tears very easily, which is good. My picky Havanese seems to love them and they are easy to make smaller. I recommend these, will buy again, and I hope this helps someone.

This is the first grass I bought for my cat. She loved it. Than I tried growing my own seeds, in my own dirty. My cat LOOOOOOVED it. prob was when it came to replanting them I couldn't use the same dirt due to the masses root system of the grass. I went back to this type of grass and my picky cat CLEARLY does not like it as much as the seeds I had planted in dirt.

PLEASE DO NOT BUY THIS TOY. Yes, your cats may love it, because the chewy gumminess is so initially satisfying. But please heed all the negative reviews on here: your cat can DIE for ingesting this toy, EVEN if you're supervising. My cat absolutely adored this little worm, and as she chewed off little bits here and there, I always made sure to grab them and throw them away; but it was just way too easy to miss one, and once I was almost positive that she could have choked or swallowed a piece if I hadn't been right there. It's just not worth the risk. I wish there was a safe alternative, but I just haven't found one.
When my puppy was ready, she took right to this toy.  She will carry the keys around in her mouth, find a nice place to settle down and chew!  She will also play fetch with them!
summary: A favorite of my teething Pug puppy

reviewText: We have three dogs, a mixed spaniel and two that are beagle/basset mix. All three are well under weight limit given for this leash. We have been through so many and when I saw the price, well I just had to give these a try. A try is ALL I got. The braking mechanism broke the very first time using the leash. The flashlight was tried and we actually decided to save batteries because it was so dim. What I paid for here was a set of garbage bags for my tiny dryer lint trash can. If you have a toy / tiny dog this leash maybe what you are looking for. If you have pullers, I would stay away from them or you just may end up with a 16 foot leash.

Nylabone's PuppyChew Teething Keys are a pretty good toy for puppies that are teething.  Until they are about 18 months, dogs need to have chew toys on hand to ease the pain of their teething process.  Dogs will chew on these teething keys.  At the same time, I can't say that this was ever one of my dog's favorites.  Nylabone should put some kind of flavoring on these keys to attract the dog and make puppies (who love flavors) more enthusiastic about the toy. My dog likes the chicken and bacon flavored nylabones much more.  Although my dog chewed on this sometimes, he often neglected it and was not especially excited when I first gave it to him.  I would give it five stars for durability and serving its basic purpose.  But I would give it three stars for my dog's apparent enjoyment level, thus an overall four star rating.
summary: Good but not Great Chewing Toy for a Puppy

reviewText: The big bag of this stuff is worth the price, although it does arrive in a clear plastic bag stored in a cardboard box. I was surprised to see how much is inside the bag and for the price am glad I ordered. The hay is green, and smells fresh not like the other brands that are already yellow and hard. These are also long strands of hay not the short pieces and there is little dust in these.Since the strands are so big I cut them in half & give what my guinea pig will eat. The bag has lasted already for a month and we haven't used that much yet. My guinea pig loves this brand more than any other on the market that I've tried. She plays in the pet store brand one and eats this one. Needless to say I have a happy pig, she popcorns around her cage when I bring out the baggie with this hay in it. She doesn't even let me get a handful in her cage before trying to eat it out of my hand.This is really worth the price if you get a larger bag.

One of my cats is obsessed with this thing. Most of the toys we get them get played with for a week and find their way to their Toy Corner. This one sits in the kitchen and gets played with at least every other day. It cracks me up, she never gets bored with it. You probably want to place this pretty far away from your bedroom, though. There is no downtime for this toy, and it will start spinning in the dark at 4 AM.
Great product for our large dogs that love to chew.  It is long-lasting, affordable, and they love the bacon flavor.

I have two elderly cats and hairball regurgitation has been an ongoing issue in their senior years. I can't tell if the product is really working as one of them has taken a turn for the worse and is on heavy medication. I also tried a new food which appears to be too rich which in turn has the healthier senior vomiting with no hairballs. However, that said, they love the treats which is a real positive since over the 20 years I've had them very few treats have been good enough for their picky palettes. So I'm giving this four stars just for the fact that they like this and I have a little treat to brighten their senior lives!

I think it is a little unfair to rate this product as my cats did not like them but according to other reviews, some cats LOVE them. So to be fair, and as there is no accounting for taste...I will rate as 4 stars. On a positive note, they are packaged well, smell OK and I am sure work well for some people. I am back to the hairball food and clean -up!!
summary: Difficult to rate - cat did not like them

reviewText: I purchased this for use with my aquaponics system currently containing about 80 goldfish. Great price and a lot of food! Should last many months for us even with that many fish. Check out the product and system here - http://youtu.be/AdWy6BewoOc

I LOVED this product, the fleas are not gone yet, but I just find a few in my dogs (2 or 3) DAILY. Not like before that I use to found 20 or more. I comb my dogs 5 days a week. And the best part is all this vitamins and minerals in it. I will buy this product again and I will recommend this product to my family and friend. I know they will loved 2 went I tell them the price.  THANK U

Can't seem to get either my dog or puppy interested in this bone. I think it is just too hard for them to chew. They both love the Nylabone Puppybone Teething Chew Toy. I wish I had just bought a bunch of those, instead.
summary: My dogs don't care for this bone.

reviewText: This works, and is less expensive than the other brand I tired, but the dogs don't like it as well.  I think the minty smell turns them off.  If you can get them past that, to drink it, it works well.

This was not quite what I expected. I actually got this for my ferrets so I wouldn't have to hear their nails scratching at the bottom of their cage. My ferrets like to try to nest by scratching at the mat and the mat can't hold up to them, so I would not buy this for a cat. Also, the mat has some plastic or paper inside it that rustles every time they move, which means it is no less annoying than before.I guess that's what I get for trying to buy something cheaper than the previous mat.

TetraFin products have never let me down.  My fish stay healthy eating them and thanks to Amazon selling these bulk buckets they are very affordable.  I'm very glad to have found these for this price.
The nylabone part was great for my chewer, but she had the rubber in the center destroyed in no time.

If you live in a model home with no people or pets this works fantastic. Sit on it one time and the backing falls behind you and you have to place it again on the top of the sofa. Its cheaper to go back to throw blankets and they at least will stay in place longer. Don't waste your cash unless you live in a model home with no humans or pets....
summary: Looks great until you sit on it

reviewText: Although my doggies love them (two 90lb dogs) they seem to have figured out how to each them quickly.  Yes, they are incased, but they don't last long!  The dogs go crazy over them!

These boxes are surprisingly sturdy for a paper box - MUCH sturdier than the pre-filled plastic boxes I used to use from the grocery store. Plus you can add litter that your cat already uses, so it lowers the likelihood of a cranky cat pooping outside of the box.These are even sturdy enough that if you have a single cat who is medium sized or smaller, this would do very well for several months with a clumping litter if cleaned regularly. The medium size is a tad small for large cats, say 13 lbs or more.This would make a GREAT donation to a pet shelter or cat rescue group/foster program.The medium size fits well in the Petego Travel Tube (also available on Amazon, not sure if it's in stores) which is a blessing for someone with a cat like mine, who feels compelled to empty both bowel and bladder within 5 minutes of travel - makes a visit to the vet much more bearable for everyone involved.
summary: Great for when you are away or, if you're crazy like me, traveling with your cat

reviewText: This goes to work soon after giving it to my pets and the fleas fall off dying or dead. This has provided relief while I was waiting for the flea control to work.
Good!

Can't believe it took us 15 years of living with cats to find these. Suddenly, we're not sweeping and mopping the floor all around the litter pans constantly. Clean-up is so much simpler now, we will never go back to regular pans. The high sides are invaluable in our house. LOVE 'em!
Have two big cats, both over 15 lbs and this is a nice size for them. High sides keep litter from spilling over.

The medium fits my 11 lb. cat very well. Putting the medium on a 7 lb. cat, however, let her slip out of it.For using on a cat, I found this harness _much_ easier to put on than a collar/harness using buckles. It's quicker and easier to put on which led to less squirming, resistance, and clawing. Slip the neck portion over the head, and a quick snap of the belly strap, and it's on almost before they figure out what you're doing. No buckles to catch in their fur means less discomfort to the cats, too.I also very much prefer the way it doesn't squeeze or cut into her neck when she pulls. I'm not afraid she'll get hurt if she suddenly bolts and is snagged by the harness at the end of the leash. The pressure is distributed across the chest and shoulders and is soft, rather than cutting in at a single point like a collar.As fussy as cats are about wearing any such thing, every one I've tried this on has been okay with it, accepting it much more quickly and easily than a standard strap-type collar/harness.
Maybe it was coincidence but my dog developed his first issue with tick bites while using this product.  Switching back to Frontline as that seemed to work for the last 5 years.
summary: Tried this as a replacement for Frontline

reviewText: My dogs hate riding in the car but I keep these on hand for friends. They really work - no splashing and dogs must have water even when in the car.

It's okay for a breeding tank but my tank couldn't be sustained with just this, maybe I didn't turn the bubbles on too strong but its good for additional, filtration and aeration but its very bulky and unattractive!
This has been a great back up filter for my tank. Weighted at the bottom so it sat at the bottom with no issue after squeezing the sponge.

Upon opening this package, the first thing I noticed was a strong odor, not sure what it is but anyone who has parrots knows that odors can be hazardous, so I knew I couldn't put my bird in the cage for awhile until the odor dissipated. Next, I found  there were no instructions or paperwork whatsoever about the cage or how to assemble it.  Upon further opening it, I discovered half the parts were missing, there is supposed to be 4 food dishes, there was not, there was supposed to be 4 brackets to attach the dish holders with and there was not. One side panel was very warped.  Some of the screw holes were not punched all the way through.  Finally, I noticed RUST, yes RUST at half a dozen of the solder connections on the inside of the cage. Another hazard for parrots. The service at Amazon in responding to the issues was good, they are sending a replacement although I told them half an hour after they set that up that I do not want a replacement, the quality of this cage was so poor that I have no faith in the manufacturer (Prevue) to put out a decent cage and I will refuse the replacement.  I went to our local bird shop and paid the extra for a cage that was SAFE and sturdy.  I was sorely disappointed in this cage, apparently Prevue has declined a great deal in the last decade, I won't be buying any of their products anymore.
summary: Missing parts, Rust, Unhealthy for birds.

reviewText: This is my picky Syrian hamsters FAVORITE tunnel! She's had so many different tunnels (CritterTrail, Habitrail, Edible) and this is by far the best one. It's flexibility allows you to use it in so MANY different ways. I've used it as a connector between different levels in her cage, attached it to the top of her cage, and had it just sit in the bottom of her cage. She loves to run through it, climb on it, hide in it, and even sometimes sleep in it. It's very easy to clean and withstands her chewing/burrowing. Plus it's the first tunnel I've had that is actually big enough so that she doesn't have to squeeze through it. The purple one matches her cage perfectly too. DEFINITELY GET THIS FOR YOUR SMALL ANIMAL!

These collars make it a pleasure to take our dogs places because they cut down pulling on the leash significantly. We have worked very hard to teach our dogs to walk with a loose leash using all kinds of positive reinforcement and even a gentle leader. We resisted going to a training collar for months. The dogs will do all kinds of obedience behaviors easily now, but when they are out with each other or other dogs, they pull like sled dogs to the point that they are gasping for breath straining against their flat collars. They are immune to leash pops and the tastiest treats. The entire experience feels abusive to the dogs and to us. The trainer who leads the Big Dawgs MeetUp training sessions here in San Antonio recommended one of these plastic training collars as a possible solution to our problem. The dogs' attitudes changed immediately and they were far more willing to walk politely with the leash loose. Now when they see us reach for these collars they get excited because they know they are going out on some kind of adventure. We can take them for walks in crowded areas, to lunch at dog-friendly restaurants, and many other places that would be an ordeal with a flat collar. Ideally we will be able to habituate them to a loose leash with a flat collar or even heeling off-leash (where that is safe and permitted). This is our ultimate goal which is why "training collar" is an appropriate name for these wonderful devices. We use the small one on the puppy and the large one with our adult dog. Both are adjustable by adding and removing links. By the way, just to be on the safe side we also use a leash with two attachments so the dog is secured with the flat collar just in case there is a malfunction with the training collar. It's a nice insurance policy that we probably will never need. It's Leerburg's Leather Prong Collar Leash, available at the Leerburg site or on Amazon. I highly recommend them just in case...

I ordered this, not sure if my dogs would like the roller ball or turn their noses up at it, but I'm happy to report they loved it! They went at it with gusto-so much so that I had to put it away after only a few licks-afraid they might make themselves sick. Little did I know that my little monsters would find a way to knock it off the shelf & absolutely destroy the bottle while I was at the grocery store. I came home to a shredded bottle & 2 pomeranians with very guilty looks on their faces.....I think this is a great product & if the reaction of my dogs is any indication-so do they. I will definitely be ordering more when it becomes available, but might have to invest in a lock box to keep it in....lol!

My dog never tires of it. We've had it for about three months. I have trimmed a few of the prongs so that the treats can come out more easily but I usually put in a large treat that won't come out in addition to smaller pieces, so that the toy keeps him interested and occupied. I break up a variety of hard bone treats or jerky or whatever I'm giving him at the moment. I haven't tried smearing anything onto the outside. Also, we only use the two larger holes. I did not buy mine on Amazon but would not hesitate to do so. The only two criticisms I have are that it has a rubbery odor (I wish the package would say whether it is BPA free) and that it's hard to clean. But my dog doesn't mind!
summary: the best treat dispensing toy I've tried

reviewText: This was a disappointment. Arrived leaking...but despite that, was not what I expected, based on other reviews. It had a greasy feel on the skin and though mildly scented, an unpleasant fragrance. I got the Davis brand chlorhexidine spray instead and was completely happy with that purchase.

I purchased 2 of these, one for my 62lb pit bull mix and one for my sister's 50lb lab. Both dogs have had theirs for about a month and it is still holding up well. My dog for one is a rough chewer and he still hasn't managed to break this. He seems to really enjoy the different textures and the taste as he still hasn't grown tired of this. I would order again!

I sent this to my brother in Illinois so that his Yorkie and Schnauzer would be calmer for the drive to NC-it was worthless.  I couldn't recommend.  I have been hearing that Recue Remedy does work-according to a veterinarian.  I will try that.
I needed clippers to trim hair from the bottom of my Briard's paws.  These clippers just don't get it done with one pass.
Great length in this ice and snow storm. My puppy is able to run ahead and yet still be on a leash.

My dogs seem to find Likety Stik extremely tasty as demonstrated by their desire to keep licking it. On my part, however, there are some reservations.  I have the liver flavor and for one, it is one of the worst smelling doggie treats that I have.  Not too sure if people want to carry this around in their purse. The stick works like a rollerball, like some of the anitperspirants you see out on market.  When you first open, it does not roll very easily, but eventually it will get going after your dog licks it a few times.  The second major reservation that I have is that if it is being licked, then the part my dog just licked cleaned, saliva and all, goes back into the fluid reservoir which doesn't seem too clean to me. Some may argue that this shouldn't make any difference to my dog who loves licking his hooha and whose favorite appetizer is cat poop, but I cannot help to think that this may be a festering ground for bacteria.  This may be prevented by having certain chemicals present that inhibit this possibility, but then it loops back to my concern of feeding these to my dog.  Although novel, I don't really see a benefit of having this as a treat other than the caloric count.

I'm not one to leave negative reviews but I have to on this one. I've tried this food on all of my tanks and even the pond outside, my fish just won't eat it! Maybe their spoiled...I feed them premium flakes, shrimp along with a variety of veggies and worms so maybe that's it...but ordinarily my pond fish will eat anything (including fingers) but they spit this out.

I have had problems getting my puppy to eat enough.  He actually was losing weight at one point (and he's still 4-7lbs under the weight they thought he would be at this point).  He seems to like a lot of dog foods at first but then gets tired of them after a week or so and just doesn't eat much.  This one though he's been eating like a champ the whole way through the bag.  Of course now i'm torn, do I buy another bag of this food assuming he likes it or switch to something else - because i made that mistake before and once the 2nd bag came he got tired of it quickly.  But that's not the food's fault and this one by all accounts seems good.  Pup likes it more than any other and i am happy with its nutritional info.  And unlike some brands like canidae he doesn't have the nuclear grade gas very often at least, he was having it all the time with that dog food.
summary: my picky puppy loves this food

reviewText: When I first opened up this toy, my cats were kind of confused and didn't know what to do with it. Eventually, it clicked and it is now their favorite toy. Whenever they aren't occupied by food/sleep/grooming, usually one cat or the other is sitting by it. Usually they spin the ball around and around and around, but sometimes they will pick on the scratcher part or just simply lay on it. They have already gained many hours of entertainment from this toy and will get many more! One thing of note is that the scratcher portion was kind of confusing for my cats at least - I still don't think they quite know what to do with it. They love the ball though.This toy is a steal for the price!

I read all the very well written and descriptive reviews of this brush before I bought it.  I just knew it would be the perfect brush for grooming my little guy.  It's what the pros use!  It is very well made. So what's my problem? Well...I am new to this grooming thing and either must not understand just what a slicker brush is used for or just didn't realize it isn't for dogs with a coat like Boone's.  Either of those things mean that there is nothing whatsoever wrong with this brush.  It is totally operator error!  Even so, I did want to offer this review for others like me who might be in the dark too.  So, if you don't have a Shih-Tzu, let me explain how Boone's hair is...thick and curly. (Honestly, it is a lot like a human's hair.) It's hot here in North Carolina and he isn't a show dog so I keep it clipped to 1/2 inch.  So, this slicker brush doesn't get all the way down into his coat and it pulls.  He struggles and tries to get away from it...me.  Believe it or not, I now use a "human's" vent brush on him.  LOL  He likes it (doesn't hurt him) and it really works.  We have a little ritual in the morning where I brush his hair when I brush mine before going out for our early morning walk.  It's totally cute how he follows me into the bathroom and waits for his turn.  I even use the vent brush on his tail (which is long). I honestly don't know how many stars to give this brush because I'm sure it's a nice brush; it just isn't for Boone.  I've settled on three stars.  Reviews really help me; I'm grateful for good ones, so I hope mine helps someone.

Our 4 cats don't play with many toys (even though they have many).  When we get a toy it's always a "maybe they will play with this".  For this, seconds after it was unwrapped for Christmas, a cat was chasing the ball.  Then another cat showed up to try to paw the ball away.  We didn't think the cats would use the scratcher, but a cat was on it immediately scratching it's nails on it.  If you throw some catnip in the middle, you're guaranteed to watch your cats have a good time.  We throw it in scratcher, pat it down, and cats come running to rub their cheeks on it.  I would recommend this for all cat lovers.

This product works very well.....too well!  My house was aglow!  Fortunately, we found the fine print that said that not only would cat urine show up, but cleaning agents as well.  It then goes on to explain the different colors.  I was able to get a couple of urine cleaning products and went to town cleaning my walls.  Now my house is still "aglow", but it smells great and the "splatter lights" are from cleaning agents rather than Fluffy.
It is short... so maybe that is the "small" part... it might be a bite too wide around for my green cheeks conure (very, very small parrot).  We'll see how she does.
My determined Lab basically threw this around in order to release the kibble. Then she literally destroyed the unit. I was so bummed.  This is probably better for smaller or just more patient breeds.

This is my third repti-fogger purchase because it works amazingly! I have all three tanks looking like the fog forests they are meant to represent. My Anoles are sitting Green with happiness right now and not envy! If anything ever malfunctions with these units (not often) then just call zoo-med and they are great with customer service. Once again, GET ONE OF THESE!
We own and operate a cat rescue so we have several of these. The cats love them. They're durable and all you have to do is reorder the cardboard scratchers to replace older used ones.

Works great and easy to use. I keep a bucket of hot, soapy water next to me while I'm combing my pets so I can just grab off the hair, fleas, and flea dirt and dump it right in the bucket. the fleas can't jump out of the soapy water and will drown. I haven't used topical flea treatment in awhile, just this comb and flea baths. High maintenance but it works!

I bought this because I just love my Lab Mix, Pepper, who I believe is one of the smartest dogs in the world.  When the puzzle came to the house Pepper jumped up on the table where UPS placed the box and seemed to know it was for him.  (He is smart, but Pepper thinks everything that comes to the house is for him).  I opened the box and placed some small bits of his favorite treats in the little cubby places and set it down to see what Pepper would make of the puzzle.  Of course he sniffed at it even through he knew what was in the enclosed areas and nudged the covering with his nose.  The cover flicked open and he tried to get the treat but it closed too quickly.  He took one look at the puzzle, it might be my interpretation of his look, but he looked disgusted. He then simply picked it up and turned it over, ate the treat and continued to try to disassemble the toy.  It was fun to watch him but it took less time for him to figure it out then it has taken me to write this review.  I did take the toy away before he could do any real damage.  It is a tough piece of plastic and he was only able to make a couple of dents, so I would say it is durable but not much of a puzzle.  Now when I fill it with treats he simply tips it over and eats the treats..
summary: Pepper is too smart, or I am too dumb.

reviewText: We use these as training treats. The dogs love them and they have never had an upset stomach, even when we give them a bunch.

I have a 6 month old Maltese & she is very active.  She loves it & it keeps her busy for a good deal of time.  Have used it outside & it is very easy to find.  She is a chewer & it has held up very well.

Our yellow lab is a barker..at everything. He's also very sensitive and has seperation anxiety at times. We needed a collar that wouldn't shock him as we were sure he'd take off running if he wore that type. This collar does the trick on low "vibrate" mode setting. Just startles him, and it's keeping him quiet.

We are parents to three dogs, one of which is a very skittish puppy mill survivor. We decided it would be a wise move to attach these lights (which can be seen from either side) to their harnesses for our nightly walks. This way, should the skittish dog ever get off leash somehow, we'd be able to spot him from far away in the dark. I'm an over-planner, it's true. ;) It also lets folks with dogs who may fair better walking away from us, or joggers and cars, know where we are and that we're approaching with three pups in tow.We purchased three colors, so each dog would be represented by a different color (red, green, blue). We walk about 45 minutes most nights, and these lights are vibrant and visible. They're also lightweight and easily clipped on - didn't seem the bother the dogs at all.It's been a few months - the green is still glowing at full force, the red died out a bit ago, and the blue was the first to go. Granted, it just means we need a battery replacement - but felt it was worth noting! :) Also, unlike another reviewer, we had no troubles with these turning themselves off or on. On the contrary, the buttons were almost so hard to push on all three that we felt it was a perk: No accidental chance our skittish dog could ever turn his off if he got away and bolted at a fast pace!
summary: Purchased Three Colors, Loved them All.

reviewText: My dog loved this one right out of the box.  Very little foot work for her..she uses her nose to lift the flaps and turn the toy around.  She can clean it out in five minutes or so.  This toy will have limited use just to keep the dog slim as she would go for those treats all day long.  It is fun for the dog...and fun to watch her nose open the flaps and then turn the flaps to get to the next compartment.  Really entertaining...it just doesn't take long enough.  I liked this well enough to send one to my daughter for her Yorkie.

I had tried pretty much everything to get my cat to take his allergy meds and nothing worked. These little guys work like a charm, he gobbles the 'treat' right down. Less stress for both parties involved!

UPDATE!!!Our Dog has used this bed now for 1 year and 3 months.  It is still in perfect shape and has been washed in the washing machine and dryer numerous times over the past year.  It is still as beautiful as the day I purchased it!!!  I highly recommend this dog bed!!!  My dog has grown into a 12 pounder and she loves to curl up in it and it fits her nicely!!(First Review) This bed has with stood 9 months of a highly active puppy who loves to chew and who has torn apart many other beds and pads.  She literally rips them to shreds!  This I would highly recommend and I have to say it has paid for itself over and over.  We still have it and she still fits in it although when we bought it she was 3lbs. and now she is 12lbs. and the only way for her to be in it is to be totally curled up in a ball.  I would say better fits dogs up to 8lbs.  GREAT PRODUCT!

I purchased the 28 inch Bubble-Wall for my second tank. My tank is a 29 gallon tank, and the 28 inch fits great across the back. I'm running it with a Tetra Whisper 40. It came in two parts (two 14 inch bubble walls) with a connector in the middle. So far, it looks pretty nice. However, I'm only giving it 4 stars because I find that it makes the tank a bit noisier (having it along the back, the air bubbles hit the filter). It also appears to put more bubbles on the side where the connector is compared to the opposite side. Overall it looks good though, hopefully it will stay that way.

This will work for a snap second.  Just enough time to get away.  It snaps the dog out of his aggression state but only for a second.  I've had to use this quite a bit.  It's harmless on the dog and does not have any lingering effects.  Kindof like a slap in the face.
This toy makes the Woody Woodpecker Ha Ha Ha Ha Ha noise whenever it is squeezed.  It really makes me smile when my dogs play with it.

While I think this product is HILARIOUS, and made of a pretty hardcore rubber, it's a little TOO hardcore for my 9 month old Golden. He prefers the planet dog, Orbee, softer rubber. This rubber is really hard, and he can't quite wrap his mouth around it. Perhaps as he gets older he'll grow to love it?
My super finicky cat adores all of these flavors, won't eat much food in general, small cat, but loves these!

My cats can be in another room sleeping and always know when the bag is about to be open. They love the taste and smell, and it's good for their teeth. This is a product that you can let your cat's enjoy and you won't feel bad about it. I have noticed a small difference in the smell of their breath (for the better) in a short amount of time.
summary: Healthy and tasty for my kitties! Excellent price too! Total satisfaction!

reviewText: After a while it does turn the water yellow, but with water changes, eventually the water will clear up. maybe not to a perfect crystal clear (at least not for me yet and I've been using it for 4 months now) but enjoyable clear after water changes.

I have had Eco-Complete in my aquarium about 2 months now, and the crypt wendtii has excelled in growth even under low light.  The dark substrate really makes the Painted Red Cherry Shrimp stand out.  When cleaning the aquarium I have to make sure that I don't get to close to the Eco-Complete, or it gets sucked up into the python.  The only thing that is a pain using this substrate is if there is any left over food from feeding time you pretty much have to net it out then toss the substrate that was scooped up back into the aquarium. All in all I think Eco-Complete is a great aquarium substrate. I highly recommend it.

These are probably The most durable dog toys I have.  My pit bull mix goes through toys that are guaranteed to last (yes, I got my money back) in one day.  She has yet to get through these.  They still whistle too, even after all of her chewing (she chews on them like a piece of gum).The dogs quickly learned to follow the whistle noise when I throw them until the ball comes back down into their field of vision.  If I pretend to throw it and there's no whistle, they whip around because they know I didn't throw it.

Over hype.  It's ok but not very strong.  The grommet between the handle and the collar broke after two weeks.  Pathetic.I would not recommend it for the price.  Polished up well though, if that matters.
I bought this toy because the description was "tough hard rubber thick fetching sticks". My dogs fetched the stick all right and then chewed it up in minutes. What a waste of money!
Our dog has a major problem with matting.  This brush is the best I've tried.  It's also the 4th brush I bought, so we've tried quite a few.
After a while, she could take or leave this.  They did not work well for training treats as she was not crazy about them.
summary: okay, but only so-so for training treat for my dog.

reviewText: My elder cat, nearly 18, is doing much better after just 3 days taking Vetri-science Renal Essentials. Last night she snatched the capsule from my fingers and gobbled it down. So I decided to offer one this morning to my other cat, four years, who recently had high createnine on a pre-dental blood test. I laid the tablet down and my very finicky girl sniffed then snatched it and ate it. Thank you Vetri-Science Laboratories.

My tiny Maltese dog loves these treats and they are perfect for training sessions.  They are small/miniature treats and about the consistancy of a 'slim jim' jerky stick for humans. Best treats I have found for toy dogs that don't crumble.
summary: My tiny dog loves Zuke's treats  !!!

reviewText: A must-have for any cat owner. Saturation followed by laundering seems to eliminate the odor (to my nose, at least, which is much less sensitive than a cat's nose). The product does have an odor of its own, but it isn't offensive, and it washes out in the laundry, though it's harder to get out of carpet. Based on examination of linens with a UV light, I suspect that once an item with urine has been laundered once, the Nature's Miracle is less effective at breaking down the residual urine.PS: I maintain that every pet owner should have a waterproof protector on his or her mattress. Nature's Miracle is better than nothing for a mattress with urine or vomit, but shielding the mattress is better still.

Our cat has stopped throwing up daily after eating and she seems to really like this food. I was hoping she would lose a pound or two since she's a fat cat, but the fact that the daily vomiting has stopped is good for us. We will keep buying this food.

My dog loves Zukes Mini Natural Treats! treats.  He expects them before he goes to sleep for the evening, and often looks for them when we just tell him he is as good boy.  When we run out of them he actually pouts because now he expects them every day.  What I like about these treats for our dog is that they are natural, no chemicals, and just the right size for our dog to chew (he is 28 lbs.).  Also, some of the proceeds go toward Cancer Research for animals, which I am all for since we lost a Jack Russell to cancer at the age of 5 (Lymphoma).  Very sad to see an animal suffer with Cancer, as with a human, and also to lose them, which is especially emotionally stressful.  We will purchase Zukes as long as our dog loves them - and we know this will be for his life.
summary: Zuke's Chicken-Flavored Mini Naturals Dog Treats, 16 Ounces

reviewText: Yes, this dog food is expensive compared to any pet store brand but it is a well balanced and high quality dog food, my dog loves it and he doesn't get any tummy troubles. Shipping was fast.
summary: My dog can't wait to eat

reviewText: My dogs love this toy and it made it past the first week { POWER chewers } with the exceptions of the word.  After the first day my dogs were able to get "Woof" off and ate it.  I would buy another as it is a strong toy, but I would remove the words before allowing my dogs to have it.

I'm not as enthusiastic about Nature's Miracle Quick Results Training Pads as the other reviewers seem to be. I'm currently using them for the third time - the first time, three years ago with a male Westie; the second two years ago with a female Scotty; and at the moment with a male Cesky Terrier. You may ask me why, if I'm not entirely satisfied with the pads, have I continued to use them? And the answer is: They're better than the alternative - particularly if the alternative is newspaper.My reluctance to give the pads a five star endoresement goes mostly to the manufacturer's claim that their "fresh grass scent" somehow promotes house breaking. That has not been my experience. I will concede that terriers are notoriously hard to house break - it took almost a year for our Scotty to get it right without fail - but putting that aside, nothing about their "scent" seems to attract a puppy. What is important is "place." You have to make sure that they are in the same place, each and every time - and of course, as you learn your pup's "restroom signals" and schedule, you need to take him/her outside as often as possible.But like I said, the pads beat newspaper, hands down. They are much more absorbent, easier to handle, and much less likely to "soak" through, (they also don't transfere ink to your carpet as newspaper sometimes does). And while a used pad is not odor free, there is some mitigation of smell.A tip on prices: Check Amazon carefully. For some reason, there are large variations in price, depending on the vendor and package size. The 80-count package is often a substantial savings when compared to the other sizes.[An Up-date: 9/13/2012 - I just thought that I'd add a couple of comments concerning the "soaking through" issue that many recent reviewers have raised. I'm sure that people are honestly reporting their experience, but mine has not been the same. Sherlock - my male Cesky and the youngest of my three terriers - is now three years old and fully house broken, but I still keep an area "padded up" so the dogs have a spot where they can go in "emergencies." Each of my dogs weighs in at about 22 pounds and if they've had to "hold it" for awhile, each of them can produce a copious amount of pee - and I've never had a pad soak through. I'm not sure why some reviewers have found that the pads can't handle a "three pound Yorkie" - it may have something to do with how long the pad sits, after it's been used - not more than a couple of hours at my house. I guess the bottom line is that if you're in the market for puppy pads, Nature's Mircle is a pretty good product - and at the price of an 80-count bag you can probably afford to check 'em out for yourself.]
summary: Not a "Miracle," But They Beat the Alternative

reviewText: My 3 month old kitten loved it, even after one of my dogs took out the stuffing. I'll definitely buy another.

My Australian sheep dog loses her mind when she sees our regular sized ball launcher. This makes it very difficult to take the launcher along with us for walks. This one is short enough to keep out of sight. It's a little bit more difficult to throw the ball long distances but it's still very effective.

I have 2 dogs and was having trouble finding a dog food that was 'healthy' and didn't impact either dog negatively.  One brand made one of them vomit, another brand made the other one's skin dry out...but I found the right one for both with natural balance!  Both dogs love it, have no bad side effects, and are healthier for it!  I use the entire line (dry, wet and the dog roll for treats).
Both Dolby & Peppermint gave it an emphatic five, or ten if they could.  I  can't vouch for its effectiveness in terms of promoting oral health.It's their review, they insist.~~ Meow ~~ =^..^=
My cats love these solid catnip balls but they usually end up under the refrigerator so I get out the "fishing pole" (aka yard stick) to get them out. I usually have a large crew when reteiving them.
I use it to train and to tire out my dog.He barks for me to take it outside with us.The squeaker inside the toy's belly is his favorite reward.

Our dogs love this toy. So far, only one of the lures has been destroyed, and even that was really our fault for letting the dog hold on to it too long. We mainly use this toy in our unfinished basement to exhaust the dogs on rainy days when walks aren't an option. Just 10 solid minutes with the flirt pole is enough for the dogs to lay down panting.

I have both a Yorkshire Terrier and a Miniature Blue Heeler.  The Yorkie LOVES this toy and when I put it away she just sits and stares up at it on the shelf and whines.  However, my Heeler (who is usually the outgoing one) seems afraid of it and will not join in with our play.  Very unusual since she always interrupts her sister's play time, just not when we are using the Teaser.
summary: One dog loves it, the other dog... not so much

reviewText: It's nice that with Prime I can get this litter for even cheaper than at Petco, and it's delivered to my door. It's not that easy to find. I have issues with migranes if litter is too dusty, so far this one has not been bothering me. It clumps ok, I've seen better, and there still is a bit of smell, but for the lack of dust (there still is some, but way less than most brands) and my cats seem to like it, so I think I'll stick with this brand.

I have a picky little Shih Tzu dog. He is very particular about the type of food that he consumes. It has to be flavorful or he will not eat it. Well, this food is a hit with him each time. I only serve it on special occasions (e.g., his birthday, Easter, Thanksgiving, Christmas and New Years). Each time I serve the chicken stew, he can not get enough of it.

My kittens go INSANE for these mice. They were scattered all over the house within an hour, and I constantly hear the little rattle going crazy when one my them is being played with. Out of all of the MANY toys I bought my kittens before bringing them home with me, these are absolutely their favorite.

My toy obsessed dog completely loves this one.  He has been through many of the chuck it zipflights which, he still loves but he drops them as soon as he sees the squirrel come out.  The way it hovers through the air... this toy is a must for any pet owner whose dogs love to play fetch.
We use it whenever our dogs have an accident. Removes the stain and the dogs do not try to sniff it out and "remark" the same spot. Nature's Miracle makes wonderful products!!!

My large 9-lb. Maltese loves playing fetch, so I thought he would enjoy a frisbee-type toy and found this.  It's very sturdy and well made, but it's not his cup of tea, so to say.  He'd much rather chew on a corner of it than throw or fetch it like he does his small stuffed animals or other toys.  A throw pillow from the sofa flies well for him.I bought the small 9-inch size.  It has a concave shape, flies well, but is not for everyone.  Each dog has his own personality and knowing what one will like is not always so easy.
summary: It's just so so, in my opinion ~

reviewText: Obviously my dog Yoda, a maltese-brussels griffon, has made it his mission in life to destroy as many squeakers as he can! Big or small, he chews them with his sharp teeth until they are punctured then looks around like, WHY AREN'T THEY SQUEAKING? So I'm glad they are replaceable or I'd go broke buying squeaky toys! If you have a dog who loves to play with squeakies but is a little rough, I recommend these!
summary: My dog destroys these! (But its still a fine product!)

reviewText: My dogs loves these and bully rings, dog cookies, and the new Himalyan chews- but he's very food driven, so no big surprise.
These are larger than I've been able to find in any stores. Now none of them sell these. This is a great per squeaker price. MY dog likes to "kill" these so it's good to have replacements.
summary: Can't buy these in the store anymore. Thanks for carrying them

reviewText: My cats seem to get bored quickly with their toys. I have a new 4 month old kitten and he seems to like this toy for now. The tail has a nice leathery feel, which my cats like to chew on when they catch it, and it does a good job of being erratic and unpredictable to keep them guessing. Nice little toy.
summary: Keeps the cats curious for a while.

reviewText: He loves them. Not much else to say, he's thoroughly satisfied and so I am as well. My cat chewed into the bag though, I guess she smelled the chicken.

For some reason, these soft squeaky toys last.  My dogs love to pull toys apart.  They especially love to remove the squeaker first thing on any toy.  These toys don't squeak loudly and the action they make when squeezed helps kep them alive...I think.  I have a few different animals in this toy.  The dogs really like them.  In fact, I bought one when they were pups, 6 yrs ago and about a year ago threw it out.  But only because the rubber was getting old.  They still played witht the toy and it still worked.  Anothe "staple" in our toy box.
This is a very well made toy for cats.  However the cat was not interested in it after a sort time.
summary: Its cute but the cat was not interested.

reviewText: This would have had a 4 rating instead of a 2 if it were not for the fact that the dimensions were smaller than it had been advertised.  A huge no-no, especially when ordering online!  With a yardstick I measured the interior room and it is actually 21Long x 13-1/2Wide x 11-1/2High.  It was falsely advertised as 23Long x 15Wide x 12-1/2High.  My 10lb Miniature Pinscher is uncomfortable it in and she looks squished - and I am returning it.With that being said, I did like the covered holder for the leash atop the carrier, and the carry handle has a concave space below it, instead of the carrier top being just flat (view carrier photo), which allows the fingers to grip the handle with ease.  The spring latch is easy and quick to open, close.  The coated bars are safe (no sharp edges) and sturdy, and I like that they run the entire carrier length on both sides, and well as on the rounded backside - excellent ventilation.  The rounded backside is a nice design for the dog's behind.  I like the door design with the large air flow openings to see through.  The plastic is solid.  If you have a small 5-7lb toy dog, no problem.  Wouldn't recommend it otherwise.
summary: Carrier dimensions are smaller than advertised

reviewText: I have 4 cats and had to buy each one of those round toys with a ball in it because they all love to bat that ball around so I thought they would love this just as much but no.  It's been here for about a week now and they just ignore it.  Also, I'm not that good at figuring out how to put things together and I hate trying to figure out diagrams.  This was pretty easy to figure out and assemble.  I just wish the cats would play with it.
summary: Cute but the cats aren't intriqued

reviewText: makes training so easy

It's a nice size for my cat. I like that I can see him and he can see out.  The carrier is built well, arrived assembled and my cat has been walking in and out of it so hopefully he won't object to being put in it.  The colors I received were not at all like the picture. The body of the carrier is tan and the door and top are light blue/ gray. It is not brown and teal.
summary: Lots of viewing space, doesn't feel claustrophobic.

reviewText: The syphon works like it should, but the primer got rocks stuck in it, which damaged the bulb starter unusable.  I would recommend a different brand to be honest.

I got this for a 5 gal betta tank.  It works OK, but because the tubing is a bit small sometimes gravel blocks the tube and all the junk I want to siphon out doesn't make it out.  I think I should have gotten a full size siphon.  Still with a little work it does the job.
I used a retractable leash before and this one is much better.  Great support and very durable!! I will order another

I have two of these for my 80 lb dogs sitting in an outdoor porch to keep them cool and they really do love them.  They hold the dog's weight well and have done good through some bad weather.  I only give it 4 stars because they do deteriorate within 4-6 months, especially with the dog's nails (yes, they are trimmed, but some are still sharp!).  One of my dogs easily chewed through one, but the mat still held at all four corners as good as it could.  I would purchase again.

My 3 dogs love these treats. They are soft but firm, and about 1-1/2 inches long. My dogs are all small, so I often break these in half if I'm giving as a reward for something. They can also be broken like this for training treats for larger dogs.The quality is excellent, made in the US for those who are cautious about ingredients.The only drawback is the price. These treats are expensive, but I think worth the cost. Milo's Kitchen is one of the few brands I regularly purchase for my dogs.

i have 2 chihuahuas that are potty pad trained and these pads are my favorite.  very absorbent, plus the scent release works great.  one of the chihuahuas is a little stubborn about going on the pads and she is much better with these

One of my favorite litter boxes.  We have three different styles due to the spots we have them in throughout the house and I really like this one as it keeps most of the litter inside the box or on the stairs keeping my floors cleaner than with other boxes.  Plus one of my cats likes to shoot litter out of the box and with this one it makes it more difficult for her to do so.

Made for a larger cat or small dog this carrier is much bigger than the other blue Suncast carrier I bought but still both of them have such a cool and different look to them.  I like that my cat can see out the sides and can even stand up in it.
summary: Much larger than the other blue Suncast carrier,  Still so cool.

reviewText: easy access to treats, good fabric etc. I have to say it is not my favourite, but not sure why as it works well.

When our Lhasa was a young pup, I gave her the mini-Nutri Dent treats and she really enjoyed each treat to the very last bite.  She wagged her tail when I opened the inner package and let her smell the contents.  She took the chew treat to a special "alone" place so not to be bothered and enjoyed the Filet Mignon flavor to the very last crumb.  These Nutri Dent chew treats do not keep her entertained long (about 10-15 minutes) but they help clean her teeth and she enjoys them.  So whats to complain about?  The Pantry Pack arrived in its off the shelf packaging within a shipping box and arrived on promised delivery date.
summary: The right size and one of our Lhasa's favorite treats!

reviewText: The harness is just like the picture, however I went with the reviews and still did not get it right.I have an Italian Greyhound who weighs 14 pounds and is 17" tall.The fit was great except for around her front legs it gets tight there. In order to tighten around her body you have pick up the slack and that is what makes the legs tight. I think if she were shorter the harness would fit great.
Great cat brush. Tiny bristles get all the hair. Easy to clean and use :) :) :)Definitely a great gift idea for pet owners.
Cat loves it, I combined with separate heater as k&h's heated cup is too low on sides for kitty.  Get cozywinters.com's outdoor rabbit kennel pad and put underneath..they love it

Our tortoise cleans this food bowl clean every meal. She walks all over it, kicks it around, and all kinds of stuff. It's durable and pretty easily cleaned. It's also not too shallow or deep. I highly recommend if you're looking for a food dish for your pet reptile.
This works, but it's big,not very flexible, not so easy to open (but easy to close), and has pockets that aren't really very useful in addition to the main pocket.  All in all, overkill.
summary: not so easy to open (but easy to close)

reviewText: The spray is not awful smelling; it actually smells like some shampoos or hand creams. It annoys my dog enough that he stops his bad behavior, and now when he even sees the bottle he stops. I like that it's not harmful to people or animals. It's not a substitute for training, but it's definitely helpful.

Very safe and digestible protein treat. No dubious imported ingredients. Good training "bait" because they can be broken into tiny pieces, and gentle for older dogs with gum and dental issues. Also handy to enhance dried food.

My kitten loves this toy. She plays with it for hours. It was a great find and will recommend to buy cat friends. I love watching my kitten play with this and she has not yet tired of it. The build was great -- the ball flows easily from one side to the other.

These are just like the "greenies" that help to keep dogs' teeth tarter-free, and the price on these are competitive.  This size is perfect for my smaller dogs, a mini, teeny tiny size that fits into their little mouths and helps to keep their teeth clean.  My larger dog loves them, too, but the larger sizes suit her better (German Shepherd).  Great product at a great price!

They just are not excited about it. They are playing with the old one we have that we have had for years. I was going to return both of them but decided to keep them both and hopefully over time they would get interested. I think its because the ball at times gets stuck so they don't spin as fast when they hit the ball. I blame that on the connection of the tracks. It has to be JUST right or the top blue piece sits wrong and the ball slows and stops fast. And, to the manufacturer's. I suggest making the holes on the top and inbetween the blue top covers be a bit bigger. Most cats have larger paws and they can't get they paw into the openings like they can other models. The other model I have for example they can push there paw in and stretch it far to push the ball & with this one they cannot! I think thats why they are not as intersted. I have tried everything! I will keep them in hopes if I get a kitten again the kitten will like it and be able to get his/her paws in the openings to push the balls!

This looks so adorable on our little brown malt-a-poo puppy.  She takes the small for she is only  7 1/2  lbs. and 10 months old.  I have gotten so many compliments when she wears it out for it is so different with the little ruffled collar and bow.  She is quite active and this makes it much easier to control her without choking her.  She does not mind to wear it and I like the Puppia Brand for they are so soft and comfortable.  I actually own 4 of these.  I just throw them in the washer on cold water/delicate setting to wash and then lay them out to dry.  Look like new each time I wash them.  I ordered another kind one time and it was uncomfortable and my dog hated it.  It is brand new and never been used.  I will never purchase any other brand from now on but these.  They are reasonably priced and hold up beautifully.  You cannot go wrong with these.  I plan to purchase the red and pink like this one as well.  I love changing the colors and looks on my sweet girl.

These wipes are our 911! We use them as a replacement for regular bath as well as for elimination of possible daily dirt. And we also clean cat's outer ear with these. Cat doesn't mind us using these wipes!

I bought two of these for my Bengal cats who are more like dogs. They require a lot of stimulation and this feeder is the perfect thing! I fed them kibble in this treat toy plus a nylabone romp n chomp treat holder that I filled with their soft food and put it in the freezer the night before...it took them an hour to eat this morning and they are so content now. They were fed and entertained at the same time. I wish I'd bought these sooner!

I have a regular laser pointer and decided to try this one, hoping it would be a truly hands off toy.  The cats enjoy it, but let's face it, it's better to be truly interactive with our pets.1)  The height is nice and the angle options are wonderful2) The base could be a bit heavier.  The cats know it is the source of the laser and tend to knock it over.3) You need a fairly big space (or maybe that is just my preference)4) I'd like to see more than one random pattern.  If there were 3 or 4 patterns I think the cats would stay interested longer5)  they like it, but they like the handheld laser pointer betterOverall, it's a pretty good toy.  It works well, does exactly what it advertises, but you might be better of with a regular laser pointer.
summary: Nice addition to the toy collection

reviewText: I love this thing but i had a hard time trying to determine which size to order.  The small is actually pretty big i would hate to see the large.  That being said it works well has sloan my pup down a bit he just didn't like the big porcelain ball in his dish.
My cat would regurgitate like once a week cause she ate too fast, now she has totally stopped because of the bowl!
summary: helped my cat stop regurgitating food

reviewText: This conditioner makes my Papillon's hair super fluffy and soft. It also smells great so she doesn't smell like wet dog.
Nothing fancy, just good classic cat toys. But I warn you, if you've got wooden floors, the noises can get pretty annoying, so be aware ;)
summary: Good, so long as you don't mind the noise

reviewText: I've used one Defuser for a year now and had great results with one "problem child(cat)" who thinks he's an alpha cat.  Clearly in a household of 3 kitties (2 males and 1 female) the oldest male is the alpha boy.  The Defuser had helped the anxiety for the second male somewhat.But, then I saw the ad for the Calming Collar and decided to give it a try.  Both my husband and I have noticed AMAZING results in our second male cat.  He's much more calmer, loving and affectionate than before.  He no longer tries to be an alpha cat, but instead seems to understand his role in the household and goes along with the order of things.  He's much more affectionate to our dog, too.The flexible plastic collar is coated with a really nice lavender scent in a powdery form.  I don't know if I was correct in doing so, but I flicked off the cracking powdery flakes so they wouldn't be dropped around the house like link.  I was also afraid our dog would eat the flake and might get ill.  With or without the flakes, the collar is working!!!  Yeah!!

I have a 2 year old male Peke-A-Poo who is highly energetic.  He is the first dog I've had who shakes, whines and wants to hide in a dark cave during thunderstorms and fireworks. (He's 20lbs - I purchased size Small)He also can be quite annoying when company is here, demanding attention and yipping.I've tried the calming treats, collar and was about to give up.  This shirt had an amazing affect on him.  It calms him even when there's no thunder.When he has the shirt on...>- He sleeps through the night and sometimes past my wakeup time!- Over the 4th, I had family here and normally have to crate him when we are watching a movie. He was perfectly sweet and calm.I am not sure what it is or how it works, but it is amazing.We've had it since the 4th of July 2nd 2013.  Best investment I've made this year.

The dog likes to play on it but seldom sleeps on it.  She still prefers the couch. However the cat LOVES to sleep on it.  Go figure.  So I guess it's not a total waste of money and I have to give it a four.

My mini schnauzer loves these.  They are a great training aid and the dog seems to really enjoy them.  Thesetreats are healthy and somewhat higher in price than some other brands but I was well pleased as was my pup.

This is a "Large", but the connectors on each end would end up cutting my flows in HALF (marineland C360) and that isn't even a "large" canister filter.  This is more like a "medium" size.  I ended up just building my own for $25 out of PVC with properly sized fittings.
summary: Good concept, but inlet/outlets too small

reviewText: I was disappointed in this. The quality seems really nice, but I could never get it to stay in shape. I bought this for a 3 pound ferret and because it would not reshape he had no room to move, also this seemed small it didn't seem like he would be comfortable in it.

I know this is not the healthiest cat food in the world but I do let me kitties have this every once in a while. This flavor is their favorite. I also applaud them for being one of the only major cat food brands that were not involved in that heartbreaking recall a few years ago- so I will give them a nod for that- and never buy food from the other guys again. And when kitties want the McDonalds of cat food I will let them have it, in moderation though of course. Great price on Amazon too.

I am always searching for bowls to slow down my fast eating weimaraners, so I bought 2 of these bowls.  At first it slowed them down to 5+ minutes which was better than 1 1/2 minutes for 2 1/2 cups of dry dog food with a little water in a regular bowl twice a day. However, they figured out how to eat in 3 minutes after 2 days.  We have had better success with their Northmate Interactive Feeders which slowed them down to 10 minutes at first. Now after several months of use, they are down to 6 minutes and seem to be holding.  Perhaps the Flower Slo- Bowls will work for smaller dogs than my huge 100 lb+ big boys. In the meantime, I will my eyes open for bowls which may or may not slow down my boys even more.

The label clearly says for small and big dogs! Well one of my dogs walks right through it and the other one gets through after a little bit of a struggle (which is SUPER DANGEROUS in case he were to ever get stuck).....this is the 3rd gate I am trying....I can't find anything thats right for my dogs.....its either too low or the bars are too wide! :(
My cats like these Whiskas packages a lot.  They have lots of gravy and nice chunks of food.  They are a decent price here on Amazon as well.

I purchased this to use to wrap my shih tzus legs/paws.  She has allergies and an annoying habit of chewing on her legs at night. This wrap worked great.  I cut a small piece off then cut that in half and have enough for both legs! It does not have the anti-chew or bitter stuff on it. My dog will chew thru that stuff, but for some reason she leaves this one alone! It could be that she has learned not to do it also.  Anyway, I love this stuff and if/when I need more I am definitely getting another roll.

I have used a lot of bowls like this in the past ten years. This one is the best I have used. I had a large golden here that bolted his food, a bloat risk dog. This slowed him down to 5 mins to eat 1/4 cup kibble.My shelties eat fast and 1/4 cup kibble took forever, their small tongues could barely get the kibble out of the troughs. easy to clean, dishwasher safe,a very good buy.updateI bought a wave bowl, same company. the wave is deeper, harder to fill, but slows down a malmute. the circle bowl is easier to fill and more shallow. I am back I keep buying these for friends and clients
summary: the best one I have ever used-dog trainer/ wave vs circle

reviewText: This item looks unusual..it is designed from the cats need for utility point of view.  The only draw back is the unattached anti skid rubber ring....kitties immediately pushed the plastic dome out and away from the base sheet.  Finally i placed the whole thing on a carpet scrap with thin plywood underneath the carpet and drove two screws through the plastic dome into the plywood locking it all together.  Now the cats sit or sprawl on the carpet and rub, and rub, and rub without traveling across the floor.
summary: It works, it really works!  My cats love to polish their whiskers on it.

reviewText: I bought one and liked it so much I got one for my other cat too. The bell comes off with moderate effort. My kitten couldn't get it off, but he tried.I ended up removing it because he was flopping all over the place trying to play with it (and hurting himself). My other cat has the bell on and is fine with it. The kittens are 9 weeks old so I had to tighten it all the way. They are loose but stay on.

I love these pads.  It's the only brand I use.  My puppy (with proper crate training) always knows to use the bathroom on these pads now.  It only took about 2 weeks for him to understand to eliminate on the pad.  I thought maybe it wasn't the pad, but the location of the pad, but when I took him to friends' homes, he immediately knew where to go.  The only downside would be a bad smell that comes off of it after it's been soaked with urine.  It's not a urine smell, but probably the scent that's built into the pad itself.  If you have a trash can that has a lid, then you're fine.  Does not leak.  I only need one pad for my 5lbs puppy.  Larger dogs may need multiple pads laid down as it's not that big.

After noticing my dogs LOVE to eat from cat bowls of friends/neighbors, I got them some. I've generally heard that ~most~ cat foods are richer than most dog foods, so if true, that makes sense why dogs like it too. Although you may be able to feed cat food to dogs, you're not supposed to give dog food to cats. I don't want them getting doggy gout from overly rich food, so I trained them to understand that they can split one of these (2.75 oz plastic cup) AFTER they finish their regular dry food. I've given them Friskies too, which is a larger size (5 or 5.5 oz), and they love that too. One of the dogs grabs the cup and holds it in his paws and licks every last speck out. If they're happy, so am I.
summary: It may be cat food, but my dogs love it.

reviewText: Bought these on recommendation from our vet.  Our dogs love them!  Have only been using it for a short time, but seems to be keeping their teeth clean.

Now that was a gamble I do NOT regret under any circumstances.  The Super Shammy Soggy Doggy Water Remover works better than any other product of its type I ever tried and believe me I have tried many.We bought it specifically for the new member of our crew, Abby - the Biewer, and she fell in love with it faster than you can imagine.  We have had about 10" to 20" of snow in the back yard and she and our old boy, Pepper, cannot wait to play in the snow.  They ran out and by the time they were ready to return, each was full of 'snow bunnies' and we knew we were going to have a water problem as soon as they came inside.  Out came the Soggy Doggy on Pepper first and he just felt as if he were being caressed by one of those body rubbing folks.  Abby was still running in the snow as if she had any sense.  Soggy Doggy dried most of Pepper's wet and he finished the rest at his cage.  I picked up Abby with the Shammy and she thought it was spectacular and it was.  After we removed most of the snow from her, she headed for her cage and finished her drying without leaving a puddle along the way.I hung the Shammy in the bathroom and within an hour or so, it was dry.  Dry and not damp.  We liked these so much, we bought another Shammy and a flat mat for each so that they can use them for a mat to keep them comfortable and warm.  On rainy or snowy days they will each have a drying station and with hope make our lives somewhat more simple.
summary: This (at last) IS the Liquid Absorber

reviewText: This is a cute tag and well made.  My only complaint is that from the picture I ordered what looked like a baby pink tag but when it came it was more of a mauve color.  It actually goes really well with the beautiful rhinestone collar I got my cat but it's not really pink.

This bed isn't quite a large as I expected according to the dimensions.  It still works for my 14 month German Shepherd but it's a good thing she lays curled up instead of sprawled out.  Otherwise, her paws would probably hang off of this bed.  I like the fabric and the color.

My two cats love these. I mean like they seriously go crazy for them. I've tried other cat treats and they tend to have no interest. They are only 1.5 calories so I don't feel bad feeding a handful each day to the kitties.

My cat loves this toy a lot.  It got his attention once out of the box.  I love that you can interchange with other flies.  My cat seems to prefer the Katarantula more so than the Kragonfly.  This toy provides fun play sessions.

I really like this product, but because of the way it attaches to the seats, it's too much trouble moving them because then the screen is crooked. It still does its job, but if you're like me, then you just won't like the way it looks like that.
summary: Once you put this on, don't plan on adjusting your seats

reviewText: I have a cat who I need to put in a cat playpen during the day. Unfortunately, I think she gets bored in there, so she started playing with her water dish...and got water everywhere.
