Everywhere!So, I solved the problem by using this bottle. At first, I thought it may be too big, but, after a couple of month of use, I find that it's the right size. The cat took to it immediately, too. I've not had any problems with the bottle excessively leaking at all, either...maybe a few drips when you first attach the bottle after it's been cleaned & refilled, but that's it!Highly recommended!UPDATE: After a few months of use, I've encountered algae growing inside the water bottle. Yuck! Although I clean the bottle once a week, apparently what I was doing (taking dish soap and a little bit of water, putting the top back on & shaking it to clean) was not enough. According to the manufacturer, the inside of the bottle needs to be cleaned with a brush at least once a week. They recommended that I purchase the house branded one at a big-box pet store that ends in "mart", because it's long enough to reach inside the bottle. On my way there now!
summary: This bottle saved my TV, walls, carpet and furniture.

reviewText: I've been through a basket full of these type of toys for my two Siberian cats. In my opinion, these are superior to Neko's closest competitor and we all know who I mean. They are life like, fun to chew and bat and durable. A+++

I have three miniature dachshunds and they have stinky breath they hate having their teeth brushed with actual dog toothbrushes and tooth paste so I wipe down their teeth with this product twice a month and it really does help keep their breath smelling better.

I bought these to keep my dogs from scratching due to allergies, and they work great.  They are not scratching as much and they actually like wearing the shirts.  The Thundershirts are well made, fit well, and the material appears as though it will wear well and launder easily.  And the cost is very reasonable.
Dogs love them, I have to monitor because I'm afraid of pieces breaking off. My  nephews puppy just had to have a $5000 surgery to remove nylabone pieces from stomach. Stay safe with these
summary: Durable but worried about small pieces

reviewText: This toy, out of five I've bought, has turned out to be down right dangerous. My 9 week old toy Chihuahua can't do much to tear up anything.  But this toy has turned out to be the exception.  She started pulling out big fluffs within a matter of minutes and of course being a puppy she tried to swallow them. A watchful eye, on my part, kept her from doing so. So beware of purchasing this toy it is not well made and can be extremely dangerous to you dog.

If your dog eviscerates every plush toy he/she gets, don't bank on this one to survive.  It can't handle an all out focused assault.BUT - it is tougher than any other plush squeaky toy I have purchased.  The squeakers are larger tubes instead of the usual smaller puff ball type.  That means the dog tends not to try squeaker surgery and is content to just bite down on the thing over and over (which it handles very well).  Of course, it also means you have to listen to the squeaker.  A lot.  But if you don't want that, don't by a squeaky toy.The head is finally starting to come off.  My fault really.  The dog always wants to play tug with it.  I should know better, but sometimes I indulge him.  Consider a 70 Lb terrier was trying his crazy best to yank the thing away, it has lasted a good while.Short of kevlar, I'm not sure how they could make it stronger and still be interesting to the dog.

I LOVE the smell and it does a GREAT job of eliminating pet odors which is rare. The only thing is.... it doesnt last longer than a week and then you are stuck with a solid useless mass. I now have 3 of them just sitting around. Its made of Vegetable Glycerin and Baking soda and I wish I could burn them as candles or do something else that would bring the rest of the "smell good" out.

I've been eyeing the Amazing Treat Machine for a while. I thought about making my own knock-off, but I'm really glad I didn't. This kit is very well engineered and super easy to assemble.I thought having to create your own dispenser from a water bottle was a downside, but it's a benefit b/c you can tailor it to the treats you use. It does take a little trial and error to get it dialed in, but it's not hard at all.My boy is only 25lbs and he doesn't have a problem getting the ball into the top.But this isn't a "busy time" toy, it's an interactive tool for you to work with your dog. If you don't enjoy working with your dog this is not for you.
summary: A fantastic interactive experience for your dog.

reviewText: I bought this for my puppy after the snake by the same company lasted much longer than most toys.  This product is OK, and is reasonably tough, but the snake lasted a lot longer.  This product has quite large squeakers that seem to be stuffed into a single compartment, whereas the snake had a separate compartment for each squeaker, which seemed to work better.  Still Gecko provided our pup hours of fun, so not a bad investment.

I purchased this product instead of the Cat Stop Ultrasonic Cat Repeller that I have bought in the past.  I have a feral cat issue in my yard and thanks to Oregon feral cat programs I have little to say about this cat's freedom.  I have tried to work with the owners but that did not resolve the issue.  I had two Cat Stop devices and thought I'd try (mostly desperation) a concentrated effort of the two in the corner normally occupied by this cat.  I have no real animosity toward the cat but I don't attract birds to my yard to be killed by a cat.  The concentrated effort seemed to do the trick but this cat decided he'd stake out a new spot in the yard.  I went to buy another Cat Stop device and saw this one on Amazon and liked the reviews and tried it out.  I like it better for three reasons.  First, it uses a metal stake that is screwed to the body.  The Cat Stop is all plastic and it is hard to get the stake into dry ground (yes it is dry occasionally in Oregon) without damaging the stake or the clips that hold the extended stake.  The metal stake is easier to install into the ground and being screwed to the body I feel it is more sturdy and less likely to snap.  Second, I like that the battery compartment has a rubber seal and the cover is screwed to the unit.  One of the Cat Stop covers was blown off the unit--by a leaf-blower or wind.  I'm not sure how but I will give Comtech credit for replacing that while it was under warranty.  However I feel it can potentially happen again and I'd have to pay for the replacement.  The lack of a seal around the compartment door also makes it susceptible to moisture (i.e. Oregon when it isn't dry).  Yes, it is a little more difficult to do a quick battery change but I feel that works for me and will keep the battery from shorting out or getting damaged by wet or the loss of the battery door.  Lastly the unit has a variety of settings to adjust the strength of the unit.  The Cat Stop doesn't have that option.  Overall I feel it is a superior buy and it has the advantage of being less expensive.  The only fault I will give to the company is a lack of documentation with the device that helps determine the settings you might start with for various purposes.  The first one I bought does seem to keep the feral cat at bay.  This is #4 for my yard (#2 Pestbye brand).  Yes, it is annoying to have to spend more and more money to keep my yard my own and my birds protected from a nuisance cat but I'm glad there is a product that works and allows me the option to keep my yard cat-free.  Thank you, Pestbye and Amazon.Update (3/27/2013) - #4 seems to be doing as well as #3 (Pestbye).  I saw the feral cat once since I put up the device.  I went out and increased the sensitivity and I haven't seen the cat since (in my yard).  The yard behind my yard has a good neighbor fence (so people tell me it is called) where you can view the yard at the right angle looking through the spaced boards.  I can see the cat moving around there.  These owners also feed birds but apparently don't concern themselves with the cat roaming their yard.  I mention this because the feral cat is that close to my yard but doesn't visit it.  I've seen him close to the fence and watched to see if he would come over.  He did visit once while I was out of town.  I saw him the day I came back (before I got #4 Pestbye) and checked the two Cat-Stop units.  One had stopped working which could explain why he wasn't bothered as much since the concentrated effort of the two seemed required for that model to work effectively on this cat.  I've notice since I have set up this system with the two concentrated Cat-Stop units and the individual Pestbye units on a fairly high setting that I don't see ANY cats in the backyard.  I do see cats in the front part but not in the back.  I have to attribute their avoidance of the back area to the units.  I'm considering a fifth unit to put in the front.  I have a good row of rhododendrons that I've heard is a popular cat litter box for the neighborhood due to the amount of cat droppings seen when a leaf blower is used to clean out that area.  I'd like to discourage the neighbor cats from using that area for their bathroom.

Google Carrageenan! There is a degraded form of it that is well known to be a Carcinogen to both animals and humans (causes cancer). The FDA allows the undegraded form to be used in our foods in small doses but there is now a reputable study that suggests that the body breaks down the undegraded form into degraded form once it gets to the gastrointestinal track and can lead to cancer. The doctor that did this study even took the undegraded form and put it into contact live breast cultures and within 2 weeks they showed positive for carcinogens. There still needs to be more studies to figure out what is going on and whether our bodies can process it without being mutated by it's degraded properties but a reputable doctor suggests limiting or eliminating Carrageenan intake until more awareness and studies have been done around it. Remember, FDA approved pesticides that are now not allowed because it was eventually proven to cause major health problems including cancer. They can be behind the ball so in my opinion, why the heck risk it while the FDA plays catchup? For dogs look at chew treats for us look at the ingredients list of things like soy, almond, coconut milk.
wish they were dark gray or black as most of the hoses are grey or black, it does show tank build up over time especially because is so light in color

Since they don't offer the beef flavor for cats, I bought these just on a whim.  Well, I can actually get 3 pills out of one pocket from these and not only does that make them more economical, the cat loves them too!  They look disgusting, if you can catch my drift, but once you get past that, they're a great find.  Highly recommend!
This was a great size bone and my dog loved it...until he got to the stuffing. But, all in all, it was a good toy while it lasted.
My cat loves the gravy.  She usually leaves the rest.  it is difficult to find varieties with extra gravy.  This is also inexpensive enough to give it to her more often.
summary: My cat loves the gravy- enough said

reviewText: this seller is a rip off. this product is not as described and is cheaply made and seemed used at best. it was disgusting and was not the size I ordered for my dog.

Fleas are becoming immune to all of the topicals.  I used a different one for 15 years.  Then all of the sudden, I had a major flea problem.  I started with FiproGuard last year.  It is a different chemical than the one I was using.  I've had no problem since.I would say that if Frontline is not working for you, FriproGuard will not work for you either all it is the same chemical as Frontline.

I had pretty high hopes for the Busy Bone. I have a large, active chewer (the kind of dog that has to have several bones to choose from all the time if you don't want her to chew up your bed frame). I was hoping that with the Busy Bone's 'long-lasting' promise, I might be able to just give her one of these and at least have time to wash the dishes. Why don't I describe what happened next...I was in the kitchen washing the dishes. It had been about fifteen minutes since I'd given the dog the bone. Deeply absorbed in annoyance with myself for not rinsing said dishes, I was scrubbing vigorously when an awful sound met my ears: a terrible and hauntingly familiar crunching noise. The dog was eating my bed. So I go into the bedroom to scold her and even before I get a chance to look at the bed frame, I am struck by the mess she has caused. The Busy Bone somehow leaves little brown crumbles ALL over the floor. Too small and numerous to pick up by hand and too gushy for the vacuum cleaner to clean up, the oobleck has to be washed out of the carpet with a dish rag. And did I mention that they're expensive?I will continue to stick with real bones that I purchase from the butcher. They're cheaper, they last longer, and they don't leave a terrible mess.

My dog loves this toy. He runs around the house with it but it's also durable enough that he hasn't been able to eat it. My dog still likes it without anything stuffed inside. Its good to use as a ball to because it has a weird bounce.

I'm going to like this product better now that I have a No-Pull harness to assist me and my over energetic puppy that is LARGE....Can't wait to see some good results in improved health!  However, I do worry about its ability to handle the huge dog....
Besides the green stuff around it, the rest of the nylabone lasts for-ev-er. Still keeps my dog occupied so it must be good
I've been using Cosequin DS for a while now because I believe it provides the best relief for my dog's arthritis. The product arrives well within delivery time and I am perfectly satisfied with it.

I bought these treats because I know how healthy they are for my dogs, especially since one of them has a sensitive stomach.  However, the actual treat is difficult for them to eat. Since the biscuits are square, it is hard for their little mouths to grab on to them. If I try to break them first, they simply crumble.  I am not sure if I would purchase these again unless Blue Buffalo changes the way they are made.
These Scaredy Cut Tiny Trim Scissors are perfect for use on my little dog.  I like everything about them and definitely recommend the purchase.  Perfect!

For the last two months, we've shared our house with a now 17-month old Weimaraner rescue. Like all adolescent Weims, he is sneaky, stubborn, exuberant and...sensitive. Like many rescues, he is still working through the effects of what came in the three homes he lived with before ours,  including three months in multiple dog foster homes.  So. sometimes even after lots of exercise, patient training session and 24/7 tenderness, his edginess remains. These calming chews work very well for us.When we give one of these after his evening meal, he becomes much less agitated. As a result, we can watch a movie without constant interruptions, and the cat can enter the room without the dog springing into full speed action. I don't think there's any placebo effect since the "patient" is a dog(or maybe we're just more relaxed after he takes it in anticipation of its calming effects)...and it calms him down.Bottom line: after taking this, we enjoy calming experience for *every* member of the house.
These are great for keeping dog poop off your hands. The little dispenser that it comes with works quite nicely and can hook right on to your leash, if that's your thing.
summary: They are poop bags, and yes they work.

reviewText: These are economical and perfect for use with our 2 senior rescue dachshunds. We will definitely buy this brand again.
summary: Works just as well as the more expensive brands

reviewText: dog will probably love them, but beware!  I also bought the pet n shape skewers which are also not made in USA.  tossed all
My dog loves these treats and pet and shape was nice enough to send my puppy a box of different treats for us to try. Now I know she likes other treats from them.Thank you

I've owned two sherpa bags, one original and one delta deluxe.The original lasted a long time and was well made, the delta deluxe was torn to shreds in 15 minutes on the way to the airport. The one I bought from south west was higher quality than this bag, very disappointed.
This is a vet recommended dog product that my 2 standard dachshund girls love.  They get one a day as a nighttime snack.
these are my dogs favorite treat. I am so glad I found a big bag of them so that I don't run out. He gets them every time he goes outside to go to the bathroom. Thanks again

I purchased this slicker brush based on high Amazon customer ratings.  The reviewers were not wrong. This is a great slicker and it does a fantastic job.  I have two Chow Chows and this is by far the best slicker I've found (we've tried about three different ones over the past decade).  The slicker does an amazing job on our Chow puppy's wooly coat.  It easily and painlessly removes mats and leaves the coat nice and fluffy.  It is very comfortable to hold and the size is good.  Our largest Chow weighs about 45 pounds and it works well on her coat too.

I wanted to get a cat gym that fit a 20x28 inch space I have in a corner of our living room right and that was reasonably tall. This gym fits perfectly and the beige color matches our decor as well. I actually had this shipped internationally through amazon global (UPS) because where I live the cat gyms are both of horrible quality and extremely over priced. Even with the shipping, this gym was cheaper! When the shipping got delayed by about 10 days during the aftermath of hurricane Sandy, amazon actually refunded the shipping cost as well, so I ended with free shipping. Our first kitten loved the gym from the start, and now we have a second kitty that enjoys it too. They don't use the hammock on the bottom or the hoop at the top much, but they like the basket, and little house, and the platform on top. I'm petite 5'3" and put this together very easily. Out of the box it's covered with small pieces of the rope and some lint, so I just gave it a quick vacuum with a furniture attachment brush and it looks great. (I also have a DIY gym made out of cardboard boxes in another room that gets just as much play as this one though! However, that one is getting chewed up so will eventually need to be thrown out!)
summary: great quality and easy to put together

reviewText: These are Treats for Cats "Whisker Lickin's Tender Moments Salmon Flavor" I saw them at the Place where I shop for Cat Food by my House and I though my Cats would love them, unfortunately they didn't feel as Excited about them as I was. My older Cat Plays with it but doesn't eat it, the other one licked one of the little Pieces and ran away,...its like they don't know what to do with it, I guess. Tender Moments are Soft and Delicious according to the Packaging, and they do feel that way, however, my Cats maybe have other things in mind and they are not that into it. The List of Ingredients is very Long and Complex with many different Ingredients Starting with Animal Liver Flavor, Wheat Flour, Corn Gluten Meal, Animal Fat, Glycerin, Gelatin, Calcium Sulfate, Phosphoric Acid, Hydrogenated Starch, Red 40, Yellow 5...too many Ingredients to List them all. I think maybe my Cats Know what's Better and Best for Them! ...Thank You D.D.
summary: My Cats Are Not That Into it ~

reviewText: Out of the box - very heavy, but seems like a quality product, not a cheap light piece of junk.  Of course, that means to mount it - it's gonna require mounting it on something sturdy as well otherwise the weight alone will pull it down.  Everything needed to mount it is also included.  Also, note it is weather resistant, not weather proof - meaning it would be best to install under an eve, etc. to keep out of direct rain, snow, etc.  I think the pic is great.  I really like how you can easily walk around the house and take the little monitor (referred to as owners unit) with you (pocket maybe?) - then you can use it's little kickstand to prop it wherever you want to sit it for monitoring.  It has a rechargeable battery, so mobility is not an issue.The camera can be controlled from the monitor (owners unit).  It can be zoomed in and out and actually turned up, down, left and right.  A little con of zooming in and out does require hitting the menu button and actually choosing 1x or 2x zoom - so the zooming feature is not really anything to write home about so to speak.  The menu also offers a way to brighten the display, which is a nice option.  You can also add 3 more cameras to the owners unit.  If you purchase/add the indoor pet camera with sound, you can actually use the microphone talk option to speak via the monitor and transmit to the camera.  This system did not come with the indoor pet unit, so I can not review that portion.  Also, some have mentioned they were able to monitor sound?  All I can hear from the speaker via the owners unit is static - I have not observed any "realtime or real life" sound.?  I just assumed the outdoor camera did NOT have any sound? If it is supposed to, then this unit is broken.The monitor (owners unit) pic can be viewed thru your tv by purchasing a special video cable.Important notes:  If you are looking for a camera that works via the internet, etc. - this one is NOT for you.  This works within the wireless range of under 600 ft only - it does not have a wifi or internet ability.  So, overall if you are wanting to view your backyard via the internet on your pc or phone away from home, this one is not for you.  If however, you will be at home and just need to keep an eye on the backyard, frontdoor, etc. without having to get up and run to look out, this is perfect.
summary: Great pic and love the camera controls!

reviewText: First, if you don't know kids are dogs, you won't spend the money for these.  Ditto on my review of Cadet bully sticks. These are more stout and last longer but are pricier. At 3 bucks a stick these are for the kids when we will be gone for a bit (hours, not days) or the baby sitter wants to bond with them.NO Odor problem, no digestion problems.Just a note to those with sensitive puppy kids, my yellow lab has a very limited tolerance to lots of foods, she is on rice/meat/chicken.  I can only give her Wellness grain free snacks and even high quality protein grain free kibble she can have issues with (she had pancreatitis which may be the issue), BUT she has never had the slightest issue with these.

So many dog treats leave crumby greasy messes in my pocket that is worth celebrating a treat that does not. These treats are also easy to break in half, which makes them a great size for training. I have five cats and the biggest one likes to remind everyone who the big cheese is. He would back up into a corner of my office and let loose. It was along the door, so he basically drew a line along the door, claiming it as his own. Twice a day I had to spray and wipe up pee. If I didn't it would permiate down the hallway. I bought the mat, the large one. I used very thin two-sided tape to keep it in place, on the tile surface. It is transparent so you can barely see it. It is made of good quality plastic/rubber. It has three settings, zap, ouch, and nuke 'em. The set up was breeze, just put in a battery, conect the little control box and you're ready for action. Initially I put it on the lowest setting and put my hand on it to test. It was a very light tingly/zap. I kept my hand on it and it kept pulsing until I took my hand off. The cats walked over, one touched it and jumped three feet in the air then an into the closet, so the other one came over to see and took off running. Even the dogs don't like it. It works like a charm. I keep it on the highest setting to keep the dogs out, and although the cats have learned to jump over it, I don't find myself wiping up pee any more.Important note, don't ever walk around barefoot and step on it at the highest setting, it's like a really good static shock that'll make you dance on the mat.

These little fury creatures bring such joy to my cat each day. I have tried numerous litters for over 22 years and have not found any that actually delivers what is promised by the manufacturer; not until I found New Improved Blue Naturally Fresh Multi-Cat Clumping Litter anyway.One thing I like about it is that it is made from walnuts, which is natural and biodegradable. There isn't anything but a fresh scent of walnuts. No perfumes nor enhancers. We don't have any cat odors permeating our house, and I keep both boxes in our pantry right next to our kitchen. I don't clean it every day either, but I still don't smell anything like I have before. When I do clean it, I don't smell anything then either. I have used litters that gagged me and made my eyes run. Not so with Blue.I learned that it needs to absorb urine for it to clump well. When it does, it really is more like a slab of clumping, and it is not wasteful. It also does not stick to the bottom or sides nor does it turn to mush. I do have to scrape just a little to remove it from the bottom of the pan. But it isn't like some I've used that ended up like concrete that I had to, literally, pry loose ending up with sore shoulders, hands and wrists. I also like the fact that there is hardly any dust and it does not track all over our furniture, floors or carpets. I am not having to sweep all the time. One time, we were using one that ended up in our bed! Yuck!The clincher was when I saw our old Mr. Persnickety using it. He is so particular about his litter, he was peeing and pooing all over the house. I think he likes the feel of this Blue under his feet. It is more like a soft sand rather than pokey.What else caused me to switch from corn litters is, our Blue is allergic to it and ends up blocked + some reviewers were complaining about bugs. I finally figured out what was causing Blue's problem. He and our Kit took to Blue right away. I had been combining it and the WB litter. No more. Now it's straight Blue litter. I left the combined corn and Blue in a separate box. They all took to the Blue.I will never use any other litter as long as we have cats. I finally found one that lives up to it's promise and I'm sticking with it. (Pardon the pun.) I hope they never stop making this litter. Please keep it on the market. As far as price, it may seem a little spendy, but it is healthier for your cats, you, and your home. I just add a little more every other day to keep a 3" level. In the long run, it still is cheaper than litters that clump so much, you end up changing out the boxes more often, which, when it is all figured, is costing you more.I, highly, recommend you try the New Improved Blue Naturally Fresh Multi-Cat Clumping Litter if you have more than one cat. I truly believe it will make a believer out of you, too.
summary: Finally, A Cat Litter that Lives Up to it's Promise

reviewText: I never post a review before I've had some time with a product but this vest is currently doing a fantastic job. The heats getting more intense and generally when it starts getting over 70 degrees our black Mastiff starts to heat up, he's 9 months and over 100 lbs. When he's uncomfortable at night he doesn't sleep and I don't sleep. He goes as far as sitting in the bathtub barking until I hose him off when the last shower cooling ended. I researched and reviewed reviews last night and bought this to be delivered today and had in on him in 10 minutes. At first he wasn't thrilled and then as soon as he started cooling down, the excessive panting and general discomfort stopped and he just laid down and napped like a king.So far Pro's (for XL in terms of sizing review)- Both sides of the vest have adjustable straps, at 100 lbs I had to pull the straps in a lot for a better fit but there's more than enough room to adjust so as he gets bigger he'll still fit in it comfortably. I was really happy with the amount of room for his deep chest and the length is perfect. The straps even pulled in for a better fit still sit past his rib cage.- After 4 hours of putting it on him the vest still cool and he's still cool-Extremely easy to put on - out of the box, run it under cold water - wring it out really well and just put it on your dog.Cons - none so far, it looks like a jacket but it's not a jacket, so if you get any flack about having a jacket on your dog in the summer simply inform that person it's a cooling vest or ignore the comment. It's for the dog, not you.I will update after a few months but otherwise our Mastiff is much much more comfortable now and back on his couch and out of my bathtub.UPDATE: July 1, 2014Still giving it 5 stars - it's not built for humid days or environments but still great for IL weather. Our Mastiff loves it on just hot days, humid days he just gets hosed off in the yard or shower like I mentioned above without the jacket. Still very happy that I found it and would definately buy again.
summary: A little early but I'll update..

reviewText: Funny, Dog Goes Nuts, chases it around the floor. I recommend this for dogs of all breeds and all sizes :)

We were adopted by a small skin-and-bones feral cat that arrived half frozen in our backyard a couple of winters ago.  After gradually taming her, she (Goose) has become completely enamored with our large German Shepherd. Even though she must be at least 3-4 years old now, she plays with the crazy, wild abandon of a small kitten.  Chasing the dog and climbing furniture are her favorite pasttimes.  In order to save the furniture, I'd recently priced some of the large cat climbing structures; and I found that to buy a large, sturdy one is well over $150.We already had plenty of scrap lumber in our workshop; so I used 3/4" thick MDF to make a wide square base and then securely bolted a 4"x4" post in the middle.  I covered the base with some leftover carpet scraps; and I'm currently in the process of wrapping the 4x4 post tightly with the sisal rope.  I brush a very thin layer of adhesive on sections of the post as I'm wrapping it, and then every 7-8 inches, I tack in a small nail through the sisal rope into the post.  During all this wrapping, my hyper kitty is stalking me and attacking the post and swaying rope.  Apparently, she's having trouble waiting for her Christmas gift.  I haven't yet decided what will go on top of the post (simple platform or sleeping box?) or how tall to make the post.  It's cut right now at 6' but I may cut it shorter.  If I leave it at a taller height like that, I'll have to secure it to the wall somehow in order to keep it upright during exuberant play.  I have to hurry up though...Goose is getting impatient.It's always nice to have other uses for products.  Since I'll have leftover sisal rope (I bought 2), I'm also making some of the small, old-fashioned sisal bottle-brush Christmas trees (found a great tutorial online).  I'm making them in assorted sizes and will leave some of them the natural sisal color and will dye some of the others.  Pretty cool.For both of these projects, I've been very happy with the quality of this sisal rope.  I had checked at 2 different home improvement and hardware stores, and their sisal ropes had a very strong unpleasant solvent-type odor.  This rope has a bit of a smell, but it's more of a subtle straw or dried-grass odor.  Nothing unpleasant.  I would have given a 5 rating; but I feel that the price is rather high.  I guess you just have to pay extra for non-stinky rope.UPDATE:  Wrapping the 6 foot tall 4x4 post tightly required nearly two packages of this sisal rope.  I finished Goose's climbing tree with a simple carpet-covered platform on top, as well as three smaller carpet-covered ledges spaced randomly up the post.  Goose loves it!
summary: Building a cat-scratch "tree" with entirely too much help from my cat

reviewText: Recently hairballs have become a significant problem for my cat, caused I suspect, by excess shedding due to the sudden extreme heat we are experiencing. I found these Hairball Remedy treats on Amazon and was excited to read the high number of positive reviews. Seeing that they only came in a pack of ten, I tried to find them in a store first; however, unable to find them in several local stores, I ordered the pack of ten. My mistake, given that my cat refuses to eat them.The first day I pulled three out of the pack and tried to feed them to him like I would a treat, and he sniffed at them, but walked away. I thought maybe there were too big so I pulled them apart into pieces and tried again, but he only licked at them, then walked away. I then left three fresh ones by his food and water bowl, and they were still there, hours later. I finally crumbled them on top of his food bowl and the poor little guy didn't eat any food until I dumped the bowl and put in fresh food.I don't want to say the product is faulty; they seem fresh and smell tasty enough (like a jerky), and feel "squishy" coming out of the pack (they definitely got hard, left out for a few hours), but I can't speak of the effectiveness, since it has been several days of trying and I still can't get him to eat any. I will say that my cat is unusual, in that, he does prefer dry food over wet food. I faithfully put out both wet and dry food daily, but he eats very little of the wet, so I probably should have guessed this wouldn't be something my cat would eat.I'll keep trying, and update if anything changes, but for now, I'm disappointed because I really wanted this to be the solution.
summary: Can't Say if They Work, My cat Refuses to Eat Them

reviewText: This is my second Aquatic Life LED Light Fixture, my first one is their 48" which is sitting atop my 55gal. The 24" fixture is over my mostly fish-only marine tank, with just a couple of "easy" corals (a kenya tree and a colony of palythoas). My 20 gallon is a generic pet store tank with a standard rectangular shape and a 20" depth. Prior to the Aquatic Life, I had theFinnex Ray2 Aquarium Day/Actinic LED Light. The Finnex 24" boasted a pretty staggering 192 LEDs while this fixture only has 57, which probably accounts for the feeling that this fixture is much less "bright" than the Finnex - however it is a 20 watt versus 36.So to answer the general questions of "will this be good enough to keep my corals alive/thriving?" - unfortunately my answer here is sort of incomplete.  All I can say is that, so far, all of my corals are alive and healthy and it hasn't encouraged the growth of cyanobacteria.What about if you have a fish-only tank and you're not really worried about PAR ratings for corals?  Well, the Aquatic Life fixture includes both 10k lights and moonlights, but also a band of lights including a couple of red LEDs.  You can individually select this band and turn it off, but it diminishes quite a bit of the overall power of the strip. If you're running a planted or fish-only freshwater, I think this would work just fine. However, if you're used to only 10k and actinic in a marine set up, you may not like the aesthetic the red band brings. It took me a couple of days to get used to it, but I actually think it helps many of the greens and yellows "pop" a bit more than they used to under just the 10k/actinic.As for the functionality, I really wish all of the bells and whistles included on this fixture was more common. You have three basic channels - blue/moonlight, white lights, and white/red/mix, and each channel can be set on a simple timer function. If I could do a "wishlist" request, it would be for the ability to do on/off times multiple times a day, but as it is, it's still more than most fixtures give you the ability to do. Some sort of battery backup would also be nice - I plugged the light in multiple times when I was setting it up (testing it, testing it on the tank, final location setup) and I had to reset the clock and the timer each time. If you live in an area prone to brownouts, I can see this getting annoying fast.Aesthetics - in my opinion, it looks nice. The fixture itself is a very slick and simple black aluminum body. Unlike many other LED aquarium lights, there's not a lot of extraneous "light bleed" since the light sits very low atop the aquarium itself (the feet are only about an inch long). My tank is a generic black-rimmed tank, but I think this would look fine even sitting above a rimless. Also unlike many other lights, the feet are securely locked into place by a friction screw - whereas other lights like the ones made by Finnex use a plastic bit that can freely slide around.Conclusion - Like on my bigger 55g, I'm going to run this alone for a while and monitor the fish and corals. I really don't expect anything drastic to occur in the meantime and I may even try running both the Finnex and the Aquatic Life for a while - although that may simply be too much light.
summary: Not bad on my 20 gal, but feels dimmer than my old Finnex Ray2

Our dog Emily tore her ACL last January and ended up having knee surgery last May.  On our vet's recommendation we began giving her a joint supplement called Glyco-Flex III.  Pet Naturals Hip+Joint Formula is very similar in size, shape and flavor.  In fact, Emily couldn't tell the difference.Looks can be deceiving.  Although both products are very similar in price (about $0.24 versus $0.22 per serving, with the Glyco-Flex being a little bit pricier,) the active ingredients are not equal.Here's how they stack up (per 2 chews):Glyco-Flex III:Glucosamine HCL 1000mgMSM 1000mgPerna Canaliculus 600mgN,N-Dimethylglycine HCL 100mgVitamin E 50mgVitamin C 24mgManganese 10mgGrape Seed Extract 5mgL-Glutathione 2mgSelenium 0.002mgHip+Joint:Glucosamine HCL 750mgMSM 400mgChondroitin Sulfate 400mgN,N-Dimethylglycine HCL 100mgVitamin C 100mgManganese 5mgEicosapentaenoic Acid EPA 18mgDocosahexaenoic Acid DHA 12mgNow, I'm not a chemist or a vet so I don't know what most of these ingredients are but I do know that the two ingredients that my vet was most concerned about are Glucosamine and MSM and the Glyco-Flex has more of both.  In addition, the Glyco-Flex dosage can be cut in half after the first 4-6 weeks of treatment.  For those reasons, I think the Glyco-Flex is a better value.

I bought this cat food because of the wonderful low price and I enjoy the adorable cat on the commercials. My cats did eat this food, in fact they really enjoyed it. However, after reading the ingredients and doing some research, I completely regret purchasing it and feel just awful for feeding it to my cats. The first three ingredients are (which indicates the most prevalent ingredients) are ground yellow corn, corn gluten meal, and chicken by-product meal. How disgusting is that?! The main ingredient is a cheap corn filler. One thing my vet told me a while back that I never forgot: "When you eat corn, what comes out of the other end? The same thing happens with cats and dogs." Basically, corn cannot be fully digested, it is just a filler and causes pets to actually eat more to feel full, poop out more (more for us to clean in the litter box), and retain less nutrients. The only meat in Friskies at all is a by-product, its not even a real meat! By-products are the stuff leftover once all the actual meat is harvested. We're talking beaks, chicken feet, eyeballs, even chicken poop! I would not recommend this product to anyone, for any reason, ever. It is an absolutely awful cat food. I suppose you get what you pay for. I think the only reason why it was cat-approved may be because it contains artificial flavors that taste good to cats and because I usually feed them dry food for dental reasons and wet food puts off much more of a scent for them to enjoy. I recommend to stay far away from Friskies, as it is simply a very low quality filler food. Even though the price is quite inexpensive, your cat will actually eat more than if you paid for a better quality food, because they will never feel full. Cats need to eat meat, and there just isn't real meat in this food. When purchasing a cat (or dog) food, the most important thing to consider is the first 3 ingredients; just make sure those first three are decent ingredients that you would eat yourself. Now that I know what to look for, I usually buy my pets all natural, dry foods such as Blue Buffalo, Halo or Wellness. All of those brands contain real, whole meats that I myself would eat, with no added fillers or corn.
I have 2 dachounds.  Who are real stuffed animal lovers.  They still play with the noisy ones,but like these as well. Really well made and most of all the dogs like them!  Recommend
HAD TO RETURN THEM..MY CAT HAD ONE FOR 3 SECONDS (HONESTLY) AND IT WAS TOTALLY DEMOLISHED .SO THEY WENT BACK TO THE COMPANY. I DID NOT CARE FOR THE WAY THEY WERE MADE AT ALL
My dog loves it!  I like the fact that you can actually see the chunks of meat that are in there rather than paste like dog food which you can't be sure what in there.
summary: The best dog food for Peggy

reviewText: A dog trainer recommended this to us for use with our unruly dog... A godsend! It's not quite as magical for us as I have read it is for others, but it certainly makes walking our dog manageable which isn't the case otherwise. Our dog, for reference, is a Dalmatian/Border Collie mix and about 60+ lbs - the medium fits well. The Raspberry color does bleed a bit on her white fur, leaving the "mark of shame" on her snout ;)
summary: A must have for an unruly dog

reviewText: Absolutely love this product! Dogs at the dog park surround me to drink from this and owners always ask where I got it.PROS: Holds plenty of water, my entire Brita filter for instance. Durable.  Easy to clean, my hand can fit through the hole to scrub.CONS: Would be perfect if it had a strap for over the shoulder.  I added my own so it's more comfortable to carry while hiking, etc.
summary: MOST POPULAR MOM AT THE DOG PARK!

reviewText: My toy poodle loves this food and since setting it up on auto delivery I never have to worry about running out of food for him or trying to find his brand as I did in the past.  Great product and great service!

It took a sale price and a really good coupon for me to try this because one of my two cats is very picky about litter. She likes the regular A&H; multi-cat, so I didn't think this would be a big stretch for her. This is very different from multi-cat, but she seems to be accepting it. The thing I really don't like about this is the fragrance. It is a weird fruity/floral scent and it is kind of strong. My husband thought I lit a scented candle when he came home, and that was a few hours after I first opened it. Needless to say, I am not a scented candle kind of person. I think the cats and I will have to get used to the texture, too. It is like very fine sand. Despite the claim, I really don't believe this product is low tracking compared to the old one. I happen to have a box with the old litter right next to one with Clump & Seal (in case the one cat refuses it), and there seems to be just as much Clump & Seal as there is multi-cats on my floor. I think Clump and Seal will be harder to clean up, too. I'm about to find out as soon as I'm done with my review, so wish me luck. Odor control is only slightly better, if at all. I never had a problem with odor, though. I am a stay-at-home mom so I am able to clean the boxes out ASAP. I never noticed odor with the multi-cats even if we were out all day and came home to a dirty litter box, except right after the fact. Even with clump & seal, there is noticeable odor at first, so I doubt the "seal" part of their claims.A good thing is that the dust from pouring is greatly reduced. I hated inhaling litter dust, and I can't say that I have noticed any dust with this. Clumping is a bit better than multi-cats, but not so greatly so that I would pay much more for this than multi-cats.This product is something I would buy if it was cheaper than our regular brand, but I certainly wouldn't pay more for it. If you like scented candles and dust is a real problem, you would probably really like this.Edit 6-7-14. We stopped using it after the first box. It turns out that the picky cat never used this and the other cat couldn't care less what litter was used. There is a weird smell to this after it has been out a while, even though the box is cleaned out at least once a day. I guess I would call it sour, but it is hard to explain. It is definitely harder to clean up off the wood floor and carpet compared to regular litter. I'm assuming it is because of the smaller grains. The texture also makes it impossible to completely clean out of the litter box. There are always these tiny "crumbs" that slip right through the litter scoop. Between the odd scent, the "crumbs", the difficulty cleaning up, and the sour smell, this isn't worth it. And now that I have read that cats are getting sick from ingesting this litter when it sticks to their paws, this isn't coming into my house even if I was getting paid to use it. I would much prefer a cloud of litter dust in my face.
summary: Like a fine sand mixed with a scented candle

reviewText: This is actually an excellent filter and I would have given it 5 stars. However, this is only the case when it's working, though it's only the biowheel that is faulty and outdated.The biowheel on these older models turns as water is ejected out of the filter. However, within a few days (maybe week and a half) the filter either starts to slow down or the wheel gets stuck against the cover because it stops turning.If you bought this item you probably bought it for the mechanical, chemical, and bio filtration it supposedly offers. However, about half of the time you'll end up with just chemical and mechanical, as the bio filtration ceases when the wheel stops to function.Still, the filter itself is an awesome piece of machinery and it is otherwise well built. Aside from the bio filtration, every other method of filtration works just great (though the filter pads could come with a bit more carbon).I've had my 30 gallon aquarium for 3 years now and the Penguin 150 has been with me since day one. During the middle of my second year with it I bought an Emperor 280 (also by marineland) to work along with the Penguin 150. I believe the Emperor models is what the Penguin was supposed to have accomplished, except the Emperor models are a lot better. The wheel does not rely on the flow of the water being ejected from the filter and instead has a hose like tube spraying water on it causing it to turn. The Emperor also has larger filter pads and comes with an extra slot in which you can add whatever type of chemical filtration you want (also holds a large amount which is a big plus). If you're looking at the Penguin models I strongly urge you to consider an Emperor model. They are a bit more expensive and a bit larger but they are incredibly effective. If you have a tank about my size, though, you're going to have to cut the intake tube as it is a lot longer than the Penguin models.Anyway, I decided to write this because I'm getting sick of my Penguin 150 and I'm about to retire it for a HOT Magnum also by Marineland.

I ordered this Pioneer Pet Replacement Filters for Ceramic and Stainless Steel Fountains, 3-Pack for my cat watering fountain.  My filter being used was way overdue for replacement.  Why I had let it go so long, as I clean the fountain regularly, I can't really say.  I think I expected them to be expensive, so I ordered a container of activated charcoal, to replace the active ingredient save some money.  The price of a 3 pack is only 5.99 delivered free with my Prime membership, so that is not an issue.  These will perform the necessary duty of freshening the water even more than the fountain does.  The jar of charcoal can be used also, as the filter does come apart with a little careful prying at the seam, but be careful so as not to break off the pin guides.  Clean and position the filter to keep the charcoal in the plastic filter container and you are ready to used the filter with fresh charcoal, but why bother with the work, just buy this 3 pack and change your filter almost effortlessly.  Simple.
summary: Pioneer Pet Replacement Filters for Ceramic and Stainless Steel Fountains, 3-Pack

reviewText: My cats indoor and out insist on eating the dog food I buy  (High Fat, High protein) so I quit buying dry catfood and now instead of giving them canned fish to share, I give them Nine Lives. So they get the nutrients missing from dog food! With some elderly or ill cats, I need to give medications and they will wolf them down in this formula. I try to stay away from Purina because of bad results and since they attempt to monopolize the pet food market by buying up the competition, that can be difficult.

I had doubts about how effective this would be because my dog chews on everything and I read some reviews that this is only as good as the spray is wet.  However, I was pleasantly surprised at how effective this is.The biggest concern I had about my dog chewing on things was the wires he was getting to - power cords, coaxial cables, etc.  After I applied the spray he stopped chewing on these things.  I can say that my dog doesn't chew on these cords any more after I sprayed them even after they are dry.The one thing that I can't say with 100% certainty is if he doesn't chew on them when they are dry because one time tasting the bitter apple was enough (and he remembered that the cord was bitter) or if it's because the bitter taste remained after it dried (haven't tried to taste the dry cords myself).  Nonetheless the effect was the same, my dog stopped chewing on the cords once he associated the taste with the cords.
summary: My Cords and Cables Can Breathe a Sigh of Relief

reviewText: we purchased this bowl for our Vizsla puppy.  I wasn't sure if it would work at this time because he was only 8wks old (at the time of purchase).  We have been using it for 2wks now and are very please with how it keeps him from wolfing down his food.  I would highly recommend this bowl to any owner of a "chow hound."  It is great for any dog who has a potential for developing bloat.

My rabbit loved this.  I would say the only downside is that he ate the dried apple pretty quickly and hasn't been too interested in the rest of it.  He did have a grand old time rolling it around his cage when I first gave it to him.

Our cat "AggieMay" has arthritis. Used to give her Cosuquin. We switched to Dasuquin to see if there was any difference. WOW, were we amazed.  After giving her two capsules a day, after a short time you could see how much the inflamation had gone down in her legs.  She is a lot more perkier, jumps a lot more, moves faster, not to mention how much her disposition has improved. I can imagine how much pain and discomfort she must have been in before. I wished I would have known about Dasuquin sooner.  This product has worked wonders with our cat.

The pet fountain is awesome. Top it up every other day, clean it out every week or so - change the filter once a month. Super easy. These little things are the key to making it work - knowing our cat always has clean water - for a low price. These inserts are filled with activated carbon - similar to what goes into aquarium filters - so it reasons they should be effective at keeping the water clean. Nothing to complain about - really good product.
summary: Clean water for the cat - fair price - the fountain makes life easier

reviewText: I often feed this food, but can't seem to find it on sale very often anymore.  This price was at least as good as sale prices and comes right to my door.  Cat loves this food.

I got two of these to replace two aqua clear 110's for my 55gallon tank. My water was always cloudy with the aqua's but only a day of using these the water is 10x better. I like the filter pads better as well. This is only one so its easier to maintain and clean than having three. The wheels spin well on all of them as well. It can be noisey but you just gotta add/decrease the water level to make it stop. Overall a great product, will never go back to aqua's.

Been using these for over a year now.  Picking up poop is not the most enjoyable thing but I love the thickness of the bag and it is so easy to flip it and tie it.  To me a must have product for dog owners - can't live without these!
Not the best quality food, but seems priced right for someone on a budget. Also seems to be my dog's choice of preferred food. So good for picky eaters. LOL.

I tested on myself before I would use them on my pet.  He reacts to the vibration.  I've only used the shock once, when he could have been in danger, and it's much milder than the others I'd like to have a safety on the shock button, so it won't accidentally be pressed or bumped.  I created one of my own.  Range is good.My dog is under 20lbs,  All of these devices are so large, but this is manageable.  I haven't used the light, but it's a nice touch.  The beeper does get his attention.Batteries on the collar didn't last very long the first time it was used.  There's no on/off on the collar except to remove the batteries.
summary: So far so good.  Milder than most - just needs a safety afournd the one button.

reviewText: My dog LOVES LOVES LOVES LOVES these balls.... So much that he is alwayskeeps bringing them to me to throw.... like ALWAYS. He likes to squish them in his mouth that makes a disgusting noise but he is so cute while doing so! These are his favorite things in the world besides his chuckit kickfetch thing. He goes bonkers for them!

Our cat shows a strong preference for 9 Lives (both seafood poultry, and the one w/ beef), compared to similarly priced F. Feast and Friskies.  And I stick with her opinion, the  prices being comparable.
summary: Cat prefers to Friskies & F. Feast

reviewText: I bought this actually from Petsmart.  But for the correct application it is great.  I am currently building a shrimp tank for my mom and using this tank.  I have about 6 red cherry shrimp and 2 small snails (these have a very low bioload compared to having actual fish).  That's it!  No fish!  I've got a rock in there, and a bunch of guppy grass for the shrimp to graze on.  For the filter, I do not use the under gravel filter it came with.  I use a sponge filter so the shrimp can graze on that.Now the incandescent light it came with is terrible.  I did not like its yellow color and the heat from incandescents.  So I bought a LED bulb, but that too was too yellow and too dim!!  I even glued aluminum foil to the inside of the lid housing which helped a little but not that much.  Finally I found a bulb here on amazon that was perfect!  It's the "E12 6 Watt LED Bulb 27 SMD 5630 LEDs omnibearing Lighting cool White 5000K" by SZHuibang sold by CCC International.  It's $9 with shipping.  The bulb looks big but it will fit.  You have to remove the clear plastic panel on the lid of the aquarium and put the bulb in that way.  The lighting difference was like night and day!  And there is very little heat.  Hopefully it will last long because I am setting this up for my mom for mother's day.So for my purposes, this tank was fine.  I have tried with fish but I think 1 gallon is just too small, except maybe for a betta.In terms of what the tank comes with…the bulb and the undergravel filter are just junk IMHO.
summary: Great for the Right Application BUT Needs Some Work!

reviewText: I have always used Arm & Hammer Double Duty and NEVER have I ever had any odor coming from the litter box.  I tried this as it was a bit cheaper but I don't like it as much.  The clumping action is not as good as "Double Duty's" and sometimes I do detect an odor right after she has defecated.  It does go away but with Double Duty, I detect NO odor at all at anytime.
summary: Arm & Hammer Super Scoop clumping litter

reviewText: How can you know what your pets really like?  We mix this Pedigree food with dry kibbles, and our two mini- Schnauzers eat it.  Some days they are not interested, or one is, and the other, not!  (Though, I suspect it might be the kibbles that they reject.)  Actually, they do enjoy the choice cut cubes of meat product and the gravy, so all is not lost!  As to the Variety Pack, who can tell what flavor they prefer?  They are thriving and are playful and happy, so the dog food must have enough nutrients to keep them healthy.  Pedigree has been in the business quite a while now, and the company is concerned with the well-being of many dogs.  I looked at their website...very nice:  dogsrule.com
These filters work well but I really think for the price they should last longer than the recommended change cycle.
Good size for both my small and medium size miniature poodles.  Colorful and has two squeakers and it stretches.  Fun toy.
I really like the sand texture of this litter, and I think the cats do, too.  But it doesn't clump very well, and the scent is too much of an intense perfume scent at times.

reviewText: These look great and smell okay. Our puppy liked to chew on them but it did not set well with her belly. Both times we tried these she trough up about 2 hours later. Maybe something in the ingredients just did not agree with her. Fast delivery of product and it comes just a discribed.

reviewText: These batteries don't last long, especially if you keep the system running at all times.  It is what it is, though, and at least they're less expensive than I imagined they would be.  Just always keep an eye on your current battery life, and always have a fresh battery on hand.  As soon as you're using your last fresh battery, order another set of these.  I wrote a full detailed review of the PetSafe PIF-300 under that product.

I have had this for six months and the bottle is no where near empty. In other words, it lasts a long time for the size and price. You simply pinch and lightly dust it over your reptile's food. This is for reptile owners that have indoor, reptile pets and do not own the a UVB/UVA bulb. The UVA/UVB bulb or natural sunlight (sunlight of course is the best option) allows the reptile to make their own D3 in their bodies. This Repti-Calcium is a good substitute to ensure that the reptile does not develop deformities or Metabolic Bone Disease. It is always best though to consult with a herpetologist.
My 2 year old dog just lives these balls.  She actually goes crazy with them and will play for hours with these balls either by herself or with me.

I have only given one of these so far to my kitten because she is only 3 months old so I am kind of giving her a variety of small toys to see what she does, but she has been having lots of fun with this.

Went from $7.99 to $11.72 in 10 days.  Not sure if it really works yet because we just started it, but when you have multiple cats, it's very cost-prohibitive, especially with huge price hikes like that!

reviewerName: Retired Navy Guy "Chief Cook & Bottle Washer,...
reviewText: This product was totally worthless in my experience.  Used exactly as instructions stated.  Noticed absolutely NO "calming" effect on my 4 cats that are a bit skiddish.  In fact they may have been a little more "hyper".AVOID this product, Save your money.

I bought this as a add on with my order. It is BIG! Perfect for my yellow lab. However, my little Westie stole it and claimed as her new toy. It almost weights as much as she does. Kong Air toys last forever. However she ripped the yellow outside material off already. I don't think they make that as thick as they used to. I gave it 4 stars because of this. Iam sure she would give it 5 stars, but Iam the one paying  for it! Most toys last about  5 minutes around here, but they (my dogs)  have Kong Air toys that are at least 5 years old. And they still squeak!
summary: Got this at a great price.

reviewText: Both of our cats love this dry food!We are very happy with it as well. It is well-tolerated on their tummies, and our picky little femalecat actually loves it as well.The main ingredient is CHICKEN, not beaks, feet and fat.The other ingredients are all things that are good for your cat (even though maybe some are notnecessary, since cats do not need vegetables. They are carnivores, not omnivores, even though theydo like to eat grasses).The way we use Blue Buffalo is as their treats. For many years, our cats were getting Temptations as their treats.They couldn't get enough of them, and would beg, rub on the drawer they were kept in to get them, even digging the emptybags out of the trash. Well, once we read up on the ingredients, we were shocked to find the garbage we'd been feeding to ourcats! It has the equivalent of kitty MSG in there, which is why they love them so much. (Think bags of flavored potato chips forhumans - you can't stop eating them for a reason!)So, we couldn't do that to our cats anymore. We'd also noticed other thing, like itchy skin, hyperness, etc.We no longer give them their old treats, and have instead used Blue Buffalo. They like it just as much.We have one of those treat balls (also purchased from Amazon!), which we fill up with Blue Buffalo. The cats adore it,roll the ball around to get their snack fix, and we know it is still very good for them. Both of our cats arechicken-holics, preferring chicken over all other meat or fish flavors. This food fills their happy spot!We have not yet replaced any formal dry meals with this food, but I would certainly not have a problem doing that.It is a nice size kibble for the cats as well, with the latest formulation being smaller than the other versions.(The other life bits were pretty big - these are smaller and easier for cats to chew.)All in all, as a long-time cat owner and fanatic, this is a really great food to give to them. Whether you feed only dryor just looking for a snack food for your kitties, this should be on your list to try.
summary: Our cats LOVE this food! Great ingredients

reviewText: If you buy these in a pet store they are 12 bucks apiece, way too expensive and I highly recommend the odorless ones b/c the non-odorless ones smell to high heaven.  Our dog loves these and will sit there until it's almost done, then carry it around and consume the rest later.  They're wonderful for his teeth, it helps to make them so bright and shiny and don't worry if it gets small, your dog won't choke on it, it kind of melts by the time he's that far down.  Definitely messy, but it keeps him busy and he loves them.
Its an interaction toy between you and your pet. Even the 1 year old gets involved. More important, its great exercise!

I have a 6 month old Bengal. If you own one you know there crazy, if you do not then you have no idea. One of the deals with owning one. They get into everything, and anything. They are more dog like then cat. Everything is a potential target to attack, sleep many hours less then a regular cat, and can play for hours continuously...serious.Anyhow I bought a packet of these gave my pretty girl one and all that hyper insanity ceased. She still will play and full of energy she just does not rampage anymore. Since then I have given her one everyday. When I do not I can tell she is nutty. Must buy product if you have a hyper active act.For my cat this does make her alot more sleepy. I have read that for most it does not though. In my case its a blessing. Now I can sleep.

We are really happy with these chuck-it! balls, we use them with the chuck-it! stick, our lab loves them and they are easy to find in the tall grass. Wish they were a little cheaper, but overall they are worth it. I'm glad they don's smell or get muddy like tennis balls.
summary: Love Chuck-it! They don't get muddy or smelly like tennis balls - orange easy to see in grass

reviewText: Be sure to break these up for cats with small throats. Like this brand of cat treats, but the chews are hard on one of my cats.

reviewText: My yorkie loves these things! If you can handle the odor, you'll love them too. Large size as shown, not skinny little things. Great for training as well as keeping your dog entertained for hours. I panic when I have only one left! One stick lasts for several days with my little dog. Price may seem high but not when compared to pet stores. I'll definitely be purchasing more.
Great dog cover! Fits the bed in my dog's crate perfectly and it is easy to put on and take off.

Well, this product says the fragrance will remain for 2 weeks and that let's you know how strong it is.  I could smell it outside the bottle, but it is a concentrate after all.  This is a really good value for the size and the number of washes you get from it, even for large dogs. reviewText: I purchased this product to use in a canister filter that i built for my turtle's tank. My turtle is very dirty, and my filter moves a lot of water (700 gph). I had this in the second stage, right after a couple of sponges. The purigen was unusable after about 2 weeks. I read that you could clean it by soaking it in a bleach/water mixture for 24 hours, but its a pain to keep opening and closing my filter. when i open my filter, i want to be able to clean or replace media, and then close it again for a couple of weeks. This product is too expensive to be used as disposable media. im sure this product is fine for many applications, but it just doesnt really work for me.
I give my cats a treat each morning before going to work and it is always these. They love them! The mega bags are the best deal, especially if you do Subscribe and Save.

My pitbull loves playing fetch with this because of the irregular bounce, and I love it because I can grab one side of it when she brings it back to me, reducing the chance of that battle of the ball.  We play tug with it sometimes, too.  The squeak makes her happy.  She will ultimately skin and chew it up, but this, the Kong football and her Kygen hedgehog are the group of three favorite toys that last longer than most, and she is a toy destroyer.

The Purigen does help clear the water.  My tank has cycled and water tests are within limits for ammonia, nitrates, and nitrites but the water was not crystal clear.  Purigen cleared things up.  The Purigen material is very fine so if you buy the bulk Purigen make sure you have a very fine bag to hold it.  The 100ml is very convenient and worked well for my needs.
This cover does fit the chair we were planning on putting it on.  Nobody really sits in the chair except maybe a dog once in a while.  The cover does move around a bit though.
This product leaves a sticky filmy residue.  it doesn't seem to work well.  The smell is not great either.  Not impressed

This is the BEST product for pets I have ever owned. The electrinics will fit computer air spray bottles that will last much longer, but the refill these guys sell is cheap enough though. Not only does it have 2 angle adustments and work just as supposed to to "retrain" your cats behavior, but it is THE FUNNIEST way to train them. I've had this for a week and our television watching has slowed at least an hour a day to watch cats bolting away. So so absolutely entertaining that I don't even care if it worked, but it does work. So buy it. I'm ordering these as Christmas gifts for cat owning family.
